translated: When the time came for them to pass away, the humans who had passed away were reborn in the Ābhāsvara host of gods, and the king who had passed away was also reborn in the Ābhāsvara host of gods. The Blessed One went with the assembly of monks to the Ābhāsvara host of gods.

original: vivartanīyakālasamaye sasthite lokasanniveśe satvā āyuḥkṣayāya ābhā svarāddevanikāyato cyavitvā icchatvamāgacchanti //🔽bodhisatvo pi ābhāsvarādde vanikāyā cyavitvā icchatvamāgatvā rājā bhavati cakravartī cāturdvīpo vijitavī yāva imāni catvāri mahādvīpāni dharmeṇaiva
analyzed: vivartanīya kāla samaye sasthite loka sanniveśe satvāḥ āyuḥ kṣayāya cyavitvā iccha tvam āgacchanti  bodhisatvaḥ pi cyavitvā iccha tvam āgatvā rājā bhavati cakravartī cāturdvīpaḥ imāni catvāri mahā dvīpāni dharmeṇa eva
translated: When the time has come for the world to be re-formed, and the world-system has settled, beings, having fallen from the Ābhāsvara class of gods, come to the desire realm, because their life-span has ended.

original: abhinirjinitvā adhyāvasati //
analyzed: abhinirjinitvā adhyāvasati
translated: The Bodhisattva, having fallen from the Ābhāsvara class of gods, comes to the desire realm and becomes a universal monarch, a lord of the four continents, who has conquered the earth as far as the ocean, and dwells there having conquered it by the power of the Dharma.

original: yadā manuṣyā parimitāyuṣkā bhavanti jarāvyādhimaraṇā ca prajñāyanti tadā bhagavānsami tāvī saśrāvakasagho jambudvīpamāgacchati //
analyzed: yadā parimita āyuṣkāḥ bhavanti jarā vyādhi maraṇā ca prajñāyanti tadā bhagavān sami tāvī sa śrāvaka saghaḥ jambudvīpam āgacchati
translated: When human beings have a limited life-span and old age, sickness, and death are known, then the Blessed One, together with the assembly of disciples, comes to Jambudvīpa.

original: āgatvā satvānā dharma deśayati //
analyzed: āgatvā satvānā dharma deśayati
translated: Having come, he teaches the Dharma to beings.

original: tathaiva rājā cakravartī samitāvisya samyaksabuddhasya sarveṇa pratyupasthito cīvarapiṇḍapātraśa yanāsanaglānapratyayabhaiṣajyapariṣkārehi
analyzed: tathā eva rājā cakravartī samitā visya samyaksabuddhasya sarveṇa pratyupasthitaḥ cīvara piṇḍapātra śa yana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkārehi
translated: In the same way, the universal monarch attends to the Blessed One, the Perfectly Awakened One, Samitāvin, with robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicines for the sick,

original: saptaratnamaya prāsāda tādṛśameva kārā payitvā bhagavataḥ samyaksabuddhasya niryātesi //
analyzed: sapta ratna maya prāsāda tādṛśam eva kārā payitvā bhagavataḥ samyaksabuddhasya niryātā isi
translated: and having had a palace made of the seven precious substances, just like that, he offers it to the Blessed One, the Perfectly Awakened One.

original: etena upāyena kalpaśatasahasra sami tāvī samyaksabuddho sthito saśrāvakasagho kalpaśatasahasra bodhisatvena upasthito sarvatra ca kalpe
analyzed: etena upāyena kalpa śata sahasra tāvī samyaksabuddhaḥ sthitaḥ sa śrāvaka saghaḥ kalpa śata sahasra bodhisatvena upasthitaḥ sarvatra ca kalpe
translated: By this method, for a hundred thousand aeons, the Perfectly Awakened One Samitāvin, together with his assembly of disciples, was served by the Bodhisattva for a hundred thousand aeons. And in every aeon,

original: saptaratnamaya prāsāda tādṛśameva kārāpayitvā niryātesi samitāvisya
analyzed: sapta ratna maya prāsāda tādṛśam eva kārāpayitvā niryātā isi
translated: having had a palace made of the seven precious substances just like that, he offered it to Samitāvin,

original: samyaksabuddhasya //
analyzed: samyaksabuddhasya
translated: the Perfectly Awakened One.

original: anuttarā samyaksabodhi prārthayamāno prāsādaśatasahasra ratnamaya aha cakravartī santo samitāvino adāsi //
analyzed: anuttarā samyaksabodhi prārthayamānaḥ prāsāda śata sahasra ratna maya aha cakravartī santaḥ samitāvinaḥ
translated: Desiring supreme perfect awakening, as a wheel-turning king, he gave a hundred thousand palaces made of precious substances to Samitāvin.

original: kalpasmi ito asakhyeye so ta dāna datvā praṇidhesi lokanāyako asyā /
analyzed: itas asakhyeye saḥ ta dāna da tvā praṇidhesi loka nāyakaḥ asyāḥ
translated: In an incalculably long aeon from now, having given that gift, he made this aspiration: 'May I become a world leader for this world.

original: devamanuṣyācāryo ārya dharma prakāśeyya //
analyzed: deva manuṣya ācāryaḥ ārya dharma
translated: May I be a teacher of gods and humans, and may I reveal the noble Dharma.'

original: eva ca mahya asyā prakāśanā deśanā ca dharmasya eva ca bahu satva ārye dharme niveśeyya //
analyzed: eva ca mahya asyā prakāśanā deśanā ca dharmasya eva ca bahu satva ārye dharme
translated: And may I reveal and teach this Dharma, and may I establish many beings in the noble Dharma.'

original: eva ca me śruṇensuḥ devamanuṣyā subhāṣita vākya /🔽eva ca dharmacakra pravartaye bahujanahitāya //
analyzed: eva ca me śruṇensuḥ devamanuṣyā subhāṣita vākya  eva ca dharmacakra pravartaye bahu jana hitāya
translated: And may gods and humans listen to my well-spoken words.'🔽And may I turn the wheel of Dharma for the benefit of many.'

original: dharmolkā vicareya parāhaṇe dharmabherī sapatākā /
analyzed: dharma ulkā vicareya parāhaṇe dharma bherī sa patākā
translated: May I wander in the world, beating the drum of Dharma, hoisting the banner of Dharma.'

original: ucchreya dharmaketumārya śakha prapūreya //
analyzed: dharma ketum ārya śakha prapūreya
translated: I will fill the world with the noble Dharma banner of the supreme Dharma.

original: kṛcchrāpanne loke jātijarāpīḍite maraṇadharme /
analyzed: kṛcchra āpanne loke jāti jarā pīḍite maraṇa dharme
translated: When the world is in distress, afflicted by birth and old age, subject to death,

original: bhavacakṣuke apāyā prajñāskandha niveśeya //
analyzed: bhava cakṣuke
translated: I will establish the aggregate of wisdom in the lower realms, the eye of existence.

original: sajīve kālasūtre saghāte raurave avīcismi /
analyzed: sa jīve kālasūtre sa ghāte raurave
translated: In the Saṃjīva, Kālasūtra, Saṃghāta, Raurava, and Avīci hells,

original: ṣaṭsu gatīṣu vikīrṇā bhavasasārātpramoceya //
analyzed: ṣaṭsu gatīṣu vikīrṇā bhava sa sārāt pramoceya
translated: I will liberate beings scattered in the six destinies from the cycle of existence.

original: narake pakvavipakvā apāyaprapīḍitā maraṇadharmā /
analyzed: narake pakva vipakvāḥ apāya prapīḍitāḥ maraṇa dharmā
translated: In the hells, being cooked and burned, afflicted by lower realms, subject to death,

original: alpasukhaduḥkhabahulā bhavasasārātpramoceya //
analyzed: alpa sukha duḥkha bahulā bhava sa sārāt pramoceya
translated: having little happiness and much suffering, I will liberate them from the cycle of existence.

original: artha careya loke devamanuṣyāṇā deśiya dharma /
analyzed: artha careya loke deva manuṣyāṇā deśiya dharma
translated: I will practice for the sake of the world, teaching the Dharma to gods and humans,

original: eva vineya satvā yathā aya lokapradyoto //
analyzed: eva vineya satvā yathā aya loka pradyoto
translated: thus guiding beings as this Light of the World does.

original: dvitīyo praṇidhi tadāsi //
analyzed: dvitīyaḥ
translated: This was my second vow.

original: aśīti candanavimānāni adāsi lokottarasya buddhasya guruṇo //🔽aha bhagavānasyā ito asakhyeye //
analyzed: aśīti candana vimānāni adāsi lokottarasya buddhasya guruṇaḥ  aha bhagavān asyāḥ itas asakhyeye
translated: I offered eighty sandalwood palaces to the transcendent Buddha, the Guru.🔽Blessed One, from that time until now,

original: tṛtīyo praṇidhiḥ tadāsīt //
analyzed: praṇidhiḥ tadā āsīt
translated: this was my third vow.

original: saptaratanamayānā guhānā aśīti sahasrāṇi arko rājā adāsi parvatanāmasya //
analyzed: sapta ratana mayānāḥ aśīti sahasrāṇi arkaḥ rājā adāsi parvatanāmasya
translated: King Arka offered eighty thousand caves made of the seven jewels to the one named Parvata.

original: caturthī tadā praṇidhiḥ āsīt //
analyzed: caturthī tadā praṇidhiḥ āsīt
translated: This was my fourth vow.

original: ṣaḍvarṣāṇi carati anityasajñānimittakāmehi ratanendreṇānuśāsito //
analyzed: ṣaḍ varṣāṇi carati ratana indreṇa anuśāsitaḥ
translated: For six years he practiced, instructed by Ratnendra, the lord of the Jinas, with the sign of impermanence, for the sake of the Dharma.

original: pacamā praṇidhiḥ tadā āsīt //
analyzed: pacamā praṇidhiḥ tadā āsīt
translated: This was his fifth vow then.

original: iti śrīmahāvastuavadāne bahubuddhasūtra samāpta //
analyzed: iti śrī mahāvastu avadāne bahu buddha sūtra samāpta
translated: Thus ends the Bahubuddha-sutra in the Mahavastu-avadana.

original: eva mayā śrutamekasmi samaye bhagavā rājagṛhe viharati sma gṛdhrakūṭe parvate //
analyzed: eva mayā śrutam ekasmi samaye bhagavā rājagṛhe viharati sma gṛdhrakūṭe parvate
translated: Thus have I heard. At one time the Blessed One was dwelling in Rajagriha on the Vulture Peak mountain.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmānmahāmaudgalyāyano kālyameva nivāsayitvā pātracīvaramādāaya rājagṛha nagara piṇḍāya prakrami //
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān mahāmaudgalyāyanaḥ kālyam eva nivāsayitvā pātra cīvaram ādāya rājagṛha nagara piṇḍāya prakrami
translated: Then the venerable Maha-Maudgalyayana, having dressed in the morning, taking his bowl and robe, set out for Rajagriha for alms.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmato mahāmaudgalyāyanasya aciraprakrānta syaitadabhavat //
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmataḥ mahāmaudgalyāyanasya acira prakrānta sya etat abhavat
translated: Then it occurred to the venerable Maha-Maudgalyayana, not long after he had set out:

original: atiprāgastāvadetarahi rājagṛha nagara piṇḍāya caritu /
analyzed: rājagṛha nagara piṇḍāya
translated: It is too early to go to Rajagriha for alms.

original: ya nūnāha yena śuddhāvāsa devanikāya tenopasakrameya //
analyzed: ya nūna aha yena śuddhāvāsa devanikāya tena upasakrameya
translated: What if I were to go to the Suddhavasa gods?

original: athāyuṣmānmahāmaudgalyāyanaḥ tadya
analyzed: atha āyuṣmān mahāmaudgalyāyanaḥ tat ya
translated: Then the venerable Maha-Maudgalyayana

original: thāpi nāma balavānpuruṣaḥ samijita bāhu prasāreyetprasārita ca bāhu samijayet ekakṣaṇena padavītihāreṇa rājagṛhādvaihāyasamamyudgamya
analyzed: thā api nāma balavān puruṣaḥ bāhu prasāreyet prasārita ca bāhu samijayet eka kṣaṇena padavī itihāreṇa rājagṛhāt vaihāyasam amyudgamya
translated: just as a strong man might extend his flexed arm, or flex his extended arm, so did he vanish from the Vulture Peak and reappear among the Suddhavasa gods.

original: śuddhāvāsadevanikāye pratya sthāt //
analyzed: śuddhāvāsa devanikāye sthāt
translated: and stood in the assembly of the Śuddhāvāsa devas.

original: adrākṣītśuddhāvāsakāyikā devaputrā āyuṣmanta mahāmaudgalyāyana dūrata evāgacchanta //
analyzed: adrākṣīt śuddhāvāsa kāyikāḥ deva putrāḥ āyuṣmanta mahāmaudgalyāyana dūratas eva āgacchanta
translated: The Śuddhāvāsa devas saw the Venerable Mahā-Maudgalyāyana coming from afar,

original: dṛṣṭvā ca punaryenāyuṣmānmahāmaudgalyāyanastenopasakramitvā āyuṣmato mahāmaudgalyāyanasya pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte asthāsi //
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca punar yena āyuṣmān mahāmaudgalyāyanaḥ tena upasakramitvā āyuṣmataḥ mahāmaudgalyāyanasya pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte asthāsi
translated: and having seen him, they approached the Venerable Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, bowed their heads at his feet, and stood to one side.

original: ekānte sthitvā ca te sabahulā śuddhāvāsakāyikā devaputrā āyuṣmanta mahāmaudgalyāyana gāthābhira dhyabhāṣasi //
analyzed: ekānte sthitvā ca te sa bahulā śuddhāvāsa kāyikāḥ deva putrāḥ āyuṣmanta mahāmaudgalyāyana gāthābhiḥ
translated: While standing to one side, those many Śuddhāvāsa devas addressed the Venerable Mahā-Maudgalyāyana in verse:

original: kalpāna śatasahasra sadhāvitvāna bodhiparipāka /
analyzed: kalpāna śata sahasra bodhi paripāka
translated: Having practiced for a hundred thousand eons, you are ripe for enlightenment.

original: sucirasyanantaratano buddho lokasmi upapanno //
analyzed: su cirasi anantaratanaḥ buddhaḥ lokasmi upapannaḥ
translated: After a long time, a Buddha has appeared in the world.

original: ittha vaditvāna te sabahulā śuddhāvāsakāyikā devaputrā āyuṣmato mahāmaudgalyā yanasya pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte asthāsi /
analyzed: ittha vaditvāna te sa bahulā śuddhāvāsa kāyikāḥ devaputrāḥ āyuṣmataḥ mahāmaudgalyāḥ yanasya pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte asthāsi
translated: Having spoken thus, those many Śuddhāvāsa devas bowed their heads at the feet of the Venerable Mahā-Maudgalyāyana and stood to one side.

original: ekānte sthitvā antarhitā //
analyzed: ekānte sthitvā antarhitā
translated: While standing to one side, they disappeared.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmato mahāmaudgalyāyanasyaitadabhavat //
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmataḥ mahāmaudgalyāyanasya etat abhavat
translated: Then this occurred to the Venerable Mahā-Maudgalyāyana:

original: eva durlabhā bodhiryatra hi nāma kalpānā śatasahasreṇa //
analyzed: eva durlabhā bodhiḥ yatra hi nāma kalpānā śata sahasreṇa
translated: Such is the rarity of enlightenment, for which one should strive for hundreds of thousands of eons.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmānmahāmaudgalyāyanastadyathā balavānpuruṣaḥ samiñjitā bāhā prasārayetprasāritā vā bāhā samiñjayet ettakena kṣaṇavītihāreṇa
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān mahāmaudgalyāyanaḥ tat yathā balavān puruṣaḥ samiñjitā bāhā prasārayet prasāritā vā bāhā samiñjayet ettakena kṣaṇa vīti hāreṇa
translated: Then the Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana, just as a strong man might extend his flexed arm or flex his extended arm,

original: śuddhāvāsato devanikāyāto antarhitaḥ rājagṛhe nagare pratyasthā //
analyzed: śuddha āvāsataḥ devanikāyātaḥ antarhitaḥ rājagṛhe nagare pratyasthāḥ
translated: disappeared from the Pure Abodes and reappeared in the city of Rājagṛha.

original: athāyuṣmā nmahāmaudgalyāyano rājagṛhe nagare piṇḍāya caritvā paścādbhakto piṇḍapātrapra tikrāntaḥ pātracīvara pratiśāmayitvā pādau
analyzed: atha āyuṣmān mahāmaudgalyāyanaḥ rājagṛhe nagare piṇḍāya caritvā paścāt bhaktaḥ piṇḍa pātra pra tikrāntaḥ pātra cīvara pratiśāmayitvā pādau
translated: Then the Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana, having gone for alms in the city of Rājagṛha, after the midday meal, having returned from his alms round, having put away his sitting mat and robe,

original: prakṣālayitvā yena bhagavāstenopasakra mitvā bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte nyaṣīdadekānte niṣṇāśca punaḥ āyuṣmānmahāmaudgalyāyano
analyzed: prakṣālayitvā yena bhagavān tena upasakra mitvā bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte nyaṣīdat ekānte niṣṇāḥ ca punar āyuṣmān mahāmaudgalyāyanaḥ
translated: having washed his feet, approached the Blessed One, and having approached the Blessed One, he bowed his head at the Blessed One's feet, sat to one side, and while sitting to one side,🔽the Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana

original: bhagavantametadavocat
analyzed: bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: said this to the Blessed One:

original: ihāha bhagavankālyasyaiva nivā sayitvā pātracīvaramādāya rājagṛha mahānagara piṇḍāya prakrami //
analyzed: iha āha bhagavan kālyasya eva sayitvā pātra cīvaram ādāya rājagṛha mahā nagara piṇḍāya prakrami
translated: Here, Blessed One, having risen early, having taken my bowl and robe, I went for alms in the great city of Rājagṛha.

original: tasya me bhagavan aciraprakrāntasyaitadabhavat //
analyzed: tasya me bhagavan acira prakrāntasya etat abhavat
translated: “Soon after he had left, I thought to myself:

original: atiprāgastāvadetarahi rājagṛhe mahānagare piṇḍāya caritu /
analyzed: ati prāgaḥ tāvat etarahi rājagṛhe mahā nagare piṇḍāya caritu
translated: Then, Blessed One, not long after he had left, I thought: It is too early to go to the great city of Rājagṛha to beg for alms.

original: ya nūnāha yena śuddhāvāsa devanikāya tenopasakrameya /
analyzed: ya nūna aha yena śuddhāvāsa devanikāya tena upasakrameya
translated: What if I were to go to the Śuddhāvāsa realm of the gods?

original: cira me devani kāya śuddhāvāsa upasakrāntasya //
analyzed: cira me devani kāya śuddha āvāsa upasakrāntasya
translated: It has been a long time since I visited the Śuddhāvāsa realm of the gods.

original: athāha balavā tadyathā puruṣaḥ samijitā bāhā prasārayeya prasāritā vā bāhā samijayet ettakena kṣaṇavītihāreṇa rājagṛhādvaihā yasamabhyudgamya 🔽śuddhāvāse devanikāye pratyasthāsi //
analyzed: atha āha balavā tat yathā puruṣaḥ samijitā bāhā prasārayeya prasāritā vā bāhā samijayet ettakena kṣaṇavīti hāreṇa rājagṛhāt vaihāyasam abhyudgamya  śuddhāvāse devanikāye pratyasthāsi
translated: Then, in an instant, just as a strong man might extend his flexed arm or flex his extended arm, I disappeared from Rājagṛha and appeared in the Śuddhāvāsa realm of the gods.

original: adrākṣīt me bhagavansabahulāḥ śuddhāvāsakāyikā devaputrā dūrata evāgacchanta dṛṣṭvā ca punaryenāha tenopasakramitvā mama pādau śirasā vanditvā
analyzed: adrākṣīt me bhagavan sa bahulāḥ śuddhāvāsa kāyikāḥ devaputrāḥ dūratas eva āgacchanta dṛṣṭvā ca punar yena āha tena upasakramitvā mama pādau śirasā vanditvā
translated: The Blessed One, I saw many Śuddhāvāsa devas coming from afar. Having seen them, I approached them and bowed my head at their feet,

original: ekānte sthānsu /🔽ekāntasthitā sabahulā te śuddhā vāsakāyikā devaputrā mama gāthāye adhyabhāṣeran //
analyzed: ekānte sthānsu  ekānta sthitā sa bahulā te śuddhāḥ vāsa kāyikāḥ devaputrāḥ mama
translated: and they stood to one side.

original: kalpāna śatasahasra sadhāvitvāna bodhiparipāka /
analyzed: kalpāna śata sahasra bodhi paripāka
translated: Standing to one side, those many Śuddhāvāsa devas addressed me in verse, saying: Having practiced for a hundred thousand eons, you are close to awakening.

original: sucirasyanantaratano buddho lokasmi upapanno //
analyzed: su cirasi anantaratanaḥ buddhaḥ lokasmi upapannaḥ
translated: After a very long time, a Buddha has appeared in the world.

original: ittha vaditvāna te sabahulāḥ śuddhāvāsakāyikā devaputrā mama pādau śirasā 🔽vanditvā prakrāmi //
analyzed: ittha vaditvāna te sa bahulāḥ śuddhāvāsa kāyikāḥ devaputrāḥ mama pādau śirasā  vanditvā prakrāmi
translated: Having spoken thus, those many gods of the Pure Abodes, having bowed their heads at my feet, departed.

original: tasya me bhagavannetadabhavat //
analyzed: tasya me bhagavan etat abhavat
translated: Then, Blessed One, this occurred to me:

original: yāvadduḥkhasamudānīyā anuttarā sabodhiryatra hi nāma kalpānā śatasahasreṇa /🔽ya nūnāha yena bhagavāstenopagamitvā bhagavantametamartha paripṛccheya /
analyzed: yāvat duḥkha samudānīyā anuttarā sa bodhiḥ yatra hi nāma śata sahasreṇa  nūna āha yena bhagavān tena upagamitvā bhagavantam etam artha paripṛccheya
translated: How difficult it is to attain unsurpassed complete enlightenment, since it takes a hundred thousand eons!🔽What if I were to approach the Blessed One and ask him about this matter,

original: yathā me bhagavā vyākariṣyati tathā na dhārayiṣyāmi //
analyzed: yathā me bhagavā vyākariṣyati tathā na dhārayiṣyāmi
translated: and then remember it as the Blessed One explains it to me?

original: iha bhagavā kimāha //
analyzed: iha bhagavān kim āha
translated: What does the Blessed One say about this?

original: evamukte bhagavānāyuṣmanta mahāmaudgalyāyanametadavocat //
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmanta mahāmaudgalyāyanam etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the Venerable Mahā-Maudgalyāyana:

original: parīttaka khalu punarmahāmaudgalyāyana śuddhāvāsakāyikānā devaputrāṇā śatasahasranti //
analyzed: parīttaka khalu punar mahāmaudgalyāyana śuddhāvāsa kāyikānā devaputrāṇā
translated: The number of hundreds of thousands of gods of the Pure Abodes is indeed small, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana.

original: aprameyehi mahāmaudgalyāyana kalpehi asakhyeyehi aprameyehi tathāgatehi arhantehi samyaksabuddhehi kuśalamūlānyavaropitāni āyatisabodhi
analyzed: aprameyehi mahāmaudgalyāyana kalpehi asakhyeyehi aprameyehi tathāgatehi arhantehi samyaksabuddhehi kuśala mūlāni avaropitāni āyati sabodhi
translated: For immeasurable, incalculable eons, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, roots of goodness have been planted with immeasurable Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones,

original: prārthayamānehi //
analyzed: prārthayamānā ihi
translated: by those who aspire to future enlightenment.

original: abhi jānāmi khalu punaraha mahāmaudgalyāyana triśadbuddhakoṭiyo śākyamunināmadheyānā ye mayā saśrāvakasaghāḥ satkṛtā gurukṛtā mānitāḥ 🔽pūjitā apacitā rājñā cakra vartibhūtena āyatisabodhimabhiprārthayamānena ca me te buddhā bhagavanto vyākarensuḥ //
analyzed: abhi jānāmi khalu punar aha mahāmaudgalyāyana ye mayā sa śrāvaka saghāḥ satkṛtāḥ gurukṛtāḥ mānitāḥ  pūjitāḥ apacitāḥ rājñā cakra varti bhūtena āyati sa bodhim abhiprārthayamānena ca me te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ vyākarensuḥ
translated: “I remember, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, thirty koṭis of Buddhas named Śākyamuni, whom I honoured, revered, worshipped, revered as worthy of offerings, and esteemed, together with their communities of disciples and bodhisattvas.

original: bhaviṣyasi tvamanāgatamadhvāna tathāgato'rha samyaksabuddho vidyācaraṇasapanno sugato lokavidanuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ śāstā devānā 🔽ca manuṣyāṇā ca //
analyzed: bhaviṣyasi tvam anāgatam adhvāna sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ śāstā devānā  ca manuṣyāṇā ca
translated: And those Buddhas, those Lords proclaimed of me that in some future time I should become a Tathāgata, an Arhan, a perfect Buddha, proficient in knowledge and conduct, a Sugata, an unsurpassed knower of the world, a driver of tameable men, and a teacher of devas and men.

original: abhijā nāmyaha khalu punarmahāmaudgalyāyana aṣṭa buddhaśatasahasrāṇi dīpakaranāmadheyakānā ye mayā saśrāvakasaghāḥ satkṛtā gurukṛtā mānitā
analyzed: abhijā nāmi aha khalu punar mahāmaudgalyāyana aṣṭa buddha śata sahasrāṇi dīpakara nāmadheya kānā ye mayā sa śrāvaka saghāḥ satkṛtāḥ gurukṛtāḥ mānitā  /
translated: “I remember, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, eight hundred koṭis of Buddhas named Dīpaṃkara, whom I honoured, revered, worshipped, revered as worthy of offerings, and esteemed, together with their communities of disciples and bodhisattvas.

original: pūjitāḥ apacitā cakravartibhūtena āyati sabodhimabhisaprārthayamānena ca me te buddhā bhagavanto vyākarensuḥ /
analyzed: pūjitāḥ apacitā cakravarti bhūtena āyati sa bodhim abhisaprārthayamānena ca me te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ vyākarensuḥ
translated: And those Buddhas, those Lords proclaimed of me that in some future time I should become a Tathāgata, an Arhan, a perfect Buddha, proficient in knowledge and conduct, a Sugata, an unsurpassed knower of the world, a driver of tameable men, and a teacher of devas and men.

original: yathā prathame parivarte tathā sarvatra kartavya //
analyzed: yathā prathame parivarte tathā sarvatra kartavya
translated: As in the first chapter, so it should be done everywhere.

original: bhaviṣyasi tvamanāgatamadhvāna //
analyzed: bhaviṣyasi tvam anāgatam adhvāna
translated: You will become in the future time...

original: abhijānā myaha mahāmaudgalyāyana paca buddhaśatāni padmottaranāmadheyānā //
analyzed: abhijānā mī aha mahāmaudgalyāyana paca buddha śatāni
translated: I remember, Mahāmaudgalyāyana, five hundred Buddhas named Padmottara.

original: sarvatra kartavya /
analyzed: sarvatra kartavya
translated: It should be done everywhere.

original: bhaviṣyasi tvamanāgatamadhvāna //
analyzed: bhaviṣyasi tvam anāgatam adhvāna
translated: You will become in the future time...

original: abhijānāmyaha mahāmaudgalyāyana aṣṭa buddhasaha srāṇi pradyotanāmadheyānā //
analyzed: abhijānāmi aha mahāmaudgalyāyana aṣṭa buddha saha srāṇi pradyota nāmadheyānā
translated: I remember, Mahāmaudgalyāyana, eighteen thousand Buddhas named Pradyota.

original: abhijānāmyaha mahāmaudgalyāyana trayo buddhakoṭīyo puṣpanāmadheyānā //
analyzed: abhijānāmi aha mahāmaudgalyāyana trayaḥ
translated: I remember, Mahāmaudgalyāyana, three koṭis of Buddhas named Puṣpa.

original: abhijānāmyaha mahāmaudgalyāyana aṣṭādaśa buddhasahasrāṇi māradhvajanāmadheyānā yatra mayā brahmacarya cīrṇa āyati bodhi prārthayamānena
analyzed: abhijānāmi aha mahāmaudgalyāyana aṣṭādaśa buddha sahasrāṇi yatra mayā brahmacarya cīrṇaḥ āyati bodhi prārthayamānena
translated: I remember, Mahāmaudgalyāyana, eighteen thousand Buddhas named Māradhvaja, under whom I practiced the holy life, aspiring to future enlightenment.

original: ca me te buddhā bhagavanto vyākarensuḥ //
analyzed: ca me te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ vyākarensuḥ
translated: And those Blessed Buddhas prophesied to me:

original: abhijānāmyaha mahāmaudgalyāyana paca buddhaśatāni padmottaranāmadheyānā ye mayā saśrāvakasaghāḥ satkṛtāḥ //
analyzed: abhijānāmi aha mahāmaudgalyāyana paca buddha śatāni ye mayā sa śrāvaka saghāḥ satkṛtāḥ
translated: I remember, Mahāmaudgalyāyana, five hundred Buddhas named Padmottara, together with their assemblies of disciples, whom I honored.

original: abhijānāmyaha mahā maudgalyāyana navati buddhasahasrāṇi kāśyapanāmadheyāni //
analyzed: abhijānāmi aha mahā maudgalyāyana navati buddha sahasrāṇi kāśyapa nāmadheyāni
translated: I remember, Mahā Maudgalyāyana, ninety thousand Buddhas named Kāśyapa.

original: abhijānāmyaha mahāmau dgalyāyana pacadaśa buddhasahasrāṇi pratāpanāmadheyāni //
analyzed: abhijānāmi aha mahāmau dgalyāyana pacadaśa buddha sahasrāṇi pratāpa nāmadheyāni
translated: I remember, Mahā Maudgalyāyana, fifteen thousand Buddhas named Pratāpa.

original: abhijānāmyaha mahāmaudga lyāyana dvau buddhasahasrau kauṇḍiṇyanāmadheyau //
analyzed: abhijānāmi aha mahāmaudga lyāyana dvau buddha sahasrau kauṇḍiṇya nāmadheyau
translated: I remember, Mahā Maudgalyāyana, two thousand Buddhas named Kauṇḍiṇya.

original: abhijānāmyaha mahāmaudgalyāyana caturaśīti pratyekabuddhasahasrāṇi //
analyzed: abhijānāmi aha mahāmaudgalyāyana caturaśīti pratyekabuddha sahasrāṇi
translated: I remember, Mahā Maudgalyāyana, eighty-four thousand Pratyekabuddhas.

original: abhijānāmyaha mahāmaudgalyāyana samantagupta nāma tathāgatamarhanta samyaksabuddha //
analyzed: abhijānāmi aha mahāmaudgalyāyana samantagupta nāma tathāgatam arhanta samyaksabuddha
translated: I remember, Mahā Maudgalyāyana, the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened Buddha Samantagupta.

original: abhijānāmyaha mahāmaudgalyāyana buddhasahasra jambudhvajanāmadheyānā //🔽abhijānāmyaha mahāmaudgalyāyana caturaśīti buddhasaha srāṇi indradhvajanāmadheyānā //
analyzed: abhijānāmi aha mahāmaudgalyāyana buddha sahasra jambudhvaja nāmadheyānā  abhijānāmi aha mahāmaudgalyāyana caturaśīti buddha saha srāṇi indradhvaja nāmadheyānā
translated: I remember, Mahā Maudgalyāyana, a thousand Buddhas named Jambudhvaja.🔽I remember, Mahā Maudgalyāyana, eighty-four thousand Buddhas named Indradhvaja.

original: abhijānāmyaha mahāmaudgalyāyana pacadaśa buddhasa hasrāṇi ādityanāmadheyānā //
analyzed: abhijānāmi aha mahāmaudgalyāyana pacadaśa buddha sa hasrāṇi āditya nāmadheyānā
translated: I remember, Mahā Maudgalyāyana, fifteen thousand Buddhas named Āditya.

original: abhijānāmyaha mahāmaudgalyāyana dvāṣaṣṭi buddha śatāni anyonyanāmadheyānā /
analyzed: abhijānāmi aha mahāmaudgalyāyana dvāṣaṣṭi buddha śatāni
translated: I remember, Mahā Maudgalyāyana, sixty-two hundred Buddhas with different names.

original: abhijānāmyaha mahāmaudgalyāyana caturṣaṣṭi buddhāna
analyzed: abhijānāmi aha mahāmaudgalyāyana caturṣaṣṭi
translated: I remember, Mahāmaudgalyāyana, sixty-four Buddhas

original: samitāvināmadheyānā //
analyzed: samitā vināmadheyānā
translated: with the name of Samitāvin.

original: suprabhāso nāma mahāmaudgalyāyana tathāgato'rha samyaksa buddho yatra maitreyeṇa bodhisatvena prathama kuśalamūlānyavaropitāni rājñā vairocanena
analyzed: suprabhāsaḥ nāma mahāmaudgalyāyana tathāgataḥ urha samyak sa buddhaḥ yatra maitreyeṇa bodhisatvena prathama kuśala mūlāni avaropitāni rājñā vairocanena
translated: The Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One Suaprabhāsa, Mahāmaudgalyāyana, in whom the Bodhisattva Maitreya first planted the wholesome roots,

original: cakravartibhūtena āyati sabodhi prārthayamānena //
analyzed: cakravarti bhūtena āyati sa bodhi prārthayamānena
translated: when he was the universal monarch Vairocana, aspiring to supreme enlightenment.

original: suprabhāse khalu punarmahāmaudgalyāyana tathāgatabhūte catasraḥ caturaśītikoṭivarṣasahasrāṇi manuṣyāṇāmāyuṣaḥ pramāṇamabhūṣi antarā ca uccāvacatā
analyzed: suprabhāse khalu punar mahāmaudgalyāyana tathāgata bhūte catasraḥ caturaśīti koṭi varṣa sahasrāṇi manuṣyāṇām āyuṣaḥ pramāṇam abhūṣi antarā ca uccāvaca tā  /
translated: In Suaprabhāsa, Mahāmaudgalyāyana, when the Tathāgata was a Buddha, the lifespan of humans was four hundred and eighty thousand koṭis of years. In between, there was variation

original: āyuṣaḥ //
analyzed: āyuṣaḥ
translated: in lifespan.

original: suprabhāsasya khalu punarmahāmaudgalyāyana tathāga tasyārhataḥ samyaksabuddhasya tayaḥ sannipātābhūt /
analyzed: suprabhāsasya khalu punar mahāmaudgalyāyana tathāga tasya arhataḥ samyaksabuddhasya sannipāta abhūt
translated: Suaprabhāsa, Mahāmaudgalyāyana, the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One, had three assemblies of disciples.

original: prathamo śrāvakasannipāto ṣaṇavati koṭīyo abhūṣi sarveṣā arhantānā kṣīṇāśravāṇāmuṣitavratānā samyagājñāvimu ktānā parikṣīṇabhavasayojanānāmanuprāptasvakārthānā
analyzed: prathamaḥ śrāvaka sannipātaḥ ṣaṇavati koṭīyaḥ sarveṣā arhantānā kṣīṇa āśravāṇām uṣita vratānām samyak ājñā vimu ktānām parikṣīṇa bhava sayojanānām anuprāpta svaka arthānām
translated: The first assembly of disciples consisted of ninety-six koṭis, all of whom were arhats, had destroyed the pollutants, had laid down the burden, had accomplished their own goal, had destroyed the fetters that bound them to existence, and had attained complete mastery of mind.

original: dvitīyo śrāvakasannipāto caturnavati koṭiyo abhūtsarveṣāmarhantānā kṣīṇāśravāṇāmuṣitavratānā samyagājñā vimuktānā parikṣīṇabhavasayojanānā
analyzed: dvitīyaḥ śrāvaka sannipātaḥ caturnavati abhūt sarveṣām arhantānā kṣīṇa āśravāṇām uṣita vratānām samyak ājñā vimuktānā parikṣīṇa bhava sayojanānā
translated: The second assembly of disciples numbered ninety-four koṭis, all of whom were Arhans who had destroyed the āśravas, had kept the observances, were liberated by perfect knowledge, had cast off the fetters that bound them to existence,

original: anuprāptasvakārthānā /
analyzed: anuprāpta svaka arthānā
translated: and had attained their own goal.

original: tṛtīyo śrāvakasanni pāto dvānavati koṭiyo abhūṣi sarveṣāmarhantānā kṣīṇāśravāṇāmuṣitavratānā samyagājñāvimuktānā parikṣīṇabhavasayojanānā
analyzed: tṛtīyaḥ śrāvaka sanni pātaḥ dvānavati sarveṣām arhantānā kṣīṇa aśravāṇām uṣita vratānām samyak ājñā vimuktānā parikṣīṇa bhava sayojanānā
translated: The third assembly of disciples numbered ninety-two koṭis, all of whom were Arhans who had destroyed the āśravas, had kept the observances, were liberated by perfect knowledge, had cast off the fetters that bound them to existence,

original: anuprāptasvakārthānā //
analyzed: anuprāpta svaka arthānā
translated: and had attained their own goal.

original: atha khalu mahāmaudgalyāyana rājño vairocanasya ta bhagavanta suprabhāsa dṛṣṭvā udāraharṣa udārave gaprītiprāmodya utpadye //🔽so ta bhagavanta saśrāvakasagha daśa varṣasahasrāṇi satkaresi
analyzed: atha khalu mahāmaudgalyāyana rājñaḥ vairocanasya ta bhagavanta suprabhāsa dṛṣṭvā udāra harṣaḥ udāra ve ga prīti prāmodyaḥ utpadye  saḥ ta bhagavanta sa śrāvaka sagha daśa varṣa sahasrāṇi satkaresi
translated: Then, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, when King Vairocana saw the exalted Suprabhāsa, he was filled with great joy, great exaltation, gladness and gladness of heart.

original: gurukaresi mānesi pūjesi apacāyesi //
analyzed: gurukaresi mānesi pūjesi apacāyesi
translated: He honoured, revered, worshipped and esteemed the exalted one and his community of disciples for ten thousand years.

original: satkṛtvā gurukṛtvā tā ca samitimanu gṛhnanto ta ca śrāvakasaghamanugṛhnanto ta cāyuḥpramāṇamanugṛhnanto eva cittamutpāde si //
analyzed: satkṛtvā gurukṛtvā tā ca samitim anu gṛhnantaḥ ta ca śrāvaka sagham anugṛhnantaḥ ta ca āyuḥ pramāṇam anugṛhnantaḥ eva cittam utpāde
translated: Having honoured, revered, worshipped and esteemed them, and having favoured his own community, and having favoured the community of disciples, and having favoured the duration of life, he conceived this thought:

original: aho punaraha bhaveyamanāgate dhvāne tathāgato'rha samyaksabuddho vidyācaraṇa sapannaḥ sugato lokavidanuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ śāstā
analyzed: aho punar aha bhaveyam anāgate dhvāne sapannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ śāstā  /
translated: May I become in a future time a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Enlightened One, endowed with knowledge and conduct, a Sugata, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed trainer of those who can be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, a Blessed Lord.🔽🔽

original: devānā ca manuṣyāṇā ca yathāya bhagavānsuprabhāso etarahi /
analyzed: devānā ca manuṣyāṇā ca yathāya bhagavān su prabhāsaḥ etarahi
translated: 'May I become in a future time a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Enlightened One, endowed with knowledge and conduct, a Sugata, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed trainer of those who can be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, a Blessed Lord, just as the Blessed One Suprabhāsa is now.

original: eva sarvākārasapanna sarvākārapratipūra dharma deśeya yathāpīha bhagavānsuprabhāso etarahi /
analyzed: eva sarva ākāra sapanna sarva ākāra pratipūra dharma deśeya yathā api iha bhagavān suprabhāsaḥ etarahi
translated: Just as the Blessed One Suprabhāsa is now, may I teach the Dharma that is good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with its own meaning, with its own phrasing, and reveal the pure spiritual life fully complete and perfect.

original: eva samagra śrāvakasagha parihareya yathāpi bhagavānsuprabhāso etarahi /
analyzed: eva samagra śrāvaka sagha parihareya yathā api bhagavān suprabhāsaḥ etarahi
translated: Just as the Blessed One Suprabhāsa now, may I lead an assembly of disciples that is harmonious, upright, and pure.

original: eva ca me devāśca manuṣyāśca śrotavya śraddhātavya manyensuḥ yathāpīda bhagavato suprabhāsasya etarahi /
analyzed: eva ca me devāḥ ca manuṣyāḥ ca śrotavya śraddhātavya manyensuḥ yathā api idam bhagavataḥ suprabhāsasya etarahi
translated: Just as the Blessed One Suprabhāsa is now, may devas and humans think of me as worthy of listening to and believing in.

original: ta bhaveya bahujanahitāya bahuja nasukhāya lokānukapāya mahato janakāyasyārthāya hitāya sukhāya devānā ca manu ṣyāṇā ca //
analyzed: ta bhaveya bahu jana hitāya bahu ja na sukhāya loka anukapāya mahataḥ jana kāyasya arthāya hitāya sukhāya devānā ca manu ca
translated: May I be for the benefit and welfare of the multitude, for the happiness of devas and humans.'

original: eva cāha mahāmaudgalyāyana ato ca bhūyo anya //
analyzed: eva ca āha mahāmaudgalyāyana ca
translated: And so, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, he made this aspiration and more besides.

original: caturacatvāriśa tkalpasaprasthitasya khalu punarmahāmaudgalyāyana maitreyasya bodhisatvasya paścā tāye bodhaye cittamutpādita //
analyzed: caturacatvāriśat kalpasaprasthitasya khalu punar mahāmaudgalyāyana maitreyasya bodhisatvasya paścā tāye bodhaye cittam utpādita
translated: “Again, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, when Maitreya the Bodhisattva had set out for the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, he aroused the thought of enlightenment for the first time.

original: aparājitadhvajo nāma mahāmaudgalyāyana tathāgato'rha samyaksa buddho yo maye saśrāvakasagho varṣasahasra satkṛto gurukṛto mānito pūjito
analyzed: aparājitadhvajaḥ nāma mahāmaudgalyāyana tathāgataḥ urha samyak sa buddhaḥ yaḥ maye sa śrāvaka saghaḥ varṣa sahasra satkṛtaḥ gurukṛtaḥ mānitaḥ pūjitaḥ
translated: “There was, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, a Tathāgata, Arhan and perfect Buddha named Aparājita-dhvaja. He was honoured, revered, esteemed, worshipped and adored by me with my retinue for a thousand years.

original: pacito rājñā dṛḍhadhanunā cakravartibhūtena āyati sabodhi prārthayamānena mahantehi ca pacehi
analyzed: pacitaḥ rājñā dṛḍhadhanunā cakravarti bhūtena āyati sa bodhi prārthayamānena ca pacehi
translated: He was honoured by King Dṛḍhadhanu as a universal king, and by a great crowd of people who were seeking for the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: duṣyayugaśatehi abhicchādito /
analyzed: abhicchāditaḥ
translated: He was covered with a hundred pairs of garments.

original: parinirvṛtasya ca stūpa kārita yojanamuccatvena yo janamabhiniveśena //
analyzed: parinirvṛtasya ca stūpa kārita yojanam ucca tvena yo janam abhiniveśena
translated: And when he had passed entirely away a tope was built for him, a yojana high, and a yojana in circumference, and it was filled with the relics of his body.

original: eṣā ca mahāmaudgalyāyana praṇidhi satatasamitā abhuṣi //
analyzed: eṣā ca mahāmaudgalyāyana
translated: And this vow, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, was constantly and continuously fulfilled.

original: yasmi samaye satvā bhavensuḥ alenā atrāṇā aśaraṇā aparāyaṇā utsadalolā utsadadoṣā utsadamohā akuśalāndharmā samādāya vartensuḥ yobhūyena ca
analyzed: yasmin samaye satvāḥ bhavensuḥ a lenāḥ a trāṇāḥ aśaraṇāḥ a parāyaṇāḥ utsada lolāḥ utsada doṣāḥ utsada mohāḥ akuśalān dharmā samādāya vartensuḥ yobhūyena ca
translated: “At the time when beings were without a leader, a protector, a refuge, a support, a final relief, a goal, when they were full of passion, hatred and folly, and were full of unwholesome practices, and when they were mostly intent on wrong conduct, on wrong view, on wrong speech, on wrong action, on wrong living, on wrong effort, on wrong mindfulness, and on wrong concentration,

original: apāyapra tipūrakā bhavensu tasmi kāle tasmi samaye ahamanuttarā samyaksabodhimabhisabuddhyeha /
analyzed: apāya pra tipūrakā tasmi kāle tasmi samaye aham anuttarā samyaksabodhim abhisabuddhya iha
translated: May I attain supreme perfect enlightenment at that time, in that age, when the hells are being filled up.

original: ta bhaveya bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukapāya mahato janakāyasyārthāya hitāya sukhāya devānā ca manuṣyāṇā ca //
analyzed: te bhaveya bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya loka anukapāya mahataḥ jana kāyasya arthāya hitāya sukhāya devānā ca manuṣyāṇā ca
translated: May I be for the benefit of many people, for the happiness of many people, out of compassion for the world, for the sake of the great multitude, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of devas and humans.

original: duṣkarakārakā mahāmaudgalyāyana tathā gatārhanto samyaksabuddhā lokasyārtha caryā caranti //
analyzed: duṣkara kārakāḥ mahāmaudgalyāyana tathā gata arhantaḥ samyaksabuddhāḥ lokasya artha caryā caranti
translated: Great Maudgalyāyana, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, performs difficult deeds for the sake of the world.

original: idamavocadbhagavānāttamano āyuṣmānmahāmaudgalyāyano bhagavato bhāṣitamabhyanandat //
analyzed: idam avocat bhagavān ātta manaḥ āyuṣmān mahāmaudgalyāyanaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāṣitam abhyanandat
translated: This was said by the Blessed One. The Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana rejoiced in and praised the Blessed One's words.

original: śākyamunināmakānāmupasthitāstriśa koṭiyo jinānā /
analyzed: śākyamuni nāmakānām upasthitāḥ triśa koṭiyaḥ jinānām
translated: Three koṭis of Jinas named Śākyamuni have appeared.

original: aṣṭaśatasahasrāṇi dīpakaranāmadheyānā //
analyzed: aṣṭa śata sahasrāṇi dīpa kara nāmadheyānā
translated: Eight hundred thousand named Dīpaṃkara,

original: ṣaṣṭi ca sahasrāṇi pradyotanāmadheyānā / / / / / /
analyzed: ṣaṣṭi ca sahasrāṇi pradyota nāmadheyānā
translated: and sixty thousand named Pradyota,

original: tatha puṣpanāmakānā trayo koṭiyo vādisihānā //
analyzed: tathā puṣpanāmakānā trayaḥ koṭiyaḥ vādisihānā
translated: and three koṭis of lion-like speakers named Puṣpa,

original: aṣṭādaśa sahasrāṇi māradhvajanāmakānā sugatānā /
analyzed: aṣṭādaśa sahasrāṇi māradhvaja nāmakānā sugatānā
translated: and eighteen thousand Sugatas named Māradhvaja,

original: yatra care brahmacarya sarvajñatāmabhilāṣāya //
analyzed: yatra care brahmacarya sarvajña tām abhilāṣāya
translated: where he practiced celibacy aspiring for omniscience.

original: pūjayi paca śatāni padmottaranāmakānā sugatānā /
analyzed: paca śatāni padma uttara nāmakānā sugatānā
translated: He worshipped one hundred and five Sugatas named Padmottara,

original: kauṇḍiṇyanāmakānāmaparāṇi dvi sahasrāṇi //
analyzed: kauṇḍiṇya nāmakānām aparāṇi dvi sahasrāṇi
translated: And another two thousand named Kauṇḍinya.

original: aparimitāsakhyeyā pratyekajināna koṭinayutā ca /
analyzed: aparimitā asakhyeyā ca
translated: He worshipped countless koṭis of nayutas of Pratyekabuddhas,

original: pūjayi buddhasahasra jambudhvajanāmadheyānā //
analyzed: buddha sahasra jambudhvaja nāmadheyānā
translated: And a thousand Buddhas named Jambudhvaja.

original: caturaśīti sahasrāṇi indradhvajanāmakānā sugatānā /
analyzed: caturaśīti sahasrāṇi indradhvaja nāmakānā sugatānā
translated: Eighty-four thousand Sugatas named Indradhvaja,

original: navati ca sahasrāṇi kāśyapasahanāmadheyānā //🔽pacadaśa buddhasahasrāṇi pratāpanāmakānā sugatānā /
analyzed: navati ca sahasrāṇi  pacadaśa buddha sahasrāṇi pratāpa nāmakānā sugatānā
translated: And ninety thousand named Kāśyapa,🔽Fifteen thousand Sugatas named Pratāpa,

original: pacadaśa ca sahasrāṇi ādityanāmadheyānā //
analyzed: pacadaśa ca sahasrāṇi āditya nāmadheyānā
translated: And fifteen named Āditya,

original: dvāṣaṣṭi ca śatāni sugatānā anyonyanāmadheyānā /
analyzed: dvāṣaṣṭi ca śatāni sugatānām anyonya nāmadheyānām
translated: Sixty-two hundred Sugatas with different names,

original: catuṣaṣṭi ca sahasrāṇi samitāvīnāmadheyānā //
analyzed: catuṣaṣṭi ca sahasrāṇi samitāvī nāmadheyānā
translated: And sixty-four thousand named Samitāvin,

original: ete ca kolitaśirī anye ca daśabalā aparimāṇā /
analyzed: ete ca kolitaśirī anye ca daśabalāḥ aparimāṇā
translated: These and other immeasurable Daśabalas, O Kolita,

original: sarve anityatāya samitā lokapradyotā //
analyzed: sarve anityatāya samitāḥ loka pradyotā
translated: All the Lokapradīpas have passed away due to impermanence.

original: yāni ca balāni kolita teṣā mahāpuruṣalakṣavarāṇā /
analyzed: yāni ca balāni kolita teṣām mahāpuruṣa lakṣa varāṇā
translated: Those great men, the foremost of the excellent, O Kolita,

original: sarve anityatāya kāla na upenti sakhyā ca //
analyzed: sarve anityatāya kāla na upenti sakhyā ca
translated: All have not escaped the time of impermanence, even though they were friends.

original: jñātvānānityabala sudāruṇa satkṛtasya anantara /
analyzed: su dāruṇa satkṛtasya anantara
translated: Having known the extremely terrible power of impermanence, O Kolita, after the worship of the infinite,

original: vīryārambho yojito anityabalasya vighātāya //
analyzed: vīrya ārambhaḥ yojitaḥ anitya balasya vighātāya
translated: The exertion of energy is applied to destroy the power of impermanence.

original: ito maudgalyāyana aparimite asakhyeye kalpe ratno nāma samyaksabuddho abhūṣi tathāgato rha samyaksabuddho vidyācaraṇasampannaḥ sugato lokavidanuttaraḥ
analyzed: itas maudgalyāyana aparimite asakhyeye kalpe ratnaḥ nāma samyaksabuddhaḥ abhūṣi tathāgataḥ rha samyaksabuddhaḥ vidyā caraṇa sampannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ  /
translated: Maudgalyāyana, in this world, in the past, innumerable, incalculable eons ago, there was a Perfectly Awakened One named Ratna, a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Awakened One, perfect in knowledge and conduct, a Sugata, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed trainer of those who can be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, a Blessed One.

original: puruṣadamya sārathiḥ śāstā devānā ca manuṣyāṇā ca //
analyzed: puruṣa damya sārathiḥ śāstā devānā ca manuṣyāṇā ca
translated: He was the Teacher of gods and humans, the Well-Gone One, the Knower of the World, the Unsurpassed One, the Trainer of those to be tamed, the Teacher of gods and humans, the Buddha, the Blessed One.

original: aha tadā rājā cakravarti abhūṣi //
analyzed: aha tadā rājā cakravarti abhūṣi
translated: At that time, I was a wheel-turning king.

original: tato mayaitasya bhagavato ratanavato caturaśīti kūṭāgārasahasrāṇi kāritāni ci
analyzed: tatas mayā etasya bhagavataḥ caturaśīti kūṭāgāra sahasrāṇi kāritāni
translated: Then, I had eighty-four thousand palaces built for that Blessed One Ratna,

original: trāṇi darśanīyāni saptānā ratnānā suvarṇasya rūpyasya muktāyā vaiḍūryasya sphāṭikasya musāragalvasya lohitikāyāḥ //
analyzed: trāṇi darśanīyāni saptānā ratnānā suvarṇasya rūpyasya muktāyāḥ vaiḍūryasya sphāṭikasya musāragalvasya lohitikāyāḥ
translated: beautiful and delightful, made of the seven precious substances: gold, silver, pearl, beryl, crystal, white coral, and ruby.

original: tāni mayā tasya bhagavato niryātetvā bodhāya anupraṇihita //
analyzed: tāni mayā tasya bhagavataḥ niryātā itvā bodhāya anupraṇihita
translated: Having offered them to that Blessed One, I made a vow for awakening.

original: na tāvadbuddhā bhagavanto parinirvāyanti yāvadyuvarājā anabhi ṣikto bhavati /
analyzed: na tāvat buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ parinirvāyanti yāvat yuvarājā an abhi siktaḥ bhavati
translated: The Blessed Buddhas do not pass into parinirvāṇa as long as the young prince has not been consecrated.

original: eṣo mama anantara buddho loke bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: eṣaḥ mama anantara buddhaḥ loke bhaviṣyati
translated: He will be the Buddha in the world after me.

original: yathaitarhi mayā maitreyo vyākṛto eṣo mamānantara buddho bhaviṣyatīti //
analyzed: yathā etarhi mayā maitreyaḥ vyākṛtaḥ eṣaḥ mama anantara buddhaḥ bhaviṣyati iti
translated: Just as now I have prophesied Maitreya, saying, ‘He will become a Buddha after me.’

original: so bhagavā caturaśītihi śrāvakasahasrehi sārdha caturaśītisavartavivartasthito savartamāne loke bhagavāñcaturaśī hihi śrāvakasahasrehi
analyzed: saḥ bhagavā caturaśītihi śrāvaka sahasrehi sārdha savartamāne loke bhagavān caturaśī hi hi śrāvaka sahasrehi
translated: That Blessed One, together with eighty-four thousand disciples, in the world of expansion, the Blessed One together with eighty-four thousand disciples

original: sārdha ābhāsvara devanikāya gacchati vivartamāne loke ihā gacchati iha dharma deśayati /
analyzed: sārdha ābhāsvara devanikāya gacchati vivartamāne loke ihā gacchati iha dharma deśayati
translated: goes to the Ābhāsvara group of gods in the world of expansion, and comes here in the world of contraction, and teaches the Dharma here.

original: aha bhūyo rājā cakravartī bhavāmi /
analyzed: aha bhūyas rājā cakravartī bhavāmi
translated: I become a wheel-turning king again.

original: caturaśīti kūṭāgārasahasrāṇi kārāpayitvā bhagavato ratanavato niryātemi //
analyzed: caturaśīti kūṭāgāra sahasrāṇi kārāpayitvā bhagavataḥ ratanavataḥ
translated: Having had eighty-four thousand kūṭāgāras built, I offer them to the Blessed One Ratna.

original: iya mahāmaudgalyāyana praṇidhicaryā //
analyzed: iya mahāmaudgalyāyana praṇidhi caryā
translated: This, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, is the practice of aspiration.

original: katamā ca anulomacaryā //
analyzed: katamā ca anuloma caryā
translated: And what is the practice of conformity?

original: iha mahāmaudgalyāyana bodhisatvo mahāsatvo bo dhāya anulomatāye sthito bhavati //
analyzed: iha mahāmaudgalyāyana bodhisatvaḥ mahāsatvaḥ sthitaḥ bhavati
translated: Here, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, the Bodhisattva, the Great Being, is established in conformity with enlightenment.

original: iya mahāmaudgalyāyana / / / / / / / / / / avivartacaryā //
analyzed: iya mahāmaudgalyāyana a vivarta caryā
translated: This, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, is the practice of non-retrogression.

original: vivartanti sasaranti vivartacaryā //
analyzed: vivartanti sasaranti vivarta caryā
translated: They retrogress, they flow, it is the practice of retrogression.

original: avaivartiyā bodhāya bhavanti avivartacaryā //
analyzed: avaivartiyāḥ bodhāya bhavanti a vivarta caryā
translated: They do not retrogress from enlightenment, it is the practice of non-retrogression.

original: atra daśabhūmiko kartavyo dīpakaravastu ca //
analyzed: atra daśa bhūmikaḥ kartavyaḥ dīpakara vastu ca
translated: Here, the Dashabhumi should be performed, as well as the Dipankara chapter.

original: namo stu buddhānā namo'rhatā //
analyzed: namaḥ stu buddhānā namaḥ ūrhatā
translated: Homage to the Buddhas, homage to the Arhats.

original: daśabhūmikasyādi vatte apratima dharmadarśana
analyzed: daśa bhūmikasya ādi vatte apratima dharma darśana
translated: The beginning of the Dashabhumi, the incomparable teaching of the Dharma,

original: naikakalpaśatasacitātmanā /
analyzed: na eka kalpa śata sacita ātmanā
translated: The one whose essence is accumulated over many hundreds of kalpas,

original: bhūmayo daśa jināna śrīmatā yairvikurviṣu sadā paṇḍitā //
analyzed: bhūmayaḥ daśa śrīmatā yaiḥ vikurviṣu sadā
translated: The ten bhumi of the glorious Jinas, by which the wise always manifest transformations.

original: mānadarpamadamohamocitā sarvaśaḥ samiyamārdavānvitā /
analyzed: māna darpa mada moha mocitā sarvaśas samiya mārdava anvitā
translated: Free from pride, arrogance, delusion, and confusion, endowed with equality and gentleness in all ways,

original: gaurava janiya sarvadarśiṣu śrūyatā jinavarasya śāsana //
analyzed: gaurava sarva darśiṣu śrūyatā jinavarasya śāsana
translated: Having generated respect for all the Omniscient Ones, listen to the teaching of the supreme Jina.

original: nirvṛte kanakarāśisannibhe śākyanandijanane tathāgate /
analyzed: nirvṛte kanaka rāśi sannibhe śākyanandijanane tathāgate
translated: When the Tathagata who gives joy to the Shakyas, who is like a heap of gold, has passed into Nirvana,

original: kapi medini saśailakānanā sāgarābaradharā saparvatā //
analyzed: kapi medini sa śaila kānanā sāgara abara dharā sa parvatā
translated: The earth with its mountains and forests, the oceans, the sky, the earth, and the mountains,

original: kampita paramaromaharṣaṇa bhūmikapamanudṛśya dāruṇa /
analyzed: kampita parama romaharṣaṇa bhūmikapam anudṛśya dāruṇa
translated: Trembled violently, causing the hair to stand on end, when the terrible earthquake was seen.

original: kāśyapo dhutaguṇāgrapārago cittamabhyupagataḥ tadā abhūt //
analyzed: kāśyapaḥ cittam abhyupagataḥ tadā abhūt
translated: Kashyapa, who has gone to the other shore of the excellent qualities of renunciation, then became absorbed in meditation.

original: ki nu adya dharaṇī saparvatā sāgarāmbaradharā vasundharā /
analyzed: ki nu adya dharaṇī sa parvatā sāgara ambara dharā vasundharā
translated: Why does the earth with its mountains, the oceans, the sky, the earth, and the mountains,

original: kampate paramadāruṇasvara nūna nirvṛti gatastathāgataḥ //
analyzed: kampate parama dāruṇa svara nūna nirvṛti gataḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: Tremble with a terrible sound? Surely the Tathagata has passed into Nirvana.

original: so ca divyanayanastathāgata devakinnaravarehi vandita /
analyzed: saḥ ca divya nayanaḥ tathāgata deva kinnara varehi vandita
translated: And that Tathāgata, with the divine eye, was worshipped by the best of gods and kinnaras.

original: dṛśya sarvabhavabandhanāntaka nirvṛta yamakaśālaantare //
analyzed: dṛśya sarva bhava bandhana antaka nirvṛta
translated: Seen by all, the end of the bonds of existence, he attained Nirvāṇa in the Yaka-śāla grove.

original: na khalu me samucita tathāgata ṛddhiye samanugantu gautama /
analyzed: na khalu me tathāgataḥ ṛddhiye samanugantu gautama
translated: It is not fitting for me to follow the Tathāgata by his miraculous power, O Gautama.

original: padbhireva vadatā vara muni draṣṭumapratima pravrajāmyaha //
analyzed: padbhiḥ eva vadatā vara muni draṣṭum apratima pravrajāmi aha
translated: I shall go forth on foot, O best of speakers, O sage, to see the incomparable one.

original: so ca matva tvaramāṇo sūrī kāśyapo mathitamānaso bhikṣuḥ /
analyzed: saḥ ca matvā tvaramāṇaḥ sūrī kāśyapaḥ mathita mānasaḥ bhikṣuḥ
translated: And that wise one, Kāśyapa, quickly thought, his mind agitated,

original: bhikṣubhirbahubhiruttamo pari nirvṛtabhuvamanupūrvamāgami //
analyzed: bhikṣubhiḥ bahubhiḥ uttamaḥ pari nirvṛta bhuvam anupūrvam āgami
translated: With many monks, the best one has come in due order to the place of Nirvāṇa.

original: tasya ca praṇidhirāsi uttamā kāśyapasya jinapādavandane /
analyzed: tasya ca praṇidhiḥ āsi uttamā kāśyapasya jina pāda vandane
translated: And he had the highest aspiration, Kāśyapa, to bow at the feet of the Victorious One.

original: tau / / / / caraṇau mahāmune mūrdhinā upanipīḍya vanditu ///🔽sagṛhyolkā vipulā atha catasro mallakā upagatā balavantaḥ /
analyzed: tau caraṇau mahā mune mūrdhinā upanipīḍya vanditu  sa gṛhya ulkāḥ vipulāḥ atha catasraḥ mallakāḥ upagatāḥ balavantaḥ
translated: He should bow down with his head to the feet of the Great Sage.🔽Then four strong Malla men, holding large torches, came.

original: vījitā paramamallavinītā dagdhaḍalkā abhiprāṇamayensuḥ //
analyzed: vījitā parama malla vinītā dagdha ḍalkā
translated: The well-trained, supremely skilled wrestlers bowed down with their torches burning.

original: taiścitāmabhimukha upanītā taiḥ parākramabalai rathaśūraiḥ /
analyzed: taiḥ citām abhimukhaḥ upanītā taiḥ parākrama balaiḥ ratha śūraiḥ
translated: They, the brave charioteers, strong in their prowess, brought the pyre near.

original: nirvṛtā ca / / / / / sā samakāla prāpya vāripariṣekamivolkā //
analyzed: nirvṛtā ca sā sama kāla prāpya vāri pariṣekam iva ulkā
translated: And when it was extinguished, it was immediately extinguished, like a torch dipped in oil.

original: saśaya vimatimadhyamupetya mallā divyanayana aniruddha /🔽gauravā nataśirā suvinītā praśnam / / / / / ida paripṛcche //
analyzed: saśaya vimati madhyam upetya mallāḥ divya nayana aniruddha  gauravā nata śirā su vinītā praśnam ida paripṛcche
translated: The Mallas, having come to the midst of doubt and uncertainty, to the one with the divine eye, Aniruddha,

original: ko nu heturiha pratyayo ca ko yenimā jinasutā upanītā /
analyzed: kaḥ nu hetuḥ iha ca kaḥ yena imāḥ jinasutāḥ upanītāḥ
translated: with bowed heads and well-disciplined, asked this question: What is the cause here, what is the condition, by which these sons of the Jina have been brought here?

original: nirvṛti upagatā sahasolkā brūhi kāraṇamihārya yathāvat //
analyzed: nirvṛti upagatā sahasā ulkā brūhi kāraṇam iha ārya yathāvat
translated: Having attained extinction, they have suddenly been extinguished like a torch. Noble one, tell us the reason here as it is.

original: devatā khalu prasannā kāśyape tasya eṣa khalu ṛddhibhāvanā /
analyzed: devatā khalu prasannā kāśyape tasya eṣa khalu ṛddhi bhāvanā
translated: The gods are indeed pleased with Kashyapa. This is indeed the manifestation of his spiritual power.

original: naiva tāva jvalano jvaliṣyati yāva nāgato agrapāragaḥ //
analyzed: na eva tāva jvalanaḥ jvaliṣyati yāva na āgataḥ agra pāragaḥ
translated: The fire will not burn until the one who has gone to the other shore returns.

original: tasya caiṣa praṇidhiḥ samṛdhyati kāśyapasya dhutadharmadhāriṇaḥ /
analyzed: tasya ca eṣa praṇidhiḥ samṛdhyati kāśyapasya dhuta dharma dhāriṇaḥ
translated: And this aspiration of his is fulfilled, of Kashyapa, the bearer of the Dharma of austerity.

original: tau kramau daśabalasya śrīmataḥ vanditu hi śirasā mahāmune //
analyzed: tau kramau daśabalasya śrīmataḥ vanditu hi śirasā mahā mune
translated: In order to pay homage with his head to the feet of the glorious one with the ten powers, the great sage.

original: so ca bhikṣugaṇasapuraskṛtaḥ kāśyapo dhutarajo jinātmajaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ ca bhikṣu gaṇa sa puraskṛtaḥ kāśyapaḥ dhutarajaḥ jina ātmajaḥ
translated: And that Kashyapa, the son of the Jina, the one with the dust of afflictions blown away, surrounded by a group of monks,

original: prājalī jinacitāmupāgato gauravā praṇataśīrṣamānasaḥ //
analyzed: prājalī jina citām upāgataḥ gauravā praṇata śīrṣa mānasaḥ
translated: having approached the Jina's funeral pyre, with reverence and bowed head and mind,

original: dṛśya ta pravararūpadhāriṇa kāṣṭhasacayagata tathāgata /
analyzed: dṛśya ta pravara rūpa dhāriṇa kāṣṭha sacaya gata tathāgata
translated: saw the Tathagata lying on a pile of wood, the one bearing the supreme form.🔽The one with the ten powers, the one with the thirty-two marks, the one with the eighty minor marks, the one with the radiance of a thousand suns, the one with the ushnisha, the one with the deep blue eyes, the one with the body hairs pointing upwards, the one with the body hairs growing singly, the one with the golden complexion, the one with the body hairs growing towards the top, the one with the body hairs growing in an orderly manner, the one with the body hairs growing in a clockwise direction, the one with the body hairs growing in a straight line, the one with the body hairs growing evenly, the one with the body hairs growing in an orderly manner, the one with the body hairs growing in a clockwise direction, the one with the body hairs growing in a straight line, the one with the body hairs growing evenly, the one with the body hairs growing in an orderly manner, the one with the body hairs growing in a clockwise direction, the one with the body hairs growing in a straight line, the one with the body hairs growing evenly, the one with the body hairs growing in an orderly manner, the one with

original: dhigbhavāniti girāmudīrayī darśitaprakṛtibhāvalakṣaṇā //
analyzed: dhik bhavān iti girām udīrayī darśita prakṛti bhāva lakṣaṇā
translated: You utter the words Shame on you! revealing the characteristics of your true nature.

original: ko nu so bhavamupetya prāṇako yo na mṛtyuvaśamāgamiṣyati /
analyzed: kaḥ nu saḥ bhavam upetya prāṇakaḥ yaḥ na mṛtyu vaśam āgamiṣyati
translated: What living being, having come into existence, will not fall under the power of death?

original: yatraya jvalanakācanopamo nirvṛto śikhirivendhana vinā //🔽kṛtva ajalipuṭa mahāyaśo pādato jinavarasya kāśyapo /
analyzed: nirvṛtaḥ śikhiḥ iva indhana vinā  pādataḥ jinavarasya kāśyapaḥ
translated: Where the one who is extinguished is like a fire without fuel, like a flame without kindling.🔽Having made a water pot, the greatly famous Kāśyapa,🔽with his head, fell at the feet of the supreme Victor, the Great Sage.

original: mūrdhinā nipatito maharṣiṇo paścima ida namasyate mune //🔽tau ca cakravaralakṣitau kramau devadānavavarehi vanditau /
analyzed: mūrdhinā nipatitaḥ mahā ṛṣiṇaḥ paścimaḥ namasyate mune  tau ca cakravara lakṣitau kramau deva dānava vara ihi vanditau
translated: The last one to bow to the Sage,🔽Those two steps, marked by the supreme wheel, worshipped by the best of gods and demons,

original: niḥsṛtau tatha vidārya tā citā devayakṣabhujagānubhāvitau //
analyzed: niḥsṛtau tathā vidārya tā citāḥ deva yakṣa bhujaga anubhāvitau
translated: Having emerged thus, having split the pyre, worshipped by gods, yakṣas, and serpents.

original: tau kramau śirasi sannipātiya pāṇibhiḥ samanugṛhya cā mune /
analyzed: tau kramau śirasi pāṇibhiḥ samanugṛhya ca mune
translated: Having placed those two steps on his head, and having touched them with his hands, the Sage,

original: ālape śrutidhara maharṣiṇa antikāvacaraḥ kāśyapastadā //
analyzed: ālape śruti dhara mahā ṛṣiṇa antika avacaraḥ kāśyapaḥ tadā
translated: The one who was close to the Sage, Kāśyapa, who remembered what he heard, spoke then:

original: ki tvimau śrutidhara kramau mune dhyāmatāmupagatau na suprabhau /
analyzed: ki tu imau śruti dhara kramau mune dhyāma tām upagatau na su prabhau
translated: Why are these two steps, O Sage, who remembers what he heard, have they become dark, not very bright?

original: brūhi kāraṇamaśeṣamāhvaya yenimau na nayanābhinandinau //
analyzed: brūhi kāraṇam aśeṣam āhvaya yena imau na nayana abhinandinau
translated: Tell the complete reason why they do not delight the eyes.

original: eta śrutva śrutasacayadharo kāśyapa idamuvāca paṇḍito /
analyzed: kāśyapaḥ idam uvāca paṇḍitaḥ
translated: Having heard this, Kāśyapa, who remembered what he heard, the wise one, said this:

original: aśruvegaduṣitā va śocatā roditehi mathitā himau kramau //
analyzed: aśru vega duṣitāḥ vaḥ śocatā roditā ihi mathitā himau kramau
translated: And the two feet of the Sage are covered with tears and are churned by the tears of the grieving ones.

original: tenimau kramavarau mahāmuneḥ rodanena janatābhipīḍitau /
analyzed: tenimau krama varau mahā muneḥ rodanena jana tā abhipīḍitau
translated: These two excellent feet of the great Sage are afflicted by the tears of the people.

original: no vibhānti munino yathā purā evametadanupaśya suvrata //
analyzed: no vibhānti muninaḥ yathā purā evam etat anupaśya suvrata
translated: They do not shine as they did before, O Sage of good vows, see it thus.

original: so nipatya śirasā punaḥ punaḥ tau kramau pravaracakralakṣaṇau /
analyzed: saḥ nipatya śirasā punar punar tau kramau pravara cakra lakṣaṇau
translated: He falls down again and again with his head to those feet, which bear the marks of excellent wheels,

original: karatalehi abhipīḍayetmune śāstu gauravaparāya buddhiye //
analyzed: kara tale hi abhipīḍayet mune śāstu gaurava parāya
translated: And presses them with his hands, the Sage, out of respect for the Teacher, with his mind intent on the Buddha.

original: vanditau ca dhutadharmadhāriṇā tau kramau guṇadhareṇa śāstuno /🔽lokanāthacitakāṣṭha tejasā vāyuvegavidhutena dīpyati //
analyzed: vanditau ca dhuta dharma dhāriṇā tau kramau guṇa dhareṇa  tejasā vāyu vega vidhutena dīpyati
translated: And those feet of the Teacher, which bear the marks of excellence, are worshipped by the one who upholds the pure Dharma,🔽And they shine with the radiance of the funeral pyre of the Lord of the World, fanned by the force of the wind.

original: dahyamāne jinacandraśarīre paca tāni vaśibhūtaśatāni /
analyzed: dahyamāne jinacandra śarīre paca tāni vaśi bhūta śatāni
translated: When the body of the moon-like Victor is burning, those hundreds of powerful ones,

original: mantrayanti sahitā samupetya nirvṛtīsamayakāle sagīti //
analyzed: mantrayanti sahitā samupetya nirvṛtī samaya kāle
translated: Having come together, chant in unison at the time of nirvana.

original: nirvṛto pravaralakṣaṇadhārī yo nu śāstu sasurāsuranetā /
analyzed: pravara lakṣaṇa dhārī yaḥ nu śāstu sa sura asura netā
translated: The one who has passed into nirvana, the bearer of the excellent marks, the leader of gods and asuras, the Teacher,

original: ko guṇo iha ciraparivāse vayamapyadya vijahāmatha deha //
analyzed: kaḥ guṇaḥ iha cira parivāse vayam api adya vijahām atha
translated: What benefit is there in dwelling here any longer? We too will abandon our bodies today.

original: sarvathā supariniṣṭhitakāryāḥ prāpya acyutamaśokamananta /
analyzed: sarvathā su pariniṣṭhita kāryāḥ prāpya acyutam aśokam ananta
translated: In every way, our tasks are well accomplished. Having attained the imperishable, sorrowless, infinite,

original: sarvabhāvabhavavītigatā sma eṣa nirvṛtimupema ihaiva //
analyzed: sarva bhāva bhava vīti gatāḥ smaḥ eṣa nirvṛtim upemaḥ iha eva
translated: We have transcended the entire existence of all beings, and we have attained nirvana right here.

original: evamukte dhutadharmaviśuddho kāśyapo bravi tadā vaśibhūtā /
analyzed: evam ukte tadā vaśi bhūtā
translated: When this was said, the one who was pure in the practice of austerities, Kashyapa, then spoke to the powerful ones:

original: na khu bhavadbhiranupādivimukti nirvṛtī samanugamya ihaiva //
analyzed: na khu bhavadbhiḥ an upādi vimukti nirvṛtī samanugamyaḥ iha eva
translated: You have not attained nirvana through non-attachment and non-clinging right here.

original: tīrthikā ca bahidhānugatāśca kreyurapratimaśāsanadoṣa /
analyzed: tīrthikā ca bahidhā anugatāḥ ca kreyuḥ apratima śāsana doṣa
translated: The non-Buddhists and those who follow external paths will accuse you of faults in the incomparable teaching.

original: dhūmakālikamiti śramaṇasya etadeva ca tu rakṣaṇiya no //
analyzed: dhūmakālikam iti śramaṇasya etat eva ca tu
translated: For an ascetic, this is like a flash of lightning. This alone should be protected by us.

original: lokanātha bahavo narasihā
analyzed: loka nātha bahavaḥ nara sihāḥ
translated: O Lord of the World, there have been many lion-like men

original: ye canāgata mahāmatiśūrā /
analyzed: ye cana āgata mahāmati śūrā
translated: And those who will come in the future, greatly wise and courageous.

original: te hi no upapadeyurudagrā yadi na sakaliye śāsana śāstuḥ //
analyzed: te hi naḥ upapadeyuḥ udagrāḥ yadi na śāstuḥ
translated: They would have come to us if the entire teaching of the Teacher were not to decline.

original: tena apratihatāḥ susamagrāḥ gāyathā sugataśāsanamagyra /
analyzed: tena apratihatāḥ su samagrāḥ gāyathā sugata śāsanamagyra
translated: Therefore, unobstructed and well-united, sing the foremost of the Sugata's teachings.

original: yatha ida suparigīta yathārtha ciratara naramarūṣu viroce //
analyzed: yatha ida suparigīta yathārtha ciratara naramarūṣu viroce
translated: So that this, well-sung and meaningful, may shine for a long time among humans and gods.

original: evamastu iti te vaśibhūtā kāśyapasya vacana pratipūjya /
analyzed: evam astu iti te vaśi bhūtā kāśyapasya vacana pratipūjya
translated: So be it! The powerful ones, having honored Kashyapa's words,

original: cittamapyupagatā kva idānī deśi dharmadharasagaṇanā syāt //
analyzed: cittam api upagatā kva idānī deśi dharma dhara sa gaṇanā syāt
translated: Thought, Where should the assembly of Dharma-holders gather now?

original: ramyakānanavane susamṛddhe māgadhasya magadhādhipatisya /
analyzed: ramya kānana vane su samṛddhe māgadhasya magadha adhipatisya
translated: In the delightful forest grove, abundant and prosperous, of the Magadha king of Magadha,

original: puravare bhavatu rājagṛhasmi saptaparṇaabhidhānaguhāyā //
analyzed: puravare bhavatu saptaparṇa abhidhāna guhāyā
translated: Let it be in the excellent city of Rajagriha, in the cave called Saptaparna.

original: parvatasya vaihāyavarasya uttarasmi tīre varapārśve /
analyzed: parvatasya vaihāyavarasya uttarasmi tīre varapārśve
translated: On the northern slope of the excellent mountain Vaibharat,

original: vividhapādape śilātalabhūmeḥ bhāge ya bhavatu dharmasamāsyā //🔽te ca ṛddhivaśibhāvabalasthā
analyzed: vividha pādape śilā tala bhūmeḥ bhāge bhavatu  te ca ṛddhi vaśi bhāva bala sthā
translated: Let there be a gathering of the Dharma in a place with various trees, on a rocky surface of the ground.

original: udgatāḥ khagapathe jinaputrā /🔽tatkṣaṇāntara / / / / prapalānā mānasa saro yathā hasayūtho //
analyzed: udgatāḥ khaga pathe jinaputrā  tad kṣaṇa antara mānasa saraḥ yathā
translated: And those sons of the Victorious Ones, who have attained the power of miraculous abilities,🔽Rose up into the sky,🔽And in that very moment, they flew away like a flock of geese to Lake Manasarovar.

original: te pratiṣṭhitā nagāgravarasya pārśve tadvanamupetya niṣaṇā /🔽śāsane ca sugatasya sūgīte devadundubhigaṇāni nadensuḥ //
analyzed: te pratiṣṭhitāḥ naga agra varasya pārśve tat vanam upetya niṣaṇā  śāsane ca sugatasya su gīte deva dundubhi gaṇāni
translated: They settled on the excellent peak of the mountain, and having entered that forest, they sat down.🔽And in the teaching of the Sugata, the assemblies of divine drums sounded.

original: te ca dundubhina nāda nadanta śrutva śāsanakarā sugatasya /
analyzed: te ca nāda nadanta śrutva śāsana karā sugatasya
translated: And those who were engaged in the teaching of the Sugata, having heard the sound of the drums,

original: bhūmikampamanudṛśya ca ghora kāśyapa dhutaraja idamūcuḥ //
analyzed: bhūmikampam anudṛśya ca ghora kāśyapa dhuta rajaḥ idam ūcuḥ
translated: And having seen the terrible earthquake, Kashyapa Dhutaraja said this:

original: kintu bhoḥ dhutadharā samakapi medinī sasaritā sasamudrā /
analyzed: kintu bhoḥ dhutadharā sama kapi medinī sa saritā sa samudrā
translated: What is this, O you who are firm in the pure Dharma? The earth with its rivers and oceans,

original: devadundubhiravāśca manojñā divyamālyavikiraṇa ca bhavanti //
analyzed: deva dundubhi ravāḥ ca manojñāḥ ca bhavanti
translated: And the delightful sounds of the divine drums, and the scattering of divine garlands, what is this?

original: tānuvāca dhutadharmasamagī kāśyapo jinasutā vaśibhūtā /
analyzed: tān uvāca kāśyapaḥ jina sutā vaśi bhūtā
translated: To them, Kashyapa, the son of the Victorious Ones, who had attained mastery, said this:

original: ete sannipatitā marusaghā śrutva śāsanavara susamagyra //
analyzed: ete sannipatitāḥ maru saghā śrutvā śāsana vara su samagyra
translated: The hosts of Maruts have assembled, having heard the excellent teaching of the one with perfect equanimity.

original: te samagravaralakṣaṇadhārī gauravātpramuditā marusaghāḥ /
analyzed: te samagra vara lakṣaṇa dhārī gauravāt pramuditāḥ maru saghāḥ
translated: The hosts of Maruts, bearing the excellent marks of perfection, are filled with joy and respect,

original: pūjā apratimakasya karonti
analyzed: pūjāḥ apratimakasya karonti
translated: making offerings to the incomparable one,

original: śāsana śṛṇuyu sarvasamagyra //
analyzed: śāsana śṛṇuyu sarva samagyra
translated: listening to the teaching of the one with perfect equanimity.

original: so hi naikabhavakalpaśatehi hitasukhāya naradevagaṇānā /
analyzed: saḥ hi hita sukhāya
translated: For many hundreds of eons, for the benefit and happiness of humans and gods,

original: evamabhyupagato cirarātra mokṣayiṣye ha prajā parimuktaḥ //
analyzed: evam abhyupagataḥ cirarātra mokṣayiṣye ha prajāḥ parimuktaḥ
translated: thus resolved, for a long time I will liberate beings, myself liberated.

original: so labhitva paramārthamaśoka sarvabhāvabhavaduḥkhanirodha /
analyzed: saḥ parama artham aśoka sarva bhāva bhava duḥkha nirodha
translated: Having attained the highest truth, free from sorrow, the cessation of the suffering of all existence and becoming,

original: kāśipuryā naradevahitārtha vartayiṣyi varacakramadbhuta //
analyzed: kāśi puryāḥ naradeva hita artha vartayiṣyi vara cakram adbhuta
translated: for the benefit of humans and gods in the city of Kashi, I will turn the wondrous wheel of the Dharma.

original: pacakehi saha tehi munīhi marugaṇā vinayavādinā varo /
analyzed: pacakehi saha tehi maru gaṇā vinaya vādinā
translated: Together with those sages and hosts of Maruts, the excellent teacher of discipline,

original: satvakoṭinayutāni nāyako jātijanmamaraṇātsamuddhare //
analyzed: sattva koṭi nayutāni nāyakaḥ jāti janma maraṇāt samuddhare
translated: the leader will deliver many quintillions of beings from birth, aging, and death.

original: so vimokṣayi bhavābhinandino toṣaya naramarū narasiho /
analyzed: toṣaya nara marū
translated: Liberating those who delight in existence, satisfying humans and gods, the lion among men,

original: mathiya sarvaparavādi sāprata nirvṛto tu bhagavā nirapekṣo //
analyzed: sarva para vādi sāprata nirvṛtaḥ tu bhagavān nirapekṣaḥ
translated: having defeated all opponents, the Blessed One, free from concern, will attain nirvana.

original: eta śrutva vacana manorama kāśyapasya dhutadharmadhāriṇo /
analyzed: eta śrutva vacana manorama kāśyapasya dhuta dharma dhāriṇaḥ
translated: Having heard these delightful words of Kashyapa, the bearer of the pure Dharma,🔽 the hosts of Maruts, the sages, and the gods, their minds filled with joy,

original: devasaghā muditā nabhe sthitā vyāharanti vacana manorama //
analyzed: deva saghāḥ muditāḥ nabhe sthitāḥ vyāharanti vacana manorama
translated: The assembly of gods, delighted, stood in the sky and spoke these delightful words:

original: sādhu sādhu dhutadharmakovidā
analyzed: sādhu sādhu dhuta dharma kovidā
translated: Excellent, excellent, O one skilled in the teachings of the ascetic!

original: śāstu śāsanakarā ananyathā /
analyzed: śāstu śāsana karā ananyathā
translated: You who carry out the teachings of the Teacher without error,

original: bhāṣase guṇamanantabuddhino jetavane naramarū sutoṣitā //
analyzed: bhāṣase guṇam ananta buddhinaḥ jetavane nara marū su toṣitā
translated: You speak of the infinite qualities of the Buddha. The gods and humans in Jetavana are greatly pleased.

original: so hi devamanujāna uttamo so hi agrapuruṣo mahāmuniḥ /
analyzed: saḥ hi uttamaḥ saḥ hi agrapuruṣaḥ mahā muniḥ
translated: He is indeed supreme among gods and humans, he is the foremost man, the great sage.

original: so hi niḥśaraṇamuttama prabhuḥ dṛṣṭadarśano hitāya prāṇinā //
analyzed: saḥ hi niḥśaraṇam uttama prabhuḥ dṛṣṭa darśanaḥ hitāya prāṇinā
translated: He is the supreme refuge, the lord, the one who has seen what is to be seen, for the benefit of living beings.

original: tena skandhā taḍibudbudopamā phenapiṇḍakamiva prabhāsvara /
analyzed: tena skandhā taḍit udbuda upamā phena piṇḍakam iva prabhāsvara
translated: By him, the aggregates are taught to be like lightning or bubbles, like a mass of foam, radiant.

original: deśitā daśabalena jānatā yasyiya guṇakathā pravartate //
analyzed: deśitā daśabalena jānatā yasya iya guṇa kathā pravartate
translated: By the one who knows, by the one of ten powers, in whom this discourse on qualities arises.

original: kṛṣṇasarpaśirasannibhāstathā kāma agrapuruṣeṇa deśitā /
analyzed: kṛṣṇa sarpa śira sannibhāḥ tathā kāma agrapuruṣeṇa deśitā
translated: Desire is taught by the foremost man to be like the head of a black serpent,

original: śastrarucchaviṣakumbhasannibhā yasyiya guṇakathā pravartate //
analyzed: śastra ruccha viṣa kumbha sannibhā guṇa kathā pravartate
translated: Like a sword's edge or a poisonous jar, in whom this discourse on qualities arises.

original: tena dṛṣṭamacala para sukha dṛṣṭibhiḥ paramasādhudṛṣṭibhiḥ /
analyzed: tena dṛṣṭam acala para sukha dṛṣṭibhiḥ parama sādhu dṛṣṭibhiḥ
translated: By him, the immovable, the supreme, is seen with unshakable, supremely virtuous vision,

original: ta amatsaravatā prakāśita savibhāgarucinā yadadbhuta //
analyzed: te amatsaravatā prakāśita savibhāga rucinā yat adbhuta
translated: By the one free from stinginess, the wonderful is revealed with a discerning mind.

original: udgate dinakare yathā kimi
analyzed: udgate dinakare yathā
translated: Just as a firefly

original: niṣprabho bhavati no ca bhrājati /
analyzed: niṣprabhaḥ bhavati no ca bhrājati
translated: is without radiance and does not shine when the sun has risen,

original: udgate jinadivākare tathā niṣprabhā paragaṇī asayatā //
analyzed: udgate jina divākare tathā niṣprabhā para gaṇī a sayatā
translated: When the sun of the Jina has risen, the light of others is eclipsed.

original: ṛddhipādabalapārami gato īśvaro jinabalena cakṣumā /
analyzed: ṛddhipāda bala pārami gataḥ īśvaraḥ jina balena
translated: Having attained perfection in the bases of supernatural power and strength, the lord, the Jina, with his eyes of knowledge,

original: locana bhagavatasya paśyatha nirvṛto kanakabimbasannibho //
analyzed: locana bhagavatasya paśyatha nirvṛtaḥ kanaka bimba sannibhaḥ
translated: sees the eyes of the Blessed One, who has passed into Nirvāṇa, resembling a golden image.

original: dhigbhavā saradaabhrasannibhā vālikānagararūpasannibhā /
analyzed: dhik bhavā sarat aabhra sannibhā vālikā nagara rūpa sannibhā
translated: Shame on existence, which resembles autumn clouds or a city of gandharvas,

original: yatra nāma kuśalāna sacayo nirvṛto paramabuddhisāgaro //
analyzed: yatra nāma sacayaḥ nirvṛtaḥ parama buddhi sāgaraḥ
translated: where the ocean of supreme knowledge, the one with a store of merit, has passed into Nirvāṇa.

original: hetukāraṇaśatehi nāyako nardate puruṣasihanardita /
analyzed: hetu kāraṇa śate hi nāyakaḥ nardate puruṣa siha nardita
translated: The leader roars with the roar of a lion among men for hundreds of reasons.

original: bhavamananyamaraṇa nirīkṣya tasya uktamantara na vidyate //🔽divyapuṣpavaramaṇḍita nabha śobhate sugatavarṇabhāṣaṇe /
analyzed: bhavam ananya maraṇa nirīkṣya tasya uktam antara na vidyate  divya puṣpa vara maṇḍita śobhate sugata varṇa bhāṣaṇe
translated: Having seen existence, which is not another, and death, his words are not in vain.🔽The sky is adorned with the best of divine flowers, it shines when the Sugata's praises are spoken.

original: divyacandranarasānuvāsita śobhate amṛtagandhika nabhamiti //
analyzed: śobhate amṛtagandhika
translated: The sky shines with the fragrance of nectar, perfumed by the divine moon and human fragrances.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmānmahāmaudgalyāyano āyuṣmanta mahākāśyapamāmantrayati //
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān mahāmaudgalyāyanaḥ āyuṣmanta mahākāśyapam āmantrayati
translated: Then the Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana addressed the Venerable Mahākāśyapa:

original: vya vasthāpaya jinaputra vaśibhūtā ye pariṣāyā saśayagatāni mānasāni vijāneyuri ti //
analyzed: vya vasthāpaya jinaputra vaśi bhūtāḥ ye saśaya gatāni mānasāni vijāneyuḥ i
translated: O son of the Jina, establish yourself in mastery, and know with your mind those in the assembly who have doubts.

original: athāniruddha upāli ca sthavira ca alakuṇḍalabhaṭṭiya sundarananda ca kāśyapa uvāca //
analyzed: atha aniruddhaḥ ca sthavira ca sundarananda ca kāśyapaḥ uvāca
translated: Then Aniruddha, Upāli, the elder, Alakundala, Bhaṭṭiya, Sundarananda, and Kāśyapa spoke:

original: avaloketha jinātmajāścittāni yā pariṣāyā /
analyzed: jina ātmajāḥ cittāni yā
translated: Look at the minds of the Victor's sons in the assembly.

original: saśaya ca paripṛcchatha yasya yatra tathā bhavediti //
analyzed: ca paripṛcchatha yasya yatra tathā bhavet iti
translated: Ask about doubts, wherever they may be.

original: sādhūti te pratiśrutvā jinaśāstraviśāradāḥ /
analyzed: sādhu iti te pratiśrutvā jina śāstra viśāradāḥ
translated: They agreed and the skilled in the Victor's teachings

original: paśyanti paracitāni kare vāmalaka yathā //
analyzed: paśyanti para citāni kare vā āmalaka yathā
translated: saw the minds of others as clearly as an āmalaka fruit in the hand.

original: pralambabāhu vaśibhūta kāśyapo idamabravīt /
analyzed: pralamba bāhu vaśi bhūta kāśyapaḥ idam abravīt
translated: The powerful Kāśyapa with outstretched arms said this:

original: gṛdhrakūṭasya śikhare nirmiṇe vasudhā laghu //
analyzed: gṛdhrakūṭasya śikhare nirmiṇe vasudhā laghu
translated: On the peak of Vulture Peak, quickly create earth.

original: aṣṭādaśa sahasrāṇi pariṣāyā samāgatā /
analyzed: aṣṭādaśa sahasrāṇi pariṣāyā samāgatā
translated: The assembly of eighteen thousand has gathered.

original: yathā sarvābhijāneyā ṛddhi sajanayā tathā //
analyzed: yathā sarva abhijāneyā sa janayā tathā
translated: So that all may know, create such a miracle.

original: vicintacūta vaśibhūta kāśyapa idamabravīt /
analyzed: vicinta cūta vaśi bhūta kāśyapaḥ idam abravīt
translated: The powerful Kāśyapa named Vicintacūta said this:

original: gagodakamayā meghā nirmiṇe gagane laghu //
analyzed: gaga udaka mayāḥ meghāḥ gagane laghu
translated: Quickly create clouds of milk and water in the sky.

original: vividhagandhapuṣpāśca upavāyantu sarvataḥ /
analyzed: vividha gandha puṣpāḥ ca sarvatas
translated: And let fragrant and various flowers blow from all directions.

original: mānuṣāṇāmāmagandhā ca śīghramantarahāpaya //
analyzed: mānuṣāṇām āma gandhā ca śīghram antarahāpaya
translated: Quickly remove the foul smell of humans.

original: haryakṣa nāma vaśibhūta kāśyapa idamabravīt /
analyzed: haryakṣa nāma vaśi bhūta kāśyapaḥ idam abravīt
translated: The powerful Kāśyapa named Haryakṣa said this:

original: tathā utpādaya śīghra samādhi sugatātmaja /
analyzed: tathā utpādaya śīghra samādhi sugata ātmaja
translated: And likewise, O Son of the Sugata, quickly generate the samadhi,
