analyzed: nitya vidvān asura sura mahita sukhita satva pratibodhane ikṣvākūnām vaśa udbhūtaḥ dharaṇi talam avatari yaśaḥ sthitaḥ acalādhṛtiḥ
translated: Having abandoned his abode, the wise one, always respected by gods and asuras, was happy in enlightening beings. Born in the lineage of the Ikṣvākus, he descended to the surface of the earth, established in fame, with unshakable resolve.🔽He entered the womb of Queen Māyā, like a white lotus, taking the excellent form of an elephant.

original: māyāyā devyāḥ kukṣismi praviśiṣu sa kumudasadṛśo varo gajarūpavā eva / / / / / / / lokālokaḥ tuṣitavarabhavananilaya vihāya ihāgataḥ /
analyzed: māyāyāḥ devyāḥ sa kumuda sadṛśaḥ varaḥ gaja rūpavān eva lokālokaḥ tuṣita vara bhavana nilaya vihāyaḥ iha āgataḥ
translated: Leaving the excellent abode of Tuṣita, the world of light, he came here.

original: satvā mattā andhā dṛṣṭvā vimatipathaviṣamapatitā samuddharitu prajāḥ
analyzed: satvāḥ mattāḥ andhāḥ dṛṣṭvā vimati patha viṣama patitā samuddharitu prajāḥ
translated: Seeing beings intoxicated and blind, fallen into the uneven path of doubt, he arose to deliver them.

original: tasmi kāle ratnākīrṇā vividhanidhinicayabharitā cacāla vasundharā ta śākyendra cāritrāḍhya smṛtinibhṛtamadhiguṇacita avandi mahāmuni
analyzed: tasmin kāle ratna ākīrṇā vividha nidhi nicaya bharitā cacāla vasundharā ta śākya indra cāritra āḍhya smṛti nibhṛtam adhiguṇa cita avandi mahā muni
translated: At that time, the earth, strewn with jewels, filled with various treasures and riches, shook. The great sage, rich in the conduct of the Śākya king, with a mind focused on mindfulness and virtues, bowed to him.

original: prāsādāgre devī māyā surapatipravarabhavane vā sukhaiḥ pravicāryate nṛtyairgītairlāsyairvādyaiḥ śravaṇahṛdinayanasubhagaiḥ sureṣviva devatā
analyzed: prāsāda agre devī māyā surapati pravara bhavane vā sukhaiḥ pravicāryate nṛtyaiḥ gītaiḥ lāsyaiḥ vādyaiḥ śravaṇa hṛdi nayana subhagaiḥ sureṣu iva devatā
translated: The queen Maya, in the palace, or in the excellent abode of the lord of gods, is being delighted with pleasures, with dances, songs, dramatic performances, and music pleasing to the ears, heart, and eyes, like a goddess among the gods.

original: sā devī rājāna khinna vadati varavara mahipate vrajeya yadicchasi lumbodyāna puṣpākīrṇa madhumadhuraparabhṛtaruta manohṛdinandana //
analyzed: sā devī rājāna khinna vadati vara vara mahipate vrajeya yat icchasi lumba udyāna puṣpa ākīrṇa madhu madhura parabhṛta ruta manaḥ hṛdinandana
translated: The queen speaks to the king, saying, O best of kings, if I wish to go to the Lumbini grove, strewn with flowers, with the sweet sounds of bees and cuckoos, pleasing to the mind and heart.

original: gatvā tasmi strībhiḥ sārdha pravicarati muditasukhitā vane vanalolayā sā codyāna paryaṇvantī taruṇalatakiśalayadharā dadarśatha lumbinī
analyzed: gatvā strībhiḥ sārdha pravicarati mudita sukhitā vane vana lolayā sā ca udyāna taruṇa lata kiśalaya dharā lumbinī
translated: Having gone there, she roams with the women, delighted and happy, in the forest, wandering in the forest. She, while wandering in the garden, sees Lumbini, with young trees and sprouts,

original: tasyāḥ śākhā / / / / gṛhyāna paramaratisukhamuditā salīlaavasthitā sā tatra śākhā rakṣantī janayi jinamajitamanasa mahāmunimuttama //
analyzed: tasyāḥ śākhā sā tatra śākhā rakṣantī sā tatra śākhā rakṣantī
translated: holding its branches, delighted with supreme joy and pleasure, standing gracefully, she, protecting that branch, gives birth to the Victorious One, the unconquered-minded, the supreme great sage.

original: śītoṣṇe ca dve vāridhāre pravarakusumabharite jina yatra snapayisu ta devā jāyanta jātamātra nṛpati surabhuvanamahita trilokamaheśvara
analyzed: śīta uṣṇe ca dve vāri dhāre pravara kusuma bharite yatra devāḥ jāyanta jāta mātra nṛpati sura bhuvana mahita triloka maheśvara
translated: Two streams of water, one cool and one warm, filled with excellent flowers, where the gods bathe the Victorious One, born, the moment he is born, worshipped by the king of gods in the world of gods, the great lord of the three worlds.

original: sānukrośa lokātīta śaraṇamiha divi ca bhuvi cā jarāmaraṇāntaka aprāpta ta bhūmau dhīra kamaladalasadṛśanayana surāsuranandana //
analyzed: sa anukrośa loka atīta śaraṇam iha divi ca bhuvi ca jarā maraṇa antaka aprāpta te bhūmau dhīra kamala dala sadṛśa nayana sura asura nandana
translated: Compassionate one, transcendent, refuge here in heaven and on earth, destroyer of old age and death, not yet attained on that stage, resolute one, with eyes like lotus petals, delight of gods and demons.

original: hṛṣṭā tuṣṭā devā sarve tridaśaprabhṛtibhavanacyutā pratisthihiṣurvana
analyzed: hṛṣṭā tuṣṭā devā sarve tridaśa prabhṛti bhavana cyutā pratisthihiṣuḥ vana
translated: The delighted and satisfied gods, all of them, having fallen from their abodes beginning with the thirty-three, will stand in the forest.

original: ikṣvākūnā vaśodbhūto dharaṇitalamavatari yaśasthito acalādhṛti /
analyzed: vaśa udbhūtaḥ yaśa sthitaḥ
translated: Born in the lineage of the Ikshvakus, you will descend to the surface of the earth, standing in fame with unshakable resolve.

original: vikramāśca sapta pūrṇa mṛgavṛṣarājāmatiriva rasamānīka jyeṣṭho śreṣṭho lokāgro ha na ca mama puna jaramaraṇā hato bhavupadravaḥ //🔽chatra daiva ratnākīrṇa sphaṭikarucirakusumacitra sitābhrasitaprabha hastā mukta sthāye sāma samabhicchadi nṛpatitanaya vihāyase utthita
analyzed: vikramāḥ ca sapta ha na ca mama hataḥ  chatra daiva ratna ākīrṇa sphaṭika rucira kusuma citra sita abhra sita prabha hastā mukta sthāye sāma samabhicchadi nṛpati tanaya vihāyase utthita
translated: Your seven strides will be complete, your mind like the king of bulls, your radiance like the first of the ocean. You will be the best, the foremost in the world. Old age and death will not overcome me again, nor will the calamities of existence.🔽A parasol, divine, adorned with jewels, beautiful with crystal flowers, white like a cloud, with a handle, will be held aloft by the gods, covering the prince as he rises into the sky.

original: vālaiścograiḥ śakhājābhairmṛdubhirupacitamanupama divaukasanirmita uccairdaṇḍa muktāśveta bhramati maṇikanakavikṛta sucāmaravījana //
analyzed: vālaiḥ ca ugraiḥ śakhā ja ābhaiḥ mṛdubhiḥ upacitam anupama divaukasa nirmitaḥ uccais daṇḍa muktā śveta bhramati maṇi kanaka vikṛta su cāmara vījana
translated: With fierce, conch-like, soft, and well-developed hair, created by the gods, a tall staff, released, white, moves around, adorned with jewels and gold, fanned by excellent yak-tail whisks.

original: dundubhyo cā meghonnādā pavanakhagagagaṇaparigā nadanti mahatsvarāḥ puṣpaughāścā divyā sṛṣṭā marubhi jinabalavaramukhe sacandanacūrṇitāḥ /
analyzed: dundubhyaḥ cā megha unnādā pavana khaga gagaṇa parigāḥ nadanti mahā svarāḥ puṣpa oghāḥ cā divyā sṛṣṭāḥ marubhi jina balavara mukhe sa candana cūrṇitāḥ
translated: And the Dundubhis, the roars of clouds, the winds, the birds, and the hosts of the sky resound with great sounds. And the Maruts have sent down a rain of flowers from heaven, mixed with sandal-wood powder, upon the face of the most excellent Conqueror.

original: satoṣātīśayayuktebhiḥ suramaru jayati sukhakaro rase ravaṇīśataiḥ kṣubdhāsannā nānāratnā udadhibhuvi talasalilayostathāgatatejasā iti //
analyzed: sura maru jayati sukha karaḥ rase ravaṇī śataiḥ kṣubdha āsannāḥ nānā ratnāḥ udadhi bhuvi tala salilayoḥ tathāgata tejasā iti
translated: With great joy and exceeding gladness, the Suras and Maruts shout hundreds of cries of joy. The waters of the ocean are agitated on the surface of the earth, as well as the jewels of various kinds. Thus it is by the splendour of the Tathagata.

original: iti śrīmahāvastuavadāne tṛtīyā bhūmiḥ samāptā //
analyzed: iti śrī mahāvastu avadāne tṛtīyā bhūmiḥ samāptā
translated: Thus ends the third bhumi of the Mahavstu Avadana.

original: evamukte āyuṣmānmahākāśyapo āyuṣmanta mahākātyāyanamuvāca //
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān mahākāśyapaḥ āyuṣmanta mahākātyāyanam uvāca
translated: When this was said, the venerable Mahakasyapa said to the venerable Mahakatyayana:

original: ye punarbho jinaputra bodhisatvā avivartikatāye sansthihanti kevattakāni karmāṇi asthānatāye samupacaranti iti //
analyzed: ye punar bho jinaputra bodhisatvāḥ avivartika tāye san sthihanti kevattakāni karmāṇi asthāna tāye samupacaranti iti
translated: Again, son of the Conqueror, those Bodhisattvas who abide in irreversibility, how many actions do they perform that are conducive to non-abiding?

original: tataḥ kātyāyanasthaviro jinaśāstraviśāradaḥ /
analyzed: tatas kātyāyana sthaviraḥ jina śāstra viśāradaḥ
translated: Then the elder Katyayana, skilled in the scriptures of the Jina,

original: kāśyapa dhutadharmāṇa gāthābhiradhyabhāṣata //🔽yāni karmāṇi sevante bodhisatvā vijānatha /
analyzed: kāśyapa gāthābhiḥ adhyabhāṣata  yāni karmāṇi sevante bodhisatvāḥ vijānatha
translated: spoke these verses to Kasyapa, the one with the virtue of austerity:🔽Know that the Bodhisattvas practice those actions

original: asthānatāye na sevante yāni tāni vijānatha //
analyzed: na sevante yāni tāni vijānatha
translated: that are conducive to non-abiding, and know that they do not practice those that are not.

original: mātara pitara caivāpyarahanta tathaiva ca /
analyzed: mātara pitara tathā eva ca
translated: They do not deprive their mother, father, or an Arhat of life,

original: jīvitā na viropenti bodhisatvā mahāyaśāḥ //
analyzed: jīvitā na bodhisatvāḥ mahā yaśāḥ
translated: The Bodhisattvas of great fame.

original: sagha ca te na bhindanti na ca te stūpabhedakā /
analyzed: ca te na bhindanti na ca te stūpa bhedakā
translated: They do not break the Saṅgha, nor do they split the stūpas,

original: na te tathāgate citta dūṣayanti katha cana //
analyzed: na te tathāgate citta dūṣayanti katha cana
translated: They never defile the mind towards the Tathāgatas.

original: na te pāpāni sevanti viparītāye pṛṣṭhiye /
analyzed: na te pāpāni sevanti viparītāye pṛṣṭhiye
translated: They do not resort to evil, being of the opposite nature,

original: alpa kṛta na nāśenti ki mama punarya bahuḥ //
analyzed: alpa kṛta na ki mama punarya bahuḥ
translated: They do not destroy even a little, what to say about much.

original: sasarantā ca sasāre na jātu dṛṣṭipūrveke /
analyzed: ca sasāre na jātu dṛṣṭi pūrve eke
translated: They do not fall into the cycle of rebirth, never having seen the beginning,

original: pratirajyanti dharmārthe puṇye vā jñānapūrvake //
analyzed: pratirajyanti dharma arthe puṇye vā jñāna pūrvake
translated: They are devoted to the Dharma and to merit, preceded by knowledge.

original: yasya vṛkṣasya chāyāyā sīdanti ca śayanti ca /
analyzed: yasya vṛkṣasya chāyāyā sīdanti ca śayanti ca
translated: In the shade of which tree they sit and lie down,

original: na tasya patrahisā ca na ghātenti ca roṣitāḥ //
analyzed: na tasya patra hisā ca na ca roṣitāḥ
translated: They do not harm its leaves, nor do they cut it down in anger.

original: daśa karmapathā kuśalā sevanti puruṣottamā /
analyzed: daśa karma pathā kuśalā sevanti puruṣa uttamā
translated: The supreme men practice the ten wholesome courses of action,

original: na ca mantra prayojenti parasya dehaghātaka //
analyzed: na ca parasya deha ghātaka
translated: They do not employ spells to kill the body of another.

original: karmasaniśritāḥ santaḥ kautūhalaviniḥśritāḥ /
analyzed: santaḥ kautūhala viniḥśritāḥ
translated: Relying on the power of karma, they are free from curiosity,

original: āpatsu na viṣīdanti na ca modanti vṛddhiṣu //
analyzed: āpatsu na viṣīdanti na ca modanti vṛddhiṣu
translated: They do not despair in calamities, nor do they rejoice in prosperity.

original: kāyakarma vacīkarma manokarma tathaiva ca /
analyzed: kāya karma vacī karma manaḥ karma tathā eva ca
translated: Bodily action, verbal action, and mental action likewise,

original: adhyāśayāśca pariśuddhāḥ dānapāramitā ca yā //
analyzed: adhyāśayāḥ ca pariśuddhāḥ dāna pāramitā ca yā
translated: And their superior intentions are pure, and they practice the perfection of generosity.

original: aṣṭamīprabhṛti bhūmī gatā te anivartiyā /
analyzed: aṣṭamī prabhṛti bhūmī gatā
translated: Starting from the eighth stage, they are irreversible.

original: ekāśena śubha karma sevante lokapūjitāḥ //
analyzed: eka aśena śubha karma sevante loka pūjitāḥ
translated: They serve with a single wholesome action, worshipped by the world.

original: prathamā ca upādāya bhūmī yāvacca saptamī /
analyzed: prathamā ca upādāya bhūmī yāvat ca saptamī
translated: Starting from the first stage up to the seventh stage,

original: vyāmiśra karma sevante bhūmīṣvetāsu janottamā //
analyzed: vyāmiśra karma sevante bhūmīṣu etāsu jana uttamā
translated: The best of people serve mixed actions on these stages.

original: evamādīni karmāṇi sevamānā mahānarāḥ /
analyzed: evamādīni karmāṇi sevamānāḥ mahā narāḥ
translated: The great men, serving such actions as these,

original: lokānāmanukapārtha pūrenti bhūmayo daśeti //
analyzed: lokānām anukapārtha bhūmayaḥ daśa iti
translated: Fulfill the ten stages for the benefit of the worlds.

original: evamukte āyuṣmā mahākāśyapo āyuṣmanta mahākātyāyanamuvāca //
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmā mahākāśyapaḥ āyuṣmanta mahākātyāyanam uvāca
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Mahakasyapa said to the Venerable Mahakatyayana:

original: ye punaḥ bho jinaputra bodhisattvā avaivartikā sāmante pṛthagjanatāye apāyā yānti āho svida neti /
analyzed: ye punar bho jinaputra bodhisattvāḥ a vaivartikāḥ sāmante apāyāḥ yānti āho svida na iti
translated: Again, son of the Victor, those irreversible Bodhisattvas, are they sometimes reborn in the lower realms among ordinary people, or not?

original: sāmante pṛthagjanatāye avarāvarāśca gatiyo gacchanti āhosvida neti //
analyzed: sāmante avara avarāḥ ca gatiyaḥ gacchanti āhosvit na iti
translated: And do they go to the lower and lower realms among ordinary people, or not?

original: evamukte āyuṣmā mahākātyāyana āyuṣmanta mahākāśyapamuvāca //
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmā mahākātyāyanaḥ āyuṣmanta mahākāśyapam uvāca
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Mahakatyayana said to the Venerable Mahakasyapa:

original: ye ime bho dhutadharmadhara bodhisatvā avaivartikadharmā te saptasu bhūmiṣu na kathacitkici tkadācit yadṛcchayā niraya pi gacchanti tiryagyoni
analyzed: ye ime bho bodhisatvāḥ te saptasu bhūmiṣu na kathacid kicid tkadācid yadṛcchayā gacchanti tiryagyoni
translated: Those bodhisattvas, my pious friend, who are irreversible from the dharma, never at any time or place, by any chance, go to hell, or to the animal kingdom, or to the world of the king of the dead, or to an inauspicious sphere of conscious existence.

original: vā gacchanti daridrā vā bhavanti durbalā vā /
analyzed: vā gacchanti daridrāḥ vā bhavanti durbalāḥ vā
translated: They never become poor, or weak.

original: atha khalu brāhmaṇā bhavanti pratyekabrāhmaṇā vā indrāśca upendrāśca yakṣādhipatayaśca yakṣāśca nāgāśca nāgarājānaśca gandharvā gandharvādhipatayaśca
analyzed: atha khalu brāhmaṇāḥ bhavanti pratyeka brāhmaṇāḥ vā indrāḥ ca upendrāḥ ca yakṣa adhipatayaḥ ca yakṣāḥ ca nāgāḥ ca nāga rājānaḥ ca gandharvāḥ gandharva adhipatayaḥ ca
translated: Then they become Brahmans, or Pratyekabrahmans, or Indras, or Upendras, or lords of the Yakshas, or Yakshas, or Nagas, or kings of the Nagas, or Gandharvas, or lords of the Gandharvas,

original: cakrava rtinaśca prādeśyāśca rājānaḥ agrāmātyāśca śreṣṭhinaśca janapadapradhānāśca rājaputrāśca śreṣṭhiputrāśca agramahiṣīputrāśca nāyakāśca
analyzed: cakrava rtinaḥ ca prādeśyāḥ ca rājānaḥ agra amātyāḥ ca śreṣṭhinaḥ ca janapada pradhānāḥ ca rāja putrāḥ ca śreṣṭhi putrāḥ ca agra mahiṣī putrāḥ ca nāyakāḥ ca
translated: or universal kings, or kings of districts, or chief ministers, or merchants, or chief men of cities, or princes, or sons of merchants, or sons of chief women, or leaders,

original: sarvaśauryavīryāśca bhavanti balasampannāḥ ca bhavanti ullokanīyāścāvalokanīyāścābhivandanīyāścādeyavākyāśca bahujanapriyāśca bahujanakāntāśca
analyzed: sarva śaurya vīryāḥ ca bhavanti bala sampannāḥ ca bhavanti ullokanīyāḥ ca avalokanīyāḥ ca abhivandanīyāḥ ca ādeya vākyāḥ ca bahu jana priyāḥ ca bahu jana kāntāḥ ca
translated: and they are all heroic and strong, and endowed with power, and looked up to, and gazed at, and saluted, and their words are accepted, and they are dear to and beloved by the multitude.🔽 And why?

original: bahujanamanāpāśca sakīrtanīyāśca pralhādanīyāśca mahādhanāśca mahā vibhavāśca mahāparivārāśca mahotsāhā mahātejāśca bhavanti //
analyzed: bahu jana manāpāḥ ca sa kīrtanīyāḥ ca pralhādanīyāḥ ca mahādhanāḥ ca mahā vibhavāḥ ca mahā parivārāḥ ca mahā utsāhāḥ mahā tejāḥ ca bhavanti
translated: They become dear to many people, praiseworthy, inspiring confidence, very wealthy, very prosperous, having a great retinue, very zealous, and of great splendor.

original: yadi kecitkathaci dāryāpavādahetoḥ saptasu bhūmiṣu vartamānā avīci mahāniraya gacchanti atha khalu prayekaniraya gacchanti /
analyzed: yadi kecid kathacid dārya apavāda hetoḥ saptasu bhūmiṣu vartamānāḥ avīci mahāniraya gacchanti atha khalu prayeka niraya gacchanti
translated: If some, for some reason, slander the seven grounds and go to the great Avīci hell, then indeed they go to the individual hells.

original: preteṣu atyantakāyeṣu nopapadyanti /
analyzed: preteṣu atyanta kāyeṣu na upapadyanti
translated: They do not take rebirth among the extremely large ghosts.

original: asureṣu nopapadyanti /
analyzed: asureṣu na upapadyanti
translated: They do not take rebirth among the asuras.

original: kṣudratiryagyoni na gacchanti /
analyzed: kṣudra tiryagyoni na gacchanti
translated: They do not go to the small animal realm.

original: uttarakuruṣu nopapadyanti /
analyzed: uttarakuruṣu na upapadyanti
translated: They do not take rebirth in Uttarakuru.

original: strītva na gacchanti /
analyzed: strī tva na gacchanti
translated: They do not become women.

original: vipaṇḍakatva na gacchanti //
analyzed: vipaṇḍaka tva na gacchanti
translated: They do not become eunuchs.

original: atha khalu sarvāsu daśabhūmiṣu puruṣā bhavanti sarvāgapra tyagopetāḥ avikalendriyā /🔽yaśca bodhisattvo bodhisatva jīvitādvyaparopayati samyaksabuddhaśrāvaka vā śrotāpanna vā ye vā satvā pratyekabuddhatvāya viniṣṭhāstathārūpa
analyzed: atha khalu sarvāsu daśa bhūmiṣu puruṣāḥ bhavanti avikala indriyāḥ  yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ bodhisatva jīvitāt vyaparopayati samyaksabuddha śrāvaka vā vā ye vā satvāḥ pratyekabuddha tvāya
translated: Then indeed, in all the ten grounds, they become men, endowed with all faculties, without any missing.

original: pudgala jīvitādvyaparopayitvā niraya gacchati //
analyzed: pudgala jīvitāt vyaparopayitvā niraya gacchati
translated: And that bodhisattva who deprives a bodhisattva of life, or a disciple of the Perfectly Enlightened One, or a stream-enterer, or those beings who are destined for the state of a pratyekabuddha, having deprived such a person of life, goes to hell.

original: ya bodhisatvāḥ saptasu bhūmiṣu prāṇātipāta vā karonti adanta vā haranti sarvaparipūrṇa vā akuśalakarma na samartha bodhisatva niraya 🔽nayitu //
analyzed: ya bodhisatvāḥ saptasu bhūmiṣu prāṇa atipāta vā karonti vā haranti sarva paripūrṇa vā akuśala karma na samartha bodhisatva niraya  nayitu
translated: Those bodhisattvas who commit murder, steal what has not been given, or engage in all forms of unwholesome actions up to the seventh stage are not able to lead the bodhisattvas to hell.

original: yāni ca karmāṇi bodhisatvaiḥ purato praṇidhānasyo pacitāni akuśalāni tāni ca prathamacittotpādāya āvṛtāni tiṣṭhanti yathā mahatā śailena mṛgasagho
analyzed: yāni ca karmāṇi bodhisatvaiḥ puratas praṇidhānasya u pacitāni akuśalāni tāni ca prathama citta utpādāya āvṛtāni tiṣṭhanti yathā mahatā śailena mṛga sagho
translated: The unwholesome actions that the bodhisattvas have accumulated before making the vow are obscured by the arising of the mind of enlightenment, like a herd of deer by a great mountain.

original: asaprāptasya praṇidhicitta dvitīyatṛtīyacaturthapacamaṣaṣṭhasa ptamāsu jātiṣu vipacyati antaśo śīrṣaparitāpenāpi //
analyzed: asaprāptasya dvitīya tṛtīya caturtha pacama ṣaṣṭha sa ptamāsu jātiṣu vipacyati antaśas śīrṣa paritāpena api
translated: For one who has not attained the vow-mind, they ripen in the second, third, fourth, fifth, sixth, and seventh lives, at least by a headache.

original: evamukte āyuṣmānmahākāśyapa āyuṣmanta mahākātyāyanamuvāca //
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān mahākāśyapaḥ āyuṣmanta mahākātyāyanam uvāca
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Mahakasyapa said to the Venerable Mahakatyayana:

original: ye punarbho jinaputra bodhisatvā avaivartikā samyaksabuddhānārādhayitvā agārasthā anagāriya pravrajanti te tathāgatāḥ kevarūpeṇa ovādena
analyzed: ye punar bho jinaputra bodhisatvāḥ samyaksabuddhān ārādhayitvā agāra sthāḥ pravrajanti te tathāgatāḥ kevarūpeṇa ovādena
translated: Again, son of the Victorious One, those bodhisattvas who are irreversible, after serving the Perfectly Enlightened Ones, leave home for homelessness. By what kind of instruction do those Tathagatas

original: tataḥ kātyāyanasthaviraḥ kāśyapa idamabravīt /
analyzed: tatas kātyāyana sthaviraḥ kāśyapaḥ idam abravīt
translated: Then the elder Katyayana said this to Kasyapa:

original: dṛṣṭāntehi viviktābhiḥ kathābhiranupūrvaśaḥ //
analyzed: viviktābhiḥ kathābhiḥ anupūrvaśas
translated: With clear similes, in due order, with stories,

original: bodhisatvacarita mahāpaka jātakāparamateṣu kovidā /
analyzed: kovidā
translated: They are skilled in the supreme Jatakas, the great Bodhisattva deeds.

original: deśayanti damadānasavara bodhisatvapariṣāya īśvarā //
analyzed: deśayanti
translated: They teach self-control, generosity, and virtue to the assembly of Bodhisattvas, as lords.

original: yo mahājanahitāya sevate karmamapratisama narottamaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ mahā jana hitāya sevate karmam apratisama nara uttamaḥ
translated: He who serves the unsurpassed action for the benefit of the great people,

original: ityeva ta ca matimā tathāgato bodhisatvapariṣāsa bhāṣati //
analyzed: iti eva ca matimā tathāgataḥ bodhisatva pariṣāsa bhāṣati
translated: The Tathagata, with such an intention, teaches to the assembly of Bodhisattvas.

original: so prabhuḥ bhagavato pravucyati jñānapūrvakamupeti duṣkara /
analyzed: saḥ prabhuḥ bhagavataḥ pravucyati jñāna pūrvakam upeti
translated: He is called the Lord, the Blessed One, who has attained the difficult through knowledge.

original: tasya loki sadṛśo sudurlabho bodhisatva iti śāsane jinaḥ //
analyzed: tasya su durlabhaḥ bodhisatvaḥ iti śāsane jinaḥ
translated: In the world, a Bodhisattva equal to him is very difficult to find, according to the teachings of the Victorious One.

original: evamādika bho dhutadharmadhara samyaksabuddhā bodhisatvaparṣāya dharma deśayantīti //
analyzed: evamādika bho samyaksabuddhāḥ bodhisatva parṣāya dharma deśayanti iti
translated: Thus, O Holder of the Dharma, the Perfectly Awakened Ones teach the Dharma to the assembly of Bodhisattvas, beginning with this.

original: evamukte āyuṣmānmahākāśyapa āyuṣmanta mahākātyāyanamidamuvāaca //
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān mahākāśyapaḥ āyuṣmanta mahākātyāyanam idam uvāaca
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Mahakasyapa said to the Venerable Mahakatyayana:

original: yānī māni bho jinaputra jātakāni jinabhāṣitāni imāni kutaḥprabhṛtikāni vijñeyā nīti //
analyzed: yāni māni bho jinaputra jātakāni jina bhāṣitāni imāni kutaḥprabhṛtikāni vijñeyāni
translated: Venerable Son of the Victor, from where should one know the beginning of the Jatakas spoken by the Victorious Ones?

original: evamukte āyuṣmānmahākātyāyana āyuṣmanta mahākāśyapamidamuvāca //
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān mahākātyāyanaḥ āyuṣmanta mahākāśyapam idam uvāca
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Mahakatyayana said to the Venerable Mahakasyapa:

original: yānīmāni bho dhutadharmadhara jātakāni jinabhāṣitāni imā aṣṭamā bhūmī prapadya ntīti //
analyzed: yāni imāni bho jātakāni jina bhāṣitāni imāḥ aṣṭamāḥ bhūmī prapadya nti iti
translated: “These Jātakas, my pious friend, which were related by the Conqueror, are the eighth stage.”

original: evamukte āyuṣmānmahākāśyapa āyuṣmanta mahākātyāyanamidamuvāca //
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān mahākāśyapaḥ āyuṣmanta mahākātyāyanam idam uvāca
translated: When this had been said, the venerable Mahā-Kāśyapa asked the venerable Mahā-Kātyāyana:

original: kutaḥ prabhṛti bho jinaputra bodhisatvāḥ sarvasvaparityāgāśca parityajanti duṣkaraparityāgā śceti //
analyzed: kutas prabhṛti bho jinaputra bodhisatvāḥ sarva sva parityāgāḥ ca parityajanti duṣkara parityāgāḥ śca iti
translated: “Son of the Conqueror, from what stage do Bodhisattvas renounce all they have, and make difficult sacrifices?”

original: evamukte mahākātyāyana āyuṣmanta mahākāśyapamuvāca //
analyzed: evam ukte mahākātyāyanaḥ āyuṣmanta mahākāśyapam uvāca
translated: When this had been said, the venerable Mahā-Kātyāyana replied to the venerable Mahā-Kāśyapa:

original: aṣṭamā bhūmi prabhṛti bho dhutadharmadhara bodhisatvāḥ sarvasvaparityāgāśca parityajanti duṣkaraparityā gāśca kurvanti iti //
analyzed: aṣṭamā bhūmi prabhṛti bho dhutadharmadhara bodhisatvāḥ sarva sva parityāgāḥ ca parityajanti duṣkara parityā gāḥ ca kurvanti iti
translated: “From the eighth stage, my pious friend, do Bodhisattvas renounce all they have, and make difficult sacrifices.

original: aṣṭamā bhūmi prabhṛti bho dhutadharmadhara bodhisatvāḥ samyaksabu ddhapūjayā pūjayitavyā iti //
analyzed: aṣṭamāḥ bhūmi prabhṛti bho dhutadharmadhara bodhisatvāḥ samyaksabu ddha pūjayā pūjayitavyāḥ iti
translated: From the eighth stage, my pious friend, should Bodhisattvas be worshipped as if they were Buddhas.

original: tatredamucyate //
analyzed: tatra idam ucyate
translated: Herein is declared:

original: aṣṭamā prabhṛti bhūmi bodhisatvā jinātmaja /
analyzed: aṣṭamā prabhṛti bhūmi bodhisatvāḥ jina ātmaja
translated: “From the eighth stage onwards the Bodhisattvas, the Sons of the Conqueror,

original: samyaksabuddhā iti draṣṭavyā ataḥ prabhṛtyanivartiyāḥ //
analyzed: samyaksabuddhāḥ iti draṣṭavyāḥ atas prabhṛti anivartiyāḥ
translated: should be regarded as perfect Buddhas, for from that time forth they are irreversible.

original: ataḥ prabhṛti dhyānāni gambhīrāṇi labhanti te /
analyzed: atas prabhṛti dhyānāni gambhīrāṇi labhanti te
translated: From that time forth they attain the profound meditations.

original: ataḥ prabhṛti uttapta jñāna teṣā pravartate //
analyzed: atas prabhṛti uttapta jñāna teṣā pravartate
translated: From this time forth, their heated knowledge begins to function.

original: ataḥ prabhṛti bhāṣanti vācā jñānapurogamā /
analyzed: atas prabhṛti bhāṣanti vācā jñāna purogamā
translated: From this time forth, they speak with a voice preceded by knowledge.

original: ataḥ prabhṛti kucchattā āyu muñcanti paṇḍitāḥ //🔽ataḥ prabhṛti yā śuddhā tā jātimanuyānti te /
analyzed: atas prabhṛti kucchattā āyu muñcanti paṇḍitāḥ  atas prabhṛti yā śuddhā tāḥ jātim anuyānti te
translated: From this time forth, the wise ones release their life-force.🔽From this time forth, they follow that pure birth.

original: ataḥ prabhṛti ya śuddha tadrūpamanubhavanti te //🔽ataḥ prabhṛti ya liṅga icchanti bhavanti tathā //
analyzed: atas prabhṛti te  atas prabhṛti ya liṅge icchanti bhavanti tathā
translated: From this time forth, they experience that pure form.🔽From this time forth, they become as they wish, with that sign.

original: ataḥ prabhṛti ya deva icchanti bhavanti tathā //
analyzed: atas prabhṛti ya deva icchanti bhavanti tathā
translated: From this time forth, they become as they wish, with that god.

original: ataḥ prabhṛti tīrthikā vā bhavanti bhavasūdanāḥ /
analyzed: atas prabhṛti tīrthikāḥ vā bhavanti bhava sūdanāḥ
translated: From this time forth, they become either tīrthikas or destroyers of existence.

original: ataḥ prabhṛti kucchanti kāmā śasanti nirvṛti //
analyzed: atas prabhṛti kucchanti kāmā śasanti nirvṛti
translated: From this time forth, they desire the pleasures and delight in nirvana.

original: ataḥ prabhṛti bhūyiṣṭhā bhavanti vadatā varāḥ /
analyzed: atas prabhṛti bhūyiṣṭhāḥ bhavanti vadatā varāḥ
translated: From this time forth, they become the most excellent of speakers.

original: śiṣyā devātidevānā sabuddhānā yaśasvinā //
analyzed: śiṣyāḥ deva atidevānā sa buddhānā yaśasvinā
translated: The disciples of the gods and over-gods, the renowned fully awakened ones,

original: adhyeṣyanti tataḥ paretya buddhairdharmaprakāśanaiḥ /
analyzed: adhyeṣyanti tatas paretya buddhaiḥ dharma prakāśanaiḥ
translated: will be requested by the buddhas who reveal the Dharma, after they have passed away.

original: dharma deśayatha prājñā pratigṛhnatha ṛṣidhvaja //
analyzed: dharma deśayatha prājñā pratigṛhnatha ṛṣidhvaja
translated: Teach the Dharma, O wise ones! Accept the banner of the sages!

original: ataḥ prabhṛti vinayanti arhatve subahu jana /
analyzed: atas prabhṛti vinayanti arhatve su bahu jana
translated: From this time forth, they will discipline many people in arhatship.

original: ataḥ prabhṛti vinayanti śaikṣabhūmau bahu jana //
analyzed: atas prabhṛti vinayanti śaikṣa bhūmau
translated: From that time on, they discipline many people on the stage of training.

original: ataḥ prabhṛti anubaddhā devā yakṣā saguhyakāḥ /
analyzed: atas prabhṛti anubaddhāḥ devāḥ sa guhyakāḥ
translated: From that time on, the gods, yakshas, and guhyakas are constantly following,

original: bodhisatva mahāsatva yāvatprāptā svayabhutā //
analyzed: bodhisatva mahāsatva yāvat prāptā svayabhutā
translated: The bodhisattva mahasattva, until he attains self-awakening.

original: ataḥ prabhṛti tadrūpa agyra sadevake loke /
analyzed: atas prabhṛti tadrūpa agyra sa devake loke
translated: From that time on, he becomes the foremost in the world with its gods,

original: ataḥ prabhṛti varṇo pi tejokīrtiyaśobala /
analyzed: atas prabhṛti tejaḥ kīrti yaśaḥ bala
translated: From that time on, his complexion, splendor, fame, glory, and strength,

original: lokena viṣama bhavati bodhisatvānamuttama //
analyzed: lokena viṣama bhavati
translated: Become unequalled in the world, for the supreme bodhisattvas.

original: anutpādācca buddhānā pacābhijñā bhavanti te /
analyzed: anutpādāt ca buddhānā pacā abhijñāḥ bhavanti te
translated: And because of the non-arising of the Buddhas, they attain the superknowledges,

original: naiṣkramyamanuvarṇayanti kāmeṣu doṣadarśinaḥ //
analyzed: naiṣkramyam anuvarṇayanti kāmeṣu doṣa darśinaḥ
translated: And they praise renunciation, seeing faults in desires.

original: ataḥ prabhṛti devāśca asurā brahmaṇā saha /
analyzed: atas prabhṛti devāḥ ca asurāḥ brahmaṇā saha
translated: From that time on, the gods, asuras, and Brahma,

original: guṇaiḥ teṣā anurajyantā āgacchanti kṛtājalī //
analyzed: guṇaiḥ teṣā anurajyantā āgacchanti kṛtājalī
translated: Become attached to their qualities, and come with palms joined in respect.

original: vaśībhūtāna yā ceṣṭā bodhisatvāna tādṛśī /
analyzed: vaśībhūtāna yā ceṣṭā bodhisatvāna tādṛśī
translated: The conduct of the bodhisattvas who have attained mastery is like that,

original: aṣṭamābhūmi yā ceṣṭā bhavanti tādṛśī tathā //
analyzed: yā ceṣṭā bhavanti tādṛśī tathā
translated: And the conduct on the eighth stage is also like that.

original: evamukte āyuṣmānmahākāśyapa āyuṣmanta mahākātyāyanamuvāca //
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān mahākāśyapaḥ āyuṣmanta mahākātyāyanam uvāca
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Mahakasyapa said to the Venerable Mahakatyayana:

original: ye ime bho jinaputra bodhisatvā avaivartikāḥ cakravartirājyāni kārayanti kevarūpa dharma deśa yanti satvānā anutpāde ca buddhānā kevarūpeṇa
analyzed: ye ime bho jinaputra bodhisatvāḥ a vaivartikāḥ cakravarti rājyāni kārayanti kevarūpa dharma deśa yanti satvānā anutpāde ca buddhānā kevarūpeṇa
translated: Those Bodhisattvas, O son of the Conqueror, who are irreversible and rule as universal monarchs, what kind of Dharma do they teach to beings? And when there are no Buddhas appearing, by what kind of

original: sagraheṇa satvā sagṛhnanti kevarūpā ca janatā upekṣanta iti //
analyzed: sa graheṇa satvā sagṛhnanti kevarūpā ca janatā upekṣante iti
translated: grasping do they grasp beings? And what kind of people do they ignore?

original: evamukte āyuṣmānmahākātyāyana āyuṣmanta mahākāśyapa muvāca //
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān mahākātyāyanaḥ āyuṣmanta mahākāśyapa muvāca
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Mahā-Kātyāyana said to the Venerable Mahā-Kāśyapa:

original: ye ime bho dhutadharmadhara bodhisatvā avaivartikā cakravartirājyāni kārayanti te satvānāmeva dharma deśayanti //
analyzed: ye ime bho dhutadharmadhara bodhisatvāḥ cakravarti rājyāni kārayanti te satvānām eva dharma deśayanti
translated: Those Bodhisattvas, O friend, who are irreversible and rule as universal monarchs, they teach the Dharma to beings.

original: daśakuśalakarmapathasamāyuktā satvānā manudarśayanti //
analyzed: daśa kuśala karma patha samāyuktā satvānām manudarśayanti
translated: They show beings the ten wholesome courses of action.

original: mā bhavantu prāṇivadhamadattaharaṇa rakṣitavyāni paradārāṇi anṛtapi śunaparuṣamabaddhapralāpābhidhyāvyāpādamithyādarśanāni varjayitavyānīti
analyzed: mā bhavantu rakṣitavyāni para dārāṇi śuna paruṣa mabaddha pralāpa abhidhyā vyāpāda mithyā darśanāni varjayitavyāni iti
translated: They teach: Do not kill living beings, do not take what is not given, do not commit sexual misconduct, do not speak falsely, do not speak harshly, do not speak frivolously, do not covet, do not have ill will, do not have wrong views. These should be avoided.

original: deśenti //
analyzed: deśenti
translated: They teach.

original: hiraṇyasuvarṇasya dhanasya agrato niveśanasya rāśayo upasthāpayitvā eva ca vandanti vaikaliya yasya yena ito sa gṛhnatu dhana /
analyzed: hiraṇya suvarṇasya dhanasya agratas niveśanasya rāśayaḥ upasthāpayitvā eva ca vandanti yasya yena itas sa gṛhnatu dhana
translated: Having set out heaps of gold and silver wealth in front, they also pay homage, saying, May he who lacks anything take wealth from here.

original: dharmalabdhā mama bhogā mā bhavanto viṣīdaya //
analyzed: dharma labdhāḥ mama bhogāḥ mā bhavantaḥ viṣīdaya
translated: Let my enjoyments be obtained through Dharma, do not be disheartened.

original: aha mālya ca gandha ca dhūpa cūrṇa manorama /
analyzed: aha mālya ca gandha ca dhūpa cūrṇa manorama
translated: I give garlands, perfumes, incense powders, and delightful things.

original: dadāmi mā viṣīdantu bhavanto ramyatāmiti //
analyzed: dadāmi mā viṣīdantu bhavantaḥ ramyatām iti
translated: Do not be disheartened, be happy.

original: evamukte mahākāśyapa āyuṣmanta mahākātyāyanamuvāca //
analyzed: evam ukte mahākāśyapaḥ āyuṣmanta mahākātyāyanam uvāca
translated: When this was said, the great Kashyapa said to the venerable Mahakatyayana:

original: kevarūpaiḥ karmabhirbodhi satvānā cakravartirājyāni kārayamāṇānā saptaratnāni bhavanti //
analyzed: kevarūpaiḥ karmabhiḥ bodhi satvānā cakravarti rājyāni kārayamāṇānā sapta ratnāni bhavanti
translated: What are the deeds by which Bodhisattvas, while ruling as Chakravartin kings, obtain the seven jewels?

original: evamukte āyu ṣmānmahākātyāyana āyuṣmanta mahākāśyapa gāthābhiradhyabhāṣe //
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān mahākātyāyanaḥ āyuṣmanta mahākāśyapa gāthābhiḥ adhyabhāṣe
translated: When this was said, the venerable Mahakatyayana spoke to the venerable Mahakasyapa in verse:

original: yatha labhati manujavṛṣabho cāturdvīpo prabhūtadhanakośo /
analyzed: yathā labhati manuja vṛṣabhaḥ cāturdvīpaḥ prabhūta dhana kośaḥ
translated: As a bull among men obtains the four continents, with abundant wealth and treasures,

original: sapta ratanāni rājā aha idamudīrayiṣyāmi //
analyzed: sapta ratanāni rājā aha idam udīrayiṣyāmi
translated: the king obtains the seven jewels. I will proclaim this.

original: taruṇaravimaṇḍalanibha pravaradaśaśatārasacayamanojña /
analyzed: taruṇa ravi maṇḍala nibha pravara daśa śatārasa caya manojña
translated: The jewel of the wheel, delightful with a thousand spokes and resembling the rising sun,

original: cakraratana naravaro purimakuśalasabhava labhati //
analyzed: cakraratana nara varaḥ labhati
translated: the supreme man obtains from his previous wholesome actions.

original: paricāravidhisayukta dadāti dānamanavadyasakalpe /
analyzed: dadāti dānam anavadya sa kalpe
translated: He gives gifts in accordance with the rules of service, without fault or hesitation.

original: ajitajayamapratihata tena naravaro labhati cakra //
analyzed: ajita jayam apratihata tena nara varaḥ labhati cakra
translated: By that, the best of men obtains the wheel, invincible and unsurpassed.

original: himanicayakumudavarṇa saptāṅgapratiṣṭhita mahānāga /
analyzed: hima nicaya kumuda varṇa sapta aṅga pratiṣṭhita mahā nāga
translated: With the color of a heap of snow and lilies, the great nāga established in the seven limbs,

original: anilabalatulyavega hastiratanamadbhuta labhati //
analyzed: anila bala tulya vega hasti ratanam adbhuta labhati
translated: With the speed equal to the strength of the wind, he obtains the wonderful elephant jewel.

original: durgeṣu ca viṣameṣu ca sakramamarisūdano pratiṣṭhapiya /
analyzed: durgeṣu ca viṣameṣu ca
translated: And in difficult and uneven places, the enemy-destroyer is established.

original: tena khagapathegāmi gajavararatana / / / / / labhati //
analyzed: tena khaga pathegāmi gaja vara ratana  /
translated: By that, the king obtains the jewel of the best elephant, which goes through the sky.

original: tada bhṛganīla suvarṇamanilajavakeśari samudyatapāda /
analyzed: bhṛganīla suvarṇam anila java keśari samudyata pāda
translated: Then, with feet raised like a lion with the speed of the wind,

original: pratilabhati turagaratana sukṛtakuśalasacayo rājā //
analyzed: pratilabhati turaga ratana sukṛta kuśala sacayaḥ rājā
translated: The king, a heap of well-done good actions, obtains the jewel of the horse.

original: hayanavarehi parivahī mātāpitara guru tathācārya /
analyzed: mātā pitara guru
translated: Surrounded by the best horses, mother, father, teacher and preceptor,

original: tena kuśalena rājā aśvaratana adbhuta labhati //
analyzed: tena kuśalena rājā aśvaratana adbhuta labhati
translated: By that wholesome action, the king obtains the wonderful jewel of the horse.

original: maṇiratanamanupamavarṇa vaiḍūryeṇa śīramanupasapannā / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / labhati
analyzed: maṇi ratanam anupama varṇa vaiḍūryeṇa śīram anupasapannā  /
translated: A jewel of a gem, of incomparable color, a crest-jewel unsurpassed, ...

original: pramadā manāpā ratanavaramanantabalavīryaiḥ //
analyzed: pramadā manāpā rata navara mananta bala vīryaiḥ
translated: ... a woman who is pleasing, with infinite strength and energy,

original: pūrvabhave hi nivāse svadārasantoṣasayamābhirato /
analyzed: pūrva bhave hi nivāse sva dāra santoṣa sayama abhirataḥ
translated: In a previous existence, while dwelling, content with one's own wife, delighting in that,

original: āsīcca narādhipatī strīratana tena so labhati //
analyzed: āsīt ca nara adhipatiḥ tena saḥ labhati
translated: One becomes a king, and obtains that jewel of a woman.

original: āḍhya vividhadhanavara prabhūtanidhinicayasacayopeta /
analyzed: āḍhya vividha dhana vara prabhūta nidhi nicaya sacaya upeta
translated: Rich in various excellent riches, endowed with abundant treasures and stores,

original: gṛhapatiratanamudāra pratilabhati mahāvaśī rājā //
analyzed: gṛhapati ratanam udāra pratilabhati mahāvaśī rājā
translated: The king obtains the jewel of a householder, vast and greatly powerful.

original: vividhadhanasacayānā dātā guruṣu gurugauravopeto /
analyzed: vividha dhana sacayānā dātā guruṣu
translated: Generous to those who are venerable, full of reverence for the venerable,

original: tena sa gṛhapatiratana pratilabhati prabhūtadhanakuśala //
analyzed: tena sa gṛhapati ratana pratilabhati prabhūta dhana kuśala
translated: By that, he obtains the jewel of a householder, with abundant wealth and virtue.

original: nayanayajña meghāvi vyakta nāyakadhyaja cāturdvīpa /
analyzed: nayanayajña meghāvi vyakta cāturdvīpa
translated: With eyes like clouds, clear, of a leader's offspring, a leader of the four continents,

original: pariṇāyakaratanavara pratilabhati mahīpatiḥ virato //
analyzed: pratilabhati mahīpatiḥ
translated: The lord of the earth, abstaining, obtains the excellent jewel of a minister.

original: mārgagato praṇaṣṭānā hatahatanayanānā deśayi mārga /
analyzed: mārga gatānām praṇaṣṭānām hata hata nayanānām
translated: For those who have lost their way, he shows the path, saying, This way, this way!

original: tena pariṇāyakavara labhati ratana uttamanāyaka //
analyzed: tena pariṇāyaka vara labhati ratanaḥ uttama nāyaka
translated: Therefore, the supreme leader attains the supreme jewel.

original: etairdhutadharmadharā karmehi samutthitāni ratanāni /
analyzed: etaiḥ dhuta dharma dharā samutthitāni
translated: These are the deeds that give rise to the jewels of the Dharma.

original: tena ca eva narendro dharmeṇa mahī praśāsayati //
analyzed: tena ca eva narendraḥ dharmeṇa mahī praśāsayati
translated: And by that very Dharma, the lord of men rules the earth.

original: evamukte āyuṣmānmahākāśyapa āyuṣmanta mahākātyāyanamuvāca //
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān mahākāśyapaḥ āyuṣmanta mahākātyāyanam uvāca
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Mahakasyapa said to the Venerable Mahakatyayana:

original: ye ime hi bho jinaputra bodhisatvāḥ prathamacittamutpādayanti te katibhirākāraiścaturthyā bhūmau vartamānāḥ pacamāyā bhūmau vivartante //
analyzed: ye ime hi bho jinaputra bodhisatvāḥ prathama cittam utpādayanti te katibhiḥ ākāraiḥ caturthyā bhūmau vartamānāḥ pacamāyāḥ bhūmau vivartante
translated: Venerable One, when these Bodhisattvas first generate the mind of enlightenment, by how many aspects do they, being on the fourth ground, turn away from the fifth ground?

original: evamukte āyuṣmānmahākātyāyana āyuṣmanta mahākāśyapametaduvāca //
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān mahākātyāyanaḥ āyuṣmanta mahākāśyapam etat uvāca
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Mahakatyayana said to the Venerable Mahakasyapa:

original: ye ime bho dhatadharmadhara bodhisatvāḥ prathamacittotpādā saptabhirākāraiścaturthyā bhūmau vartamānāḥ pacamāyā bhūmau vivartante //
analyzed: ye ime bho bodhisatvāḥ prathama citta utpādā saptabhiḥ ākāraiḥ caturthyā bhūmau vartamānāḥ pacamāyāḥ bhūmau vivartante
translated: Venerable One, these Bodhisattvas, when they first generate the mind of enlightenment, by seven aspects turn away from the fifth ground while being on the fourth ground.

original: katamehi saptahi //
analyzed: katamehi saptahi
translated: By which seven?

original: bhikṣuṇīdūṣakāśca bhavanti /🔽puruṣadūṣakāśca bhavanti /
analyzed: bhikṣuṇī dūṣakāḥ ca bhavanti  puruṣa dūṣakāḥ ca bhavanti
translated: They become defilers of nuns.🔽They become defilers of men.

original: paṇḍakadūṣakāśca bhavanti /
analyzed: paṇḍaka dūṣakāḥ ca bhavanti
translated: They become defilers of eunuchs.

original: mantrabalena cāpi parasya asanta rogamutpādayanti /
analyzed: mantra balena ca api parasya rogam utpādayanti
translated: And by the power of spells, they cause disease in others that does not exist.

original: suśīlavantāśca śīlāccyāvayanti /🔽ahirīkāśca bhavanti /
analyzed: su śīlavantaḥ ca śīlāt cyāvayanti  a hirīkāḥ ca bhavanti
translated: And they cause those of good conduct to fall away from their virtue.🔽They become shameless.

original: anotrāpiṇaśca bhavanti //
analyzed: anotrāpiṇaḥ ca bhavanti
translated: And they become without conscience.

original: ye kecidbho dhutadharmadhara bo dhisatvāḥ prathama cittamutpādayanti te imebhiḥ saptabhirākāraiścaturthāyā bhūmau varta mānāḥ pacamāyā 🔽bhūmau vivartanti //🔽ityeṣā bhūmirupadiṣṭā caturthī sugatātmaja /
analyzed: ye kecid bho cittam utpādayanti te imebhiḥ saptabhiḥ ākāraiḥ caturthāyāḥ bhūmau carta mānāḥ  bhūmau vivartanti  iti eṣā bhūmiḥ upadiṣṭā caturthī sugata ātmaja
translated: Those bodhisattvas, my friend Dharmika, who generate the first thought of enlightenment, they, while on the fourth stage, turn back from the fifth stage due to these seven aspects.

original: ramaṇīyā bodhisatvānā ye te bodhiparāyaṇā iti //
analyzed: ramaṇīyāḥ bodhisatvānā ye te bodhi parāyaṇāḥ iti
translated: Thus this fourth stage is taught for the sons of the Sugata, which is delightful for the bodhisattvas who are intent on enlightenment.

original: iti śrīmahāvastuavadāne caturthī bhūmiḥ samāptā //
analyzed: iti śrī mahāvastu avadāne caturthī bhūmiḥ samāptā
translated: Thus ends the fourth stage in the Mahāvastu-Avadāna.

original: evamukte āyuṣmānmahākāśyapo āyuṣmanta mahākātyāyanametaduvāca //
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān mahākāśyapaḥ āyuṣmanta mahākātyāyanam etat uvāca
translated: When this had been said, the venerable Mahā-Kāśyapa said to the venerable Mahā-Kātyāyana:

original: bho ji naputra bodhisatvā avaivartikā caturthībhūmito ye pacamā bhūmi sakrāmanti teṣā katama sandhicitta bhavatīti //
analyzed: bho naputra bodhisatvāḥ caturthī bhūmitaḥ ye pacamā bhūmi sakrāmanti teṣām katama sandhi citta bhavati iti
translated: Son of the Conqueror, what is the thought of the bodhisattvas who do not lapse when they pass on from the fourth to the fifth stage?

original: evamukte āyuṣmānmahākātyāyana āyuṣmanta mahākāśyapa muvāca //
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān mahākātyāyanaḥ āyuṣmanta mahākāśyapa muvāca
translated: When this had been said, the venerable Mahā-Kātyāyana replied to the venerable Mahā-Kāśyapa:

original: ādīptā sarvabhavā paśyanti rāgadveṣamohebhyaḥ /
analyzed: ādīptā sarva bhavā paśyanti rāga dveṣa mohebhyaḥ
translated: They see all existences as ablaze, due to desire, hatred, and delusion.

original: aśaraṇya nirānanda sandhicitta catuḥpacamānantara bhavatīti //
analyzed: aśaraṇya nirānanda bhavati iti
translated: Without refuge, without joy, with a mind in the joints, they are cooked in the four hells one after another.

original: evamukte āyuṣmānmahākāśyapa āyuṣmanta mahākātyāyanamuvāca //🔽ye punarbho
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān mahākāśyapaḥ āyuṣmanta mahākātyāyanam uvāca  ye punarbho
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Mahakasyapa said to the Venerable Mahakatyayana:

original: jinaputra samyaksabuddhena bhagavatā pacamāyā bhūmau samyaksabuddhāḥ pūjitāsteṣā samya ksabuddhānā kāni nāmāni gotrāṇi kevattā śrāvakasannipātā
analyzed: jinaputra samyaksabuddhena bhagavatā paca māyāḥ bhūmau samyaksabuddhāḥ pūjitāḥ teṣā samyaksabuddhānā kāni nāmāni gotrāṇi kevattā śrāvaka sannipātā  /
translated: Those who, son of the Victor, were rightly worshipped by the Blessed One, the Perfectly Awakened One, on the fifth ground, what were the names and lineages of those Perfectly Awakened Ones? How many assemblies of disciples did they have?

original: kevattikā prabhā kevattikamāyuḥpramāṇamiti //
analyzed: kevattikā prabhā kevattikam āyuḥ pramāṇam iti
translated: How much radiance did they have? What was the measure of their lifespan?

original: evamukte āyuṣmānmahākātyāyana āyuṣmanta mahā kāśyapa gāthābhiradhyabhāṣi //
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān mahākātyāyanaḥ āyuṣmanta mahā kāśyapa gāthābhiḥ adhyabhāṣi
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Mahakatyayana spoke to the Venerable Mahakasyapa in verse:

original: śākyamuni nāma jinavaro abhūṣi vaśibhūtakoṭiparivāro /
analyzed: śākyamuni nāma jina varaḥ vaśibhūta koṭi parivāraḥ
translated: There was a supreme Victor named Shakyamuni, surrounded by a koṭi of those with mastery.

original: vyāmaprabho girighano kanakagirinibho nihataśatruḥ //
analyzed: vyāma prabhaḥ giri ghanaḥ kanaka giri nibhaḥ nihata śatruḥ
translated: With a radiance of a fathom, solid like a mountain, golden-hued, with defeated foes.

original: ṣaḍvarṣasahasrāṇi āyuḥ puruṣottamasya tatkāla /
analyzed: ṣaṣ varṣa sahasrāṇi āyuḥ puruṣottamasya tad kāla
translated: The lifespan of that supreme man was six thousand years.

original: nāma tasya yaśavrato abhūṣi atisundaro buddho //
analyzed: nāma tasya ati sundaraḥ
translated: His name was Yashasvrat, the Buddha Atisundara.

original: gotreṇa gotamo sau aya ca bhagavāntadāsi śreṣṭhisuto /
analyzed: gotreṇa gotamo sau ca
translated: He was of the Gautama lineage, and this Blessed One was then the son of a guildmaster.

original: yāgūdāna datvā buddhapramukhe kṛtā praṇidhiḥ //
analyzed: buddha pramukhe kṛtā praṇidhiḥ
translated: Having given gruel, he made a vow in front of the Buddha.

original: ya maye kuśalamupacita saśliṣya saghe arhante dattvā /
analyzed: ya maye kuśalam upacita sa śliṣya saghe arhante dattvā
translated: Whatever merit I have accumulated by respectfully giving to the Arhats,

original: tena paramārthadarśī bhaveyamakhila mama puṇya //
analyzed: tena parama artha darśī bhaveyam akhila mama puṇya
translated: By that, may I become one who sees the ultimate truth, and may my merit be unimpeded.

original: antimavataraṇagāmī sundaro sudarśano nāma narasihaḥ /
analyzed: antima avataraṇa gāmī sundaraḥ sudarśanaḥ nāma nara sihaḥ
translated: The one who will descend in his last birth, the handsome Narasiṃha, will be named Sudarśana.

original: bhāradvājasagotro prabhā ca daśayojanā tasya //
analyzed: bhāradvāja sagotraḥ prabhā ca daśa yojanā tasya
translated: He will be of the Bhāradvāja lineage, and his radiance will extend for ten yojanas.

original: vaśibhūtānā koṭī parivāro tasya satvasārasya /
analyzed: vaśibhūtānā koṭī parivāraḥ tasya satva sārasya
translated: The retinue of that essence of beings, the one who has mastered the mind, will be a koṭi of powerful beings.

original: daśavarṣasahasrāṇi āyuḥ tada māradamakasya //
analyzed: daśa varṣa sahasrāṇi āyuḥ tada māradamakasya
translated: The lifespan of that tamer of Māra will be ten thousand years.

original: rājā ca cakravartī abhūṣi dharaṇīdharo ti nāmena /
analyzed: rājā ca cakravartī dharaṇīdharaḥ ti nāmena
translated: There will be a universal monarch named Dharaṇīdhara.

original: so ta jina sudarśana saśiṣyasagha idamuvāca //
analyzed: saḥ ta jina sudarśana sa śiṣya saghaḥ idam uvāca
translated: To that Jina Sudarśana, along with his disciples and assembly, he will say:

original: sarva hitopadhāna aha ti demīti paṇḍito avacī /
analyzed: sarva
translated: The wise one will say, 'I give this, which is the best means for the benefit of all.'

original: eva ca bhaveyamaha praṇidhesi para praṇidhi rājā //
analyzed: eva ca bhaveyam aha rājā
translated: And he will make the vow, 'May I become like that, O King of Vows.'

original: jarāmaraṇasya sāgaragatā alīno janatā tāreyya /
analyzed: jarā maraṇasya sāgara gatāḥ a līnaḥ janatā tāreyya
translated: The people who are submerged in the ocean of old age and death should be liberated.

original: anupahatakuśalamūlo abhūṣi bhagavā nareśvaro nāma /
analyzed: anupahata kuśala mūlaḥ bhagavā nareśvaraḥ nāma
translated: The Blessed One, the lord of men, will be named Anupahatakuśalamūla.

original: gotreṇa ca vāsiṣṭho ābhā daśayojanā tasya //
analyzed: gotreṇa ca vāsiṣṭhaḥ ābhā daśa yojanā tasya
translated: And by clan he was a Vāsiṣṭha, his radiance was ten yojanas.

original: vaśibhūtānā koṭī parivāro tasya dvādaśa āsi /
analyzed: vaśibhūtānā koṭī parivāraḥ tasya dvādaśaḥ āsi
translated: He had a retinue of twelve koṭis of Vidyādharas.

original: nava na varṣasahasrāṇi manujāna tadā abhūṣyāyuḥ //
analyzed: nava na varṣa sahasrāṇi manujāna tadā abhūṣya āyuḥ
translated: The lifespan of humans at that time was nine thousand years.

original: rājā ca cakravartī abhūṣi aparājito ti nāmena /
analyzed: rājā ca cakravartī abhūṣi aparājitaḥ ti nāmena
translated: And there was a universal monarch named Aparājita.

original: so daśabala narendra prasannacitto idamuvāca //
analyzed: saḥ daśabala narendra prasanna cittaḥ idam uvāca
translated: With a clear mind, he spoke to the Lord of Men with the ten powers:

original: saptaratanāṅgacitrā imā anekaratanasampattīyo /
analyzed: sapta ratana aṅga citrāḥ imāḥ
translated: These are adorned with the seven precious substances, with many precious substances,

original: śīti caturuttarā tava vibhū vihārānaha demi //
analyzed: catur uttarā tava vibhū vihārān aha demi
translated: and I give you eighty-four thousand palaces.

original: so ta dāna dattvā tasmi nareśvarake anupraṇidhi /
analyzed: saḥ ta dāna dattvā tasmin nareśvarake
translated: Having given that gift, the lord of men made a vow:

original: praṇidhesi eva bhaveyamadhigaccheya jinabalāni //
analyzed: eva bhaveyam adhigaccheya jina balāni
translated: May I become like this and attain the powers of a Victor.

original: vijayo nāma amātyo abhūṣi pūrva jinaḥ suprabho nāma /
analyzed: vijayaḥ nāma amātyaḥ jinaḥ suprabhaḥ nāma
translated: The previous Victor was named Suprabha, and the minister was named Vijaya.

original: gotreṇa kāśyapo sau prabhā ca daśayojanā tasya //
analyzed: gotreṇa kāśyapaḥ sau prabhā ca daśa yojanā tasya
translated: He was of the Kāśyapa clan, and his radiance was ten yojanas.

original: tasya ca śiṣyasagho aṣṭādaśa koṭī dhūtarajānā /
analyzed: tasya ca śiṣya saghaḥ aṣṭādaśa koṭī
translated: His assembly of disciples was eighteen koṭis of dust-free ones.

original: viśannarāṇa āyuḥ varṣasahasrāṇi tatkāla //
analyzed: āyuḥ varṣa sahasrāṇi tad kāla
translated: The lifespan of the people was then eight thousand years.

original: so vandya jinavara ta vijayo nimantrayī bhavanirghāti /
analyzed: saḥ bhava nirghāti
translated: Vijaya, having bowed to the supreme Victor, invited the one who destroys existence:

original: adhivāsayati daśabalo atha vijayo harṣito āsi //
analyzed: adhivāsayati daśabalaḥ atha vijayaḥ harṣitaḥ āsi
translated: The One of Ten Powers accepted, and then Vijaya was filled with joy.

original: agreṇa praṇītena ca adhigatasvādena bhakṣyabhojyena /
analyzed: agreṇa praṇītena ca adhigata svādena bhakṣya bhojyena
translated: With the best and most delicious food and drink,

original: santarpayitvānugata praṇidhesi tadā anupraṇidhi //
analyzed: santarpayitvā anugata tadā
translated: Having satisfied them, he made a vow, then a counter-vow.

original: so hamapi bhaveyameva naravaramahito naramaruṇa hitakaro /
analyzed: saḥ ham api bhaveyam eva nara vara mahitaḥ nara maruṇa hita karaḥ
translated: May I too become thus revered by the best of men, a benefactor of men and gods,

original: tenāpi nāyakavaro daśabalo bhave vādiśārdūlo //
analyzed: tena api nāyaka varaḥ daśabalaḥ bhave vādi śārdūlaḥ
translated: And by that may I become a leader, a One of Ten Powers, a lion among speakers!

original: āsītpūrva buddhastathāgato ratanaparvato nāma /
analyzed: āsīt pūrva buddhaḥ tathāgataḥ ratanaparvataḥ nāma
translated: There was a Buddha in the past, a Thus-Gone One named Ratanaghosa,

original: gotreṇa gautamo'so prabhā ca daśayojanā tasya //
analyzed: gotreṇa gautamosaḥ prabhā ca daśa yojanā tasya
translated: Of the Gautama lineage, his radiance extended ten yojanas.

original: triśatmanuṣyakoṭyo parivāro āsi dāntacittānā /
analyzed: parivāraḥ āsi dānta cittānā
translated: He had a retinue of three koṭis of tamed and disciplined people,

original: varṣasahasrāṇi viśa āyuḥ tadāsi manuṣyāṇā //
analyzed: varṣa sahasrāṇi viśa āyuḥ tadā asi manuṣyāṇā
translated: And the lifespan of humans at that time was one thousand years.

original: rājā ca cakravartī abhūṣi tatkālamacyuto nāma /
analyzed: rājā ca cakravartī tad kālam acyutaḥ nāma
translated: There was a universal monarch named Acyuta at that time,

original: jinakramāṇi nipīḍiya idamavaci vara naramarūṇā //
analyzed: jina kramāṇi vara nara marūṇā
translated: Who, having stepped on the Victor's feet, spoke this to the best of men and gods:

original: prāsādasahasrāṇi mahya naranāgā caturaśīti /
analyzed: prāsāda sahasrāṇi nara nāgā caturaśīti
translated: I have eighty-four thousand palaces, O Lord of Men,

original: tāni samalakṛtāni saśiṣyasaghasya aha demi //
analyzed: tāni samalakṛtāni sa śiṣya saghasya aha demi
translated: I offer them all, along with my disciples and followers.

original: adhivāsanā viditvā rājā / / / / / / / / / / prītamano /
analyzed: adhivāsanāḥ viditvā rājā prīta manaḥ
translated: Knowing that it was accepted, the king's mind was filled with joy.

original: anupraṇidhi praṇidhesi purato varalakṣaṇadharasya //
analyzed: puratas vara lakṣaṇa dharasya
translated: You made a vow in the presence of the one who bears the excellent marks:

original: kuśalena anena aha kuśalopacitavarāṇā caritānā /
analyzed: kuśalena anena aha kuśala upacita varāṇā
translated: By this wholesome action, may I practice the excellent accumulations of wholesome actions,

original: durantakavīryakarmo bhaveya nātho anāthānā //
analyzed: durantaka vīrya karmaḥ bhaveya
translated: And may I become a protector for those who are without a protector, through the deeds of boundless diligence.

original: gaganatalavimalacitto sabuddho kanakaparvato nāma /
analyzed: gagana tala vimala cittaḥ sabuddhaḥ kanakaparvataḥ nāma
translated: With a pure mind like the sky, the Buddha named Kanakaparvata,

original: abhūṣi naratāmahito kauṇḍinyo nāma gotreṇa //
analyzed: kauṇḍinyaḥ nāma gotreṇa
translated: Appeared, revered by humans, with the clan name Kauṇḍinya.

original: tasya śubhakarmajātā śarīraprabhā abhū yojanāni ṣaṭ /
analyzed: tasya śubha karma jātā śarīra prabhā yojanāni ṣaḍ
translated: His bodily radiance, born of wholesome actions, extended six yojanas,

original: paca vaśībhūtānā koṭīyo ca parivāro 'sya //
analyzed: paca vaśībhūtānā ca parivāraḥ sya
translated: And he had a retinue of six koṭis of powerful ones.

original: daśa ṣaḍvarṣā āyu tadā abhūṣi manujānā ca caturdaśa sahasrāṇi /
analyzed: daśa ṣaṣ varṣā āyu tadā abhūṣi manujānā ca caturdaśa sahasrāṇi
translated: At that time, the lifespan of humans was ten or six thousand years, and fourteen thousand years.

original: varṣāṇā saptatriśa varṣasahasrāṇi ityeva //
analyzed: varṣāṇā saptatriśa varṣa sahasrāṇi iti eva
translated: It was said to be thirty-seven thousand years.

original: āsi tada cakravartī rājā priyadarśano ti nāmena /
analyzed: āsi tada cakravartī rājā priyadarśano ti nāmena
translated: At that time, there was a universal monarch named Priyadarśana,

original: saptaratanadyutīmān cāturdvīpaḥ pṛthivipālo //🔽so kanakavarṇaparvata sabuddha kramavareṣu nipatitvā /
analyzed: sapta ratana dyutīmān  saḥ kanakavarṇa parvata sa buddha krama vareṣu nipatitvā
translated: Possessing the radiance of the seven jewels, a lord of the four continents.🔽He, Kanakaparvata, having fallen at the feet of the excellent Buddha,

original: yācati sāmātyagaṇo muktāhārāntapuro prāha //
analyzed: yācati sa amātya gaṇaḥ prāha
translated: Requested along with his retinue of ministers and harem of jeweled necklaces, saying:

original: mama nagaranigamabharita rājya caturo mahādhanadvīpāḥ /
analyzed: mama nagara nigama bharita rājya caturaḥ mahādhana dvīpāḥ
translated: My kingdom is filled with cities and towns, and the four great continents are my wealth,

original: tāntava dadāmi vīrā saśiṣyasaghasya nirapekṣaḥ //🔽yadbhojana ṛṣīṇā yadvastra yā ca oṣadhividhīyo /
analyzed: tān tava dadāmi vīrā sa śiṣya saghasya nirapekṣaḥ  ṛṣīṇām
translated: I give to the hero, without hesitation, together with his disciples and retinue.🔽Whatever food the sages have, whatever clothes and medicinal treatments,

original: yāni śayanāsanāni ca prāsādavare tathā yeva //
analyzed: yāni śayana āsanāni ca prāsāda vare tathā
translated: And whatever beds and seats there are in the excellent palace,

original: niḥsṛṣṭameva sarva paribhojya yasya dvādaśākāra /
analyzed: niḥsṛṣṭam eva sarva
translated: All of it is given up, to be enjoyed by him who has the twelve aspects.

original: mama pravararūpadhāri anukampārtha kuruhi karuṇā //
analyzed: mama pravara rūpa dhāri anukampā artha kuruhi karuṇā
translated: O bearer of the supreme form, have compassion for me and show mercy.

original: etaddattvā dāna so pārthivalambako anupraṇidhi /
analyzed: etat dattvā
translated: Having given this gift, the one who was the king made a vow:

original: praṇidhesi prītimānaso purato sapūrṇakuśalasya //
analyzed: praṇidhesi prīti mānasaḥ puratas sa pūrṇa kuśalasya
translated: With a joyful mind, I dedicate this to the one who is fully virtuous.

original: paramārtha śūkṣmadarśi vaiśāradyavarapāramiprāptaḥ /
analyzed: paramārtha śūkṣma darśi vaiśāradya vara pārami prāptaḥ
translated: The one who sees the subtle ultimate truth, who has attained the supreme fearlessness and perfection,

original: tenāha nāyakavaro bhaveya sarvopadhikṣayakaro //
analyzed: tena āha nāyaka varaḥ bhaveya sarva upadhi kṣaya karaḥ
translated: Therefore, I will become the supreme guide, the one who brings about the destruction of all conditioned things.

original: dvātriśalakṣaṇadharo bhagavānnāmena puṣpadanto ti /
analyzed: dvātriśa lakṣaṇa dharaḥ bhagavān nāmena puṣpadantaḥ ti
translated: The Blessed One, who bears the thirty-two marks, was named Puṣpadanta.

original: abhūtparamārthadarśi vatso gotreṇa sabuddho //
analyzed: abhūt parama artha darśi vatsaḥ gotreṇa sa buddhaḥ
translated: He was the fully enlightened one, born in the Vatsa family, who saw the ultimate truth.

original: tasyāpi yojanāni nava śarīraprabhā jinapravarasya /
analyzed: tasya api yojanāni nava śarīra prabhā jina pravarasya
translated: The supreme Jina's bodily radiance extended nine yojanas,

original: vaśibhūtakoṭiyo catustriśaddaśabale samanubaddhāḥ //
analyzed: catustriśat daśa bale samanubaddhāḥ
translated: And he was followed by 3.4 trillion powerful beings.

original: pacāśa ca abhūṣi varṣasahasrāṇi āyuḥparimāṇa /
analyzed: pacāśa ca abhūṣi varṣa sahasrāṇi
translated: His lifespan was fifty thousand years,

original: manujāna eva na vimati kāryā tatropadeśasmi //
analyzed: eva na
translated: One should not doubt the teaching there among humans.

original: pārthivo caiva narapatī ta kāla āsi durjayo nāma /
analyzed: pārthivo ca eva narapatī kāle āsi durjayaḥ nāma
translated: And at that time, there was a king of the earth named Durjaya.

original: upagamya puṣpadanta vandati pādā saparivāraḥ //
analyzed: upagamya puṣpadanta vandati sa parivāraḥ
translated: Approaching Puṣpadanta, he bowed at his feet with his retinue.

original: kṛtakarapuṭo prasannaḥ naraprabho puṣpadantamidamāha /
analyzed: kṛta kara puṭaḥ prasannaḥ nara prabho puṣpadantam idam āha
translated: With palms joined, the lord of men, delighted, said this to Puṣpadanta:

original: adhivāsayatu me daśabalo saptāha bhojanavidhāna //
analyzed: adhivāsayatu me daśabalo sapta aha bhojana vidhāna
translated: May the one with ten powers accept my offering of food for seven days.

original: adhivāsana viditvā rājāsya durjayordhvabala eva /🔽chādayati medinitala suvarṇapaṭṭehi sucirehi //
analyzed: adhivāsana viditvā rājā asya durjaya ūrdhva balaḥ eva  chādayati suvarṇa paṭṭehi
translated: Knowing the acceptance, King Durjaya, of lofty strength,🔽Covered the ground with golden sheets for a long time.

original: tatra ratanāmayāni vinikṣipati āsanāni citrāṇi /
analyzed: tatra ratana āmayāni vinikṣipati āsanāni citrāṇi
translated: There he placed various jeweled seats made of the seven precious substances.

original: bhojanavidhi ca citrā sthāpayati sugandhipratyagrā //
analyzed: bhojana vidhi ca citrā sthāpayati sugandhi pratyagrā
translated: And he arranged various offerings of food, fragrant and fresh.

original: saptaratanāmayāni chatrāṇi naramarūṇā aṣṭaśata /
analyzed: sapta rata nāmayāni chatrāṇi nara marūṇāḥ
translated: The gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three held eight hundred parasols made of the seven precious substances,

original: dhārenti bhūṣaṇadharā citrābharaṇadhāriṇo puṣpā //
analyzed: dhārenti bhūṣaṇa dharā citra ābharaṇa dhāriṇaḥ
translated: Adorned with flowers, holding various ornaments.

original: eva ekaikasya vaśibhūtasya dhārenti hṛdimano /
analyzed: eva ekaikasya vaśibhūtasya hṛdimanaḥ
translated: In the same way, each of the powerful ones held a jeweled parasol in their heart,

original: chatraratana vicitra śaśiśakhatalopama vimala //
analyzed: chatra ratana vicitra śaśi śakha tala upama vimala
translated: A jeweled parasol of various colors, pure as the surface of the moon.

original: santarpayitva rājā saparivāra puṣpasāhvaya sugata /
analyzed: santarpayitvā rājā sa parivāra puṣpasāhvaya sugata
translated: Having satisfied the Sugata named Puṣpa, the king and his retinue,

original: atha manasā praṇidheti tadā va so ta anupraṇidhi //
analyzed: atha manasā praṇidhā iti tadā va saḥ te
translated: Then he made a vow with his mind, and then that was his vow:

original: tvamivamaha sabuddho dharma prakāśayeya naramarūṇā /
analyzed: tvam ivam aha sabuddhaḥ dharma prakāśayeya nara marūṇā
translated: Just like you, may I become a fully enlightened one and teach the Dharma to gods and humans.

original: dvātriśallakṣaṇadharo nāmena lalitavikramo sabuddho
analyzed: dvātriśat lakṣaṇa dharaḥ nāmena lalitavikramaḥ sa buddhaḥ
translated: The fully enlightened one named Lalitavikrama, endowed with the thirty-two marks,

original: āsi bhagavā bhavanudo vāsiṣṭhagotro dhutakileśo //
analyzed: āsi bhagavā bhava nudaḥ vāsiṣṭha gotraḥ dhuta kileśaḥ
translated: was the Blessed One, the remover of existence, of the Vasistha clan, the one who has shaken off defilements.

original: tasya ca svaśarīrajātā prabhā abhū yojanāni triśa duve /
analyzed: tasya ca sva śarīra jātā prabhā yojanāni
translated: And his radiance, born from his own body, was three thousand two hundred yojanas.

original: vaśibhūtakoṭiyo ca triśa naravarasya parivāro //
analyzed: ca nara varasya
translated: And the retinue of the best of men, the one with power over the mind, was three koṭis.

original: āyu tadā narāṇā varṣasahasrāṇi āsi caturaśīti /
analyzed: āyu tadā narāṇā varṣa sahasrāṇi āsi caturaśīti
translated: At that time, the lifespan of humans was eighty-four thousand years.

original: rājā ca tadā āsī caturagabalo priyo manāpo //
analyzed: rājā ca tadā āsīt caturagabalaḥ
translated: And at that time, there was a king with an army of four divisions, beloved and dear.

original: prāsādakoṭiyo ca catvāriśa anekaratanānā /
analyzed: ca catvāriśa
translated: And there were forty koṭis of palaces, with many jewels,

original: kārayati bhūmipālo pravara eka ca prāsāda //
analyzed: kārayati bhūmipālo pravaraḥ eka ca prāsāda
translated: and the lord of the earth had one supreme palace built.

original: śayyāsana ca vipula kārayate pārthivo nirupavadya /
analyzed: śayyā āsana ca vipula kārayate pārthivaḥ nirupavadya
translated: And the king had vast beds and seats made, free from reproach,

original: bhojanagilānapraccayamṛṣiyogya sanniveśeti //
analyzed: bhojana gilāna praccayam ṛṣi yogya sanniveśa iti
translated: with provisions for food, illness, and the necessities of ascetics.

original: bhagavato niryātitvā saśiṣyasaghasya so anupraṇidhi /
analyzed: bhagavataḥ niryātitvā sa śiṣya saghasya
translated: Having offered them to the Blessed One, together with his disciples and assembly, that was his vow.

original: praṇidheti hṛṣṭacitto rājā purato daśabalasya //
analyzed: praṇidhā iti hṛṣṭa cittaḥ rājā puratas daśabalasya
translated: The king, with a joyful mind, made a vow in front of the One with Ten Powers.

original: durlabhasadṛśo asamaḥ daśabalo ca jarāmaraṇavimatimathano /
analyzed: durlabha sadṛśaḥ asamaḥ ca jarā maraṇa vimati mathanaḥ
translated: He was incomparable, unequaled, the One with the Ten Powers, the Destroyer of Old Age and Death, the Destroyer of Doubt.

original: bhaveya śreṣṭho naramaruṇā kugaṇīgaṇavacanamathano //
analyzed: bhaveya śreṣṭhaḥ ku gaṇī gaṇa vacana mathanaḥ
translated: He became the Best, the Destroyer of the Words of the Crowds of Evil Voices among Humans and Divinities.

original: dvātriśalakṣaṇadharo bhagavā āsī mahāyaśo nāma /
analyzed: dvātriśa lakṣaṇa dharaḥ bhagavān āsī mahāyaśaḥ nāma
translated: The Blessed One had the thirty-two marks, and was named Mahāyaśas.

original: gotreṇa kāśyapo so vistīrṇayaśo amitakīrtiḥ //
analyzed: gotreṇa saḥ vistīrṇa yaśaḥ amita kīrtiḥ
translated: He was of the Kāśyapa lineage, of vast fame, of immeasurable glory.

original: śarīrabhāsā tasya pacāśa yojanāni puṇyavato /
analyzed: śarīra bhāsā tasya pacāśa yojanāni
translated: The radiance of his body extended fifty yojanas, of the meritorious one.

original: vaśibhūtakoṭiyo ca tasyāsī pacapacāśa //🔽varṣasahasrāṇi tadā caturaśīti āyuḥparimāṇa /
analyzed: ca pacapacāśa  varṣa sahasrāṇi tadā
translated: He had thirty-five koṭis of disciples who were controlled.🔽At that time, the lifespan was eighty-four thousand years.

original: āsi tadā manujānā caturguṇa eṣa caturaśīti //
analyzed: āsi tadā manujānā caturguṇaḥ eṣa caturaśīti
translated: At that time, the lifespan of humans was eighty-four thousand years, four times that.

original: rājā tadā abhūṣī nāmena so mṛgapatisvaro nāma /
analyzed: rājā tadā abhūṣī nāmena saḥ mṛgapatisvaraḥ nāma
translated: At that time, there was a king named Mṛgapaṭisvara by name.

original: cāturdvīpādhipatirvipulabalavaro ajitacakro //
analyzed: cāturdvīpa adhipatiḥ vipula bala varaḥ ajita cakraḥ
translated: He was the lord of the four continents, the most excellent one with vast power, with an unconquered wheel.

original: so ratnaskandhaśākhā vanakhaṇḍā yojanāni ṣaṇavati /🔽kārāpayi bhūmipati pravarā varavastrasachannā //
analyzed: saḥ ratna skandha śākhāḥ vana khaṇḍāḥ yojanāni ṣaṇavati  kārāpayi bhūmipati pravarā vara vastra sa channā
translated: He had a forest grove with jewel-like branches and twigs, ninety-six yojanas in extent.🔽The lord of the earth had it made, the most excellent one, covered with the finest garments.

original: vaiḍūryamaṇitalā ca kṛtvāna vasudhā vibhūṣaṇavicitrā /
analyzed: vaiḍūrya maṇi talā ca vasudhā vibhūṣaṇa vicitrā
translated: Having made the ground with a floor of beryl jewels, adorned with various ornaments,

original: aguruvaradhūpagandhā sugandhapuṣpāvakīrṇatalā //
analyzed: aguru vara dhūpa gandhā sugandha puṣpa avakīrṇa talā
translated: with the fragrance of the finest agaru incense, with the ground strewn with fragrant flowers.

original: ta tatra vādisiha ṛṣabha so bhojanena saptāha /
analyzed: ta tatra vādi sihaḥ ṛṣabha saḥ bhojanena sapta āha
translated: There, the lion of debaters, the bull, was satisfied for seven days

original: tarpayati bhūmipālo prasannacitto praṇītena //
analyzed: tarpayati bhūmipālaḥ prasanna cittaḥ praṇītena
translated: by the lord of the earth, with a serene mind, with excellent food.

original: ta suravaravanaupama divāvihāra daśabalasya //
analyzed: ta suravara vana opama divāvihāra daśabalasya
translated: Like a divine forest, the abode of the gods, was the dwelling place of the one with ten powers.

original: dattvā sa rājā / / / / mahāyaśasya saśiṣyasaghasya /
analyzed: dattvā sa rājā mahā yaśasya sa śiṣya saghasya
translated: Having given to the one of great fame, together with his disciples and assembly,

original: rājā udagracitto praṇidheti tadā anupraṇidhi //
analyzed: rājā udagracittaḥ
translated: the king, with a joyful mind, made a vow then, a subsequent vow:

original: bahujanamahito svayabhu ananyaneyo bhaveya sarvajño /
analyzed: an anya neyaḥ bhaveya
translated: May I become revered by the multitude, self-existent, not to be led by others, all-knowing.

original: kuśalena hi me tena tathāgatabalo vibhū bhomi //🔽vipulabalapuṇyakośo nayānayajño jino ratanacūḍo /
analyzed: kuśalena hi me tena tathāgata balaḥ bhomi  vipula bala puṇya kośaḥ naya anaya jñaḥ jinaḥ ratana cūḍaḥ
translated: By this wholesome action of mine, may I become endowed with the powers of a Tathāgata.🔽The Jina Ratana-chuda, who knew the right and wrong paths, was a treasure of vast power and merit,

original: āsi abhinīlanetro nirupamaguṇasacayo dhīrī //
analyzed: āsi abhinīla netraḥ nirupama guṇa sacayaḥ dhīrī
translated: and had incomparable eyes, an incomparable store of qualities, and was resolute.

original: tasya ca prabhā śarīre yojanaśatavistarā samantena /
analyzed: tasya ca prabhā śarīre yojana śata vistarā samantena
translated: And the radiance of his body extended a hundred yojanas in all directions.

original: bhāradvājasagotro sa sarvadarśī tadā āsi //
analyzed: sa sarva darśī tadā āsi
translated: And he was of the same clan as Bharadvaja, and was then all-seeing.

original: tasya sagho āsī navanavati koṭiyo dhūtarajānā /
analyzed: tasya saghaḥ āsī nava navati
translated: His assembly consisted of ninety-nine koṭis of dust-free ones,

original: varṣāṇā ca sahasrāṇi caturāśīti tadā āyu //
analyzed: varṣāṇā ca sahasrāṇi caturāśīti tadā āyu
translated: and his lifespan was then eighty-four thousand years.

original: rājā tada cakravarti abhūṣi cāturdvīpo mahisthāmo /
analyzed: rājā
translated: At that time there was a universal monarch, a lord of the four continents, of great might,

original: nāmena maṇiviṣāṇo śāsati dharmeṇa yo janatā //
analyzed: nāmena maṇiviṣāṇaḥ śāsati dharmeṇa yaḥ janatā
translated: Named Maniviṣāṇa, who ruled the people righteously.

original: dvānavati koṭinayutā prāsādānāmanekarūpāṇā /
analyzed: dvānavati koṭi nayutā prāsādānām aneka rūpāṇām
translated: Ninety-two koṭis of nayutas of palaces of various forms,

original: kārayati bhūmipālo ta ratanajina samuddiśya //
analyzed: kārayati bhūmipālaḥ tat ratana jina samuddiśya
translated: The lord of the earth had them built for the sake of the Jewel Jina.

original: so pravarakāñcananibha naramarugaṇasatkṛta ratanacūḍa /
analyzed: so pravara kāñcana nibha nara maru gaṇa satkṛta ratana cūḍa
translated: He, who was like the color of excellent gold, honored by hosts of men and gods, Ratana-cūḍa,

original: bhojayati saparivāra varṣāṇi daśa aviśrāma //
analyzed: bhojayati saparivāra varṣāṇi daśa aviśrāma
translated: Fed him and his retinue for ten years without rest.

original: prathamadivasa ca sugata bhojetvāa sārdha śiṣyasaghena /
analyzed: prathama divasa ca sugata sārdha śiṣya saghena
translated: On the first day, having fed the Sugata together with the assembly of disciples,

original: niryāteti naravaro prāsādavarā guṇadharasya //
analyzed: niryātā iti prāsāda varā guṇa dharasya
translated: The best of men sent forth the best of palaces for the one who possesses qualities.

original: so ta dāna datvā tasya mahāpudgalasya rājavaro /🔽anupraṇidheti praṇidhi prasannacitto jinasakāśa //
analyzed: saḥ ta dāna da tvā tasya mahāpudgalasya rājavaraḥ  anupraṇidhā iti praṇidhi prasanna cittaḥ jina sakāśa
translated: That best of kings, having given that gift to that great being,🔽Made a vow in the presence of the Jina, with a clear mind:

original: ucchinnamohajālo pasannacitto asagapratibhāno /
analyzed: ucchinna moha jālaḥ pasanna cittaḥ asaga pratibhānaḥ
translated: Having cut through the net of delusion, with a clear mind, unobstructed eloquence,

original: tāreyya sarvajanatā sasāramahārṇave patitā //🔽evameva aprameyā pacamyā bhūmiyā puruṣasihāḥ /
analyzed: tāreyya sarva janatā sa sāra mahā arṇave patitā  evam eva aprameyā pacamyā bhūmiyā puruṣasihāḥ
translated: May I deliver all people who have fallen into the great ocean of existence.🔽In the same way, the lions among men on the fifth ground,

original: pretyekajinā tathāpi śaikṣāśaikṣā ca jinaputrāḥ //
analyzed: pretya eka jinā tathā api śaikṣa aśaikṣā ca jinaputrāḥ
translated: The Tathāgatas, the Jinas, and the Jina's sons, both those in training and those beyond training,

original: sapūjitā bhagavatā ime tathānye tathāgatāḥ sarve /
analyzed: sa pūjitāḥ bhagavatā ime tathā anye tathāgatāḥ sarve
translated: Having been worshipped by the Blessed One, and all the other Tathāgatas,

original: samupacita kuśalamūla arthe jagatasya sarvasya //
analyzed: samupacita kuśalamūla arthe jagatasya sarvasya
translated: for the sake of the entire world's accumulation of wholesome roots.

original: evamukte āyuṣmānmahākāśyapa āyuṣmanta mahākātyāyanamuvāca //
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān mahākāśyapaḥ āyuṣmanta mahākātyāyanam uvāca
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Mahakasyapa said to the Venerable Mahakatyayana:

original: ye bho ji naputra bodhisatvā bodhāye praṇidhenti te katibhirākāraiḥ pacamāyā bhūmau vartamānāḥ ṣaṣṭhāyā bhūmau vivartanti //
analyzed: ye bho naputra bodhisatvāḥ bodhāye te katibhiḥ ākāraiḥ pacamāyāḥ bhūmau vartamānāḥ ṣaṣṭhāyāḥ bhūmau vivartanti
translated: Those Bodhisattvas, son of the Victor, who aspire to enlightenment, in how many ways do they turn back from the sixth ground while abiding on the fifth ground?

original: evamukte āyuṣmānmahākātyāyanaḥ āyuṣmanta mahākā śyapamuvāca //
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān mahākātyāyanaḥ āyuṣmanta mahākā śyapam uvāca
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Mahakatyayana said to the Venerable Mahakasyapa:

original: caturbhi bho jinaputra ākārairdhutadharmadhara bodhisattvā bodhāye ye praṇidhenti pacamāyā bhūmau vartamānāḥ ṣaṣṭhyā bhūmau vivartanti //
analyzed: bho jinaputra ākāraiḥ dhuta dharma dhara bodhisattvāḥ ye ye
translated: Son of the Victor, the Bodhisattvas who aspire to enlightenment in four ways turn back from the sixth ground while abiding on the fifth ground.

original: katamehi caturhi //
analyzed: katamehi caturhi
translated: In what four ways?

original: samyakasabuddhānuśāsane pravrajitvā yogācārehi sārdha sambhuva kurvanti /
analyzed: samyakasabuddha anuśāsane pravrajitvā sārdha kurvanti
translated: Having gone forth in the teaching of the Perfectly Awakened Ones, they associate with yogis.

original: aṣṭamake dhuta devanāgṛddhā bhāvanā uttrasanti /
analyzed: aṣṭamake dhuta devanā gṛddhāḥ bhāvanāḥ uttrasanti
translated: They are attached to the eight precepts and are afraid of meditation.

original: śamathavipaśyanābhāvanābahulāśca abhikṣṇa viha ranti /
analyzed: śamatha vipaśyanā bhāvanā bahulāḥ ca abhikṣṇa viha ranti
translated: They frequently dwell in the practice of tranquility and insight meditation.

original: ālabaṇālabaṇacitta hetuśo parikalpenti //
analyzed: ālabaṇa ālabaṇa citta
translated: They imagine the causes of a mind that is attached to mere appearances.

original: ye hi keci bho dhutadharmadhara bodhisatvā bodhāya praṇidhento pacamāyā bhūmau vartamānā ṣaṣṭhyā bhūmau vivartanti sarve te imehi caturhi
analyzed: ye hi bho bodhisatvāḥ bodhāya praṇidhentaḥ pacamāyā bhūmau vartamānā ṣaṣṭhyā bhūmau vivartanti sarve te ime hi caturhi
translated: All those, my pious friend, who, being Bodhisattvas, have vowed to win enlightenment, and who, while on the fifth stage, have fallen back on the sixth stage, have all fallen back on these four grounds,

original: ākārehi vivartensuḥ vivartanti vivartiṣyanti vā //
analyzed: ākārehi vivartensuḥ vivartanti vivartiṣyanti vā
translated: and will fall back.

original: ityeṣā pacamī bhūmī vyākṛtā sanidarśitā /
analyzed: iti eṣā pacamī bhūmī vyākṛtā sa nidarśitā
translated: Thus has the fifth stage been described and explained,

original: teṣā bahuvidhapuṇyānā bodhisatvāna māriṣa iti //
analyzed: teṣām bahuvidha puṇyānām bodhisatvāna māriṣaḥ iti
translated: of those who are Bodhisattvas, and have abundant merit, my pious friend.

original: iti śrīmahāvastuavadāne pacamī bhūmiḥ samāptā //
analyzed: iti śrī mahāvastu avadāne pacamī bhūmiḥ samāptā
translated: Here ends the fifth bhūmi of the Mahāvastu-Avādana.

original: tataḥ sthaviraḥ kāśyapaḥ kātyāyanamathābravīt /
analyzed: tatas sthaviraḥ kāśyapaḥ kātyāyanam atha abravīt
translated: Then the elder Kāśyapa said to Kātyāyana,

original: vi citta bodhisatvānā pacamāyā vipaścitā //
analyzed: vi citta bodhisatvānā paca māyāḥ vipaścitā
translated: “The wise have declared the five stages of the Bodhisattvas.

original: tataḥ kātyāyanasthaviraḥ munikāśyapa dhutadharmadhara gāthayādhyabhāṣi //
