original: dharmadhara mātuḥ kukṣigata pūjārtha apsaraśatasahasrāṇi sandarśayanti divya puṣpavarṣa divya cūrṇavarṣa noparamante kadācit //
analyzed: dharma dhara mātuḥ kukṣi gata pūjā artha apsara śata sahasrāṇi sandarśayanti divya puṣpa varṣa divya cūrṇa varṣa na uparamante kadācid
translated: Blessed One, when the Bodhisattva has entered his mother's womb, hundreds of thousands of celestial maidens appear for his worship, and a rain of celestial flowers and a rain of celestial powders never cease.

original: mātuḥ kukṣimādau kṛtvā bodhisatvānā yāvatpari nirvṛtā daśabalā ca divyā ca agurudhūpā noparamanti //
analyzed: mātuḥ kukṣim ādau kṛtvā bodhisatvānā yāvat pari nirvṛtā daśa balā ca divyā ca aguru dhūpāḥ na uparamanti
translated: From the time the Bodhisattvas first enter their mothers' wombs until the time the Ten-Powered Ones attain complete nirvana, divine incense and aloe-wood smoke never cease.

original: na khalu bho dhutadharmadhara bodhisatvā mātāpitṛnirvṛttā bhavanti /
analyzed: na khalu bho dhutadharmadhara bodhisatvāḥ mātā pitṛ nirvṛttāḥ bhavanti
translated: Blessed One, the Bodhisattvas are not born from parents.

original: atha khalu svaguṇanirvṛttā upapādukā bhavanti //
analyzed: atha khalu sva guṇa nirvṛttāḥ upapādukāḥ bhavanti
translated: Rather, they are born spontaneously, from their own qualities.

original: tatredamucyate //
analyzed: tatra idam ucyate
translated: Regarding this, it is said:

original: atha sā kamaladalanayana anubaddhā gandharvabahubhi śyāmā /
analyzed: atha sā kamala dala nayana anubaddhā gandharva bahubhiḥ śyāmā
translated: Then she, with eyes like lotus petals, dark, followed by many gandharvas,

original: sahita pi ta sumadhura śuddhodanamabravīt māyā //
analyzed: sahita pi ta su madhura śuddhodanam abravīt māyā
translated: together with him, spoke sweetly and purely to Shuddhodana, Maya:

original: eṣā samādhiyāmi prāṇehi ahisa brahmacarya ca /
analyzed: eṣā samādhiyāmi prāṇehi ahisa brahmacarya ca
translated: I will practice celibacy with my life-force, O Brahmana.

original: viramāmi cāpyadinnā madyādanibaddhavacanācca //
analyzed: viramāmi ca api a dinnā madyāt anibaddha vacanāt ca
translated: I abstain from taking what is not given, from drinking alcohol, and from speaking falsely.

original: paruṣavacanācca naravara prativiramāmi tathaiva paiśunyā /
analyzed: paruṣa vacanāt ca nara vara prativiramāmi tathā eva paiśunyā
translated: O best of men, I abstain from harsh speech and likewise from slander.

original: anṛtavacanācca narapati viramāmi aya mama chando //
analyzed: anṛta vacanāt ca narapati viramāmi mama chandaḥ
translated: O lord of men, I abstain from false speech - this is my vow.

original: parakāmeṣu ca īrṣyā na sajaneṣya nāpi abhidroha /
analyzed: parakāmeṣu ca īrṣyā na sajaneṣya nā api abhidroha
translated: I have no envy for others' pleasures, nor do I wish for harm.

original: bhūteṣu maitracittā mithyādṛṣṭi ca vijahāmi //
analyzed: bhūteṣu maitra cittā mithyādṛṣṭi ca vijahāmi
translated: I have a mind of friendliness towards beings and abandon wrong views.

original: ekādaśaprakāra śīla sevāmyaha pṛthivipāla /
analyzed: ekādaśa prakāra śīla sevāmi aha pṛthivipāla
translated: I follow the eleven-fold morality, O lord of the earth.

original: rajanīmimāmanūnāmeva me jāyate chando //
analyzed: rajanīm imām anūnām eva me jāyate chandaḥ
translated: This is my vow for this night and every night.

original: api ca khalu bhūmipālā kāmavitarko mā mā pratikākṣi /
analyzed: api ca khalu bhūmipālā kāma vitarkaḥ mā mā pratikākṣi
translated: Moreover, O lord of the earth, do not expect me to have thoughts of desire.

original: prekṣasva mā ti adharmo bhaveya mayi brahmacāriṇiye //🔽sakalpa prapūreṣyanti pāarthivo bhāriyāmidamavocat /
analyzed: prekṣasva mā ti adharmaḥ bhaveya mayi brahmacāriṇiye  pāarthivaḥ bhāriyām idam avocat
translated: Look, let there be no unrighteousness in me, a celibate.🔽O king, I will fulfill my vow. This is my request.

original: abhirama bhavanavaragatā aha ca rājya ca te vaśya //
analyzed: abhirama bhavana vara gatāḥ aha ca rājya ca te vaśya
translated: Rejoice, having gone to your excellent palace, and let the kingdom be under your control.

original: sā strīsahasramagyra anurakta gṛhya ta vimānavara /
analyzed: sā strī sahasra magyra anurakta gṛhya te vimāna vara
translated: That foremost woman, loved by a thousand men, took that excellent palace.

original: abhiruhya sanniṣīde manāpaparipūrṇaparivārā //
analyzed: abhiruhya san niṣīde manāpa paripūrṇa parivārā
translated: Having ascended, she sat down, surrounded by a delightful and perfect retinue.

original: sā kacideva kāla tasmi himapāṇḍupuṇḍarīkanibhe /
analyzed: sā kacid eva hima pāṇḍu puṇḍarīka nibhe
translated: At some time, in that place resembling a white lotus,

original: śayane praśamadamaratā tuṣṇībhāvena kṣepayate //
analyzed: śayane praśama dama ratā tuṣṇībhāvena kṣepayate
translated: On her bed, she passed the time in silence, devoted to tranquility and peace.

original: atha kautūhalamano sajaniyā bahudevakanyā varamālyadharāḥ /🔽jinamātuḥ upagatā draṣṭumanā prāsādasundarāgreṇa sthitā //
analyzed: atha kautūhala mano bahu deva kanyāḥ vara mālya dharāḥ  jinamātuḥ upagatā draṣṭu manā prāsāda sundara agreṇa sthitā
translated: Then, with curious minds, many celestial maidens, wearing fine garlands,🔽approached the mother of the Victorious One, eager to see her, and stood on the beautiful top of the palace.

original: upasakramitva śayanopagatā māyā niśāmya varavidyunibhā /
analyzed: śayana upagatā māyā niśāmya vara vidyut nibhā
translated: Having approached and gone to the bed, they saw Māyā, who was like an excellent lightning bolt,

original: prītisukha vipula sajaniyā atha sapravarṣi divija kusuma //
analyzed: prīti sukha vipula atha sa pravarṣi divija
translated: and with their minds filled with joy and happiness, they caused a rain of celestial flowers to fall from the sky.

original: mānuṣyaka pi kila īdṛśaka rūpa sujātamidamāścarya /
analyzed: kila su jātam idam āścarya
translated: It is said that such a beautiful form as this is indeed human, and this is a wonder.

original: kacitkāla sthihiya antarato nāya samā maruvadhūhi bhave //
analyzed: antarataḥ samā maru vadhū hi bhave
translated: Having remained inside for some time, it will not be equal to the celestial women.

original: līlā niśāmayatha he sakhikā pramadāye yādṛśī yathopayikā /
analyzed: līlā niśāmayatha he sakhikā yādṛśī
translated: Look at the play, O friends, of the woman who is like this and acts like this.

original: śayane virocati mana harati vibhrājate kanakarītiriva sā //
analyzed: śayane virocati harati vibhrājate kanaka rītiḥ iva sā
translated: She shines on the bed, captivates the mind, and shines like a golden streak.

original: iya ta dhareṣyati mahāpuruṣa atyantadānadamaśīlarata /
analyzed: iya te mahā puruṣa atyanta dāna dama śīla rata
translated: She will bear a great man, who delights in giving, self-control, and morality to the highest degree.

original: sarvāśravāntakaraṇa viraja ki hāyate tava narendravadhū //
analyzed: sarva āśrava anta karaṇa viraja ki hāyate tava narendra vadhū
translated: O Queen of Men, why are you not delighted that he will put an end to all defilements and be free from passion?

original: cāpodare karatalapratime vararomarājini citrastavane /
analyzed: cāpa udare kara tala pratime vara roma rājini citra stavane
translated: In the womb, which is like the palm of the hand, with a beautiful line of hair in the grove of the variegated forest,

original: iha vāsamabhyupagato varado avimrakṣito aśucinā bhagavā //
analyzed: iha vāsam abhyupagataḥ vara daḥ a vimrakṣitaḥ aśucinā bhagavā
translated: “You have taken up your abode here, O boon-giver, O unsullied Lord, and have not been protected by the impure one.

original: anurūpā tva ca pramadā pravarā mātā sa caiva puruṣapravaro /
analyzed: anurūpā ca pramadā pravarā mātā sa ca eva puruṣa pravaraḥ
translated: You are a woman worthy of him, the best of women, and he is the best of men,

original: putro bhavāntakaraṇo bhagavā ki hāyate tava narendravadhū iti //
analyzed: putraḥ bhava anta karaṇaḥ ki hāyate tava narendra vadhū iti
translated: the Lord who puts an end to existence. What is lacking in you, O queen of men?”🔽“Now, my pious friend, when the mothers of Bodhisattvas conceive them in their womb, they become the foremost of women, pure, complete, and unimpaired in body.

original: yasyā khalu bho dhutadharmadhara jātīyā bodhisatvamātaro caramabhavika bodhisatva dhārayanti tasyā jātau pramadāvarāṇā pariśuddha paripūrṇamakhaṇḍa 🔽brahmacarya bhavati //
analyzed: yasyāḥ khalu bho dhutadharmadhara jātīyāḥ bodhisatva mātaraḥ caramabhavika bodhisatva dhārayanti tasyāḥ jātau pramadā varāṇā pariśuddha paripūrṇam akhaṇḍa  brahmacarya bhavati
translated: They observe perfect and pure chastity.

original: manasāpi tāsā pramadottamānā rāgo notpadyate sarvapuruṣeṣu bhartāramādau kṛtvā //🔽bodhisatve ca bho dhutadharmadhara mātuḥ kukṣigate bodhisatvamatā divyavastrasavṛtaśarīrā ca bhavati divyābharaṇadhāriṇī ca susnātocchādanaparimardanapariṣeka
analyzed: manasā api tāsā pramadā uttamānā rāgaḥ na utpadyate sarva puruṣeṣu bhartāram ādau kṛtvā  bodhisatve ca bho dhutadharmadhara mātuḥ kukṣi gate bodhisatva matā divya vastra savṛta śarīrā ca bhavati divya ābharaṇa dhāriṇī ca su snātā ucchādana parimardana pariṣeka
translated: Not even in thought do these best of women turn to lust, except with their husbands.🔽“Again, my pious friend, when the Bodhisattva has entered his mother’s womb, the mother of the Bodhisattva becomes clothed in raiment of Benares cloth, and adorned with golden ornaments. She is bathed and anointed, and her body is refreshed with sandal-wood powder.

original: ca apsarogaṇāḥ bodhisatvamātuḥ pratijāgaranti //
analyzed: ca apsaraḥ gaṇāḥ bodhisatva mātuḥ pratijāgaranti
translated: She is fanned with yak’s tail fans, and attended by maid-servants.

original: bodhisatve mātuḥ kukṣigate bodhisatvamātuḥ devaka nyāśatasahasrehi sārdha hāsya bhavati //
analyzed: bodhisatve mātuḥ kukṣi gate bodhisatva mātuḥ devaka nyā śata sahasrehi sārdha ha asya bhavati
translated: When the Bodhisattva has entered his mother's womb, the Bodhisattva's mother laughs with a thousand divine maidens.

original: tathā prasuptā ca bodhisatvamātara devakanyā mandāravapuṣpadāmaiḥ parivījayanti agrayauvanamaṇḍaprāptā //
analyzed: tathā prasuptā ca deva kanyāḥ mandārava puṣpa dāmaiḥ parivījayanti agra yauvana maṇḍa prāptā
translated: And when the Bodhisattva's mother falls asleep, the divine maidens fan her with garlands of mandāra flowers, and she attains the prime of youth.

original: yadā ca tasyā pramado ttamāyāḥ bodhisatvaḥ kukṣimavatarati na bodhisatvamātā kānicidduḥkhānyanubhavati yathānyā pramadā //
analyzed: yadā ca tasyāḥ bodhisatvaḥ kukṣim avatarati na bodhisatva mātā kānicid duḥkhāni anubhavati yathā anyā pramadā
translated: And when the Bodhisattva descends into the womb of that most excellent woman, the Bodhisattva's mother does not experience any suffering as other women do.

original: tuṣitabhavanamādau kṛtvā sarveṣā bodhisatvānā paca nīvaraṇāni
analyzed: tuṣita bhavanam ādau kṛtvā sarveṣām bodhisatvānām paca nīvaraṇāni
translated: Beginning with the Tusita heaven, all obstacles for all Bodhisattvas

original: viṣkambhitāni bhavanti aprāpte dharmarājye //
analyzed: viṣkambhitāni bhavanti aprāpte dharmarājye
translated: are removed, even before attaining the Dharma-realm.

original: paripūrṇehi ca daśahi māsehi sarve bo dhisatvāḥ mātuḥ kukṣau prādurbhavanti dakṣiṇena pārśvena na ca ta pārśva bhidyate /
analyzed: paripūrṇehi ca daśahi māsehi sarve bo dhisatvāḥ mātuḥ kukṣau prādurbhavanti dakṣiṇena pārśvena na ca bhidyate
translated: And when the ten months are complete, all Bodhisattvas appear in their mother's womb from the right side, and that side is not split open.

original: na cātra kicidvilamba bhavati jāta ityeva bhavati //
analyzed: na ca atra kicid vilamba bhavati jātaḥ iti eva bhavati
translated: And there is no delay at all, it is as if he has been born.

original: tatredamucyate //
analyzed: tatra idam ucyate
translated: Regarding this, it is said:

original: atha pratipūrṇe daśame māse mātā prabhūtapuṇyasya /
analyzed: atha pratipūrṇe daśame māse mātā prabhūta puṇyasya
translated: Then, when the tenth month is complete, the mother of great merit,

original: śuddhodana upagamya idamabravīt dṛṣṭasakalpā //
analyzed: śuddhodanaḥ upagamya idam abravīt dṛṣṭa sakalpā
translated: Approaching, he said this: I have seen everything.

original: udyānagamanabuddhī utpannā me narādhipā śīghra /
analyzed: udyāna gamana buddhī utpannā me narādhipā śīghra
translated: O Lord of men, the thought has arisen in me to go to the pleasure grove, quickly.

original: sajjehi vāhana me yathocitā caivamārakṣā //
analyzed: sajjehi vāhana me yathā ucitā ca evam ārakṣā
translated: Prepare my vehicle and let there be proper protection.

original: eta śrutvā vacana rājā śuddhodano suprītamano /
analyzed: eta śrutvā vacana rājā śuddhodano su prīta mano
translated: Having heard these words, King Śuddhodana, with a delighted mind,

original: ālapati sābhilāṣa parivāravara pṛthivipālo //
analyzed: ālapati sa abhilāṣa parivāra vara pṛthivipālaḥ
translated: spoke with longing to his excellent retinue, the lord of the earth: Quickly.

original: śīghra gajaturagavatī senā padātisamākulā vipulā /
analyzed: śīghra gaja turagavatī senā padāti samākulā vipulā
translated: Let the vast army go, full of elephants and horses, crowded with foot soldiers,

original: prāsaśaraśakticitrā sajjiya prativedayadhva mama //
analyzed: prāsa śara śakti citrā prativedayadhva mama
translated: adorned with spears, arrows, and javelins. When it is ready, inform me.

original: catughoṭāna tatha aśvarathāna daśaśatasahasrā yujyantu /
analyzed: catughoṭāna tathā aśvarathāna daśaśata sahasrāḥ yujyantu
translated: Let ten thousand chariots be yoked, each with four horses,

original: pravarā kāñcanaghaṇṭāravāṇi madhurānunādāni //🔽ajanaghanasadṛśānā nāgānā varmadhāriṇā śīghra /
analyzed: pravarā kāñcana ghaṇṭā ravāṇi madhura anunādāni  ajana ghana sadṛśānā nāgānā varma dhāriṇā śīghra
translated: with excellent golden bells ringing, with sweet and melodious sounds.

original: pratidheyatha adhimātrā sajjāni daśaśatasahasrāṇi //
analyzed: adhimātrā sajjāni daśa śata sahasrāṇi
translated: Quickly, let ten thousand elephants be prepared,🔽each with armor and riders, like dense clouds.

original: āyuktavarmakavacā śūrā sajjībhavantu anivartyā /
analyzed: āyukta varma kavacā śūrā sajjībhavantu anivartyā
translated: Let the heroes be ready, with armor and helmets, invincible,

original: sajjībhavantu capala viśatsāhasriyo teṣā //
analyzed: sajjībhavantu teṣām
translated: and let ten thousand of them be ready quickly.

original: vipula sakikiṇiraṇita sahemajāla uḍāraaśvaratha /
analyzed: vipula sa kikiṇi raṇita sa hema jāla uḍāra aśva ratha
translated: Let the vast and splendid horse chariots go, with golden nets and tinkling bells,

original: varamālyavastradhāriṇo pramadā dhārentu devīye //
analyzed: vara mālya vastra dhāriṇaḥ pramadāḥ devīye
translated: Let the women, wearing fine garlands and clothes, attend to the Queen.

original: lumbinivana ca śīghra vyapagatatṛṇareṇupatrasakāra /
analyzed: ca śīghra vyapagata tṛṇa reṇu patra sakāra
translated: In the Lumbini grove, quickly remove the grass, dust, leaves, and chaff,

original: suśodhita manojña kuruta devīye devabhuvana vā //
analyzed: su śodhita manojña kuruta devīye deva bhuvana vā
translated: And make it well-swept and delightful, like the celestial realm of the gods.

original: ekaika ca drumavara dukūlapaṭṭorṇakośikārehi /
analyzed: ekaika ca
translated: For each excellent tree, provide silk, brocade, and woolen covers,

original: kalpayatha kalpavṛkṣā yathā divi devapravarasya //🔽sādhūti pratiśrutvā tasya vacanena narendragarbhasya /
analyzed: kalpayatha kalpavṛkṣāḥ yathā divi deva pravarasya  sādhu uti pratiśrutvā tasya vacanena narendra garbhasya
translated: So that they appear like wish-fulfilling trees in the sky for the supreme god.🔽Having agreed to do as he said, the one who holds the embryo of the king,

original: nacireṇa yathājñapta kṛtamiti prativedita rājñaḥ //🔽sā salīlacāruvadanā mātā mārabalasapramathanasya /
analyzed: nacireṇa yathā ājñapta kṛtam iti prativedita rājñaḥ  sā sa līla cāru vadanā mātā māra bala sa pramathanasya
translated: Soon reported to the king that it had been done as instructed.🔽The mother of the one who will crush the power of Mara, with her playful and beautiful face,

original: abhirūhi saparivārā tāni manojñāni yānāni //
analyzed: abhirūhi sa parivārā tāni manojñāni yānāni
translated: Together with her retinue, mounted those delightful vehicles.

original: sā vividhābharaṇavatī pādaudharathaughasakulā / / / / / / /
analyzed: sā vividha ābharaṇavatī pāda odha ratha ogha sakulā
translated: Adorned with various ornaments, she descended from the multitude of chariots,

original: śobhati susaprayātā senā manujapradhānasya //
analyzed: śobhati su sa prayātā senā manuja pradhānasya
translated: And the army of the foremost of men, well-advanced, shone forth.

original: avagāhya tadvanavara māyā sakhisavṛtā jinajanetrī /
analyzed: avagāhya māyā sakhi savṛtā jina ja netrī
translated: Having entered that excellent forest, Maya, the mother of the Victorious One, surrounded by her friends,

original: vicarati citrarathe iva amaravaravadhū ratividhijñā //
analyzed: vicarati citrarathe iva amara vara vadhū rati vidhi jñā
translated: Roamed about like a celestial maiden in a pleasure garden, knowing the ways of love.

original: sā krīḍārthamupagatā plākṣā śākhā bhujebhiravalambya /
analyzed: sā krīḍā artham upagatā plākṣā śākhāḥ bhujebhiḥ avalambya
translated: That Plakṣa branch, which she had climbed for amusement, supported by her arms,

original: pratijṛmbhitā salīla tasya yaśavato jananakāle //
analyzed: pratijṛmbhitā sa līla tasya yaśavataḥ janana kāle
translated: Was playfully shaken by him at the time of the birth of that famous one.

original: atha viśa sahasrāṇi apratimāni tadāpsaravarāṇā /
analyzed: atha viśa sahasrāṇi apratimāni tadā apsara varāṇā
translated: Then thousands of incomparable celestial nymphs,

original: daśanakhakṛtājalipuṭā māyāmabhinandiya bhaṇanti //
analyzed: daśa nakha kṛta ajali puṭāḥ māyām abhinandiya bhaṇanti
translated: With their hands cupped in reverence, joyfully addressed Māyā:

original: adya jarājātimathana janayiṣyasi amaragarbhasukumāra /
analyzed: adya jarā jāti mathana janayiṣyasi amara garbha su kumāra
translated: Today you will give birth to the one who crushes old age and rebirth, tender as a celestial child,

original: devī divi bhuvi mahita hita hitakara naramarūṇā //
analyzed: devī divi bhuvi mahita hita hita kara nara marūṇā
translated: O divine one, revered in heaven and on earth, benefactor of gods and humans.

original: mā khu janayī viṣāda parikarma vaya tava kariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: mā khu janayī viṣāda parikarma vaya tava kariṣyāmaḥ
translated: Do not give rise to sorrow. We will attend to you.

original: yatkartavyamudīraya dṛśyatu kṛtameva mā cintā //
analyzed: yat kartavyam udīraya dṛśyatu kṛtam eva mā cintā
translated: Speak of what needs to be done. Let it be seen as already accomplished. Do not worry.

original: mātaramabādhamāno prādurbhūto manāpo māyāye /
analyzed: mātaram a bādhamānaḥ prādurbhūtaḥ manāpaḥ māyāye
translated: Unharmed, the beloved one appeared from his mother's side, through Māyā.

original: dakṣiṇapārśvena muniḥ susaprajāno paramavādī //
analyzed: dakṣiṇa pārśvena muniḥ su sa prajāno parama vādī
translated: The sage, the supreme speaker, emerged from the right side, fully aware.

original: atha vividharatananicayā nagaranagarā anekasahasrāṇi /
analyzed: atha vividha ratana nicayāḥ nagara nagarāḥ aneka sahasrāṇi
translated: Then, when the supreme man appeared, many thousands of cities and towns,

original: prajvali prabhā ca vimalā prādurbhūte naravarendre ti //
analyzed: prajvali prabhā ca vimalā prādurbhūte nara vara indre
translated: Filled with various treasures, blazed with pure light.

original: na khalu bho dhutadharmadhara so asti satvo satvanikāye yo caramā jāti samana ntarajāta bodhisatva samartho vyākartu anyatra śuddhāvāsebhyo
analyzed: na khalu bho satvaḥ satva nikāye caramā jāti ntara jāta bodhisatva samarthaḥ anyatra śuddhāvāsebhyaḥ
translated: “Good sirs, there is no being in the world of beings who, immediately after being born in his last existence, is able to proclaim the Bodhisattva’s destiny, except those of the Pure Abodes.

original: devebhyaḥ //
analyzed: devebhyaḥ
translated: But, my pious friend, there is no being in the world of life who, immediately after his birth in his last existence, is able to declare himself to be a Bodhisattva, except the gods of the Pure Abodes.

original: tatredamucyate //
analyzed: tatra idam ucyate
translated: Here it is said:

original: aśukasuveṣṭitaśirā aṣṭa sahasrā maheśvaravarāṇā /
analyzed: a śuka su veṣṭita śirāḥ aṣṭa sahasrāḥ maheśvara varāṇām
translated: With heads wrapped in the feathers of the ashoka bird, eight thousand of the best Maheśvaras,

original: brāhmaṇaveṣadharāṇā abhigacchi pura kapilavastu //
analyzed: brāhmaṇa veṣa dharāṇā abhigacchi pura kapilavastu
translated: clothed in the attire of Brahmins, approached the city of Kapilavastu.

original: te rājakuladvāre varavasanadharā varābharaṇadhārī /🔽upagamya muditamanasā pratihāramuvāca satvavarā //
analyzed: te rāja kula dvāre vara vasana dharā vara ābharaṇa dhārī  upagamya mudita manasā pratihāram uvāca satva varā
translated: At the gate of the royal palace, those best of beings, wearing fine clothes and ornaments,

original: śuddhodanamupagamya brūvīhi ime lakṣaṇaguṇavidhijñā //
analyzed: śuddhodanam upagamya brūvīhi ime lakṣaṇa guṇa vidhi jñāḥ
translated: approached with joyful minds and spoke to the doorkeeper: Go to Śuddhodana and tell him that we, who know the rules of the characteristics and virtues,

original: tiṣṭhanti aṣṭasahasra praviśediti yadyanumatante //
analyzed: tiṣṭhanti praviśet iti yadi anumatante
translated: are waiting. If it is agreeable to you, let us enter.

original: eta śrutvā vacana pratihārarakṣo upetya rājavara /
analyzed: eta śrutvā vacana pratihāra rakṣaḥ upetya rāja vara
translated: Having heard these words, the doorkeeper went to the best of kings

original: kṛtājalipuṭaḥ praṇamya ida uvāca narādhipati //
analyzed: kṛta ājali puṭaḥ praṇamya idam uvāca narādhipati
translated: and, having made the gesture of salutation, spoke to the lord of men:

original: sukha atulabala dīptida kāraya rājya cira nihataśatruḥ /
analyzed: sukha atula bala dīpti da kāraya rājya cira nihata śatruḥ
translated: Enjoy incomparable strength and splendor, O king, rule for a long time, having defeated your enemies.

original: dvāre te amarasadṛśā tiṣṭhanti praveṣṭumicchanti //
analyzed: dvāre te amara sadṛśā tiṣṭhanti praveṣṭum icchanti
translated: At your gate stand those who are like immortals. They wish to enter.🔽Here ends the second chapter, called The Birth, in the Mahāvastu-Avadāna.

original: pratipūrṇavimalanayanā madhurasvaramattavāraṇavicārī /
analyzed: pratipūrṇa vimala nayanā madhura svara matta vāraṇa vicārī
translated: Their eyes are completely pure and clear, their voices are sweet, and they move like a proud elephant in rut.

original: bhavati mama teṣu sakā na te manuṣyā marusutāste //
analyzed: bhavati mama teṣu sakāḥ na te manuṣyāḥ maru sutāḥ te
translated: They are not human beings, they are the sons of the gods.

original: paricakramatā teṣā dharaṇirajaḥ kramavarā na sakirati /
analyzed: paricakramatā teṣā dharaṇiḥ rajaḥ krama varā na
translated: When they walk, the dust on the ground does not stir up their excellent feet,

original: na ca teṣu sandhiśabdaḥ cakramatā śruyyati kadācit //
analyzed: na ca teṣu sandhi śabdaḥ cakramatā śruyyati kadācid
translated: And the sound of their joints is never heard when they move.

original: gambhīramadhuraceṣṭā āryākārā praśāntadṛṣṭipathā /
analyzed: gambhīra madhura ceṣṭā ārya ākārā praśānta dṛṣṭi pathā
translated: They move with a deep and sweet gait, with noble forms and a peaceful gaze.

original: vipulā janenti prīti janasya samudīkṣamāṇasya //
analyzed: vipulā prīti janasya samudīkṣamāṇasya
translated: When people see them, they generate vast joy.

original: niḥsaśaya naravarā putravara upagatā tava draṣṭu /
analyzed: niḥsaśaya nara varā putra vara upagatā tava draṣṭu
translated: There is no doubt, O best of men, that the best of sons has come to see you.

original: devagaṇapuruṣapradeva abhivādya nanditu narasiha //
analyzed: deva gaṇa puruṣa pradeva abhivādya nanditu narasiha
translated: Having paid homage, the assembly of gods and men should rejoice, O lion among men.

original: eta śrutvā vacana pratihārarakṣa narādhipovāca /
analyzed: eta śrutvā vacana pratihāra rakṣa narādhipa uvāca
translated: Having heard these words, the doorkeeper said to the king:

original: mayi bho kṛtābhyanujñā praviśantu niveśanamudāra //
analyzed: mayi bho kṛtā abhyanujñā praviśantu niveśanam udāra
translated: O lord, having obtained permission from you, let them enter the magnificent palace.

original: amarapravaragaṇāste gaganasamanibhā viśuddhakarmāntā /
analyzed: amara pravara gaṇāḥ te gagana sama nibhā viśuddha karmāntā
translated: Those excellent gods, who are like the sky, with pure actions,

original: praviśensuḥ pārthivakulamahīnakulavaśamukhyasya //
analyzed: praviśensuḥ pārthiva kula mahīna kula vaśa mukhyasya
translated: should enter the royal palace of the foremost of the Śākya clan.

original: śuddhodano pi rājā maheśvarā dūrato niśāmetvā /
analyzed: śuddhodanaḥ pi rājā maheśvarāḥ dūratas niśām etvā
translated: King Śuddhodana, having seen Maheśvara from afar,

original: pratyutthita āsanāto saparijano gauravabalena //
analyzed: pratyutthitaḥ sa parijanaḥ gaurava balena
translated: The king rose from his seat with his retinue, out of respect and strength,

original: abhivādate narapatiḥ svāgatamanurāgata ca sarveṣā /
analyzed: narapatiḥ svāgatam anurāgata ca sarveṣām
translated: And greeted them all with a welcome.

original: prītā sma darśanena praśamadamabalena ca bhavatā //
analyzed: prītā sma darśanena praśama dama balena ca bhavatā
translated: We are delighted to see you, with your power of tranquility and self-control.

original: savidyante imāni varāsanāni vararūpavikṛtāni /
analyzed: savidyante imāni varāsanāni vara rūpa vikṛtāni
translated: Here are these excellent seats, of excellent form and design,

original: āstā tāva bhavanto asmākamanugrahārthāya //
analyzed: tāva bhavantaḥ asmākam anugraha arthāya
translated: Please sit down for a while, out of favor to us.

original: atha teṣvāsanavareṣu kanakarajatavarṇacitrapādeṣu /
analyzed: atha teṣu āsana vareṣu kanaka rajata varṇa citra pādeṣu
translated: Then, on those excellent seats, with feet inlaid with gold and silver,

original: vigatamadamānadarpāḥ te tatra sukha niṣīdensuḥ //
analyzed: vigata mada māna darpāḥ te tatra sukha niṣīdensuḥ
translated: They sat down there happily, free from pride, conceit, and arrogance.

original: te kicideva kāla niṣaṇamātrā narādhipamuvāca /
analyzed: te kicid eva kāla niṣaṇa mātrāḥ narādhipam uvāca
translated: After sitting for a while, they said to the king:

original: śṛṇvatu bhavā prayojana ya asmākamiha gamanāya //
analyzed: śṛṇvatu bhavā asmākam iha gamanāya
translated: Listen, Your Majesty, to the purpose for which we have come here.

original: sarvānavadyagātro putrastava anujāto / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / /
analyzed: sarva anavadya gātraḥ putraḥ tava anujātaḥ
translated: A son has been born to you, faultless in body,

analyzed: lakṣaṇa pārami prāptaḥ
translated: Endowed with the perfection of marks,

original: vayamapi lakṣaṇakuśalā doṣaguṇā lakṣaṇairvijānāma /
analyzed: vayam api lakṣaṇa kuśalāḥ doṣa guṇāḥ lakṣaṇaiḥ vijānāma
translated: We are skilled in the marks, and by the marks we know the good and bad qualities.

original: yadi na guru tava sutante paśyema mahāpuruṣarūpa //
analyzed: yadi na guru tava su tante paśyema mahā puruṣa rūpa
translated: If it is not burdensome for you, we would like to see your son, that great being.

original: so vadati etha paśyatha suvyapadeśakṣema mama putra /
analyzed: saḥ vadati etha paśyatha su vyapadeśa kṣema mama putra
translated: He said, “Come, see my son, who is well-known and secure.

original: marumanujakīrtiyaśasa lakṣaṇaguṇapāramiprāpta //
analyzed: maru manuja kīrti yaśasa lakṣaṇa guṇa pārami prāpta
translated: He has attained the perfection of the characteristics and qualities of fame and glory among gods and men.”

original: atha mṛdukakācalindikapraveṇiśayita ca kanakavarṇābha /
analyzed: atha mṛduka kācalindika praveṇi śayita ca kanaka varṇa ābha
translated: Then, lying on a bed of soft cotton and silk, with a golden complexion,

original: upanayati pārthivavaro naramaruparivandita sugata //
analyzed: upanayati pārthiva varaḥ nara maru parivandita sugata
translated: The best of kings brought forth the Sugata, worshipped by gods and men.

original: ālokayitva dūrā maheśvarāḥ kramavarānnaravarasya /
analyzed: ālokayitva dūrāḥ mahā īśvarāḥ krama varān nara varasya
translated: The great lords, seeing from afar the excellent steps of the best of men,

original: mūrdhnā vigalitamakuṭā dharaṇivaratale praṇipatensuḥ //
analyzed: mūrdhnā vigalita makuṭāḥ dharaṇi vara tale praṇipatensuḥ
translated: With their crowns loosened, bowed their heads to the ground and prostrated themselves.

original: gokṣīravimalacandra mahītale mūrdhna pratiṣṭhāpetvā /
analyzed: go kṣīra vimala candra mahī tale mūrdhnaḥ
translated: Having placed on the ground the pure moon of cow's milk,

original: daśabalamabhinandantāḥ sthitā sucirakālamabhikākṣita iti //
analyzed: daśabalam abhinandantāḥ sthitā su cira kālam abhikākṣitaḥ iti
translated: The ten powers were delighted and stood there for a long time, looking at him.

original: jātā khalu bho dhutadharmadhara bodhisatvāḥ sarvāṇi mānuṣyakāni śilpāni anā cāryakā pyanutiṣṭhanti //
analyzed: jātā khalu bho dhutadharmadhara bodhisatvāḥ sarvāṇi mānuṣyakāni śilpāni anā pi anutiṣṭhanti
translated: Good sirs, when a Bodhisattva is born, he practices all human arts and crafts, even those that are not noble.

original: na khalu bho dhutadharmadhara bodhisatvāḥ tuṣitabhavanātprabhṛti kāmā pratisevanti //
analyzed: na khalu bho dhutadharmadhara bodhisatvāḥ tuṣita bhavanāt prabhṛti kāmā pratisevanti
translated: Good sirs, a Bodhisattva does not enjoy sensual pleasures from the time he is in the Tusita heaven onwards.

original: bho jinaputra ko hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ ya aprahīṇehi kleśehi bodhisatvāḥ kāmā na pratisevanti rāhulaśca kathamutpanna iti /
analyzed: bho jinaputra kaḥ hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ aprahīṇehi kleśehi bodhisatvāḥ kāmāḥ na pratisevanti rāhulaḥ ca katham utpannaḥ iti
translated: What is the cause, what is the condition, O son of the Victorious One, that the Bodhisattvas do not indulge in desires while their defilements are not yet abandoned? And how was Rahula born?

original: evamukte āyuṣmānmahākātyāyana āyuṣmanta mahākāśyapamuvāca //
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān mahākātyāyanaḥ āyuṣmanta mahākāśyapam uvāca
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Mahakatyayana said to the Venerable Mahakasyapa:

original: paripiṇḍatvātkuśalasya bodhisatvā kāmā na pratisevanti kalyāṇādhyāśayatvāt agrādhyāśayatvātpraṇītādhyāśayatvācca bodhisatvā kāmā na pratisevanti
analyzed: paripiṇḍa tvāt kuśalasya bodhisatvā kāmāḥ na pratisevanti kalyāṇa adhyāśaya tvāt agra adhyāśaya tvāt praṇītā adhyāśaya tvāt ca bodhisatvā kāmāḥ na pratisevanti
translated: The Bodhisattvas do not indulge in desires because of the completeness of their wholesome [roots], because of their wholesome superior attitude, because of their excellent superior attitude, and because of their sublime superior attitude.

original: akāmakāmitvāt jñānadhvajatvāt atatparāyaṇatvā spṛhānupasthita tvādbodhisatvāḥ kāmā na pratisevanti /
analyzed: a kāma kāmi tvāt jñāna dhvaja tvāt a tad parāyaṇa tvā spṛhā anupasthita tvāt bodhisatvāḥ kāmāḥ na pratisevanti
translated: The Bodhisattvas do not indulge in desires because they do not desire what is undesirable, because they are the banner of knowledge, because they are not devoted to that, because they are not attached, and because they are noble.

original: āryatvāt anīcatvātkuśalaparibhāvitatvācca bodhisattvāḥ kāmānna pratisevante paramapuruṣasabhāvitatvācca lokasya samyaksabuddho bhaviṣyatīti
analyzed: ārya tvāt anīca tvāt kuśala paribhāvita tvāt ca bodhisattvāḥ kāmān na pratisevante parama puruṣa sa bhāvita tvāt ca lokasya samyaksabuddhaḥ bhaviṣyati iti
translated: The Bodhisattvas do not indulge in desires because they are noble, because they are not low, because they are cultivated by the wholesome, and because they are cultivated by the supreme man, thinking 'I will become a perfectly enlightened Buddha in the world.'

original: atha rāhulastuṣitakāyāccyavitvā mātuḥ yaśodharāyāḥ kṣatriyaka nyāyāḥ kukṣimavatīrṇa iti /
analyzed: atha rāhulaḥ tuṣita kāyāt cyavitvā mātuḥ yaśodharāyāḥ kṣatriyaka nyāyāḥ kukṣim avatīrṇaḥ iti
translated: Then Rahula, having passed away from the Tusita heaven, descended into the womb of his mother Yashodhara, a Kshatriya woman.

original: evamanuśruyate bho dhutadharmadhara //
analyzed: evam anuśruyate bho dhutadharmadhara
translated: Thus it is heard, O you who are pure in regard to the Dharma.

original: rājānaścakravartinaḥ aupapādukā babhūvu //
analyzed: rājānaḥ cakravartinaḥ aupapādukāḥ babhūvu
translated: and also the universal monarchs, who were born spontaneously.

original: tadyathā kusumacūḍaḥ hemavarṇaḥ gāndharvaḥ sumālaḥ ratnadaṇḍaḥ suvi
analyzed: tat yathā kusumacūḍaḥ hemavarṇaḥ gāndharvaḥ sumālaḥ ratnadaṇḍaḥ
translated: For example, Kusumacūḍa, Hemavarṇa, Gāndharva, Sumāla, Ratnadaṇḍa, Suvimāna,

original: mānaḥ ārjavaḥ māndhātā sunayaḥ suvastraḥ bahupakṣaḥ toragrīvaḥ maṇivirajaḥ pavanaḥ marudevaḥ supriyaḥ tyāgavā śuddhavaśaḥ durāroha iti ityevamādayaścakravartigaṇāḥ
analyzed: mānaḥ ārjavaḥ māndhātā sunayaḥ suvastraḥ bahupakṣaḥ toragrīvaḥ maṇivirajaḥ pavanaḥ marudevaḥ supriyaḥ tyāgavā śuddhavaśaḥ durārohaḥ iti iti evamādayaḥ cakravarti gaṇāḥ  /
translated: Ārjava, Māndhātṛ, Sunaya, Suvastra, Bahupākṣa, Torgrīva, Maṇivīrajas, Pavana, Marudeva, Supriya, Tyāgavān, Śuddhavaśa, Durāroha, and so on - these were the groups of universal monarchs.

original: aupapādukā āsannatathā rāhulabhadra iti //
analyzed: aupapādukaḥ āsannatathāḥ rāhulabhadraḥ iti
translated: And also Rāhulabhadra, who was born spontaneously.

original: katha bho dhutadharmadhara bodhisatvā abhiniṣkramaṇasapannā bhavanti //
analyzed: katha bho dhutadharmadhara bodhisatvāḥ abhiniṣkramaṇa sapannāḥ bhavanti
translated: How, Venerable One, do Bodhisattvas become endowed with renunciation?

original: bhūtapūrva bho jinaputra bodhisatvo abhiniṣkrāntaḥ //
analyzed: bhūta pūrva bho jinaputra bodhisatvaḥ abhiniṣkrāntaḥ
translated: Venerable Son of the Victorious One, in the past, when the Bodhisattva was about to renounce,

original: rājakulagataḥ chandaka gāthayādhyabhāṣate //
analyzed: rāja kula gataḥ chandaka gāthayā adhyabhāṣate
translated: he spoke this verse to Chanda at the royal palace:

original: kṣipra chandaka kaṇṭhakamupanītvā mā cira vilambāhi /
analyzed: kṣipra chandaka kaṇṭhakam upanītvā mā cira vilambāhi
translated: Quickly bring Kanthaka, Chanda, do not delay!

original: sagrāmamaha durjaya jayiṣye adya bhava vūdagro //
analyzed: sa grāma maha durjaya jayiṣye adya bhava vūdagro
translated: Today I will conquer the invincible city of existence, and become exalted.🔽Chanda, with a face full of tears and sighing,

original: so vāṣpapūrṇavadano pariniḥśvasanto chandakaḥ saśokaravitāni samutthitāni /
analyzed: saḥ vāṣpa pūrṇa vadanaḥ chandakaḥ sa śoka ravitāni samutthitāni
translated: arose with feelings of grief and lamentation.

original: vāṣpāṇi muñcati imāni prabodhanārtha suptasya pārthivajanasya / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / //🔽ki dāni āvigalitā varakośabhārā vāṣpaughasastaragatā madanābhibhūtā /
analyzed: vāṣpāṇi muñcati imāni prabodhana artha suptasya pārthiva janasya  ki dāni āvigalitā vara kośa bhārā vāṣpa ogha sastara gatā madana abhibhūtā
translated: These tears are shed to awaken the sleeping people of the earth.🔽What is this? The burden of the excellent treasure has been suddenly cast off, and the flood of tears has passed, overcome by passion.

original: lālasyasokaparidevitakāla eva suptā idāni yada jāgraṇadeśakālaḥ //🔽devī pi nāma sucira pratijāgaritvā saudāmanīpratimarūpanibhā śayānā /
analyzed: lālasya soka paridevita kāle eva suptāḥ idāni jāgraṇa deśa kālaḥ  devī nāma su cira pratijāgaritvā saudāmanī pratima rūpa nibhā śayānā
translated: The time for weeping, lamenting, and crying out in grief is over. Now is the time for the country to be awake.🔽The queen, who has been watching for a long time, is sleeping, her form resembling a lightning flash.

original: niryāṇakālasamaye naralambakasya varasurapure suravadhūpratimā salīlā //
analyzed: niryāṇa kāla samaye naralambakasya vara sura pure sura vadhū pratimā sa līlā
translated: At the time of the departure of the human elephant, in the excellent city of the gods, she is like a celestial maiden, graceful.

original: sā dāni tasya mahiṣī manujeśvarasya mātā savatsalaviśālasucārunetrā /
analyzed: sā dāni tasya mahiṣī manuja īśvarasya mātā sa vatsala viśāla su cāru netrā
translated: That queen, the mother of the lord of men, with eyes that are affectionate, vast, and very beautiful,

original: sapraśyamāna karuṇa priyaviprayoga nidrābhibhūta na vijānati ālapanta //
analyzed: sa praśyamāna karuṇa priya viprayoga nidrā abhibhūta na vijānati ālapanta
translated: is being addressed with piteous words, but she does not know, being overcome by sleep, due to the separation from her beloved.

original: sā dāni kuñjaravarāśvasamāptayodhā nārācaprāsaśaraśaktivicitravarmā /
analyzed: sā dāni kuñjara vara aśva samāpta yodhā nārāca prāsa śara śakti vicitra varmā
translated: The army, with its excellent elephants and horses, its warriors, its armor variegated with iron arrows, spears, arrows, and javelins,

original: senā kahi vasati ka vā guṇa karoti yā śākyapuṅgava na budhyati niṣkramanta //
analyzed: senā kahi vasati ka vā guṇa karoti yā śākya puṅgava na budhyati niṣkramanta
translated: where does it dwell? Who is performing its duties? The best of the Shakyas does not know that it is departing.

original: ka bodhayāmi mama ko nu bhave sahāyo ki vā karomi devase api vipranaṣṭe /
analyzed: ka bodhayāmi mama kaḥ nu bhave sahāyo ki vā karomi devase api vipranaṣṭe
translated: Who will I wake up? Who will be my companion now? What can I do, even if the gods have abandoned me?

original: hā hemakāñcananibhena kila vihīno rājā jahiṣyati sabandhujano śarīra //
analyzed: hā hema kāñcana nibhena kila vihīnaḥ rājā jahiṣyati
translated: Alas! Separated from him who is like gold, the king will lose his life along with his relatives.

original: ta devasagha avacī madhurapralāpī ki chandakā lapasi ki ti vihanyitena /
analyzed: madhura pralāpī ki lapasi ki
translated: Then the assembly of gods, speaking sweetly, said, Why do you lament, Chanda? Why are you distressed?

original: naitasya mārakaputrāṇyapi udyatāni vighna samartha janayeyu kuto punastva //
analyzed: na etasya māraka putrāṇi api udyatāni vighna samartha janayeyu
translated: The sons of Mara, with their weapons raised, cannot create an obstacle for him, let alone you.

original: bherimṛdaṅga yadi śakhasahasraśabda kuryātkocitkapilavastuni bodhanārtha /
analyzed: bheri mṛdaṅga yadi śakha sahasra śabda kuryāt kaścid kapilavastuni bodhana artha
translated: If someone were to make a sound with a thousand drums, conches, and cymbals in Kapilavastu to awaken him,

original: naitadvibuddhi amareśvaramādikehi ta sopita puravara hi samṛddhavāra //
analyzed: ta sopita puravara hi samṛddha vāra
translated: The Lord of the gods and the rulers of the world would not be able to awaken him. That city is prosperous and flourishing.

original: paśyāsi tāva gagane maṇiratnacūḍā
analyzed: paśyāsi tāva gagane maṇi ratna cūḍā
translated: You will see in the sky the gods with jeweled crowns,

original: devā divi gurukṛtasya vasānuvartī /
analyzed: devāḥ divi gurukṛtasya vasa anuvartī
translated: Following the guru of the gods in heaven,🔽Bowing with palms joined, bowing their heads,

original: prahvā kṛtājalipuṭā praṇipatya mūrghnā tva bandhu tva ca śaraṇa ti namasyamānā //
analyzed: prahvā kṛta ajali puṭā praṇipatya mūrghnā tva bandhu tva ca śaraṇa ti namasyamānā
translated: Saying, We are your relatives, we are your refuge, we pay homage to you.

original: tatsādhu kaṇṭhakamupānaya nāyakasya gokṣīrahemavapuṣa sahaja turaga /
analyzed: tat sādhu kaṇṭhakam upānaya nāyakasya go kṣīra hema vapuṣa sahaja turaga
translated: Then lead Kanthaka, the king's horse, who has a body like milk and gold, O natural horse,

original: na hyasti so bhuvi divi naralambakasya yo vighna kuryā upanehi turagaśreṣṭha //
analyzed: na hi asti saḥ bhuvi divi nara lambakasya yaḥ vighna kuryāḥ upanehi turaga śreṣṭha
translated: For there is no one on earth or in heaven who could create an obstacle for the human elephant. Lead the excellent horse here!

original: so ta praphullakumudākarakundagaura sapūrṇacandravapuṣa sahaja turaṅga /
analyzed: sa u ta praphulla kumuda ākara kunda gaura sa pūrṇa candra vapuṣa sahaja turaṅga
translated: He, with a body white like a blooming lotus pond or jasmine, with a body like the full moon, the natural horse,

original: tasya mahāguṇadharasya vacābhitunno suśrūṣakāri upanāmayate rudanto //
analyzed: tasya mahā guṇa dharasya suśrūṣa kāri upanāmayate
translated: Overcome by the words of the one with great qualities, crying, he presents the obedient servant.

original: eṣo ti nātha varalakṣaṇabhūṣitāṅgo sajjaḥ sudyotacaraṇo lalitāgragāmī /
analyzed: sajjaḥ sudyota caraṇaḥ lalita agra gāmī
translated: O Lord, the one with limbs adorned by excellent marks, the well-illuminated one, the graceful leader,

original: ya dāni te dhyavasita vararūpadhāri tante samṛdhyatu viśālabhujāntarāśā //
analyzed: ya dāni te vara rūpa dhāri tante samṛdhyatu viśāla bhujāntara āśā
translated: Now that you have decided, O bearer of excellent form, may your vast hopes between your mighty arms be fulfilled!

original: śatruśca te grabala durbalabhagnaśūko śīghra tapetu tava tejavarābhibhūtaḥ /
analyzed: śatruḥ ca te durbala bhagna śūko śīghra tapetu tava teja vara abhibhūtaḥ
translated: And your enemy, O king, may the weak and broken-toothed one quickly be tormented, overcome by your excellent splendor.

original: āsā ca te naralambaka mahārthayuktā sapūryatā kanakaparvatasannikāśā //
analyzed: āsā ca te nara lambaka mahā artha yuktā sa pūrya tā kanaka parvata sannikāśā
translated: And may your hopes, O human elephant, connected with great meaning, be fulfilled, resembling a mountain of gold!

original: ye tubhya vighnakarā te tu apakramantu
analyzed: ye tubhya vighna karā te tu apakramantu
translated: Those who create obstacles for you, may they depart,

original: śreyāvahā tu ti bala vipula labhantu /
analyzed: śreyāvahā tu ti bala vipula labhantu
translated: And those who bring about what is excellent, may they obtain vast strength.

original: ya ca vrata samupagacchasi tasya pāra gacchāsi mattavaravāraṇakhelagāmi //
analyzed: ya ca vrata samupagacchasi tasya pāra gacchāsi matta vara vāraṇa khela gāmi
translated: And whatever vow you undertake, you will reach its end, moving like an intoxicated excellent elephant.

original: maṇikuṭṭimā ca vasudhā rājakule kaṇṭhakasya pādehi /
analyzed: maṇi kuṭṭimā ca vasudhā rājakule kaṇṭhakasya pādehi
translated: The ground in the royal palace was of bejewelled pavement, and as Kaṇṭhaka's hoofs struck it,

original: samanihatā rasati madhura niśā sphurati adbhuta śabda //
analyzed: samanihatā rasati madhura niśā sphurati adbhuta śabda
translated: it resounded with a sweet sound, and a wonderful light shone forth.

original: caturaśca lokapālā vigalitamakuṭā pralambavaramālāḥ /
analyzed: caturaḥ ca lokapālāḥ vigalita makuṭā pralamba vara mālāḥ
translated: The Four Great Kings, their diadems loosened, their fine garlands hanging down,

original: kaṇṭhakapādeṣu karā nyasanti raktotpalasakāśā //
analyzed: kaṇṭhaka pādeṣu karāḥ nyasanti rakta utpala sakāśā
translated: placed their hands on Kaṇṭhaka's feet, which were like red lotuses.

original: agrato vajravaradharo tridaśagurū ābaddhamaṇīcūḍo /
analyzed: agratas vajra vara dharaḥ tridaśa gurū ābaddha maṇī cūḍaḥ
translated: The chief of the Thirty-three Gods, bearing his thunderbolt, his crest-jewel fastened,

original: indro sahasranayano gacchati purato naravarasya //
analyzed: indraḥ sahasra nayanaḥ gacchati puratas nara varasya
translated: Indra, with his thousand eyes, went in front of the Best of Men.

original: sajñākṛtamātramida kaṇṭhako vahatīti vādiśārdūla /
analyzed: sajñā kṛta mātram idam kaṇṭhakaḥ vahati iti vādi śārdūla
translated: As soon as Kaṇṭhaka was thought of, he carried him, the best of speakers,

original: devā pravarakarahṛta vahanti aśupravaravarṣa //
analyzed: devā pravara kara hṛta vahanti aśu pravara varṣa
translated: and the gods, with their excellent hands, carried him, raining down excellent flowers.

original: niṣkramya nagaravarāto avalokayi puravara puruṣasiho /
analyzed: niṣkramya nagara varātaḥ
translated: Having left the best of cities, the Lion-man looked back at the best of cities,

original: na ta punaraha pravekṣyamaprāpya jarāmaraṇapāramiti //
analyzed: na te punar aha pravekṣyam a prāpya jarā maraṇa pāram iti
translated: thinking, I shall not enter again until I have reached the other shore of old age and death.

original: evamabhiniṣkramaṇasapannā khalu bho dhutadharmadhara samyaksabuddhā iti /
analyzed: evam abhiniṣkramaṇa sapannā khalu bho dhutadharmadhara samyaksabuddhāḥ iti
translated: Thus, my friend Dhutādharma, the perfect Buddhas have the quality of going forth.

original: na pratibalo khalvaha bho dhutadharmadhara bodhisatvasya garbhāvakrāntimādau kṛtvā yāvadabhiniṣkramaṇato vistareṇa bhāṣitu kalpa kalpāvaśeṣa
analyzed: na khalu aha bho dhutadharmadhara bodhisatvasya garbhāvakrāntim ādau kṛtvā yāvat abhiniṣkramaṇataḥ vistareṇa bhāṣitu kalpa kalpa avaśeṣa
translated: I am not able, good Dharmôdgata, to explain in detail, beginning with the Bodhisattva's conception and ending with his departure from home, the whole matter of the Bodhisattvas.

original: vā na ca guṇā samantā śakyamabhigantu //
analyzed: vā na ca guṇā samantā śakyam abhigantu
translated: Nor is it possible to reach the end of the Bodhisattvas' virtues.

original: ityapi bahuguṇasapannā samyaksabuddhā iti //
analyzed: iti api bahu guṇa sapannā samyaksabuddhā iti
translated: Thus, the perfect Buddhas are endowed with many virtues.

original: bodhimūlamupagamya cāprāptāyā sarvākārajñatāyā pacacakṣusamanvāgatā bhavanti //
analyzed: bodhi mūlam upagamya ca a prāptāyāḥ sarva ākārajña tāyāḥ paca cakṣu samanvāgatāḥ bhavanti
translated: And having approached the foot of the Bodhi tree, they are endowed with the five eyes, which are not yet obtained in the knowledge of all modes.

original: evamukte āyuṣmānmahākāśyapa āyuṣmanta mahākātyāyanamuvāca //
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān mahākāśyapaḥ āyuṣmanta mahākātyāyanam uvāca
translated: When this had been said, the venerable Mahakasyapa said to the venerable Mahakatyayana:

original: vistareṇa bho jinaputra paca cakṣūṇi parikīrtaya avahitaśrotā devamanuṣyasakulā pariṣā sarvabhūtagaṇā iti //
analyzed: vistareṇa bho jinaputra paca cakṣūṇi parikīrtaya avahita śrotā deva manuṣya sakulā pariṣā sarva bhūta gaṇāḥ iti
translated: Explain in detail, son of the Conqueror, the five eyes. The assembly of gods, men, and the families of the clans, and all the hosts of beings, are attentive listeners.

original: evamukte āyuṣmānmahākātyāyana āyuṣmanta mahākāśyapamuvāca //
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān mahākātyāyanaḥ āyuṣmanta mahākāśyapam uvāca
translated: When this had been said, the venerable Mahakatyayana said to the venerable Mahakasyapa:

original: paca imāni bho dhutadharmadhara samyaksabuddhānā cakṣūṇi bhavanti //
analyzed: paca imāni bho dhutadharmadhara samyaksabuddhānā cakṣūṇi bhavanti
translated: These, friend Dharmôdgata, are the five eyes of the perfect Buddhas.

original: katamāni paca //
analyzed: katamāni paca
translated: What are the five?

original: mā nsacakṣuḥ divyacakṣuḥ prajñācakṣuḥ dharmacakṣuḥ buddhacakṣuḥ //
analyzed: mā nsa cakṣuḥ divya cakṣuḥ prajñā cakṣuḥ dharma cakṣuḥ buddha cakṣuḥ
translated: The fleshly eye, the divine eye, the wisdom eye, the Dharma eye, and the Buddha eye.

original: imāni bho dhutadharmadhara paca cakṣūṇi samyaksabuddhānā bhavanti asādhāraṇāni pratyekabuddhebhyaḥ arhantebhyaḥ śaikṣebhyaḥ sarvabālapṛthagjanebhya
analyzed: imāni bho cakṣūṇi samyaksabuddhānām bhavanti asādhāraṇāni pratyekabuddhebhyaḥ arhantebhyaḥ śaikṣebhyaḥ sarva bāla pṛthagjanebhyaḥ
translated: These, Venerable One, are the five eyes of the Perfectly Awakened Ones, which are not common to the Pratyekabuddhas, Arhats, or any of the foolish ordinary people.

original: iti /
analyzed: iti
translated: Thus it is said.

original: tatra bho dhutadharmadhara mānsacakṣustathāgatānā //
analyzed: tatra bho
translated: There, Venerable One, the flesh eye of the Tathagatas...

original: yāye prabhāye samanvāgata yāye śūkṣmadarśanāye samanvāgata yāye tattvadarśanāye samanvāgata tanmānsacakṣu anyasya satvasya satvakāye nāsti
analyzed: anyasya satvasya satva kāye na asti
translated: Endowed with that light, endowed with that subtle vision, endowed with that true vision, that flesh eye of theirs is not found in any other being in the world of beings.

original: prāpte ca sarvadarśitve bodhisatvā yāvattakamavakāśamavalokayitumicchanti ta darśana tatra apratihata pravartate /
analyzed: prāpte ca sarva darśi tve bodhisatvāḥ yāvattakam avakāśam avalokayitum icchanti darśana tatra apratihata pravartate
translated: And having attained the state of seeing everything, the Bodhisattvas, wherever they wish to look, there it proceeds unobstructed.

original: ki kāraṇa //
analyzed: ki kāraṇa
translated: What is the reason?

original: vipulakuśalasacitatvāt //
analyzed: vipula kuśala sacita tvāt
translated: Because of the accumulation of vast merit.

original: tadyathāpi nāma ṛddhibalena rājā cakravarti sārdha caturaginīyā senāye vaihāyasa dvīpāto dvīpa sakrāmati tatheda pi draṣṭavya //
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma ṛddhi balena rājā cakravarti vaihāyasa dvīpātaḥ dvīpa sakrāmati tathā idam pi draṣṭavya
translated: Just as King Chakravarti, together with his four-division army, travels through the sky from one continent to another, so should this be seen.

original: samyaksabuddhānā carite ṛddhibalena anākākṣamāṇānā niścalā vasumati pratikra mantānā unnatā ca onamati onatā na unnamati tathaitadapi 🔽draṣṭavyamityevamādinā
analyzed: samyaksabuddhānā carite ṛddhi balena niścalā vasumati mantānā unnatā ca onamati onatā na unnamati tathā etat api  draṣṭavyam iti evamādinā
translated: And when the Perfectly Awakened Ones, without any desire, walk on the earth with the power of their supernormal abilities, the earth rises up and then subsides, and what is high becomes low, and what is low becomes high. It should be seen in this way, and so on.

original: lakṣaṇamātreṇa samyaksabuddhānā mānsacakṣuḥ nirupadiśyate //
analyzed: lakṣaṇa mātreṇa samyaksabuddhānā mānsa cakṣuḥ nirupadiśyate
translated: In this way, the physical eye of the Perfectly Awakened Ones is described only by its characteristics.

original: na ca kalpena samyaksa buddhānā mānsacakṣusya śakya guṇaparyantamadhigantu //
analyzed: na ca kalpena samyaksa buddhānām mānsa cakṣusya śakya guṇa paryantam adhigantu
translated: And it is not possible to reach the limit of the qualities of the physical eye of the Perfectly Awakened Ones by calculation.

original: ki kāraṇa //
analyzed: ki kāraṇa
translated: Why is that?

original: na hi kicitsa myaksabuddhānā lokena sama //
analyzed: na hi kicid sa myaksabuddhānā lokena
translated: Because there is nothing in the world that is equal to the Perfectly Awakened Ones.

original: atha khalu sarvameva maharṣiṇā lokottara //
analyzed: atha khalu sarvam eva mahā ṛṣiṇā
translated: Rather, the entire world of the Great Sage is transcendent.

original: tathā hi samyaksabuddhānā samudāgamaḥ so pi lokottaro //🔽tacca samyaksabuddhānā mānsacakṣuṣaḥ varṇa pravṛtta sthāna ca yathānyeṣā satvānā satvakāye //
analyzed: tathā hi samyaksabuddhānā samudāgamaḥ saḥ pi lokottaraḥ  tat ca samyaksabuddhānām mānsacakṣuṣaḥ varṇa pravṛtta sthāna ca yathā anyeṣā satvānā satva kāye
translated: For thus the attainment of the Perfectly Awakened Ones is also transcendent.

original: yena cakṣuṣā bhaumyā devāśca yakṣāśca rākṣasāśca kāmāvacarāśca rūpāvacarāśca devāḥ tato viśiṣṭatara ca vipulatara ca sphuṭatara ca samyaksabuddhānā
analyzed: yena cakṣuṣā bhaumyāḥ devāḥ ca yakṣāḥ ca rākṣasāḥ ca kāmāvacarāḥ ca rūpāvacarāḥ ca devāḥ tatas ca viśiṣṭatara ca vipulatara ca sphuṭatara ca samyaksabuddhānā
translated: And that physical eye of the Perfectly Awakened Ones is superior, more vast, and clearer than the eye by which the earthly gods, yakshas, rakshasas, gods of the desire realm, and gods of the form realm see the world of beings.

original: divyacakṣuḥ //
analyzed: divya cakṣuḥ
translated: The divine eye.

original: tatpravṛtta manomayeṣu rūpeṣu //
analyzed: tat pravṛtta manaḥ mayeṣu rūpeṣu
translated: In the forms that arise from the mind.

original: yeneha prajñācakṣuṣā samanvāgatā cakṣutvaparīkṣayā aṣṭamakādikā puḍgalā yāvadarha tpudgalā iti ato parivyaktatara samyaksabuddhānā prajñācakṣuḥ
analyzed: yena iha prajñā cakṣuṣā samanvāgatā cakṣu tva parīkṣayā aṣṭamaka ādikā puḍgalāḥ yāvat arhant pudgalāḥ iti atas parivyaktatara samyaksabuddhānā prajñā cakṣuḥ
translated: By which, endowed with the eye of wisdom here, through the examination of the eye, the individuals beginning with the eighth, up to the individuals who are arhats, are distinguished. Therefore, the eye of wisdom of the perfectly enlightened ones is even more distinct.

original: tatra katama samyaksa buddhānā dharmacakṣuḥ //
analyzed: tatra katama samyaksa buddhānā dharmacakṣuḥ
translated: Among them, what is the Dharma eye of the perfectly enlightened ones?

original: sa daśānā balānā manovibhutā /
analyzed: sa daśānā balānā manaḥ vibhu tā
translated: That is the mental mastery of the ten powers.

original: tatra katamāni daśa balāni //
analyzed: tatra katamāni daśa balāni
translated: Among them, what are the ten powers?

original: tadyathā sthānāsthāna vetti prathama bala aprameyabuddhīnā /
analyzed: tat yathā sthāna asthāna vetti prathama bala aprameya buddhīnām
translated: Namely, he knows the possible and impossible as the first power, with immeasurable understanding.

original: sarvatragāminī ca pratipada vetti bala dvitīya //
analyzed: sarvatragāminī ca pratipada vetti bala dvitīya
translated: He knows the path that goes everywhere as the second power.

original: nānādhātuka loka vidanti khyāta bala tṛtīya /
analyzed: nānādhātuka loka vidanti khyāta bala tṛtīya
translated: He knows the world with its many elements as the third power.

original: adhimuktinānātva vetti caturtha bala bhavati //
analyzed: adhimukti nānātva vetti caturtha bala bhavati
translated: He knows the various inclinations as the fourth power.

original: parapuruṣacaritakuśalāni vetti tatpacama bala ca /
analyzed: para puruṣa carita kuśalāni vetti ca
translated: He knows the abilities of other beings as the fifth power.

original: karmabala pratijānanti śubhāśubha tadbala ṣaṣṭha //
analyzed: karma bala pratijānanti śubha aśubha tad bala ṣaṣṭha
translated: He knows the good and bad actions as the sixth power.

original: kleśavyavadāna vetti saptama bala dhyānasamāpatti vetti /
analyzed: kleśa vyavadāna vetti saptama bala dhyāna samāpatti vetti
translated: He knows the defilements and purification as the seventh power. He knows the meditations and attainments.

original: aṣṭama bala pūrvanivāsa vetti bahuprakāra //
analyzed: aṣṭama bala pūrvanivāsa vetti bahuprakāra
translated: The eighth power knows the many kinds of former abodes.

original: bala navama bhavati pariśuddhadivyanayanā bhavanti /
analyzed: bhavati pariśuddha divya nayanāḥ bhavanti
translated: The ninth power is the attainment of pure divine vision.

original: sarvakleśavināśa prāpnonti daśama bala bhavati //🔽etāni manovibhubalāni yaiḥ sarvadarśī divi bhuvi ca jātakīrtiḥ daśabala ityeva mākhyāto //
analyzed: sarva kleśa vināśa prāpnonti daśama bala bhavati  etāni manaḥ vibhu balāni yaiḥ sarva darśī divi bhuvi ca jāta kīrtiḥ daśabalaḥ iti eva
translated: The tenth power is the destruction of all afflictions.🔽These are the mental powers, by which the omniscient one, whose fame extends throughout heaven and earth, is called the One with the Ten Powers.

original: ya eteṣu daśabaleṣu manovibhujñāna idamucyate dharmacakṣuriti //
analyzed: yaḥ eteṣu daśa baleṣu manaḥ vibhu jñāne idam ucyate dharmacakṣuḥ iti
translated: The knowledge of these ten powers is called the Dharma eye.

original: tatra katama buddhacakṣuḥ //
analyzed: tatra buddha cakṣuḥ
translated: Now, what is the Buddha eye?

original: aṣṭādaśāveṇikā buddhadharmāḥ //
analyzed: aṣṭādaśa āveṇikāḥ buddha dharmāḥ
translated: The eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha.

original: tadyathā atīte aśe tathāgatasya apratihata jñānadarśana /🔽anāgate aśe apratihata jñānadarśana /
analyzed: tat yathā atīte tathāgatasya apratihata jñāna darśana  anāgate aśe apratihata jñāna darśana
translated: Namely, in the past, the Tathāgata's knowledge and vision are unobstructed.🔽In the future, his knowledge and vision are unobstructed.

original: pratyutpanne aśe apratihata jñānadarśana /
analyzed: pratyutpanne aśe apratihata jñāna darśana
translated: In the present, his knowledge and vision are unobstructed.

original: sarva kāyakarma jñānapūrvagama jñānānuparivarti /
analyzed: kāya karma jñāna pūrva gama jñāna anuparivarti
translated: All bodily actions are preceded by knowledge and follow knowledge.

original: sarva vācākarma jñānapūrvagama jñānānuparivarti /
analyzed: sarva vācākarma jñāna pūrva gama jñāna anuparivarti
translated: All verbal actions are preceded by knowledge and follow knowledge.

original: sarva manokarma jñānapūrvagama jñānānuparivarti /🔽nāsti chandasya hāniḥ /
analyzed: sarva manaḥ karma jñāna pūrva gama jñāna anuparivarti  na asti chandasya hāniḥ
translated: All mental actions are preceded by knowledge and follow knowledge.🔽There is no loss of aspiration.

original: nāsti vīryasya hāniḥ /🔽nāsti smṛtiye hāniḥ /
analyzed: na asti vīryasya hāniḥ  na asti smṛtiye hāniḥ
translated: There is no loss of energy.🔽There is no loss of mindfulness.

original: nāsti samādhīye hāniḥ /
analyzed: na asti samādhīye hāniḥ
translated: There is no loss of concentration.

original: nāsti prajñāye hāniḥ /🔽nāsti vimuktīye hāniḥ /🔽nāsti khalita /
analyzed: na asti prajñāye hāniḥ  na asti vimuktīye hāniḥ  na asti khalita
translated: There is no loss of wisdom.🔽There is no loss of liberation.🔽There is no faltering.

original: nāsti ravita /🔽nāsti muṣitasmṛtitā /🔽nāsti asamāhita citta /
analyzed: na asti ravita  na asti muṣita smṛti tā  nāsti asamāhita citta
translated: There is no stammering.🔽There is no loss of mindfulness.🔽There is no distracted mind.

original: nāsti apratisakhyāya upekṣā /
analyzed: na asti apratisakhyāya upekṣā
translated: There is no indifference due to lack of full awareness.

original: nāsti nānātvasajñā /
analyzed: na asti nānātva sajñā
translated: There is no perception of diversity.

original: ya imeṣu aṣṭādaśasvāve ṇikeṣu buddhadharmeṣu jñānamidamucyate buddhacakṣuriti //
analyzed: ye imeṣu buddha dharmeṣu jñānam idam ucyate buddha cakṣuḥ iti
translated: The knowledge of these eighteen unique qualities of a Buddha is called the Buddha-eye.

original: evamukte āyuṣmānmahākāśyapa āyuṣmanta mahākātyāyanamuvāca //
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān mahākāśyapaḥ āyuṣmanta mahākātyāyanam uvāca
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Mahakasyapa said to the Venerable Mahakatyayana:

original: ki punarbho jinaputra bhagavato etadadhivacana yādṛśānā bhūmīnā vyākaraṇa utāho samyaksabuddhā nāmetaditi //
analyzed: ki punar bho jinaputra bhagavato etat adhivacana yādṛśānā bhūmīnā vyākaraṇa uta aho samyaksabuddhāḥ nāma etat iti
translated: Again, son of the Victor, is this a designation of the Blessed One, as it is of the stages of prophecy, or is it of the Perfectly Enlightened Ones?

original: evamukte āyuṣmānmahākātyāyana āyuṣmanta mahākāśyapamuvāca //
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān mahākātyāyanaḥ āyuṣmanta mahākāśyapam uvāca
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Mahakatyayana said to the Venerable Mahakasyapa:

original: ekasmi samaye bho dhutadharmadhara bhagavā vārāṇasyā vijahāra ṛṣivadene mṛgadāve aṣṭāviśatīnā vaśībhūtaśatānā puraskṛtaḥ //
analyzed: ekasmi samaye bho dhutadharmadhara bhagavā vārāṇasyāḥ vijahāra ṛṣivat ene mṛgadāve aṣṭāviśatīnā vaśībhūta śatānā puraskṛtaḥ
translated: At one time, O you who uphold the pure Dharma, the Blessed One was dwelling in Varanasi, in the Deer Park at Risivadana, attended by eighty thousand perfected beings.

original: tatra bhagavatā aṣṭādaśa buddhadharmā vi bhaktāḥ atīte aśe apratihata jñānadarśanameva samyaksabuddhānā bhavatīti daśa bhūmayo samutkīrtaye
analyzed: tatra bhagavatā aṣṭādaśa buddha dharmāḥ vi bhaktāḥ atīte aśe a pratihata jñāna darśanam eva samyaksabuddhānā bhavati iti daśa bhūmayo samutkīrtaye
translated: There, the Blessed One has explained the eighteen qualities of a Buddha: The knowledge and vision of the past is unobstructed for the Perfectly Enlightened Ones. Thus, the ten stages are proclaimed.

original: śākyamuni samyaksabuddha ādau kṛtvā daśa bhūmayo deśitā //
analyzed: śākyamuni samyaksabuddhaḥ ādau kṛtvā daśa bhūmayaḥ deśitā
translated: Starting with the Perfectly Enlightened One Shakyamuni, the ten stages are taught.

original: tatrede mucyate //
analyzed: tatra ide mucyate
translated: Here, this is said:

original: priyāṇi vastūni dadāti cakṣumā cira prasannena manena sasaran /
analyzed: priyāṇi vastūni dadāti cakṣumā cira prasannena manena sasaran
translated: The one with eyes gives dear objects, rejoicing with a long-satisfied mind.

original: tato priya budhyati jñānamuttama svaya mahīmaṇḍagato tathāgato //
analyzed: tatas priya budhyati jñānam uttama svayam mahī maṇḍa gataḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: Then, the Tathāgata, who has gone to the center of the earth, understands the excellent knowledge that is dear to him.

original: vicitravastrābharaṇairalakṛtāḥ striyo dadāti parituṣṭamānaso /
analyzed: vicitra vastra ābharaṇaiḥ alakṛtāḥ striyaḥ dadāti parituṣṭa mānasaḥ
translated: With a satisfied mind, he gives women adorned with various clothes and ornaments.

original: vicitramasya pratijñānamadbhuta udīryate tasya phalena karmaṇaḥ //
analyzed: vicitram asya pratijñānam adbhutaḥ udīryate tasya phalena karmaṇaḥ
translated: The wonderful variety of his vow is proclaimed by the fruit of that action.

original: na śaktinārāca na prāsatomarā prāsesi satveṣu bhaveṣu sasaran /
analyzed: na śakti nārāca na prāsa tomarā satveṣu bhaveṣu sasaran
translated: While rejoicing in existences, he does not throw spears, arrows, javelins, or lances at beings.

original: tathāsya mārgo'tṛṇakhaṇḍakaṇṭako
analyzed: tathā asya
translated: Thus, his path is without grass, twigs, or thorns.

original: aghāti grāmā nagarā ca sasaran //
analyzed: aghāti grāmā nagarā ca sasaran
translated: While rejoicing, he does not harm villages or towns.

original: svakasya dāsasya pi dharmavādinaḥ śṛṇoti satkṛtya kathā na cchindati /
analyzed: svakasya dāsasya pi dharma vādinaḥ śṛṇoti satkṛtya kathāḥ na chindati
translated: He listens to the Dharma talk of his own servant and does not interrupt it respectfully.

original: tato sya dharma bruvato mahājane na kaści no ramyati no ca tuṣyati //
analyzed: tatas sya dharma bruvataḥ mahājane na kaścid no ramyati no ca tuṣyati
translated: Then, when he preaches the Dharma to the great assembly, no one is displeased or dissatisfied.

original: praṇītadānāni dadāti / / / / / / / / / vineti kākṣāñca tathaiva saśaya /
analyzed: praṇīta dānāni dadāti vinā iti tathā eva
translated: He gives excellent gifts, and thus dispels doubt and uncertainty.

original: tato sya kāyāt jvalanārcisannibhā prabhā samuttiṣṭhati śītalaprabhā //
analyzed: tatas sya kāyāt jvalana arci sannibhā prabhā samuttiṣṭhati śītala prabhā
translated: Then from his body arises a radiance like a flame, a cool radiance.

original: na kasyacidyācanakasya yācanā bhavanti bandhyā naradevaveśitā /
analyzed: na kasyacid yācanakasya yācanāḥ bhavanti bandhyā naradeva veśitā
translated: For no one who asks for something from the king of men does his wish remain unfulfilled.

original: tato abandhyā bhavi tasya deśanā tadadbhuta mārabalapramardane //
analyzed: tatas tasya deśanā tat adbhuta māra bala pramardane
translated: Then his teaching becomes fruitful, that wondrous subduing of the power of Mara.

original: manoramā kāñcanatālaparṇiyo jineṣu denti parituṣṭamānasāḥ /
analyzed: manoramā kāñcana tālaparṇiyaḥ jineṣu denti parituṣṭa mānasāḥ
translated: With delighted minds they offer to the Victors delightful golden palm leaves.

original: tato anālokiyā lokabāndhavā sadā ca lokeṣu / / etadadbhuta //
analyzed: tatas sadā ca lokeṣu
translated: Then the kinsmen of the world become unassailable, always in the worlds this is wondrous.

original: upānahā ratnamayā ca pādukā dadāti nitya parituṣṭamānasaḥ /
analyzed: upānahā ratna mayāḥ ca pādukāḥ dadāti nitya parituṣṭa mānasaḥ
translated: He always gives with a delighted mind jeweled sandals and shoes.

original: tataḥ sadā cakramate narottamaḥ asaspṛśanto caturagula mahī //
analyzed: tatas sadā cakramate narottamaḥ
translated: Then the wheel-turning king, best of men, does not touch the ground with his four feet.

original: parehi ukto paruṣa punaḥ punaḥ prabhuḥ samāno kṣamate na ūhate /
analyzed: parehi ukto paruṣa punar punar prabhuḥ samāno kṣamate na ūhate
translated: Though spoken to harshly again and again by others, the lord remains patient and does not retaliate.

original: tato piya cakramato saparvatā samunnatāntonamati vasundharā //
analyzed: sa parvatā vasundharā
translated: Then the earth with its mountains and lofty peaks bows down, the wheel-turning king is dear.

original: karoti dīnāna nayena sagraha patantamabhyuddharate mahājana /
analyzed: karoti nayena sagraha patantam abhyuddharate mahājana
translated: He acts with compassion for the afflicted, and rescues the fallen great multitude.

original: tato sya ratnāmayaratnasacayā samonatā unnamate vasudharā //
analyzed: tatas sya ratna āmaya ratna sacayā samaḥ natā unnamate vasudharā
translated: Then the earth, with its mountains and oceans, trembles and rises up.

original: svaguṇaparikīrtanena ca samyaksabuddhena buddhānusmṛtirnāma dharmaparyāyo bhāṣitaḥ //
analyzed: sva guṇa parikīrtanena ca samyaksabuddhena buddhānusmṛtiḥ nāma dharmaparyāyaḥ bhāṣitaḥ
translated: And the Blessed One, having praised the qualities of the Buddha, taught the Dharma discourse called Recollection of the Buddha.

original: tasya paryavasāne āyuṣmatā vāgīsena samyaksabuddho samukhamabhistuto //
analyzed: tasya paryavasāne āyuṣmatā vāgīsena samyaksabuddhaḥ sa mukham abhistutaḥ
translated: At the conclusion of that discourse, the Venerable Vāgīsa praised the Blessed One face to face:

original: namo stu te buddha anantadarśana samantacakṣuḥ śatapuṇyalakṣaṇa /
analyzed: namaḥ stu te buddha ananta darśana samanta cakṣuḥ śata puṇya lakṣaṇa
translated: Homage to you, O Buddha, of infinite vision, all-seeing, endowed with the marks of a hundred merits.

original: hitānukampī paramārthakovida namāmi tvā valgugirāhi gautama //
analyzed: hita anukampī parama artha kovida namāmi tvā gautama
translated: Compassionate towards beings, skilled in the ultimate truth, I pay homage to you, Gautama, with sweet words.

original: tāresi tīrṇo janatā mahāmune na bhāyasi kṣemakarāgrapudgala /
analyzed: tāresi tīrṇaḥ janatā mahā mune na bhāyasi kṣema kara agra pudgala
translated: You have crossed over and lead others across, O great sage, O foremost person who brings peace and security,

original: yathātatha sthānamabhiprakāśaya vinesi satye amṛte bahu jana //
analyzed: yathā tatha sthānam abhiprakāśaya vinesi satye amṛte bahu
translated: You illuminate the true state of things as they are, and through the nectar of truth, you guide many beings.

original: śīla maharṣisya anantadarśinaḥ gambhīramārya vipula subhāṣita /
analyzed: śīla mahā ṛṣisya ananta darśinaḥ gambhīra mārya vipula subhāṣita
translated: The morality of the great sage who sees the infinite, profound, noble, vast, and well-spoken,

original: śīle viśiṣṭo tvamaripramardanaḥ imasmi loke parataśca suvrataḥ //
analyzed: śīle tvam ari pramardanaḥ imasmi loke paratas ca suvrataḥ
translated: In morality, you are supreme, O conqueror of enemies, you of good vows, in this world and the next.

original: akhaṇḍamacchidramakācamavraṇa anāśravante caraṇa mahāmune /
analyzed: akhaṇḍam acchidram akācam avraṇa caraṇa mahā mune
translated: You have attained the perfection of the great sage's path, which is unbroken, flawless, without blemish, without fault, and without attachment.

original: śuci viśuddhi paramā gato sadā virocase nagaśikhare yathānalo //🔽cittasthititve asi pāramigato vaśī samādhismi tathāpi pudgala /
analyzed: sadā virocase naga śikhare yathā analaḥ  citta sthiti tve asi pārami gataḥ vaśī tathā api pudgala
translated: You are pure, having attained the highest purity, you always shine like a fire on the peak of a mountain.🔽You have attained perfection in mental stability, you have mastery over concentration, and you are a person who has attained the ultimate.

original: citte vaśī tva vaśitā parā gataḥ vakāvakāśā vigato virocase //
analyzed: citte vaśī tva vaśitā parā gataḥ vakāvakāśā vigataḥ virocase
translated: You have attained mastery over the mind, you are free from obstacles and shine.

original: yathecchaka araṇasamādhi śāntara / / / / / / / / / / / / devanareṣu arcita /
analyzed: deva nareṣu arcita
translated: You are the one who has attained the peaceful concentration that is desired, you are worshipped by gods and humans.

original: niveśasan kāñcanadāmaprabhaḥ namo stu te gautama satyavikrama //
analyzed: niveśa san kāñcana dāma prabhaḥ namaḥ stu te gautama satya vikrama
translated: You are like a golden garland, I pay homage to you, Gautama, whose steps are true.

original: virocano nabhasi yathā mahāprabho śuddhe nabhe pacadaśīya candramā /
analyzed: virocanaḥ nabhasi yathā mahā prabho śuddhe nabhe candramāḥ
translated: Just as the great light shines in the sky, the fifteenth moon in the pure sky,

original: tathā samādhismi sthito virocase suvarṇamuttaptamivātra pudgalā //
analyzed: tathā sthitaḥ virocase suvarṇam uttaptam iva atra pudgalā
translated: in the same way, you shine while abiding in concentration, O person who is like well-refined gold.

original: ākākṣamāṇā vigatā vipaṇḍitā satvā na jānanti samantaudyamā /
analyzed: satvāḥ na jānanti samanta audyamā
translated: Those who desire, but are devoid of wisdom, do not know the one who is always striving.

original: sukha samādhi araṇāni sevato namo stu te devamanuṣyapūjita //
analyzed: sukha samādhi araṇāni sevataḥ namaḥ stu te deva manuṣya pūjita
translated: I pay homage to you, who are worshipped by gods and humans, who enjoy concentration, peace, and tranquility.

original: yadā ca ālokasi nāgagāmi yadā ca āgata maraṇāya pāra /
analyzed: yadā ca ālokasi nāga gāmi yadā ca āgata maraṇāya pāra
translated: When you appear, O one who walks like an elephant, when you have come to the other shore of death,

original: matīsmṛtīmā vimalena cetasā tadā aya bhūtadharā prakampate //
analyzed: vimalena cetasā tadā bhūtadharā prakampate
translated: With pure mind, then the earth element shakes.

original: satyā abhisametiya darśana tathā svaya abhijñāye anuśruta purā /
analyzed: satyā darśana tathā svaya abhijñāye anuśruta purā
translated: Having realized the truths and seen them thus, having known them through one's own higher knowledge and heard them from the Buddha in the past,

original: imā girā vyāhara agrapudgala sahasranetro maghavā va śobhase //
analyzed: imāḥ girā vyāhara agra pudgala sahasra netraḥ maghavā vaḥ śobhase
translated: You, foremost person, speak these words. You shine like the thousand-eyed Indra, the wealthy one.

original: ida samāpta vyasana mahadbhaya ito na bhoti agre asya sabhavo /
analyzed: idam samāpta vyasana mahadbhaya itas na agre asya
translated: This great danger and calamity is finished. From here on, there is no more assembly for him.

original: tasyāvarodhānamadho pravartate nirvāti vātāna svaro va pākaḥ //
analyzed: tasya avarodhānam adhas pravartate nirvāti svaraḥ pākaḥ
translated: His obstruction turns downward and proceeds. He is extinguished like a wind-blown lamp.

original: vimukticittasya vimuktidarśanā acintiyā tarkapathena niśritā /
analyzed: vimukti cittasya vimukti darśanā acintiyā tarka pathena niśritā
translated: The mind of liberation and the vision of liberation are inconceivable, based on the path of reasoning.

original: p / asakiyā vīragirā virocate yā sā suvelā mṛdu satyasabhavā //
analyzed: vīra girā virocate yā sā su velā mṛdu satya sabhavā
translated: The words of the hero cannot be measured. That is the good time, gentle and true to nature.

original: anuddhatā tā ca girā prakāśaya tva / / / / / / / / / / /hi janasy sannidhau /
analyzed: anuddhatā tā ca girā prakāśaya janasi sannidhau
translated: You should speak those words without pride in the presence of the assembly.

original: te tuhya śrutvā madurā subhāṣitā pibanti tṛṣṇārta ivāmbhasārṇave //
analyzed: te śrutvā madurā su bhāṣitā pibanti tṛṣṇā ārtaḥ iva ambhasā arṇave
translated: Having heard your sweet and well-spoken words, they drink them up like those afflicted with thirst in the ocean.

original: hateṣu tva prāṇiṣu maitra cintaya aiśvaryaṛddhi pratibhānamuttama /
analyzed: hateṣu tva prāṇiṣu maitra cintaya aiśvarya ṛddhi pratibhānam uttama
translated: When beings are killed, you think of them with friendliness. You have supreme mastery, spiritual power, and eloquence.

original: śreṣṭheṣu dharmeṣu hi pāramīgato yathā na kocī iha lokadhātuye //
analyzed: śreṣṭheṣu dharmeṣu hi pāramī gataḥ yathā na iha
translated: For you have reached perfection in the highest virtues, as no one else has in this world system.

original: prajñā ca te asti anuttarā mune sarvasmi loke'pratimā anopamī /
analyzed: prajñā ca te asti anuttarā mune sarvasmi lokepratimā anopamī
translated: And you have unsurpassed wisdom, Sage, incomparable and matchless in the whole world.

original: tvameva śreṣṭho sakalasya prāṇino śiloccayānā yatha meruparvataḥ //
analyzed: tvam eva sakalasya meru parvataḥ
translated: You alone are supreme among all living beings, like Mount Meru among the high mountains.

original: na te sti tulyo sadṛśo samāno kutottaro guṇeṣu guṇadharasya /
analyzed: na te sti tulyaḥ sadṛśaḥ samānaḥ kutottaraḥ guṇeṣu guṇa dharasya
translated: There is no one equal, similar, or the same as you, let alone superior, O bearer of virtues.

original: tvameva śreṣṭho paramārthapudgalo dharmāṇa nirvāṇamivācala sukha //
analyzed: tvam eva parama artha pudgalaḥ sukha
translated: You alone are the supreme person, like the immovable bliss of nirvana among dharmas.

original: rāga ca moha ca prahāya doṣa māna ca mrakṣa tasiṇā ca jālinī /
analyzed: rāga ca moha ca prahāya doṣa māna ca mrakṣa tasiṇā ca jālinī
translated: Having abandoned passion, delusion, hatred, pride, conceit, and the net of deceit,

original: p / virājase doṣavimuktamānaso yathā śaśī pūrṇa iva nabhe śubhe //
analyzed: virājase doṣa vimukta mānasaḥ yathā śaśī pūrṇaḥ iva nabhe śubhe
translated: You shine forth with a mind free from faults, like the beautiful full moon in the sky.

original: yadatra satya tuva mārgase ṛjuḥ seturmahā satpuruṣeṇa sevitaḥ /
analyzed: yat atra satya mārgase ṛjuḥ setuḥ mahā sat puruṣeṇa sevitaḥ
translated: Whatever is true here, you follow straightforwardly, the bridge traversed by great noble beings.

original: imā gira vyāhara agrapudgala sahasranetrī maghavā va śobhase //
analyzed: imāḥ giraḥ vyāhara agra pudgala sahasra netrī maghavā vaḥ śobhase
translated: Speaking these words, O foremost person, you shine like the thousand-eyed Indra.

original: kleśairvimukta vimala suśānta niṣeva satvaśaraṇa samādhi /
analyzed: kleśaiḥ vimukta vimala su śānta niṣeva sattva śaraṇa samādhi
translated: O one free from afflictions, pure, and peaceful, cultivate the samadhi that is the refuge of beings.

original: hitāya bhūtānabhibhurvirājase ravī yathā devamanuṣyapūjitaḥ //
analyzed: hitāya bhūtān abhibhuḥ virājase ravī yathā deva manuṣya pūjitaḥ
translated: For the benefit of beings, you shine forth, the all-conquering one, like the sun, worshipped by gods and humans.

original: aniśritaḥ tva iha ca paratra ca dhyāyanto dhyāne ramase pratiṣṭhitaḥ /
analyzed: a niśritaḥ tvaḥ iha ca paratra ca dhyāyantaḥ dhyāne ramase pratiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: You are not attached to this world or the next, meditating, you delight in meditation, established.

original: vandanti devā bahavo samāgatā namaskṛta prājaliyo mahāmuni //
analyzed: vandanti devāḥ bahavaḥ samāgatāḥ mahā muni
translated: Many gods, having come together, praise you, O greatly revered sage, who is worshipped.

original: bahudhā bahuprakāra cakṣu bhavate viśuddhacakṣūṇā /
analyzed: bahudhā bahu prakāra cakṣu bhavate viśuddha cakṣūṇā
translated: In many ways, with many kinds, you have become the eye for those with pure vision.

original: jarāmaraṇamardanāna buddhāna adāntadamakānā //
analyzed: jarā maraṇa mardanāna buddhāna a dānta damakānā
translated: You are the one who crushes old age and death, the buddhas, the ones who tame the untamed.

original: lokottarā bhagavato caryā lokottara kuśalamūla /
analyzed: lokottarā bhagavato caryā lokottara kuśala mūla
translated: The Blessed One's conduct is supramundane, the roots of virtue are supramundane.

original: gamana sthita niṣaṇa śayita lokottara munino //
analyzed: gamana sthita niṣaṇa śayita lokottara munino
translated: The sage's going, standing, sitting, and lying down are supramundane.

original: yattatsugataśarīra bhavate bhavasya bandhanakṣayakaraṇa /
analyzed: yat tat sugata śarīra bhavate bhavasya bandhana kṣaya karaṇa
translated: That which becomes the body of the Well-Gone One, the cause for the destruction of the bondage of existence,

original: p / lokotara tadapi bho ityatra na saśayaḥ kāryo //
analyzed: tat api bho iti atra na saśayaḥ
translated: That too is supramundane, O Blessed One, here one should have no doubt.

original: cīvaradharaṇa munino lokottara atra saśayo nāsti /
analyzed: cīvara dharaṇa atra saśayaḥ na asti
translated: The sage's wearing of robes is supramundane, here there is no doubt.

original: āhārāharaṇamatho lokottarameva sugatasya //
analyzed: āhāra āharaṇam atho lokottaram eva sugatasya
translated: The Sugata's taking of food is also supramundane.

original: deśanā naranāgānā sarvalokottarā matā /
analyzed: deśanā nara nāgānā sarva loka uttarā matā
translated: The teachings for the elephants among men are all considered supramundane.

original: yathātatha pravakṣyāmi māhātmya varabuddhinā //
analyzed: yathātatha pravakṣyāmi māhātmya vara buddhinā
translated: I will speak as it is, with a supreme and noble mind.

original: deśakālavaśa prāpya paripāka ca karmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: deśa kāla vaśa prāpya paripāka ca karmaṇaḥ
translated: Having attained the power of time and place, and the ripening of karma,

original: satya vā abhinivṛta dharma deśenti nāyakāḥ //
