analyzed: satya vā abhinivṛta dharma deśenti nāyakāḥ
translated: The leaders teach the Dharma that has been realized as true.

original: lokānuvartanā buddhā anuvartanti laukikī /
analyzed: loka anuvartanā buddhāḥ anuvartanti laukikī
translated: The Buddhas conform to worldly conventions in order to guide beings.

original: prajñaptimanuvartanti yathā lokottarāmapi //
analyzed: prajñaptim anuvartanti yathā lokottarām api
translated: They conform to designations, just as they transcend the world.

original: īryāpathā darśayanti catvāraḥ puruṣottamāḥ /
analyzed: īryāpathāḥ darśayanti catvāraḥ puruṣa uttamāḥ
translated: The supreme beings display four postures,

original: no ca pariśramasteṣā jāyate śubhakarmiṇā //
analyzed: no ca pariśramaḥ teṣā jāyate śubha karmiṇā
translated: but they, the performers of good actions, do not experience fatigue.

original: pādā ca nāma dhīvanti na caiṣā sajjate rajaḥ /
analyzed: ca nāma dhīvanti na ca eṣā sajjate rajaḥ
translated: Their feet are said to be like lotus flowers, yet dust does not stick to them.

original: pādāḥ kamalapatrābhā eṣā lokānuvartanā /
analyzed: pādāḥ kamala patra ābhāḥ eṣā loka anuvartanā
translated: Their feet have the luster of lotus petals - this is conforming to the world.

original: snāyanti nāma sabuddha na caiṣā vidyate malo /
analyzed: snāyanti nāma sabuddha na ca eṣā vidyate
translated: They are said to bathe, yet no dirt is found on them.

original: bimbe kanakabimbābhe eṣā lokānuvartanā //
analyzed: bimbe kanaka bimba ābhe eṣā loka anuvartanā
translated: In the image, which is like a golden image, this is conforming to the world.

original: dantadhovañca sevanti mukha cotpalagandhika /
analyzed: sevanti mukha
translated: They use tooth cleaners, and their mouths have the fragrance of lotuses.

original: nivasana nivāsenti prāvāra ca tricīvara //
analyzed: nivasana prāvāra ca tricīvara
translated: They wear garments, and their robes consist of three pieces.

original: caila vātāni vāyitvā vikopenti na dehaka /
analyzed: caila vātāni vāyitvā vikopenti na dehaka
translated: Having shaken off the dust particles, they do not disturb their bodies.

original: p / vastra puruṣasihānā eṣā lokānuvartanā //
analyzed: eṣā loka anuvartanā
translated: The garments of the lion-like men are this conforming to the world.

original: chāyāyā ca niṣīdanti ātapaśca na bādhati /
analyzed: chāyāyā ca niṣīdanti ātapaḥ ca na bādhati
translated: They sit in the shade, and the sun does not bother them.

original: buddhānā śubhaniṣyandānā eṣā lokānuvartanā //
analyzed: buddhānā eṣā loka anuvartanā
translated: The Buddhas have a pure radiance - this is conforming to the world.

original: auṣadha pratisevanti vyādhi caiṣā na vidyate /
analyzed: auṣadha pratisevanti vyādhi ca eṣā na vidyate
translated: They use medicines, yet no illness is found in them.

original: nāyakānā phala mahanta eṣā lokānuvartanā //
analyzed: nāyakānā eṣā loka anuvartanā
translated: The leaders have great results - this is conforming to the world.

original: prabhūśca karma vārayitu karma darśayanti ca jinā /
analyzed: prabhūḥ ca karma karma darśayanti ca jinā
translated: The Victorious Ones have abundant power to prevent actions, yet they display actions.

original: aiśvarya vinigūhanti eṣā lokānuvartanā //
analyzed: aiśvarya vinigūhanti eṣā loka anuvartanā
translated: They conceal their mastery - this is in accord with the world.

original: karonti nāma āhāra na caiṣā bādhate kṣudhā /
analyzed: karonti nāma āhāra na ca eṣā bādhate kṣudhā
translated: They eat food, but hunger does not afflict them.

original: janatāyā upadārtha eṣā lokānuvartanā //
analyzed: janatāyāḥ eṣā loka anuvartanā
translated: This is for the sake of the people - it is in accord with the world.

original: pibanti nāma pānīya pipāsā ca na bādhate /
analyzed: pibanti nāma pānīya pipāsā ca na bādhate
translated: They drink water, but thirst does not afflict them.

original: tadadbhuta maharṣiṇā eṣā lokānuvartanā //
analyzed: tat adbhuta mahā ṛṣiṇā eṣā loka anuvartanā
translated: This is the marvel of the great sages - it is in accord with the world.

original: cīvarāṇi nivāsenti sadā ca prāvṛto jinaḥ /
analyzed: cīvarāṇi sadā ca prāvṛtaḥ jinaḥ
translated: They put on robes, but the Victorious One is always covered.

original: yathārūpo bhave devo eṣā lokānuvartanā //
analyzed: yathārūpaḥ bhave eṣā loka anuvartanā
translated: This is in accord with the world.

original: kleśā ca orūpayanti na caiṣā chindate kṣuraḥ /
analyzed: kleśā ca orūpayanti na ca eṣā chindate kṣuraḥ
translated: They shave their hair, but the razor does not cut them.

original: keśā nīlāñjananibhā eṣā lokānuvartanā //
analyzed: keśāḥ nīlāñjana nibhāḥ eṣā loka anuvartanā
translated: Their hair is like dark collyrium - this is in accord with the world.

original: jarā ca upadeśenti na caiṣā vidyate jarā /
analyzed: jarā ca na ca eṣā vidyate jarā
translated: They show aging, but they do not have old age.

original: jinā jinaguṇopetā eṣā lokānuvartanā //
analyzed: jināḥ jina guṇa upetāḥ eṣā loka anuvartanā
translated: The Victorious Ones, endowed with the qualities of the Victorious Ones, this is in accord with the world.

original: kalpakoṭīmasakhyeyā puṇyeṣu pāramigatā /
analyzed: kalpa koṭīm asakhyeyā puṇyeṣu pāramigatā
translated: For innumerable millions of eons, they have perfected merit.

original: ārabdhamupadeśenti eṣā lokānuvartanā //
analyzed: eṣā loka anuvartanā
translated: They show birth - this is in accord with the world.

original: p / na ca maithunasabhūta sugatasya samucchrita /
analyzed: na ca sugatasya samucchrita
translated: The Sugata has abandoned sexual intercourse.

original: mātāpitṛñca deśenti eṣā lokānuvartanā //
analyzed: mātā pitṛñca eṣā loka anuvartanā
translated: They show mother and father - this is in accord with the world.

original: dīpakaramupādāya vītarāgastathāgataḥ /
analyzed: dīpakaram upādāya vīta rāgaḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: The Tathagata, free from attachment, from the time of being Dipankara,🔽🔽

original: rāhula putra darśeti eṣā lokānuvarttanā /
analyzed: rāhula putra darśa iti eṣā loka anuvarttanā
translated: The Tathagata, free from passion, shows Rahula, his son, saying, This is the world's practice.

original: kalpakoṭīmasakhyeyā prajñāpāramitā gatā /
analyzed: kalpa koṭīm asakhyeyā prajñāpāramitā gatā
translated: For countless koṭis of kalpas, he has practiced the perfection of wisdom,

original: bālabhāva ca darśenti eṣā lokānuvartanā //
analyzed: eṣā loka anuvartanā
translated: yet he shows the state of a child - this is the world's practice.

original: asanmantrā vibhāṣitvā asmi loke sadevake /
analyzed: asat mantrā vibhāṣitvā asmi loke sa devake
translated: Having taught false mantras in this world with its gods,

original: punaḥ paryeṣanti tīrthe eṣā lokānuvartanā //
analyzed: punar paryeṣanti tīrthe eṣā loka anuvartanā
translated: he again seeks the tirthikas - this is the world's practice.

original: bodhyitvāmatulā bodhi sarvasatvāna kāraṇā /
analyzed: kāraṇā
translated: Having attained the incomparable enlightenment for the sake of all beings,

original: alpotsukatva pradeśenti eṣā lokānuvartanā //
analyzed: eṣā loka anuvartanā
translated: he shows little concern - this is the world's practice.

original: paramaguṇasapannā vacanasapannāśca sarve samyaksabuddhā //
analyzed: parama guṇa sapannāḥ vacana sapannāḥ ca sarve samyaksabuddhā
translated: All perfectly enlightened ones are endowed with supreme qualities and speech.

original: ṣaṣṭibhiḥ guṇaiḥ samyaksabuddhānā vācā samanvāgatā bhavati //
analyzed: ṣaṣṭibhiḥ guṇaiḥ samyaksabuddhānā vācā samanvāgatā bhavati
translated: The speech of the perfectly enlightened ones is endowed with sixty qualities.

original: katamehi ṣaṣṭibhiḥ //🔽gītaravamadhuravādī naravaravacanā viniścarati vācā /
analyzed: katamehi ṣaṣṭibhiḥ  gīta rava madhura vādī nara vara vacanā viniścarati vācā
translated: What are the sixty?🔽Speech issues forth with the melodious sound of song, the voice of the best of men.

original: vīṇāravaveṇuravā hasaravarutā sugatavācā //🔽jīmūtarasitamadhurā parabhṛtarathanebhitulyanirghoṣā /
analyzed: vīṇā rava veṇu ravā hasa rava rutā sugata vācā  jīmūta rasita madhurā parabhṛta ratha nebhi tulya nirghoṣā
translated: With the sound of the veena, the flute, and the sweet sounds of the cuckoo, the speech of the Sugata.🔽Sweet as the sound of the cuckoo, with a voice like the cry of the peacock and the sound of a chariot,

original: sāgaranarditasārasaprabhāvā varabuddhino vācā //
analyzed: sāgara nardita sārasa prabhāvāḥ vara buddhinaḥ vācā
translated: with the majestic voice of the ocean and the swan, the speech of the best of Buddhas.

original: kinnarakalavikarutā meghavarasvararavā varagajarutā /
analyzed: kinnara kalavika rutā meghavara svara ravā vara gaja rutā
translated: The voices of the Kinnaras, Kalaviṅkas, and the sounds of the best of elephants,

original: thismuc p / ṛṣabhamṛgarājarasitā vācā varalakṣaṇadharāṇā //🔽dundubhiravabambhīrā vanadevaanilavidhūtasvaraprapātā /
analyzed: ṛṣabha mṛga rāja rasitā vācā vara lakṣaṇa dharāṇā  dundubhi rava bambhīrā vana deva anila vidhūta svara prapātā
translated: The voices of the best of lions, endowed with the marks of excellence.🔽The voices of the best of men and gods, like the deep sound of a drum,

original: bhūmīvikṣobhanaravā girā naramarupradhānānā //🔽pacāgikatulyaravā pralulitakalahasabarhiṇanivātā /🔽bimboṣṭhasutanujihvā jinavadanā niścarati vācā //
analyzed: bhūmī vikṣobhana ravā girā nara maru pradhānānā  paca āgika tulya ravā pralulita kalaha sa barhiṇa nivātā  bimba uṣṭha su tanu jihvā jina vadanā niścarati vācā
translated: Shaken by the wind of the forest gods, with a waterfall of sound,🔽Causing the earth to tremble, with a sound like the sound of a drum.🔽The voices of the Jinas, like the sound of a peacock's cry in the rainy season,🔽With bimba-like lips, a slender tongue, and a voice that emerges.

original: gandharvagītamadhurā jaladhārāṇā nipātatulyaravā /🔽avistarapiṇḍitaravā girā guṇavarapradhānānā //
analyzed: gandharva gīta madhurā nipāta tulya ravā  a vistara piṇḍita ravā girā
translated: The voices of the best of the excellent qualities, like the sweet song of the Gandharvas,🔽With a sound like the falling of a rain of water,🔽Without being too long or short, with a voice that is not interrupted.

original: varakikaṇīkasalīlasusacitā hemajālatulyaravā /
analyzed: vara kikaṇīka salīla su sacitā hema jāla tulya ravā
translated: The voices of the best of the excellent qualities, like the sound of a golden net,

original: ābharaṇaghaṭṭitaravā bhuvi divi ca girāpradhānānā //
analyzed: ābharaṇa ghaṭṭita ravāḥ bhuvi divi ca
translated: With the sound of ornaments jingling, on the earth and in the sky,

original: nātidrutā anamantī anupacchinnā vivartate madhurā /
analyzed: na atidrutā a namantī an upacchinnā vivartate madhurā
translated: Not too fast, not slow, not interrupted, but turning sweetly,

original: galitapadasacayavatī vācā varalakṣaṇadharāṇā //
analyzed: galita pada sacayavatī vācā vara lakṣaṇa dharāṇā
translated: With words and phrases that flow forth, the voice of those endowed with the marks of excellence.

original: sarvāmevānucarati pariṣā yadi lokadhātunayutāni /
analyzed: sarvām eva anucarati pariṣā yadi lokadhātuna yutāni
translated: If all the assemblies of the world systems in the ten directions were to follow,

original: vijñāpayate sarvā pariṣā sumadhurā vācā daśabalānā //
analyzed: vijñāpayate sarvā pariṣā su madhurā vācā daśa balānā
translated: The entire assembly addresses the Ten Powers with sweet words:

original: śakayāvanacīṇaramaṭhapalhavadaradeṣu dasyupariṣāyā /
analyzed: śaka yāvana cīṇa ramaṭha palhava daradeṣu dasyu pariṣāyā
translated: In the Shakya, Avanti, Cheena, Ramatha, Palhava, and Darada countries, among the assemblies of robbers,

original: ekavidhamucyamānā sarvaviṣayacāriṇī bhavati //🔽pariṣā nātikramate niścaramāṇā girā naravarāṇā /
analyzed: ekavidham ucyamānā sarva viṣaya cāriṇī bhavati  pariṣā na atikramate niścaramāṇā girā nara varāṇā
translated: when spoken in one way, it becomes the language used in all countries.🔽The assembly does not transgress the words that come forth from the speech of the best of men.

original: p / na vardhate na ca hāyati girā sthitalayā daśabalānā //
analyzed: na vardhate na ca girā sthita layā
translated: The words of the Ten Powers remain steady and do not increase or decrease.

original: na ca bhidyate na nudyati na ca upatapyate / / / / / / / / / / /
analyzed: na ca bhidyate na nudyati na ca upatapyate
translated: It is not divided, not shaken, not tormented,

original: na ca vikhalakhalakhalāyati abhisvararutā sugatavācā //
analyzed: na ca vikhalakhalakhalāyati abhisvara rutā sugata vācā
translated: and does not make a harsh sound, but a sweet sound, with the speech of the Well-Gone One.

original: na ca sā apaśabdavatī śabdabhraṣṭā aśeṣa anuyuktaśabdā /🔽śabdeṣu kuśalākuśalā sarvā janatā praharṣayati //
analyzed: na ca sā apaśabdavatī śabda bhraṣṭā aśeṣa anuyukta śabdā  śabdeṣu kuśala akuśalā sarvā janatā praharṣayati
translated: It is not full of meaningless sounds, not deficient in sound, but with all sounds properly applied.🔽It delights all people, whether skilled in words or not.

original: vadanā suvimaladaśanā niścarati girā yadā guṇadharāṇā /
analyzed: vadanā su vimala daśanā niścarati girā yadā guṇa dharāṇā
translated: When the speech of those who possess virtues comes forth from the mouth with pure teeth,

original: mādyanti śakunasaghā gagaṇatalagatā vanagatāśca //
analyzed: mādyanti śakuna saghāḥ gagaṇa tala gatāḥ vana gatāḥ ca
translated: flocks of birds flying in the sky and in the forest rejoice.

original: yo yasya svara abhimataḥ sā ta pūrayati tasya sakalpa /
analyzed: yaḥ yasya svaraḥ abhimataḥ sā ta pūrayati tasya sakalpa
translated: Whatever sound each one desires, it fulfills that wish.

original: sugatavacanaprabhūtā vācā pariṣadi vicaramāṇā //
analyzed: sugata vacana prabhūtā vācā pariṣadi vicaramāṇā
translated: The speech of the Well-Gone One, abundant in words, moves about in the assembly.

original: varavāsanasahitaghoṣā girinadinirghoṣasannibhā śuddhā /🔽utkrośakurararutanayā prabhavati vācā vararutānā //
analyzed: vara vāsana sahita ghoṣā giri nadi nirghoṣa sannibhā śuddhā  utkrośa kurara ru tanayā prabhavati vācā
translated: Pure, with a voice accompanied by the best of sounds, resembling the sound of a mountain stream,🔽With a voice like the cry of a peacock or curlew, the best of sounds arises.

original: śakuntajīvajīvaka jinavācā kanakatālapatraravā /
translated: The voice of the Victorious Ones is like the sound of a golden palm leaf,

original: paṭupaṭahapravadamṛdagacāṭusvaratulyanirghoṣā //
analyzed: paṭu paṭaha pravada mṛda ga cāṭu svara tulya nirghoṣā
translated: With a sound like a loud drum, a mridanga, or a flattering voice.

original: ājñeyā vijñeyā gambhīrabhīṣmarūpā karṇasukhā /
analyzed: ājñeyā vijñeyā gambhīra bhīṣma rūpā karṇa sukhā
translated: To be understood, to be known, with a deep and frightening form, pleasing to the ears,

original: hṛdayagamā ca nitya vācā varapāramigatānā //
analyzed: hṛdaya gamā ca nitya vācā vara pārami gatānā
translated: Reaching the heart, always with a voice, the best of the best.

original: vallakiśravaṇīyā ca premaṇiyā ca girā guṇadhārīṇā /
analyzed: ca ca girā guṇa dhārīṇā
translated: To be heard like a lute, and to be loved, the speech of those who possess virtues,

original: vipulaśubhasacayānā sarveṣā anantayaśasānāmiti //
analyzed: sarveṣām ananta yaśasānām iti
translated: Of those who have accumulated vast and pure merit, of all those of infinite fame.

original: p / yathābhūta deśitā vācā //
analyzed: yathābhūta deśitā vācā
translated: The speech is taught as it truly is.

original: samyaksabuddhā eva dharma deśayanti //
analyzed: samyaksabuddhāḥ eva dharma deśayanti
translated: Only the Perfectly Enlightened Ones teach the Dharma.

original: nāha bhikṣavo ye dharmā anityāste nityato deśayāmi /
analyzed: na āha bhikṣavaḥ ye dharmāḥ anityāḥ te nityatas deśayāmi
translated: Monks, I do not teach that which is impermanent as permanent,

original: nāpi ye dharmā nityā te anityato deśayāmi /🔽nāpi ye dharmāḥ duḥkhāste sukhāto deśayāmi /
analyzed: na api ye dharmāḥ nityā te anityataḥ deśayāmi  na api ye dharmāḥ duḥkhāḥ te sukhātaḥ deśayāmi
translated: Nor do I teach that which is permanent as impermanent.🔽I do not teach that which is suffering as happiness,

original: nāpi ye dharmā sukhā te duḥkhāto deśayāmi /
analyzed: na api ye dharmā sukhā te duḥkhātaḥ deśayāmi
translated: Nor do I teach that which is happiness as suffering.

original: nāpi ye dharmā anātmīyā te ātmato deśayāmi /
analyzed: na api ye dharmāḥ anātmīyā te ātmataḥ deśayāmi
translated: I do not teach that which is not the self as the self,

original: nāpi ye dharmā ātmīyāste anātmato deśayāmi /🔽nāpi ye dharmā aśubhāste śubhato deśayāmi /
analyzed: na api ye dharmāḥ ātmīyāḥ te anātmataḥ deśayāmi  na api ye dharmāḥ aśubhāḥ te śubhataḥ deśayāmi
translated: Nor do I teach that those things which are one's own are selfless.🔽Nor do I teach that those things which are impure are pure.

original: nāpi ye dharmāḥ śubhāste aśubhāto deśayāmi /
analyzed: na api ye dharmāḥ śubhāḥ te aśubhātaḥ deśayāmi
translated: Nor do I teach that those things which are pure are impure.

original: nāpi ye dharmā rūpiṇaste arūpiṇo deśayāmi /🔽nāpi ye dharmāḥ kuśalāste akuśalāto deśayāmi /
analyzed: na api ye dharmāḥ rūpiṇaḥ te arūpiṇaḥ deśayāmi  na api ye dharmāḥ kuśalāḥ te akuśalāḥ atas deśayāmi
translated: Nor do I teach that those things which are material are immaterial.🔽Nor do I teach that those things which are wholesome are unwholesome.

original: nāpi ye dharmā akuśalāste kuśalāto deśayāmi /🔽nāpi ye dharmā anāśravāḥ te sāśravā ti deśayāmi /
analyzed: na api ye dharmāḥ akuśalāḥ te kuśalā atas deśayāmi  nā api ye dharmāḥ anāśravāḥ te sāśravā ti deśayāmi
translated: Nor do I teach that those things which are unwholesome are wholesome.🔽Nor do I teach that those things which are uncontaminated are contaminated.

original: nāpi ye dharmāḥ sāśravāste anāśravā ti deśayāmi /🔽nāpi ye dharmāḥ vyākṛtāste avyākṛtā iti deśayāmi /
analyzed: na api ye dharmāḥ sa āśravāḥ te anāśravā deśayāmi  na api ye dharmāḥ vyākṛtāḥ te avyākṛtāḥ iti deśayāmi
translated: Nor do I teach that those things which are contaminated are uncontaminated.🔽Nor do I teach that those things which are indeterminate are determinate.

original: nāpi ye dharmā avyākṛtāste vyākṛtāste vyākṛtā iti deśayāmi /🔽nāpi ye dharmā hīnāste praṇītā iti deśayāmi /
analyzed: na api ye dharmāḥ a vyākṛtāḥ te vyākṛtāḥ te vyākṛtāḥ iti deśayāmi  na api ye dharmāḥ hīnāḥ te praṇītāḥ iti deśayāmi
translated: Nor do I teach that those things which are determinate are indeterminate.🔽Nor do I teach that those things which are inferior are superior.

original: nāpi ye dharmā praṇītāste hīnā iti deśayāmi /🔽nāpi ye dharmāḥ gṛhāśritāste naiṣkramyāśritā iti deśayāmi /
analyzed: na api ye dharmāḥ praṇītāḥ te hīnāḥ iti deśayāmi  na api ye dharmāḥ gṛha āśritāḥ te naiṣkramya āśritāḥ iti deśayāmi
translated: Nor do I teach that those things which are superior are inferior.🔽Nor do I teach that those things which are based on the household life are based on renunciation.

original: nāpi ye dharmā naiṣkramyāśritāste gehāśritā iti deśayāmi //
analyzed: na api ye dharmāḥ naiṣkramya āśritāḥ te geha āśritāḥ iti deśayāmi
translated: Nor do I teach that those things which are based on renunciation are based on the household life.

original: atha khalu bho dhutadharmadhara samyaksabuddhāḥ satyavādi kālavādi bhūtavādi arthavādi tathāvādi ananyathāvādi avitathavādi dharmavādi vinayavādi
analyzed: atha khalu bho dhutadharmadhara samyaksabuddhāḥ satya vādi kāla vādi bhūta vādi artha vādi tathāvādi an anyathāvādi avitatha vādi dharma vādi vinaya vādi
translated: Then, O Dhutadharma, the Perfectly Awakened Ones are truth-speakers, time-speakers, fact-speakers, meaning-speakers, thusness-speakers, non-otherwise-speakers, non-erroneous-speakers, dharma-speakers, discipline-speakers,

original: iti //
analyzed: iti
translated: Thus it is.

original: p / bhūtapūrva bho dhutadharmadhara tuṣitabhavanakāyiko devaputro śikharadharo nāma bodhisattvaḥ samyaksabuddha ṛṣivadanagataā vānārasyā
analyzed: bhūta pūrva bho tuṣita bhavana kāyikaḥ deva putraḥ śikharadharaḥ nāma bodhisattvaḥ samyaksabuddhaḥ
translated: Once upon a time, O Dhutadharma, the god-son of the Tuṣita heaven named Śikharadhara, a bodhisattva, a Perfectly Awakened One, having gone to the Ṛṣipatana Deer Park near Vārāṇasī,

original: vanavare varacakrapravartanadivase bhagavanta samukhābhiradhyabhāṣe sagauravaḥ sapratīsaḥ prahvaḥ kṛtājalipuṭaḥ //
analyzed: vana vare vara cakra pravartana divase bhagavanta sa mukhābhiḥ adhyabhāṣe sa gauravaḥ sa pratīsaḥ prahvaḥ kṛta ājali puṭaḥ
translated: on the day of turning the excellent wheel, spoke to the Blessed One face to face with respect, reverence, humility, and palms joined in supplication.

original: sādhu te sādhurūpasya vācā na pratihanyate /
analyzed: sādhu te sādhu rūpasya vācā na pratihanyate
translated: Excellent is your speech, which is not obstructed by form.

original: sādhu arthānvitā sādhyā vācā tava manoramā //
analyzed: sādhu artha anvitā sādhyā vācā tava manoramā
translated: Excellent is your meaningful and worthy speech, which is delightful to the mind.

original: sādhu susvarasayogā varṇasandhiguṇānvitā /
analyzed: sādhu su svara sayogā varṇa sandhi guṇa anvitā
translated: Excellent is your speech, which is endowed with the qualities of a good voice and proper word connections.

original: sādhu satyāni catvāri pravadase mahāmune //
analyzed: sādhu satyāni catvāri pravadase mahā mune
translated: Excellent is your proclamation of the four truths, O Great Sage.

original: sādhu te devagandharvā pibanti madhurā girā /
analyzed: sādhu te deva gandharvā pibanti madhurā girā
translated: Excellent are your sweet words, which the gods and gandharvas drink.

original: sādhvihāpratima cakra pravartesi anivartika //
analyzed: sādhu iha apratima cakra pravartesi anivartika
translated: Excellent is your turning of the incomparable wheel here, which is irreversible.

original: tubhya loke samo nāsti rūpe varṇe kule bale /
analyzed: tubhya loke samaḥ na asti rūpe varṇe kule bale
translated: There is no one in the world equal to you in form, complexion, family, and strength,

original: īryāpathe ca vīrye ca dhyāne jñāne śame dame //
analyzed: īryāpathe ca vīrye ca dhyāne jñāne śame dame
translated: In conduct, energy, meditation, knowledge, peace, and self-control.

original: adya hṛṣṭā daśa vīra koṭyo te prathame phale /
analyzed: adya hṛṣṭāḥ daśa vīra koṭyaḥ te prathame phale
translated: Today, O Hero, ten koṭis of beings are delighted in the first fruit,

original: vinītā devaputrāṇā śāsane prathame mune //
analyzed: vinītāḥ deva putrāṇā śāsane prathame mune
translated: The gods have been disciplined in the first teaching of the Sage.

original: triśa koṭyo prabho vīra vinesi prathame phale /
analyzed: prabho vīra prathame phale
translated: O Lord, O Hero, you have disciplined three koṭis in the first fruit,

original: dvitīye śāsane nara devaputrāṇa eva ca //
analyzed: dvitīye śāsane nara deva putrāṇaḥ eva ca
translated: In the second teaching, O Man, of the gods alone.

original: pañcāśa koṭīyo bhūyo śāsane tṛtiye mune /
analyzed: śāsane tṛtiye mune
translated: Again, in the third teaching of the Sage, fifty koṭis,

original: vinītā devaputrāṇā apāyehi vimocitā //
analyzed: vinītā deva putrāṇā apāyehi vimocitā
translated: The gods have been disciplined and released from the lower realms.

original: p / aśīti koṭīyo bhūyo śrotāpattiphale vibhū /
translated: Again, eighty koṭis have been liberated in the fruit of stream-entry,

original: caturthe śāsane dametvā durgatīhi vimokṣitāḥ //🔽tasmātte sadṛśo nāsti maitrāya puruṣottama /
analyzed: caturthe śāsane dama itvā vimokṣitāḥ  tasmāt te sadṛśaḥ na asti maitrāya puruṣa uttama
translated: In the fourth teaching, having disciplined them, they have been released from the lower realms.🔽Therefore, there is no one equal to you in loving-kindness, O Supreme Being,

original: karuṇāye kāruṇiko bhūto bhūyo nararṣabha //
analyzed: karuṇāye kāruṇikaḥ bhūtaḥ bhūyas nara ṛṣabha
translated: Out of compassion, you have become compassionate, O Bull among Men.

original: hṛṣṭā puruṣaśārdūlā utpannā lokasundarā /
analyzed: hṛṣṭā puruṣa śārdūlā utpannā loka sundarā
translated: The delighted tigers among men have arisen, the world's darlings,

original: hitāya sarvasatvānā vicaranti mahāmune //
analyzed: hitāya sarva satvānā vicaranti mahā mune
translated: For the benefit of all beings, they wander, O Great Sage.

original: aticirasya rājasuta utpanno si nararṣabha /
analyzed: aticirasya rāja sutaḥ utpannaḥ si nara ṛṣabha
translated: After a long time, O Prince, you have arisen, O Bull among Men,

original: praṇetā vipranaṣṭānā ārttānā nayanandana //
analyzed: praṇetā vipranaṣṭānām ārttānām naya nandana
translated: The leader of the lost, the delight of the afflicted.

original: mā ca kadācidbhūtaguru nātho antarahāyatu /
analyzed: mā ca kadācid bhūta guru nā atho antarahāyatu
translated: And may the Lord, the Guru of beings, never disappear.

original: aparyanta tava sthāna bhavati lokabāndhava //
analyzed: aparyanta tava sthāna bhavati loka bāndhava
translated: Your realm will be limitless, O Friend of the World.

original: apāyā tanukībhūtā svayambhū tava tejasā /
analyzed: apāyā tanukībhūtā svayambhū tava tejasā
translated: The lower realms will become diminished through your splendor, Self-Existent One.

original: anokāśā kṛtā svargā tvā prāpya puruṣottama //
analyzed: an okāśā kṛtā svargā tvā prāpya puruṣa uttama
translated: Having attained you, O Supreme Being, the heavens will be filled.

original: yasya mithyātvaniyato rāśiḥ puruṣapudgala /🔽eṣa vāniyata rāśi tvā prāpya pūrayiṣyate //
analyzed: yasya mithyātva niyataḥ rāśiḥ puruṣa pudgala  eṣa vāniyata rāśi tvā prāpya pūrayiṣyate
translated: The one who is in the indeterminate class, O Person, Individual,🔽Will, having attained you, fill the determinate class.

original: yasyāpyaniyato rāśiḥ tvā prāpya suravandita /
analyzed: yasya api aniyataḥ rāśiḥ tvā prāpya sura vandita
translated: The one who is in the indeterminate class, having attained you, O One Worshipped by the Gods,

original: pūrayiṣyati so rāśi samyaktejakulodita //
analyzed: pūrayiṣyati saḥ rāśi samyak teja kula udita
translated: Will fill that class, O One Arisen from the Family of the Perfectly Luminous.

original: adbhutānā ca dharmāṇā viśuddhirupalabhyate /
analyzed: adbhutānā ca dharmāṇā viśuddhiḥ upalabhyate
translated: The purification of the wondrous dharmas is perceived.

original: tvā prāpya puruṣāditya tamontakaramucyata //
analyzed: tvā prāpya puruṣa āditya tamaḥ nta karam ucyata
translated: Having attained you, O Sun among Men, the destroyer of darkness is spoken of.

original: p / tasya te bhāṣamāṇasya bhūtā dharmā jinarṣabha /
analyzed: tasya te bhāṣamāṇasya bhūtāḥ dharmāḥ jina ṛṣabha
translated: When you speak thus, O Victorious Bull, the true dharmas

original: abhinandanti vākyante sendrā lokā mahāmune //
analyzed: abhinandanti vākyante sa indrāḥ lokāḥ mahā mune
translated: Are rejoiced in by the worlds with Indra, O Great Sage.

original: iti stuvanti devagaṇā varada prītimānasā /
analyzed: iti stuvanti deva gaṇāḥ vara da prīti mānasā
translated: Thus the hosts of gods praise the Bestower of Boons with joyful minds,

original: anantaguṇasapanna sastavārha narottamamiti //
analyzed: ananta guṇa sapanna sa stava arha narottamam iti
translated: O One Endowed with Infinite Qualities, O Worthy One, O Supreme Being, they say.

original: upacāravidhisapannā bho dhutadharmadhara samyaksabuddhā kālajñānasamarthakā viśuddhanetrā anuccāvacadarśanā pūrvāntanayasapannā ucchrāpitadharmadhvajā
analyzed: upacāra vidhi sapannā bho dhuta dharma dhara samyaksabuddhā kāla jñāna samarthakā viśuddha netrā anuccāvaca darśanā pūrva anta naya sapannā ucchrāpita dharma dhvajā
translated: Endowed with the method of service, O bearer of pure Dharma, the Perfectly Awakened Ones are capable of knowing time, have pure eyes, and do not see high or low. Endowed with the way of the past, they have raised the banner of Dharma,

original: niṣpratimānadhvajā kalaharaṇaniśātakā pravacanaviduṣo anavasānajñānāḥ samaye ca āvusādayanto anayanānā pravartakāḥ apamārgakakutsakā iti //
analyzed: pravacana viduṣaḥ anavasāna jñānāḥ samaye ca pravartakāḥ apamārga kakutsakāḥ iti
translated: The banner of the incomparable, skilled in removing disputes, wise in the teachings, with inexhaustible knowledge, and when the time comes, they encourage those who are lazy, are the founders of the non-conducive, and despise the wrong path.

original: tatredamucyate //
analyzed: tatra idam ucyate
translated: Regarding this, it is said:

original: sarvākāraguṇopetā sarve sarvārthaniścitā /
analyzed: sarva ākāra guṇa upetā sarve sarva artha niścitā
translated: Endowed with all aspects and qualities, all have ascertained all meanings.

original: pranetāro vinetāro buddhā budhajanārcitāḥ //
analyzed: pranetāraḥ vinetāraḥ buddhāḥ budha jana arcitāḥ
translated: The guides, the teachers, the Buddhas, worshipped by the wise,

original: asakīrṇena jñānena viśuddhena manena ca /
analyzed: asakīrṇena jñānena viśuddhena manena ca
translated: With unmixed knowledge, and with a pure mind,

original: triṣu lokeṣu bhrājante pūrṇacandra iva nabhe //
analyzed: triṣu lokeṣu bhrājante pūrṇa candre iva nabhe
translated: They shine in the three worlds like the full moon in the sky.

original: caraṇena manojñena satā kāntena nāyakāḥ /
analyzed: caraṇena manojñena satā kāntena nāyakāḥ
translated: With delightful and beautiful conduct, the leaders,

original: nadanti ca mahānāda samyakkuśalasabhavāḥ //
analyzed: nadanti ca mahānāda samyak kuśala sabhavāḥ
translated: They roar the great roar, born from right skill.

original: śāsanti janatā vīrā upacāreṣu niścitāḥ /
analyzed: śāsanti janatāḥ vīrāḥ upacāreṣu niścitāḥ
translated: The heroes teach the people, certain in the services.

original: vivāda parasatvānā mathanti tattvadarśinaḥ //
analyzed: vivāda para sattvānām mathanti tattva darśinaḥ
translated: They crush the disputes of other beings, seeing the truth.

original: loke jātā naraśreṣṭhā na ca lokena lipyatha /
analyzed: loke jātāḥ nara śreṣṭhāḥ na ca lokena
translated: Born in the world, best of men, yet you are not smeared by the world.🔽

original: prajñaptisamatikrāntā gambhīraviṣayā vibhūḥ //
analyzed: prajñapti samatikrāntā gambhīra viṣayā vibhūḥ
translated: Transcending designations, they have the vast domain of the profound.

original: p / guru dhura samāropya na viṣīdanti paṇḍitā /
analyzed: guru dhura samāropya na viṣīdanti paṇḍitā
translated: The wise ones, having taken up the heavy burden, do not despair.

original: yathāvādītathākārī anupakruṣṭacāraṇā //
analyzed: yathāvādī tathākārī an upakruṣṭa cāraṇā
translated: As they speak, so they act, their conduct is irreproachable.

original: dṛṣṭiviṣa ta ghora ca dagdhvā jñānāgninā prabhūḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭi viṣa ta ghora ca dagdhvā jñāna agninā prabhūḥ
translated: Having burned the terrible poison of views with the fire of wisdom,

original: anuttrāsitāsantrastā para pradanti prāṇinā //
analyzed: an uttrāsitā a santrastā para pradanti prāṇinā
translated: The powerful ones, undaunted and fearless, tame other beings.

original: kāntāra samatikramya kṣema prāpya nararṣabhāḥ /
analyzed: kāntāra samatikramya kṣema prāpya nara ṛṣabhāḥ
translated: Having crossed the wilderness, the best of men have attained peace.

original: āhvāyanti janadhīrā ihaiva nirbhaya ida //🔽jarāmaraṇarogāṇā utpatti neha vidyate /
analyzed: āhvāyanti jana dhīrāḥ iha eva  jarā maraṇa rogāṇām utpatti na iha vidyate
translated: The wise ones invite the people here, saying, Fear not!🔽Here, old age, death, and sickness do not arise.

original: iha āyāsaśokānā pravṛttirnopalabhyate //
analyzed: iha āyāsa śokānām pravṛttiḥ na upalabhyate
translated: Here, the occurrence of striving and sorrow is not perceived.

original: te tasya vacana śrutvā madhura devamānuṣā /
analyzed: te tasya vacana śrutvā madhura deva mānuṣā
translated: Having heard those words, sweet like the speech of gods and humans,

original: anuśāsti tathā kṛtvā pratipadyanti tatsukha //
analyzed: anuśāsti tathā kṛtvā pratipadyanti
translated: Having acted accordingly, they follow his teachings and attain happiness.

original: tenāsti kīrtivistīrṇāḥ triṣu lokeṣu cottamāḥ /
analyzed: tena asti kīrti vistīrṇāḥ triṣu lokeṣu ca uttamāḥ
translated: By that, their fame has spread, supreme in the three worlds.

original: caranti arcitā sadbhi na caiva praśamanti te iti //
analyzed: caranti arcitā na ca eva praśamanti te iti
translated: Honored by the virtuous, they wander without ever being extinguished.

original: paropahārāśca bho dhutadharmadhara upaharanti samyaksabuddhāḥ satvānāmanugrahārtha //
analyzed: para upahārāḥ ca bho dhuta dharma dharaḥ upaharanti samyaksabuddhāḥ satvānām anugraha artha
translated: Moreover, O you who are pure in conduct, the Perfectly Awakened Ones inflict harm in order to favor beings.

original: tadyathā kaligarājñaḥ kusumāye devyā paropahāra bhagavā vṛttavā dhruvasya śreṣṭhino vacanopahāra bhagavā vṛttavā //
analyzed: tat yathā kaliga rājñaḥ kusumāye devyā dhruvasya śreṣṭhinaḥ vacana upahāra bhagavā vṛttavā
translated: Just as the Blessed One was worshipped with offerings by Queen Kusumā of the Kaliṅga king, and by the merchant Dhruva with words of offering, the Blessed One was worshipped.

original: tathaiva ca rājagṛhe parottame paropahāra bhagavā pravṛttavā /
analyzed: tathā eva ca rājagṛhe para uttame para upahāra bhagavā
translated: In the same way, in Rājagṛha, the Blessed One was worshipped with offerings by the supreme one.

original: p / samutkarṣesi svavidhānakovido upālino ta vacanopahāra //
analyzed: samutkarṣesi sva vidhāna kovidaḥ ta vacana upahāra
translated: You, O Upāli, skilled in your own rules, have made a word offering to the Blessed One, which you have greatly exalted.

original: tathā para merutaṭe samāgatā sa vādisiho vaśinā vaśī vaśī /
analyzed: tathā meru taṭe samāgatā sa vādi sihaḥ vaśinā vaśī vaśī
translated: In the same way, on the peak of Mount Meru, the lion of speakers, the self-controlled one, the master,

original: paropahāra bhagavā sa bhikṣu saghasya ta idamavacā mahāmuniriti //
analyzed: paropahāra bhagavā sa bhikṣu saghasya te idam avacāḥ mahā muniḥ iti
translated: the Blessed One, the monk, the sage, spoke this to the assembly.

original: etā sarvā pravakṣyāmi upahārā manoramā /
analyzed: etā sarvā pravakṣyāmi upahārā manoramā
translated: I will tell all of these delightful offerings,

original: tasya satvapradhānasya śṛṇu vikrīḍita śubha //
analyzed: tasya satva pradhānasya śṛṇu vikrīḍita śubha
translated: listen, O Vikrīḍita, to the auspicious play of that foremost being.

original: utpanne puruṣaśreṣṭhe dharmacakre pravartite /
analyzed: utpanne puruṣa śreṣṭhe dharma cakre pravartite
translated: When the best of men arose and the wheel of Dharma was set in motion,

original: kaligarājā kārayati rājya sphītamakaṇṭaka //
analyzed: kaliga rājā kārayati rājya sphītam akaṇṭaka
translated: the Kaliṅga king ruled a prosperous kingdom free from enemies.

original: nāmena abhayo nāma tasyeda darśana abhūt /
analyzed: nāmena abhayaḥ nāma tasya idam darśana abhūt
translated: His name was Abhaya, and he had this view:

original: śubhāśubhānā karmāṇā phala nāstīti niścayaḥ //
analyzed: śubha aśubhānā karmāṇā phala na asti iti niścayaḥ
translated: There is no result of good or bad actions, this is certain.

original: paraloko tathā nāsti dānaphala kvacidyatra /
analyzed: tathā na asti dāna phala kvacid yatra
translated: There is no other world, and nowhere is there a result of giving.

original: vītarāgo vītadoṣo vītamoho na vidyate //
analyzed: vīta rāgaḥ vīta doṣaḥ vīta mohaḥ na vidyate
translated: Free from passion, free from hatred, free from delusion, he does not exist.

original: so ta ca darśana prāpya janatā sannipātayet /
analyzed: sā u ta ca darśana prāpya janatā sannipātayet
translated: Having attained that view, he would gather a multitude of people.

original: svakā dṛṣṭi samākhyāti paścācca na nivartate //
analyzed: svakā dṛṣṭi samākhyāti paścāt ca na nivartate
translated: He proclaims his own view and does not turn back later.

original: yadi mahya pitā brūyātpratyakṣa mama agrataḥ /
analyzed: yadi pitā brūyāt pratyakṣa mama agratas
translated: If my father were to tell me directly in my presence,

original: svayamupagamya evantacchraddadhe tadā tathā //
analyzed: svayam upagamya tadā tathā
translated: approaching himself, I would then believe it to be so.

original: sarvadā sa tadā āsi śīlavā maitramānaso /
analyzed: sarvadā sa tadā āsi śīlavā maitra mānasaḥ
translated: He was always then, of good conduct, friendly-minded.

original: p / yadi tasya phalamasti tasya devapura gatiḥ /
analyzed: yadi tasya phalam asti tasya deva pura gatiḥ
translated: If there is a fruit for him, his destination is the city of the gods.

original: devabhūto mama jñātvā imā dṛṣṭi vimocayet /
analyzed: deva bhūtaḥ mama jñātvā imāḥ dṛṣṭi vimocayet
translated: Having become a god, he would liberate me from this view.

original: ityutkrāsti paraloko dṛṣṭi muñcāhi pāpakā //
analyzed: iti utkrāsti para lokaḥ
translated: Thus, the other world exists. Abandon the evil view.

original: yasya ca paralokasya pravṛttirnopalabhyate /
analyzed: yasya ca para lokasya pravṛttiḥ na upalabhyate
translated: For one for whom the existence of the other world is not perceived,

original: tasmātpitā mamāgatvā sapraharṣayatu mānasa //
analyzed: tasmāt pitā mama ā gatvā sa praharṣayatu mānasa
translated: therefore, may my father, having come, gladden my mind.

original: tato lokānukapārtha kāruṇo mahadviśāradaḥ /
analyzed: tatas kāruṇaḥ mahat viśāradaḥ
translated: Then, the compassionate one, skilled in great compassion for the world,

original: kaligarājasya rūpa nirmiṇati svaya muniḥ //
analyzed: kaliga rājasya rūpa nirmiṇati svayam muniḥ
translated: the sage himself creates the form of Kali the king.

original: prāsādavaramāruhya antaḥpuragato tathā /
analyzed: prāsāda varam āruhya tathā
translated: Having ascended the excellent palace, and being in the inner quarters,

original: antaḥpurasya darśeti yatta prakṛtidarśana //
analyzed: antaḥpurasya prakṛti darśana
translated: he shows the inner quarters to the one who has the appearance of the natural one.

original: tato sa nirmito rājā antarīkṣagatasthitaḥ /
analyzed: tatas sa nirmitaḥ rājā antarīkṣa gata sthitaḥ
translated: Then that emanated king, standing in the sky,

original: rājānamabhaya dhīro uvāca puruṣottamaḥ //
analyzed: rājānam abhaya uvāca puruṣottamaḥ
translated: The fearless, courageous, supreme being spoke to the king:

original: parityajya svakāryāṇi parakāryeṣu vyāpṛtaḥ /
analyzed: parityajya sva kāryāṇi para kāryeṣu vyāpṛtaḥ
translated: Abandoning your own duties, you are engaged in the duties of others.

original: mithyādarśanasayukta arājya rājyasajñita //
analyzed: mithyā darśana sayukta arājya rājya sajñita
translated: Associated with false views, you rule a kingdom that is not a kingdom.

original: adya bhave gatī tubhya narako dāruṇo mahat /
analyzed: adya bhave gatī narakaḥ dāruṇaḥ mahat
translated: Today, your destiny will be a great and terrible hell,

original: ye ca te darśayipyanti teṣāmapi ca sā gati //
analyzed: ye ca te darśayipyanti teṣām api ca sā
translated: And that will also be the destiny of those who show you the way.

original: anyān hi vihato hanti naṣṭo nāśayate parā /
analyzed: anyān hi vihataḥ hanti naṣṭaḥ nāśayate parā
translated: You strike others and kill them, you are lost and destroy others,

original: andhīkaroti anyā pi svayamandhavyapatrapo //
analyzed: andhīkaroti anyā
translated: You make others blind while yourself ashamed of being blind.

original: samuṣṭo muṣase anyā mṛto ca mārase parā /
analyzed: sa muṣṭaḥ muṣase anyā mṛtaḥ u ca mārase parā
translated: You deceive others with your fist, and when you die, you will kill others.

original: sukhitānapi satvā tva duḥkhāpayasi durmate //
analyzed: sukhitān api satvā tva duḥkhāpayasi durmate
translated: O evil-minded one, you bring suffering even to those who are happy.

original: nimagno kāmapakasmi gṛddhu kāmeṣu mūrcchitaḥ /
analyzed: nimagnaḥ kāma pakasmi gṛddhu kāmeṣu mūrcchitaḥ
translated: You are sunk in the mud of desire, greedy for sensual pleasures, intoxicated.

original: p / paraloka draṣṭukāmo dharmāṇā nayana nṛpaḥ //
analyzed: para loka draṣṭu kāmaḥ
translated: You, a king, who should be the eye of the Dharma, desire to see the other world.

original: asthānameta bhūmipati yastva kāmaparāyaṇaḥ /
analyzed: asthānam eta bhūmipati yaḥ tva kāma parāyaṇaḥ
translated: O lord of the earth, it is impossible for one who is devoted to sensual pleasures

original: asamartho tarhiḥ gantu paralokamima prabho //
analyzed: tarhiḥ gantu para lokam ima prabho
translated: To go to the other world, O lord, if one is unable to do so.

original: āsvāda pi tu kāmeṣu buddhvā doṣantathaiva ca /
analyzed: tu kāmeṣu buddhvā ca
translated: Having tasted sensual pleasures and understood their faults,

original: kāme niḥsaraṇajñasya te vai jāne paraparā //
analyzed: kāme niḥsaraṇa jñasya te vai jāne paraparā
translated: I know that you are the supreme one, who knows the way out of desire.

original: etacchrutvā naraśreṣṭho abhayo kampito bhayāt /
analyzed: etat śrutvā nara śreṣṭhaḥ abhayo kampitaḥ bhayāt
translated: Having heard this, the best of men, Abhaya, trembled with fear.

original: prahvo idamuvāca ta antarikṣe sudarśana //
analyzed: prahvaḥ idam uvāca te antarikṣe su darśana
translated: Humble, he spoke this to the one in the sky, Sudarshana:

original: śraddadhāmi ta te deva evameta na anyathā prasīda bhava me nātha abhaya parimocaya //
analyzed: śraddadhāmi te te deva evameta na anyathā prasīda bhava me nātha abhaya parimocaya
translated: I have faith in you, O god, it is so, not otherwise. Be gracious to me, O lord, deliver me from fear.

original: tadvasāntaḥpurāmātyaḥ śāstā me apratipudgalaḥ /
analyzed: tad vasā antaḥpura amātyaḥ śāstā me aprati pudgalaḥ
translated: The one who was in the harem with him, the teacher, the one without equal,

original: vinayavaśī tavāsmi tathānyā janatā bahu //
analyzed: vinaya vaśī tava asmi tathā anyā janatā bahu
translated: the one who is disciplined and controlled, I am yours, and so is much of the people.

original: paropahāra ityeṣastena paramabuddhinā vṛtto anugrahārthāya satvānā varabuddhinā /
analyzed: para upahāraḥ iti eṣaḥ tena parama buddhinā vṛttaḥ anugraha arthāya satvānā vara buddhinā
translated: This is the gift to others, given by that one of supreme wisdom, for the benefit of beings, by the one of excellent wisdom.

original: devī kusumbharājasya kusumā iti viśrutā /
analyzed: devī kusumbha rājasya kusumā iti viśrutā
translated: The queen of King Kusumbha, known as Kusuma,

original: iṣṭā kusumbharājasya strīsahasrāṇamuttamā //
analyzed: iṣṭā kusumbha rājasya
translated: was the most beloved of King Kusumbha's thousand wives.

original: tasya mātā pitā caiva jīrṇā daṇḍaparāyaṇā /
analyzed: tasya mātā pitā ca eva jīrṇā daṇḍa parāyaṇā
translated: Her mother and father, who were old and dependent on a staff,

original: dhītaramevamāhansu kusume putri he śṛṇu //
analyzed: dhītaram evam āhansu kusume putri he śṛṇu
translated: said this to their daughter Kusuma: O daughter, listen!

original: vaya jīrṇā tuva bālā kāmapralulitā asi /
analyzed: vaya jīrṇā tuva bālā kāma pralulitā asi
translated: We are old, and you are young, swayed by desire.

original: p / icchema pratisṛjyantau icchema maraṇamātmanaḥ //
analyzed: icchema pratisṛjyantau icchema maraṇam ātmanaḥ
translated: We wish to retire, we wish for our own death.

original: etacca vacana śrutvā kusumā labhate mata /
analyzed: etat ca vacana śrutvā kusumā
translated: Having heard these words, Kusuma became distressed.

original: avarṇo ya mama asyā ydyambātāto praghātyate //
analyzed: avarṇaḥ ya mama asyāḥ praghātyate
translated: If she is not given to me, she will be killed by my father.

original: dāsyāmi viṣasayukta bhaktameṣā sudāruṇa /
analyzed: dāsyāmi viṣa sayukta bhaktam eṣā su dāruṇa
translated: I will give her poisoned food, which is very terrible.

original: bhuktvā yena ubhāvetau mariṣyanti na saśayaḥ //
analyzed: bhuktvā yena ubhau etau mariṣyanti na saśayaḥ
translated: By eating which, both of them will die, there is no doubt.

original: yadāsyā niścitā buddhi mātāpitṛṣu dāruṇā /🔽tato utpādaye śāstā kāruṇya kusumā prati //
analyzed: yadā asyāḥ niścitā mātā pitṛṣu dāruṇā  utpādaye śāstā kāruṇya kusumā prati
translated: When her mind was firmly set on her cruel parents,🔽Then the Teacher produced the flower of compassion.

original: tataḥ kusumāye śāstā mātara pitara tathā /
analyzed: tatas kusumāye śāstā mātara pitara tathā
translated: Then the Teacher, the Fully Enlightened One,

original: apanāmayati sabuddho anyau sthāpeti nirmitau //
analyzed: apanāmayati sabuddhaḥ anyau sthāpeti nirmitau
translated: removed the parents and placed two other magically created ones.

original: kusumā viṣasayukta ta bhojanamāpadyati /🔽nirmitānāha bhujantu ambā tāto ca bhojana //
analyzed: bhojanam āpadyati  nirmitān āha ambā ca
translated: That flower ate the food mixed with poison.🔽The magically created ones said, Let mother and father eat the food.

original: avikampamānā bhujanti bhojana jinanirmitāḥ /

analyzed: tasya

analyzed: vidita vādi sihasya atra vijaha saśaya

analyzed: sa tvara sa prahvaḥ rājā sa stryāgāraḥ kṛta ājaliḥ

analyzed: vaśībhūta sahasrāṇām navatīhi puraskṛtaḥ

analyzed: tā ca paśya narāditya tā ca dṛṣṭi parityaja

original: na jāyanti na jīryanti na mṛyanti katha cana /
analyzed: na jāyanti na jīryanti na mṛyanti katha cana
translated: They are never born, they never age, they never die,

original: parama mitramāsādya vinītā varabuddhinā //
analyzed: parama mitram āsādya vinītā vara buddhinā
translated: Having attained the supreme friend, with humble and excellent intelligence,

original: gambhīracarita dhīrā prajānanti paraspara /
analyzed: dhīrā prajānanti
translated: The wise ones of profound conduct understand each other.

original: anantapratibhāna ca sarve sarvāṅgaśobhanā iti //
analyzed: ca sarve sarva aṅga śobhanāḥ iti
translated: All of them have infinite eloquence and are beautiful in every limb.

original: iti śrīmahāvastu avadāne abhiṣekavatī nāma daśamā bhūmiḥ samāptā //
analyzed: iti śrīmahāvastu avadāne abhiṣekavatī nāma daśamā bhūmiḥ samāptā
translated: Thus ends the tenth stage named Abhishekanandi in the Avadana of the Great Story.

original: śikhare gṛddhakūṭasmi pacānā vaśībhūtaśatānā samavāye daśabhūmika nāma upadeśamukha bhāṣita //
analyzed: śikhare pacānā vaśībhūta śatānā samavāye daśa bhūmika nāma upadeśa mukha bhāṣita
translated: On the peak of Gṛdhrakūṭa, in the assembly of a hundred tamed beings, the teaching of the name Daśabhūmika was spoken.

original: samāpta daśabhūmika //
analyzed: samāpta daśa bhūmika
translated: The Daśabhūmika is complete.

original: ye satvā buddhatvāya praṇidhenti tehi uddeśitavya daśabhūmika bodhisatvānā ca dṛṣṭasatyānā śraddadhānānā dātavya nānyeṣā ete hyatra
analyzed: ye satvāḥ buddha tvāya praṇidhenti tehi uddeśitavya daśa bhūmika bodhisatvānā ca dṛṣṭa satyānā śraddadhānānā dātavya na anyeṣā ete hi atra
translated: Those beings who aspire to Buddhahood, for them the Daśabhūmika should be taught, to the Bodhisattvas who have seen the truth and have faith, but not to others. For they would doubt here.

original: śraddadhānā anye vicikitseyuḥ //
analyzed: śraddadhānāḥ anye vicikitseyuḥ
translated: Others who have faith might doubt.

original: samāptā ādibhūmī yāvaddaśamā daśabhūmayaḥ mahāvastuparisara //
analyzed: samāptā ādi bhūmī yāvat daśamāḥ daśa bhūmayaḥ mahā vastu parisara
translated: The first stage up to the tenth stage, the ten stages, are complete. The outer frame of the Great Story.

original: dīpakaravastusyādiḥ /
analyzed: dīpa kara vastu sya ādiḥ
translated: The beginning of the story of Dīpaṃkara.

original: ito mahāmaudgalyāyana aparimite asakhyeye kalpe rājā arcimā nāma abhūṣi cakravartī kṛtapuṇyo maheśākhyo saptaratnasamanvāgato cāturdvīpo
analyzed: itas mahāmaudgalyāyana aparimite asakhyeye kalpe rājā arcimā nāma cakravartī kṛta puṇyaḥ maheśākhyaḥ sapta ratna samanvāgataḥ cāturdvīpaḥ
translated: “After innumerable, incalculable aeons, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, there was a king named Arciṣmān, a universal king, righteous, valorous, a king of dharma, possessing the seven treasures, sovereign over the four continents.

original: vijitāvī anuraktapaurajānapado dhārmilo dharmarājā daśa kuśalā karmapathā samādāyavartī //
analyzed: vijita āvī anurakta paura jānapadaḥ dhārmilaḥ dharma rājā daśa kuśalā karma pathā samādāyavartī
translated: He had taken upon himself the ten right ways of behaviour.

original: tasya sapta ratanāni abhūt /
analyzed: tasya sapta ratanāni abhūt
translated: He had seven treasures:

original: tadyathā cakraratna hastiratana aśvaratna maṇiratana strīratana gṛhapatiratna pariṇāyakaratana eva saptaratna //
analyzed: tat yathā cakra ratna hasti ratana aśva ratna maṇi ratana strī ratana gṛhapati ratna pariṇāyaka ratana eva sapta ratna
translated: the precious wheel, the precious elephant, the precious horse, the precious wife, the precious jewel, the precious steward, and the precious general—these were the seven treasures.

original: pūrṇa cāsya putra sahasra abhūṣi śūrāṇā vīrāṇā varāṅgarūpiṇā parasainyapramardakānā //
analyzed: pūrṇa ca asya putra sahasra śūrāṇā vīrāṇā vara aṅga rūpiṇā para sainya pramardakānā
translated: He had a full thousand sons, who were valiant, brave, comely, and vanquishers of the armies of their enemies.

original: so imā catvāri mahādvīpā sāgaragiriparyantā akhilā akaṇṭakā adaṇḍenāśāstreṇānutpīḍena dharmeṇemā abhinirjiṇitvā adhyāvasi //
analyzed: sā u imā catvāri mahā dvīpā sāgara giri paryantā akhilā akaṇṭakā a daṇḍena a śāstreṇa an utpīḍena dharmeṇa imāḥ abhinirjiṇitvā adhyāvasi
translated: He reigned over these four great land masses surrounded by the ocean and the snowy mountains, without confusion, without hindrance, without the rod, the sword, the scourge, or oppression, but with dharma.

original: arcimato khalu punaḥ mahā p / maudgalyāyana rājño dīpavatī nāma rājadhānī abhūṣi dvādaśa yojanāni āyāmena purastimena ca paścimena ca sapta
analyzed: arcimataḥ khalu punar mahā maudgalyāyana rājñaḥ dīpavatī nāma rājadhānī dvādaśa yojanāni āyāmena purastimena ca paścimena ca sapta
translated: Now, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, King Arcimat had a royal city named Dipavatī, twelve yojanas long from east to west,

original: yojanāni vistāreṇa dakṣiṇena ca uttareṇa ca saptahi prākārehi parikṣiptā abhūṣi sauvarṇehi suvarṇapracchannehi //
analyzed: yojanāni vistāreṇa dakṣiṇena ca uttareṇa ca saptahi prākārehi parikṣiptā sauvarṇehi suvarṇa pracchannehi
translated: and seven wide from south to north. It was surrounded by seven ramparts made of gold covered with gold.

original: dīpavatī khalu punarmahāmaudgalyāyana rājadhānī saptahi tālapaktihi parikṣiptā abhūṣi citrāhi darśanīyāhi saptānā ratnānā suvarṇasya rūpyasya 🔽muktāyā vaiḍūryasya sphaṭikasya musāragalvasya lohitikāyāḥ //
analyzed: dīpavatī khalu punar mahāmaudgalyāyana rājadhānī saptahi tāla paktihi parikṣiptā abhūṣi citrāhi darśanīyāhi saptānā ratnānā suvarṇasya rūpyasya  / muktāyāḥ vaiḍūryasya sphaṭikasya musāragalvasya lohitikāyāḥ
translated: Now, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, the royal city of Dipavatī was surrounded by seven rows of bright, beautiful palm-trees, made of the seven precious substances, gold, silver,🔽pearl, beryl, crystal, white coral and ruby.

original: sarvarṇasya tālaskandhasya rūpyamaya patra ca phala ca abhūṣi /🔽rūpyamayasya tālaskandhasya muktāyā patrā ca phalā ca abhūṣi /
analyzed: sarvarṇasya tālaskandhasya rūpya maya patra ca phala ca abhūṣi  rūpya mayasya tāla skandhasya muktāyā patrā ca phalā ca abhūṣi
translated: The trunks of the palm-trees were of gold and their leaves and fruit were of silver.🔽The trunks of the palm-trees were of silver and their leaves and fruit were of pearl.

original: muktāmayasya tālaskandhasya vaiḍūryamayā patrā ca phalā ca abhuṣi /
analyzed: muktā mayasya tāla skandhasya vaiḍūrya mayā patrā ca phalā ca
translated: The trunks of the palm-trees were of pearl and their leaves and fruit were of beryl.

original: vaiḍūryamayasya tālaskandhasya sphaṭikasya patrā ca phalā ca abhūṣi /
analyzed: vaiḍūrya mayasya tāla skandhasya sphaṭikasya patrā ca phalā ca abhūṣi
translated: The trunk of the palm tree was made of beryl, and its leaves and fruit were of crystal.

original: sphaṭikamayasya tālaskandhasya musāgalvamayā patrā ca phalā ca abhūṣi /🔽musāgalvamayasya tālaskandhasya lohitikāmayā patrā ca phalā ca abhūṣi /
analyzed: sphaṭika mayasya tāla skandhasya musāgalva mayā patrā ca phalā ca abhūṣi  musāgalva mayasya tāla skandhasya lohitikā mayā patrā ca phalā ca abhūṣi
translated: The trunk of the palm tree was made of crystal, and its leaves and fruit were of coral.🔽The trunk of the palm tree was made of coral, and its leaves and fruit were of ruby.

original: lohitikāmayasya tālaskandhasya muktāmayā patrā ca phalā ca abhūṣi //
analyzed: lohitikā mayasya tāla skandhasya muktā mayā patrā ca phalā ca abhūṣi
translated: The trunk of the palm tree was made of ruby, and its leaves and fruit were of pearl.

original: teṣā khalu punaḥ mahāmaudgalyāyana tālānā vāteritānā vātasaghaṭṭitānā ghoṣo niścarati valgu manojñaḥ āsecanako apratikūlo śravaṇāya //
analyzed: teṣām khalu punar mahāmaudgalyāyana tālānām vāteritānām vātasaghaṭṭitānām ghoṣaḥ niścarati valgu manojñaḥ āsecanakaḥ a pratikūlaḥ śravaṇāya
translated: And, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, when those palm trees were shaken and stirred by the wind, a lovely, charming, delightful, and intoxicating sound arose, agreeable to the senses and pleasing to the mind.

original: tadyathāpi nāma pacāṅgikasya tūryasya kuśalehi vādakehi samyaksupravāditasya ghoṣo niścarati valgu valgu manojño āsecanakaḥ apratikūlo śravaṇāya
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma pacāṅgikasya tūryasya kuśalehi vādakehi samyak su pravāditasya ghoṣaḥ niścarati valgu valgu manojñaḥ āsecanakaḥ a pratikūlaḥ śravaṇāya
translated: Just as the sound of a five-fold musical instrument played by skilled players, well-tuned and in harmony, produces a lovely, charming, delightful, and intoxicating sound, agreeable to the senses and pleasing to the mind,

original: evameva / / / / / / / / / / /bho mahāmaudgalyāyana tena kālena tena samayena dīpavatīye rājadhānīye manuṣyā abhūṣi śuṇḍāpeyā te tena tālapatranirghoṣeṇa 🔽pacahi kāmaguṇehi samarpitā samaṅgībhūtā krīḍensu ramensu pravicārensu //🔽dīpavatī khalu punarmahāmaudgalyāyana rājadhānī saptahi vedikājālehi parikṣiptā abhūṣi citrāhi darśanīyāhi saptānā varṇānā suvarṇasya rūpyasya 🔽muktāyā vaiḍūryasya sphaṭikasya musāgalvasya lohitikāyā //
analyzed: evam eva bho mahāmaudgalyāyana tena kālena tena samayena dīpavatīye rājadhānīye manuṣyāḥ śuṇḍāpeyā te tena tāla patra nirghoṣeṇa  pacahi kāmaguṇehi samarpitā samaṅgībhūtā krīḍensu ramensu pravicārensu  dīpavatī khalu punar mahāmaudgalyāyana rājadhānī saptahi vedikā jālehi parikṣiptā citrāhi darśanīyāhi saptānā varṇānā suvarṇasya rūpyasya  muktāyāḥ vaiḍūryasya sphaṭikasya musāgalvasya lohitikāyāḥ

original: sauvarṇasya pādakasya rūpyamayī sūcikā p / ālambanamadhiṣṭhānaka cābhūṣi /🔽rūpyamayasya pādakasya muktāmayā sūcikā ālambanamadhiṣṭhānaka ca abhūṣi /🔽muktāmayasya vaiḍūryamayī vaiḍūryamayasya sphaṭikamayī sphaṭikamayasya musāragalvamayī musāragalvamayasya lohitikāmayī /
analyzed: sauvarṇasya pādakasya rūpya mayī sūcikā 🔽rūpya mayasya pādakasya muktā mayā sūcikā ālambanam adhiṣṭhānaka 🔽muktā mayasya vaiḍūrya mayī vaiḍūrya mayasya sphaṭika mayī sphaṭika mayasya musāragalva mayī musāragalva mayasya lohitikā mayī

original: lohitikāmayasya pādakasya sauvarṇikā sūcikā ālambanamadhiṣṭhānaka ca abhūṣi //
analyzed: lohitikā mayasya pādakasya sauvarṇikā sūcikā ālambanam adhiṣṭhānaka ca
translated: The golden thread-cross-bars and the golden supporting-posts were the feet of the red-sandalwood palace.

original: te ca khalu punarmahāmaudgalyāyana vedikājālā dvihi hemajālehi praticchannā abhūṣi suvarṇamayena ca hemajālena rūpyamayena ca //🔽sauvarṇasya hemajālasya rūpyamayīyo kikiṇiyo abhūṣi /
analyzed: te ca khalu punar mahāmaudgalyāyana vedikā jālāḥ dvihi hema jālehi praticchannāḥ suvarṇa mayena ca hema jālena rūpya mayena ca  sauvarṇasya hema jālasya rūpya mayīyaḥ kikiṇiyaḥ
translated: Again, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, those railings were covered with two nets, one of gold and the other of silver.🔽On the golden net were bells of silver,

original: rūpyamayasya hemajālasya saurvarṇikā kikiṇikā abhūṣi //🔽dīpavatīya khalu punaḥ rājadhānīya samantato trīṇi trīṇi dvārāṇi abhūṣi citrāṇi darśanīyāni saptānā ratnānā suvarṇasya rūpyasya muktāyā
analyzed: rūpya mayasya hema jālasya saurvarṇikā kikiṇikā abhūṣi  khalu punar rājadhānīya samantataḥ trīṇi trīṇi dvārāṇi citrāṇi darśanīyāni saptānā ratnānā suvarṇasya rūpyasya muktāyāḥ
translated: and on the silver net were bells of gold.🔽Now, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, in the city of Dipavatī there were three gates on each side,

original: vaiḍūryasya sphaṭikasya musāgalvasya lohitikāyāḥ //🔽teṣā khalu punarmahāmaudgalyāyana dvārāṇā dvinnā varṇānā vyāmotsagā abhūṣi suvarṇasya ca rūpyasya ca /
analyzed: vaiḍūryasya sphaṭikasya musāgalvasya lohitikāyāḥ  teṣām khalu punar mahāmaudgalyāyana dvārāṇām dvinnā varṇānām vyāma utsagāḥ suvarṇasya ca rūpyasya ca
translated: which were bright and beautiful, and made of the seven precious substances, gold, silver, pearl, beryl, crystal, white coral, and ruby.🔽Again, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, those gates were two hundred cubits high and a hundred cubits wide.

original: dvinnā varṇānā tulā abhunsuḥ suvarṇasya ca rūpyasya ca /
analyzed: dvinnāḥ varṇānā tulāḥ abhunsuḥ suvarṇasya ca rūpyasya ca
translated: They were two cubits thick, and were plastered inside and outside with a layer of cement an inch thick.

original: dvinnā varṇānā anuvargā abhunsuḥ suvarṇasya ca rūpyasya ca /🔽dvinnā varṇānā phaṭikaphalakāni abhunsuḥ suvarṇasya ca rūpyasya ca /
analyzed: dvinnāḥ varṇānāḥ anuvargāḥ abhunsuḥ suvarṇasya ca rūpyasya ca  dvinnāḥ varṇānā phaṭika phalakāni abhunsuḥ suvarṇasya ca rūpyasya ca
translated: There were two kinds of pavements, of gold and of silver.🔽There were two kinds of mosaic pavements, of gold and of silver.

original: dvinnā varṇānā phalakastārā abhunsuḥ suvarṇasya ca rūpyasya ca /
analyzed: dvinnāḥ varṇānā phalakastārāḥ abhunsuḥ suvarṇasya ca rūpyasya ca
translated: There were two kinds of star-like pavements, of gold and of silver.

original: caturṇā varṇānā paṭimodakā abhunsuḥ suvarṇasya ca rūpyasya muktāyā vaiḍūryasya //
analyzed: caturṇā varṇānā paṭimodakāḥ abhunsuḥ suvarṇasya ca rūpyasya muktāyāḥ vaiḍūryasya
translated: There were four kinds of couches, of gold, of silver, of ivory and of black aloe-wood.

original: teṣā khalu punarmahāmaudgalyāyana dvārāṇā dvinnā varṇānā ekūkā abhunsuḥ suvarṇasya rūpyasya ca //
analyzed: teṣām khalu punar mahāmaudgalyāyana dvārāṇām dvinnāḥ ekūkāḥ abhunsuḥ suvarṇasya rūpyasya ca
translated: And, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, these gates were faced with two kinds of stone, with white and with variegated marble.

original: teṣā khalu punarmahāmaudgalyāyana dvārāṇā caturṇā varṇānā indrakīlakā abhunsu suvarṇasya ca rūpyasya ca muktāyā vaiḍūryasya ca /🔽dvinnā varṇānā kapāṭāni abhunsuḥ suvarṇasya ca rūpyasya ca /
analyzed: teṣām khalu punar mahāmaudgalyāyana dvārāṇām caturṇām varṇānām indrakīlakāḥ suvarṇasya ca rūpyasya ca muktāyāḥ vaiḍūryasya ca  dvinnā varṇānā kapāṭāni abhunsuḥ suvarṇasya ca rūpyasya ca
translated: And, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, at these gates there were four kinds of door-posts, of gold, of silver, of pearl and of beryl.🔽There were two kinds of doors, of gold and of silver.🔽There were two kinds of door-hinges, of gold and of silver.

original: dvinnā varṇānā argalapāśā abhunsuḥ suvarṇasya ca rūpyasya p / ca //
analyzed: dvinnāḥ varṇānāḥ argala pāśāḥ abhunsuḥ suvarṇasya ca rūpyasya ca
translated: There were two kinds of door-fastenings, of gold and of silver.

original: teṣā khalu punarmahāmaudgalyāyana dvārāṇā purato iṣikāni māpitāni abhunsuḥ tripauruṣanekhānyāni tripauruṣaparigohyāni dvādaśapauruṣā udvedhena 🔽citrāṇi darśanīyāni saptānā varṇānā suvarṇasya rūpyasya muktāyā vaiḍūryasya sphaṭikasya musāragalvasya yāni saptānā varṇānā suvarṇasya rūpyasya
analyzed: teṣām khalu punar mahāmaudgalyāyana dvārāṇām puratas iṣikāni māpitāni abhunsuḥ tri pauruṣa nekhānyāni tri pauruṣa parigohyāni dvādaśa pauruṣāḥ udvedhena  citrāṇi darśanīyāni saptānā varṇānā suvarṇasya rūpyasya muktāyāḥ vaiḍūryasya sphaṭikasya musāragalvasya yāni saptānā varṇānā suvarṇasya rūpyasya
translated: In front of these gates, Maudgalyāyana, there were planted pillars, three hundred cubits high, three hundred cubits underground, and three hundred cubits visible above the ground.🔽They were beautiful and lovely, of the seven precious substances, gold, silver, pearl, beryl, crystal, white coral and ruby.

original: muktāyā vaiḍūryasya sphaṭikasya musāragalvasya lohitikāyāḥ /
analyzed: muktāyāḥ vaiḍūryasya sphaṭikasya musāragalvasya lohitikāyāḥ
translated: They were of the seven precious substances, gold, silver, pearl, beryl, crystal, white coral and ruby.

original: te khalu punarmahāmaudgalyāyana dvārā dvihi dvihi hemajālehi praticchannā abhūnsuḥ sauvarṇikena hemajālena rūpyamayena hemajālena //
analyzed: te khalu punar mahāmaudgalyāyana dvārā dvihi dvihi hema jālehi praticchannāḥ abhūnsuḥ sauvarṇikena hema jālena rūpya mayena hema jālena
translated: These gates, Maudgalyāyana, were covered with two nets of gold, one of gold and the other of silver.

original: suvarṇasya hemajālasya rūpyamayīyo kikiṇīyo abhunsuḥ rūpyamayasya hemajālasya sauvarṇikā kikiṇīyo abhūnsuḥ //
analyzed: suvarṇasya hema jālasya kikiṇīyaḥ abhunsuḥ rūpya mayasya hema jālasya sauvarṇikā kikiṇīyaḥ abhūnsuḥ
translated: On the golden net there were silver bells, and on the silver net golden bells.

original: teṣā khalu punarmahāmaudgalyāyana hemajālānā vāteritānā vātasaghaṭṭitānā ghoṣo niścarati valgu manojñaḥ āsecanako apratikūlo śravaṇāya
analyzed: teṣām khalu punar mahāmaudgalyāyana hema jālānām vāta īritānām vāta saghaṭṭitānām ghoṣaḥ niścarati valgu manojñaḥ āsecanakaḥ a pratikūlaḥ śravaṇāya
translated: And, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, from those golden nets, when stirred and shaken by the wind, there came a sound sweet, entrancing, ravishing, stirring, pleasing, delightful, charming, exhilarating, gladdening, and agreeable.

original: evameva mahāmaudgalyāyana teṣā hemajālānā vāteritānā vātasaghaṭṭitānā ghoṣo niścarati valgu manojñaḥ āsecanako apratikūlo śravaṇāya
analyzed: evam eva mahāmaudgalyāyana teṣām hema jālānām vāta īritānām vāta saghaṭṭitānām ghoṣaḥ niścarati valgu manojñaḥ āsecanakaḥ a pratikūlaḥ śravaṇāya
translated: Even so, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, from those golden nets, when stirred and shaken by the wind, there came a sound sweet, entrancing, ravishing, stirring, pleasing, delightful, charming, exhilarating, gladdening, and agreeable.

original: dīpavatī khalu punarbho mahāmaudgalyāyana rājadhānī aśūnyā abhūṣi imehi evarūpehi śabdehi sayyathāpi hastiśabdehi rathaśabdehi pattiśabdehi 🔽bherīśabdehi mṛdaṅgaśadehi paṇavaśabdehi śakhaśabdehi veṇuśabdehi vīṇāśabdehi gītaśabdehi vāditraśabdehi aśnutha khādatha pibatha detha dānāni
analyzed: dīpavatī khalu punarbho mahāmaudgalyāyana rājadhānī a śūnyā abhūṣi imehi evarūpehi śabdehi sayyathā api hasti śabdehi ratha śabdehi patti śabdehi  bherī śabdehi mṛdaṅga śadehi paṇava śabdehi śakha śabdehi veṇu śabdehi vīṇā śabdehi gīta śabdehi vāditra śabdehi aśnutha khādatha pibatha detha dānāni
