translated: We too, for the benefit of the world, will enjoy delightful pleasures of love,

original: pūjārtha tava atideva manuṣyaloke vasiṣyāmo //🔽te vimalaruciravarṇa mandāravapuṣpavarṣamākāśe /
analyzed: pūjā artha tava atideva manuṣya loke vasiṣyāmaḥ  te vimala rucira varṇa mandārava puṣpa varṣam ākāśe
translated: in order to worship you, O supreme god, we will dwell in the human world.🔽They rained down a shower of coral tree flowers of pure and bright color from the sky,

original: pravarṣinsu udagracittāḥ śuci sumadhurāhi vācāhi //
analyzed: udagra cittāḥ śuci su madhurāhi vācāhi
translated: raining them down with joyful minds, with pure and very sweet words.

original: yamamaravasanā praśamanamanoramā śokaduḥkhavinimiśrā /
analyzed: yam amara vasanā praśamana manoramā śoka duḥkha vinimiśrā
translated: Wearing the garments of Yama and the gods, pleasing with the pacification of the mind, mixed with sorrow and suffering,

original: na nandasi na ca niṣevasi kāmānidamadbhuta tubhya //
analyzed: na nandasi na ca niṣevasi kāmān idam adbhuta tubhya
translated: You do not rejoice nor do you indulge in desires. This is truly amazing for you.

original: ya pi abhibhūya marugaṇa jambūnadaparvatopamaprakāśo /
analyzed: ya pi abhibhūya maru gaṇa jambūnada parvata upama prakāśaḥ
translated: Having surpassed the hosts of Maruts, shining like the Jambu River gold mountain,

original: udyotayasi daśa diśā surarṣabha ida pi āścarya //
analyzed: udyotayasi daśa diśā surarṣabha ida pi āścarya
translated: You illuminate the ten directions, O bull among gods. This is also a wonder.

original: abhibhavasi devasaghā samaheśvaradānavā samāragaṇā /
analyzed: abhibhavasi deva saghā sa maheśvara dānavā sa māra gaṇā
translated: You surpass the assemblies of gods, Maheśvara, Dānavas, and the hosts of Māras,

original: tārāgaṇā khagacarā amitamati ida pi āścarya //
analyzed: tārā gaṇā khagacarā amitamati idam pi āścarya
translated: The hosts of stars, and the birds. O one of immeasurable mind, this is also a wonder.

original: ki cāpi viprayoga tvayā na iccāma bhūtasaghaguru /
analyzed: ki ca api viprayoga tvayā na iccāma bhūta sagha guru
translated: And although you do not wish for separation from the assembly of beings, O Guru of Beings,

original: p / api tvaravindanayanā bhaviṣyasi gatirnaramarūṇā //
analyzed: api tu aravinda nayanā bhaviṣyasi gatiḥ nara marūṇā
translated: You will become the goal of humans and gods, with eyes like a blue lotus.

original: atha cyavanakālasamaye viśuddhaśatapatrapadmanayanasya /
analyzed: atha cyavana kāla samaye viśuddha śatapatra padma nayanasya
translated: Then, at the time of passing away, with eyes like a pure hundred-petaled lotus,

original: ānandito marugaṇaḥ ghoṣeti diśāhi sarvāhi //
analyzed: ānanditaḥ maru gaṇaḥ ghoṣa iti diśāhi sarvāhi
translated: The hosts of Maruts are delighted and proclaim it in all directions.

original: eṣā ca vartati kathā tuṣitapure sā ca apratimā sudīpā /
analyzed: eṣā ca vartati kathā tuṣitapure sā ca apratimā su dīpā
translated: And this story circulates in the city of Tuṣita, that incomparable, very bright one,

original: rājño'rcimasya mahiṣī rājānupetya idamāha //
analyzed: rājñā ūrcimasya mahiṣī rājā an upetya idam āha
translated: Approaching King Arcimat's queen, she says this:

original: sā hariṇavatsanayanā viśuddhagandharvavadhunibhā śyāmā /
analyzed: sā hariṇa vatsa nayanā viśuddha gandharva vadhu nibhā śyāmā
translated: She with eyes like a fawn, with the appearance of a pure Gandharva maiden, dark-skinned,

original: sahitamida arcimasya sumadhuramidamabravi sudīpā //
analyzed: sahitam arcim asya su madhuram idam abravi su dīpā
translated: Together with her, he spoke these very sweet and luminous words to Arcimat:

original: ābharaṇastambhitabhujā pravaravasanadhāriṇī sakhīhi saha /
analyzed: ābharaṇa stambhita bhujā pravara vasana dhāriṇī sakhīhi saha
translated: With your arms adorned with ornaments, wearing the finest clothes, together with your friends,

original: tvayā vinā rājarṣabha rajanīminā kṣapayitu chando //
analyzed: tvayā vinā rāja ṛṣabha rajanīminā kṣapayitu chandaḥ
translated: O bull among kings, I wish to spend the night without you.

original: śataraśmisya naravarā prāsādavarasya uttamā bhūmi /
analyzed: śata raśmisya nara varā prāsāda varasya uttamā
translated: On the highest floor of the excellent palace Shatarashmi,

original: śayanavaramāruhe yatra kumudavasanasannibha vimala //
analyzed: śayana varam āruhe yatra kumuda vasana sannibha vimala
translated: Ascend the excellent bed, which is pure and resembles a white lotus.

original: tena vacanena tuṣṭo devīye arcimā manāpena /
analyzed: tena vacanena tuṣṭaḥ devīye arcimā manāpena
translated: Delighted by the goddess's pleasing words, Arcimat,

original: āmantrayati naravaro parivāramudagrasakalpo //
analyzed: āmantrayati nara varaḥ parivāram udagra sa kalpaḥ
translated: The best of men, summoned his retinue, which was like the highest peak.

original: prativedayantu me laghu śataraśmi pravarakusumasachanna /
analyzed: prativedayantu me laghu
translated: Quickly announce to me in Shatarashmi, covered with the finest flowers,

original: muktakusumāvakīrṇa karotha divi devabhuvana vā //🔽osaktapaṭṭadāma śataraśmi śobhatā capalameva /
analyzed: mukta kusuma avakīrṇa karotha divi deva bhuvana vā  osakta paṭṭa dāma śata raśmi śobhatā capalam eva
translated: Scattered with loose flowers, make it like the celestial world in heaven.🔽Let Shatarashmi be adorned with hanging silk banners, swiftly,

original: varahemajālacchanna sumeruvaraśṛgasakāśa //
analyzed: vara hema jāla channa sumeru vara śṛga sakāśa
translated: Covered with nets of excellent gold, like the peak of Mount Sumeru.

original: caturaginī ca senā saśūlanārācatomaravicitrā /
analyzed: catur aginī ca senā sa śūla nārāca tomara vicitrā
translated: And let the fourfold army, with its various spears, arrows, and lances,

original: parivārayatā capala śataraśmimanojñasaghāta //
analyzed: parivārayatā capala śata raśmi manojña saghāta
translated: Swiftly surround the delightful Shatarashmi.

original: osṛṣṭā yevājñā narapatinā sajja eva ca sarva /
analyzed: osṛṣṭāḥ narapatinā sajje eva ca
translated: As soon as the king's command was issued, everything was ready.

original: kṛtvā tatra svakula rājānamupetya idamāhu //🔽p / varṣasahasramanūna āyuḥ paripāletu mahīpālo /
analyzed: kṛtvā tatra sva kula rājānam upetya idam āhu  āyuḥ paripāletu
translated: Having done so, they approached their king and said this:🔽May the king protect his life for a thousand years without deficiency.

original: sajja ti vimānavara śobhati tava harṣasajanana //
analyzed: sajja ti vimāna vara śobhati tava harṣa sa janana
translated: The excellent celestial palace shines, generating joy.

original: atha sā amaravadhunibhā devī utthāya āsanavarāto /
analyzed: atha sā amara vadhu nibhā devī utthāya
translated: Then the queen, who was like an immortal woman, rose from her excellent seat

original: abravīt mahīpativara āditye astamitamātre //🔽eṣā samādiyāmi prāṇiṣu avihisa brahmacariya ca /
analyzed: abravīt mahīpati varaḥ āditye astamita mātre  eṣā samādiyāmi prāṇiṣu avihisa brahmacariya ca
translated: and said to the excellent king, As soon as the sun has set.🔽I undertake to abstain from harming beings, to practice celibacy,

original: viramāmi cāpyadinnānmadyādanibaddhavacanācca //🔽akhilavacanācca naravara prativiramāmi tathaiva paiśunyāt /
analyzed: viramāmi ca api a dinnāt madyāt anibaddha vacanāt ca  akhila vacanāt ca nara vara prativiramāmi tathā eva paiśunyāt
translated: and to abstain from alcohol, which is the cause of heedlessness.🔽O best of men, I also abstain from harsh speech and from divisive speech.

original: paruṣavacanācca narapati viramāmi aya mama cchando //
analyzed: paruṣa vacanāt ca narapati viramāmi mama chandaḥ
translated: O lord of men, I abstain from idle chatter, and this is my wish.

original: parakāmeṣu ca īrṣyā na sajaneṣya nāpi abhidroha /
analyzed: parakāmeṣu ca īrṣyā na sajaneṣya nā api abhidroha
translated: I will not be jealous of others' pleasures, nor will I be envious or malicious.

original: bhūteṣu upajaneṣya viparītamati ca vijahāmi //
analyzed: bhūteṣu viparīta mati ca vijahāmi
translated: I will generate compassion towards beings and abandon wrong views.

original: ekādaśaprakāra śīla sevāmyaha pṛthivipāla /
analyzed: ekādaśa prakāra śīla sevāmi aha pṛthivipāla
translated: O lord of the earth, I serve the eleven-fold morality.

original: rajanīmimāmanūnāmeva mama jāyate chandaḥ //
analyzed: rajanīm imām anūnām eva mama jāyate chandaḥ
translated: This is my wish for the remaining part of this night.

original: api cakkhu bhūmipālā kāmavitarko mā mā pratikākṣi /
analyzed: api bhūmipālā kāma vitarkaḥ mā mā
translated: Moreover, O lord of the earth, do not expect lustful thoughts from me.

original: preṣaya mā te apuṇya bhaveya mama brahmacāriṇiye //🔽sarve tava sakalpā paripūremīti pārthivo avaci /
analyzed: preṣaya mā te apuṇya bhaveya mama brahmacāriṇiye  sarve tava sakalpā paripūremi iti pārthivaḥ avaci
translated: Send me away, lest there be misfortune for me, your celibate disciple.”🔽“I will fulfill all your wishes,” said the king.

original: abhirama bhavanavaragatā aha ca rājya ca te vaśya //🔽sā strīsahasramagrya anurakta gṛhya ta vimānavara /
analyzed: abhirama bhavana vara gatā aha ca rājya ca te vaśya  sā strī sahasram agrya anurakta gṛhya te vimāna vara
translated: “Be happy, having gone to your fine abode, and the kingdom is subject to you.”🔽She, the foremost of a thousand women, took her beloved and entered the fine palace.

original: abhiruhya abhiniṣīde manāpaparipūrṇasakalpā //🔽sā kañcideva kāla tasmi himakumudapuṇḍarīkanibhe /
analyzed: abhiruhya abhiniṣīde manāpa paripūrṇa sakalpā  sā kañcid eva hima kumuda puṇḍarīka nibhe
translated: Having ascended, she sat down, her wishes fulfilled and pleasing.🔽For some time, in that bed resembling a snow-white lotus,

original: śayane prasamadamaratā tuṣṇībhāvena kṣepayati /
analyzed: śayane tuṣṇībhāvena kṣepayati
translated: she passed the time in silence, with peaceful and passionless thoughts.

original: l p / sā dāni dakṣiṇena pārśvena parinyāse śarīravara /
analyzed: tad dāni dakṣiṇena pārśva parinyāsa śarīra vara
translated: Then she lay down on her right side, her excellent body in the posture of a sleeping lion,

original: kusumalatā va drumavara śayana parivelliyāśayitā //🔽atha tā niśāmya śayanopagatā devī divi pramadārūpanibhā /
analyzed: kusuma latā druma vara  atha tāḥ niśāmya śayana upagatā devī divi pramadā rūpa nibhā
translated: like a flowering vine wrapped around an excellent tree, lying down.🔽Then, seeing the queen lying down in bed, like a celestial maiden in heaven,

original: tuṣitālayā cyaviya devagaṇāḥ prāsādamūrdhni pratisthihisu //
analyzed: deva gaṇāḥ prāsāda mūrdhni
translated: the hosts of gods from the Tusita abode stood on the roof of the palace.

original: te mūrdhanā abhinatā sarve hṛṣṭā kṛtājalipuṭāḥ amarā /
analyzed: te mūrdhanā abhinatā sarve hṛṣṭā kṛtājalipuṭāḥ amarā
translated: All of them, with their heads bowed down, delighted, their hands folded in respect, the immortals,

original: vandanti tā vipulapuṇyadharā devī jinasya jananī śayane //
analyzed: vandanti tāḥ vipula puṇya dharāḥ devī jinasya jananī śayane
translated: worshiped the queen, the mother of the Victorious One, who possesses great merit, lying down in bed.

original: atha kautūhalapara sajaniyā bahudevakanyā śucimālyadharā /🔽jinamāturupagatā draṣṭumanā prāsādamūrdhni pratiṣṭhihisu //
analyzed: atha bahu deva kanyā śuci mālya dharā  jinamātuḥ upagatāḥ draṣṭu manāḥ prāsāda mūrdhni
translated: Then, out of curiosity, many celestial maidens, wearing pure garlands,🔽approached the mother of the Victorious One, wishing to see her, and stood on the roof of the palace.

original: upasakramitvā śayanopagatā devī niśāmya varavidyunibhā /
analyzed: upasakramitvā śayana upagatā devī niśāmya vara vidyut nibhā
translated: Having approached and seen the queen lying down, who was like an excellent lightning bolt,

original: prītisukha vipula sajaniyā atha sapravarṣi divija kusuma //
analyzed: prīti sukha vipula atha sa pravarṣi divija
translated: with great joy and happiness, a rain of celestial flowers fell from the sky.

original: mānuṣyaka pi kila edṛśaka rūpa sujātamidamāścarya /
analyzed: kila su jātam idam āścarya
translated: It is said that such a well-formed human form is a wonder.

original: kacitkāla sthihiyamantaro nāya samā maruvadhūhi bhave //🔽līlā niśāmayatha he sakhikā pramadāyimasya yatha opayikā /
analyzed: bhave  līlā niśāmayatha he sakhikā
translated: For how long will it remain? It is not equal to the celestial maidens.🔽Look at her playful movements, O friends, as if she were a young woman.

original: śayane virocati mana harati vibhrājate kanakamarīciriva //
analyzed: śayane virocati harati vibhrājate kanaka marīciḥ iva
translated: She shines on the bed, captivating the mind, like a ray of gold.

original: ayanta dhareṣyati mahāpuruṣa atyantadānadamaśīlarata /
analyzed: ayanta mahā puruṣa atyanta dāna dama śīla rata
translated: She will give birth to a great man, who delights in giving, self-control, and morality to the highest degree.

original: sarvāśravāntakaraṇa viraja ki hāyate tava narendravadhū //
analyzed: sarva āśrava anta karaṇa viraja ki hāyate tava narendra vadhū
translated: O queen of men, why are you not delighted that he will put an end to all defilements and be free from dust?

original: cāpodare karatalapratime vararomarājivicitre rucire /
analyzed: cāpa udare kara tala pratime vara romarāji vicitre rucire
translated: In her womb, which is like the palm of the hand, adorned with a beautiful line of hair, delightful,

original: iha so bhaviṣyati anantamatiḥ satata alipta aśubhena śuci //
analyzed: iha saḥ bhaviṣyati ananta matiḥ satata alipta aśubhena śuci
translated: there will be born one of infinite wisdom, always unstained by impurity, pure.

original: bahudīrgharātranicita kuśala pramadāyimasya vipula parama /
analyzed: bahu dīrgha rātra nicita kuśala vipula parama
translated: The mother of this one who has accumulated merit for a long time, who is greatly supreme,

original: p / yā ta dhareṣyati anantaguṇa cirarātrasannicitapuṇyabala //🔽anurūpā tva ca pramadā pravarā mātā sa caiṣa puruṣapravaro /
analyzed: yā te ananta guṇa cira rātra sannicita puṇya bala  anurūpā ca pramadā pravarā mātā sa ca eṣa puruṣa pravaraḥ
translated: Will bear him, of infinite qualities, through the power of merit accumulated over a long time.🔽You are a suitable and excellent woman, and he is the best of men,

original: putro prahīnavanatho virajo ki hāyate tava narendravadhū //
analyzed: virajaḥ ki hāyate tava narendra vadhū
translated: The son who has abandoned illness and is free from defilements. Why are you not happy, queen of the king?

original: atha rākṣasā vividharūpadharā āṇattā divi parito capala /
analyzed: atha rākṣasāḥ vividha rūpa dharāḥ āṇattāḥ divi
translated: Then the demons, assuming various forms, were ordered: Fly around in the sky and all around,

original: tiṣṭhantu bho pravaraśastradharāḥ sarvadiśā kurutha asavaraṇā //
analyzed: tiṣṭhantu bho pravara śastra dharāḥ sarva diśā kurutha a savaraṇā
translated: You who carry excellent weapons, stand guard. Make all directions unobstructed.

original: teṣāmanantara dvijihvagaṇā ārakṣahetu diśatāsu sthitāḥ /
analyzed: teṣām anantara dvijihva gaṇāḥ ārakṣa hetu sthitāḥ
translated: Immediately after them, the groups of two-tongued ones were stationed in the directions for the purpose of protection.

original: vāta pi yeṣa calita śruṇiya krodha samutpatati agnisamo //
analyzed: vāta pi krodha samutpatati
translated: Hearing the sound of the wind moving, anger arises in them like fire.

original: teṣāmanantaragatāḥ thapitā yakṣāḥ pradīptaśikharā vikṛtā /
analyzed: teṣām anantara gatāḥ thapitāḥ yakṣāḥ pradīpta śikharā vikṛtā
translated: Immediately after them, the Yakshas were placed, with distorted, blazing peaks,

original: ye duṣṭacittā vinivārayātha mā ca vadha kurutha kasyacāpi //
analyzed: ye duṣṭa cittāḥ vinivāraya atha mā ca vadha kurutha kasyaca api
translated: Who, with evil intentions, should be restrained, and should not kill anyone at all.

original: teṣāmantantarasthitā balavā gandharvasagho śubharūpadharāḥ /
analyzed: teṣām antantara sthitāḥ balavāḥ śubha rūpa dharāḥ
translated: Immediately after them, the powerful Gandharva hosts, possessing beautiful forms, were stationed,

original: ārakṣahetu śubhacāpadharā varalakṣaṇā vipulabuddhimato //
analyzed: śubha cāpa dharāḥ vara lakṣaṇāḥ
translated: Holding bows and arrows, bearing auspicious marks, and possessing vast wisdom.

original: catvāri lokapatino sthapitā gagane svayaparivāreṇa saha /
analyzed: catvāri gagane svaya parivāreṇa saha
translated: The Four Great Kings, along with their own retinues, are stationed in the sky,

original: adya cyaviṣyati kila bhagavā lokasya arthasukhavṛddhikaro //
analyzed: adya cyaviṣyati kila bhagavā lokasya
translated: Thinking, Today the Blessed One, who brings about the increase of happiness and benefit for the world, will pass away.

original: tridaśehi sārdha tridaśapravaro sthitu antarīkṣe varacakradharo /
analyzed: tridaśehi sārdha tridaśa pravaraḥ sthitu antarīkṣe vara cakra dharaḥ
translated: The supreme one among the Thirty-Three, together with the Thirty-Three, stands in the sky, holding a supreme wheel.

original: acira cyaviṣyati cyuti caramā ākākṣamāṇa sukha apratima //
analyzed: acira cyaviṣyati cyuti caramā ākākṣamāṇa sukha apratima
translated: Soon, he will pass away, his last passing, desiring incomparable happiness.

original: devīya mūle bahu devagaṇā kṛtvā daśāguli natābhimukhā /
analyzed: mūle bahu deva gaṇā kṛtvā
translated: At the foot of the goddess, many hosts of gods, with palms joined, bow to him.

original: samudīrayanti vacana madhura ullokayanti tuṣiteṣu jina //
analyzed: samudīrayanti vacana madhura ullokayanti tuṣiteṣu jina
translated: They utter sweet words and look up to the Victor in the Heaven of Joy.

original: vyavadānasannicitapuṇyabalā samayo khu antimamupetu bhava /
analyzed: vyavadāna sannicita puṇya balā bhava
translated: The time has come for you, who have accumulated merit and the power of purification, to attain your final existence.

original: sajjā tāva bhavati te jananī anukampa dāni duḥkhitā janatā //
analyzed: sajjā tāva bhavati te jananī anukampa dāni duḥkhitā janatā
translated: Your mother is ready. Have compassion for the suffering people.

original: p / eṣo cyavāmi iti muci girā śubha vacana udīrayi / / / / / / / / /
analyzed: eṣo cyavāmi iti muci girā śubha vacana udīrayi
translated: I will descend, he says with a clear voice, uttering auspicious words.

original: atha supina janani jinasya tasmi kṣaṇe paśyate varavipākaphala //
analyzed: atha janani jinasya tasmi kṣaṇe paśyate vara vipāka phala
translated: Then, at that moment, the mother of the Victor sees a supreme dream with excellent results:

original: himarajatanibho se ṣaḍviṣāṇo sucaraṇacārubhujo suraktaśīrṣo /
analyzed: hima rajata nibhaḥ se ṣaṣ viṣāṇaḥ su caraṇa cāru bhujaḥ su rakta śīrṣaḥ
translated: He was like snow or silver, with six tusks, beautiful feet and trunk, and a lovely red head.

original: udaramupagato gajapradhāno lalitagatiḥ anavadyagātrasandhiḥ //
analyzed: udaram upagataḥ gaja pradhānaḥ lalita gatiḥ anavadya gātra sandhiḥ
translated: The chief of elephants, with graceful gait and flawless joints, entered her womb.

original: na khalu punarmahāmaudgalyāyana bodhisattvā kālapakṣe mātuḥ kukṣimavakrāmanti /
analyzed: na khalu punar mahāmaudgalyāyana bodhisattvāḥ kāla pakṣe mātuḥ kukṣim avakrāmanti
translated: Moreover, Mahāmaudgalyāyana, Bodhisattvas do not enter their mother's womb during the dark fortnight.

original: atha pūrṇāyā pūrṇamāsyā puṣyanakṣatrayogayuktāyā bodhisatvā mātuḥ kukṣimavakrāmanti //
analyzed: atha pūrṇāyāḥ pūrṇamāsyāḥ puṣya nakṣatra yoga yuktāyāḥ bodhisatvāḥ mātuḥ kukṣim avakrāmanti
translated: But when the full moon is joined with the constellation Puṣya, then Bodhisattvas enter their mother's womb.

original: upoṣadhikāyā ārohasampannāyā pariṇāhasampannāyā vyaktāyā agrayauvanamaṇḍaprāptāyā vinītāyā bahuśrutāyā smṛtāyā samprajānāyā sarvākārapradakṣiṇacittāyā
analyzed: upoṣadhikāyāḥ āroha sampannāyāḥ pariṇāha sampannāyāḥ vyaktāyāḥ agra yauvana maṇḍa prāptāyāḥ vinītāyāḥ bahu śrutāyāḥ smṛtāyāḥ samprajānāyāḥ sarva ākāra pradakṣiṇa cittāyāḥ
translated: When the mother is fasting, endowed with height and girth, mature, in the prime of youth, disciplined, learned, mindful, fully aware, with a mind inclined to all that is wholesome,

original: sarvākārapratirūpāyā pramadottamāyā bodhisatvā mātuḥ kukṣimavakrāmanti //
analyzed: sarva ākāra pratirūpāyāḥ pramadā uttamāyāḥ bodhisatvāḥ mātuḥ kukṣim avakrāmanti
translated: and when she is the most excellent of women, suitable in every way, then Bodhisattvas enter their mother's womb.

original: bodhisatvena mahāmaudgalyāyana tuṣitabhavanagatena cyavanakāle prabhā osṛṣṭā yāye prabhāye sarva buddhakṣetra obhāsita //
analyzed: bodhisatvena mahāmaudgalyāyana tuṣita bhavana gatena cyavana kāle prabhā osṛṣṭā sarva buddhakṣetraḥ
translated: When the Bodhisattva, Mahāmaudgalyāyana, was dwelling in Tuṣita, at the time of his descent, he emitted a light that illuminated all the Buddha-fields.

original: devaputro devaputra pṛccati //
analyzed: deva putraḥ deva putra pṛccati
translated: A god asked another god:

original: ki kāraṇa suravareṇa prabhā pramuktā candrāśuśītalatarā kanakāvadātā /
analyzed: suravareṇa prabhā pramuktā candra āśu śītalatarā kanaka avadātā
translated: What is the reason, O best of gods, that you have emitted this radiance, which is cooler than the moon and snow, and shines like gold?

original: yenāsureśvaragaṇā manujeśvarāśca prahlāditā ca narakā jvalanārcikalpā //
analyzed: yena asura īśvara gaṇāḥ manuja īśvarāḥ ca prahlāditā ca narakāḥ jvalana arci kalpā
translated: By which the hosts of Asura lords and human lords are delighted, and the hells, which are like blazing flames, are gladdened.

original: so dāni āha //
analyzed: saḥ dāni āha
translated: He said:

original: ye tatra tatra janatā pratipālayanti sasārapajaragatā madanābhibhūtā /
analyzed: ye tatra tatra janatā pratipālayanti madana abhibhūtā
translated: Those people who are there, protected by their mothers, overcome by passion,

original: teṣā vimokṣakaraṇena mahāyaśena āmantraṇārtha anaghena prabhā pramuktā //
analyzed: teṣām vimokṣa karaṇena mahā yaśena āmantraṇa artha anaghena prabhā pramuktā
translated: for the sake of their liberation, the greatly famous one, the sinless one, has emitted this radiance as an invitation.

original: p / bodhisatvo āha //
analyzed: bodhisatvaḥ āha
translated: Then the Bodhisattva said:

original: mucatha amarā purāṇi na kila prāmodyasya aya kālaḥ /
analyzed: mucatha amarā purāṇi na kila prāmodyasya aya kālaḥ
translated: You should leave the cities, O immortals, this is not the time for joy.

original: jarāmaraṇapura bhettu kālo jñānaprahāreṇa //
analyzed: kālaḥ jñāna prahāreṇa
translated: It is time to break through the city of old age and death with the weapon of knowledge.

original: bodhisatvo smṛto saprajāno pradakṣiṇacitto mātuḥ kukṣimavakrānto iti //
analyzed: bodhisatvaḥ smṛtaḥ sa prajāno pradakṣiṇa cittaḥ mātuḥ kukṣim avakrāntaḥ iti
translated: The Bodhisattva, mindful and fully aware, with a benevolent mind, entered his mother's womb.

original: so nadīya sihanāda narasiho cyavanakālasamayasmi /
analyzed: saḥ
translated: Like a lion's roar in the forest, the lion among men, at the time of his passing away,

original: antarahito kṣaṇena narendrabhavane samutpadye //
analyzed: kṣaṇena narendra bhavane samutpadye
translated: disappeared and in an instant was reborn in the palace of the king of men.

original: yo so tuṣita kāya obhāseti śubhena varṇena /
analyzed: yaḥ saḥ tuṣita kāyaḥ śubhena varṇena
translated: He who illuminated the Tusita realm with his beautiful complexion,

original: devapurāccyavamāno anativaro lokapradyotaḥ //
analyzed: deva purāt cyavamānaḥ an ativaraḥ loka pradyotaḥ
translated: the supreme one, the light of the world, passing away from the city of the gods,

original: sabrahmaka ca loka saśramaṇabrāhmaṇā prajā sarvā /
analyzed: sa brahmaka ca loka sa śramaṇa brāhmaṇā prajā sarvā
translated: The world with its Brahma gods, its ascetics and brāhmans, its devas and men,

original: varṇenobhāseti anativaraḥ lokapradyoto //
analyzed: varṇena ubhāsā iti an ativaraḥ loka pradyotaḥ
translated: Was suffused with a radiance more excellent than the light of the sun and moon.

original: āscaryamadbhutamida paśyatha yāvat maharddhikaḥ śāstā /
analyzed: āscaryam adbhutam ida paśyatha yāvat maharddhikaḥ śāstā
translated: Behold this marvel and this wonder, that the mighty Master,

original: smṛtimā susaprajāno mātuḥ kukṣismi okrānto //
analyzed: smṛtimā su saprajānaḥ mātuḥ kukṣismi okrāntaḥ
translated: Mindful and self-possessed, entered his mother’s womb.

original: yāvacca naravarapravara uttamalakṣaṇasamagi asthāsi /
analyzed: yāvat ca nara vara pravaraḥ uttama lakṣaṇa samagi asthāsi
translated: And as the Best of Men, endowed with the highest virtues, entered,

original: mātāye kuṣkismi smṛtimatimā saprajāno ca //
analyzed: smṛti matimā saprajāno ca
translated: Mindful and self-possessed, his mother’s womb,

original: samanantaraukrānte ca mahāmaudgalyāyana bodhisatve mahāsatve mātuḥ kukṣismi iya mahāpṛthivī atīva ṣaḍvikāra kampe sakampe prakampe saharṣaṇīya
analyzed: ca mahāmaudgalyāyana bodhisatve mahāsatve mātuḥ iya mahā pṛthivī atīva ṣaṣ vikāra kampe sa kampe prakampe sa harṣaṇīya
translated: Immediately, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, after the Bodhisattva, the Great Being, had entered his mother’s womb, the great earth shook, trembled, quaked, quivered, quivered strongly, quivered strongly all over, and there was a great, strong, overpowering shock.🔽It shook, trembled, quaked, quivered, quivered strongly, quivered strongly all over, and there was a great, strong, overpowering shock.

original: ca kampe darśanīya ca harṣaṇīya ca modanīya ca premaṇīya ca prahlādanīya ca nirvarṇanīya ca ullokanīya ca p / āsecanaka ca apratikūla 🔽ca prāsādika ca prasaraṇīya ca nirudvega ca niruttrāsa ca //
analyzed: ca kampe darśanīya ca harṣaṇīya ca modanīya ca premaṇīya ca prahlādanīya ca nirvarṇanīya ca ullokanīya ca āsecanaka ca a pratikūla  ca prāsādika ca prasaraṇīya ca nirudvega ca niruttrāsa ca
translated: It was lovely, delightful, charming, captivating, refreshing, and inspiring.

original: kampamānā ca punarna kacitsatva vyābādhati yamida jagama sthāvara vā //
analyzed: kampamānā ca punar na kacid satva vyābādhati yam idam sthāvara vā
translated: And as it shook, trembled, quaked, quivered, quivered strongly, quivered strongly all over, and there was a great, strong, overpowering shock, it did not distress any living being in the universe, whether animal, bird, or worm.

original: tato aya sāgaramerumaṇḍalā prakampitā ṣaḍvidhamāsi medinī /
analyzed: sāgara meru maṇḍalā prakampitā ṣaḍvidha mā asi medinī
translated: Then this earth, with its oceans and Mount Meru, shook in six ways.

original: kṛto ca loko vimalo manoramo mahāndhakārāpanudasya tejasā //
analyzed: ca lokaḥ vimalaḥ manoramaḥ mahā andhakārāpanudasya tejasā
translated: And the world became pure and delightful through the splendor of the one who removes great darkness.

original: so ya mahānubhāvo smṛtimā tuṣitabhavanāccyavitvāna /
analyzed: saḥ ya mahā anubhāvaḥ smṛtimān tuṣita bhavanāt cyavitvāna
translated: He, the one of great power, mindful, having descended from the Tusita abode,

original: pāṇḍaravarāhakanibho bhavitva gajarūpi ṣaḍḍanto //🔽vīraśayane śayantiye poṣadhikāye viśuddhavasanāye /
analyzed: gajarūpi  vīra śayane śayantiye poṣadhi kāye viśuddha vasanāye
translated: Taking on the form of a white elephant with six tusks.🔽While the mother was lying in the hero's bed, fasting, wearing pure clothes,

original: smṛto saprajāno kuśalo mātuḥ kukṣismi okrāntaḥ //
analyzed: smṛtaḥ sa prajāno kuśalaḥ mātuḥ kukṣismi okrāntaḥ
translated: Mindful, fully aware, skilled, she conceived in her womb.

original: sā ca rajanīprabhāte ākhyāso bhartuno manāpasya /
analyzed: sā ca rajanī prabhāte ākhyāsaḥ bhartunaḥ manāpasya
translated: And in the morning, she announced to her dear husband:

original: rājavara pāṇḍaro me gajarājā kukṣimokrānto //
analyzed: rāja vara pāṇḍaraḥ me gaja rājā
translated: O best of kings, a white elephant king has entered my womb.

original: ta śṛṇuya bhartu rājā vaipacanikā samāgatā avaci /
analyzed: te śṛṇuya bhartu rājā vaipacanikā samāgatā
translated: Hearing this, the king summoned the diviners and said:

original: supinasmi asyā sarve bhaṇātha bhūta phalavipāka //
analyzed: sarve
translated: All of you, tell me the future result of this dream.

original: te tatrāpi avacisu nimittikā pṛcchitā svaya rājñā /
analyzed: te tatra api avacisu nimittikā pṛcchitā svaya rājñā
translated: They, too, were asked by the king himself, the diviners:

original: dvātriśallakṣadharo kukṣi devīya okrānto //
analyzed: dvātriśat lakṣa dharaḥ
translated: The one who bears the thirty-two marks has entered the womb of the queen.

original: hṛṣṭo bhavāsi naravara yasya tava kulasmi pratyutpanno /
analyzed: hṛṣṭaḥ bhavāsi nara vara yasya tava pratyutpannaḥ
translated: You should be delighted, O best of men, that he has been born in your family.

original: pṛthivīdhara varagarbho anupamasatvo mahāsatvo //
analyzed: pṛthivīdhara vara garbhaḥ anupama satvaḥ mahā satvaḥ
translated: The supreme embryo of the earth-holder, the incomparable being, the great being,

original: yatha maya paurāṇānāmācāryāṇā svaya samupāhṛta /
analyzed: yatha maya paurāṇānām ācāryāṇām svayam samupāhṛta
translated: Just as I have heard from the ancient teachers themselves,

original: p / dve sya gatayo ananyā bhavanti naravīraśārdūla //
analyzed: dve sya gatayaḥ ananyāḥ bhavanti nara vīra śārdūla
translated: The two destinies of the tiger among men and heroes are not different,

original: yadi āsiṣyati agāre mahīpati hoti saratano maharddhiko /
analyzed: yadi āsiṣyati agāre mahīpati saratanaḥ maharddhikaḥ
translated: If he remains in the household, he becomes a lord of the earth, possessing treasures and great wealth,

original: nityānubaddhavijayo rājaśatasahasraparivāro //
analyzed: nitya anubaddha vijayaḥ rāja śata sahasra parivāraḥ
translated: Always victorious, surrounded by a hundred thousand kings.

original: atha khalu pravrajiṣyati cāturdvīpā mahī vijahiyāna /
analyzed: atha khalu pravrajiṣyati cāturdvīpā mahī
translated: But if he goes forth, he abandons the four continents,

original: hohiti ananyaneyo buddho netā naramarūṇā //
analyzed: an anya neyaḥ buddhaḥ netā nara marūṇā
translated: He becomes a Buddha, the leader of men and gods, not to be led by another.

original: yāvattakā nāgarājāno nāgādhipatayo te sarve bodhisatvasya rakṣāvaraṇaguptīye autsukyamāpadyensuḥ //
analyzed: yāvattakāḥ nāga rājānaḥ nāga adhipatayaḥ te sarve bodhisatvasya rakṣā āvaraṇa guptīye autsukyam āpadyensuḥ
translated: As many nāga kings and nāga lords there are, they all became eager to protect, guard, and watch over the Bodhisattva.

original: bodhisatve khalu punarmahāmaudgalyāyana mātuḥ kukṣigate yāvanto suvarṇarājāno suvarṇādhipatayo te sarve bodhisatvasya rakṣāvaraṇaguptīye autsukyamāpadyensuḥ
analyzed: bodhisatve khalu punar mahāmaudgalyāyana mātuḥ kukṣi gate yāvantaḥ suvarṇa rājānaḥ suvarṇa adhipatayaḥ te sarve bodhisatvasya rakṣā āvaraṇa guptīye autsukyam āpadyensuḥ
translated: When the Bodhisattva had entered his mother's womb, Mahāmaudgalyāyana, all the Suvarṇa kings and Suvarṇa lords became eager to protect, guard, and watch over the Bodhisattva.

original: catvāro pi mahārājāno bodhisatvasya rakṣāvaranaguptīye autsukyamāpadyensuḥ //
analyzed: catvāraḥ pi mahā rājānaḥ bodhisatvasya rakṣāvaranaguptīye autsukyam āpadyensuḥ
translated: The four great kings also became eager to protect, guard, and watch over the Bodhisattva.

original: caturo pi lokapālā rakṣāmakarinsu lokanāthasya /
analyzed: caturaḥ pi lokapālāḥ lokanāthasya
translated: The Four Great Kings also kept watch over the Lord of the world.

original: mā kocī ahitaiṣī namucibalanuda vihiseya //
analyzed: mā kocī ahita eṣī namuci bala nuda vihiseya
translated: May no one who wishes him ill, no one who is hostile to the one who has overcome Namuci, get a chance.

original: śakro devānāmindro suyāmo pi devaputro satuṣito pi devaputro sunirmito pi devaputro vaśavartī pi devaputro mahābrahmā pi śuddhāvāso pi devaputro
analyzed: śakraḥ devānām indraḥ suyāmaḥ pi deva putraḥ satuṣitaḥ pi deva putraḥ sunirmitaḥ pi deva putraḥ vaśavartī pi deva putraḥ mahābrahmā pi śuddhāvāsaḥ pi deva putraḥ
translated: Śakra, lord of the devas, and the deva Suyāma, the deva Santuṣita, the deva Sunirmita, the deva Vaśavartin, the great Brahmā, and the Śuddhāvāsa deva

original: bodhisatvasya mātuḥ kukṣigatasya rakṣāvaraṇaguptīye autsukyamāpadyensuḥ //
analyzed: bodhisatvasya mātuḥ kukṣi gatasya rakṣā āvaraṇa guptīye autsukyam āpadyensuḥ
translated: were eager to protect, guard, and conceal the Bodhisattva who had entered his mother's womb.

original: sahasrāṇi devānāmarcimapuramupagatāni tuṣṭāni /
analyzed: sahasrāṇi devānām arcima puram upagatāni tuṣṭāni
translated: Thousands of shining devas approached the city, rejoicing.

original: ārakṣārtha / / / / / /varabuddhino amarapuramiva //🔽manorama dīpavatīpuramuttama kṛtamanuviśantehi /
analyzed: ārakṣa artha vara buddhinaḥ amara puram iva  manorama dīpavatī puram uttama kṛtam anuviśanta ihi
translated: For the sake of guarding the one of excellent wisdom, like in the city of the immortals.🔽The delightful and excellent city of Dīpavatī is filled with those who have entered.

original: manomayavikramagatehi amaragaṇehi abhivirocati //
analyzed: manaḥ maya vikrama gatehi amara gaṇehi abhivirocati
translated: It shines forth with the assembly of immortals who move with the speed of thought.

original: p / devī parivāretvā maheśvaragaṇānā kila sahasrāṇi /
analyzed: devī kila sahasrāṇi
translated: It is said that thousands of Mahêśvara hosts, along with the queen's retinue,

original: aṣṭau gagaṇatalagatā ākāśagatā abhiniṣaṇā //
analyzed: aṣṭau gagaṇa tala gatāḥ ākāśa gatāḥ abhiniṣaṇā
translated: eight of them, are seated in the sky, in the sky's realm.

original: teṣā dāni pṛṣṭhato indrasahasrāṇi vimalaśikharāṇi /
analyzed: teṣām dāni pṛṣṭhatas indra sahasrāṇi vimala śikharāṇi
translated: Behind them, thousands of Indras, of Vimalashikharas,

original: subahuni bahuguṇasya ārakṣārtha niṣaṇāni //
analyzed: su bahuni bahuguṇasya ārakṣā artha
translated: many of them, are seated for the sake of guarding the one of many virtues.

original: teṣā dāni pṛṣṭhato devendrāṇā sahasranayutāni /
analyzed: teṣām dāni pṛṣṭhatas deva indrāṇā sahasra nayutāni
translated: Behind them were thousands of nayutas of the lords of the gods,

original: kāmāvacarā devā niṣaṇā gagane nirālambe //
analyzed: kāmāvacarāḥ devāḥ niṣaṇāḥ gagane nirālambe
translated: and the gods of the desire realm, seated in the sky, without support.

original: teṣā devagaṇānā pṛṣṭhato asurā asurāṇā ca dvijihvagaṇā /
analyzed: teṣām deva gaṇānām pṛṣṭhatas asurāḥ asurāṇām ca dvijihva gaṇāḥ
translated: Behind those hosts of gods were the asuras and the multitudes of the two-tongued ones,

original: yakṣāśca vikṛtarūpā rākṣasasaghāśca sanniṣaṇā //
analyzed: yakṣāḥ ca vikṛta rūpāḥ rākṣasa saghāḥ ca sanniṣaṇā
translated: and the yakshas of distorted forms and the hordes of rakshasas were seated.

original: etāye vidhiye gagaṇa amaraśatasahasrasakula śrīma /
analyzed: gagaṇa
translated: In this way, the sky was filled with hundreds of thousands of celestial beings, glorious,

original: atyantasupariśuddha kuśalapumacita hi virajena //
analyzed: atyanta su pariśuddha hi virajena
translated: extremely pure, with virtuous minds, and stainless.

original: mahābrahmā āha //
analyzed: mahābrahmā āha
translated: Mahabhrama said:

original: svapnāntare yā pramadā dadarśa sūrya nabhā kukṣimanupraviṣṭa /
analyzed: svapna antare yā pramadā dadarśa sūrya nabhā kukṣim anupraviṣṭa
translated: The woman who in a dream sees the sun enter her womb,

original: prasūyate sā varalakṣaṇāga so bhavati rājā balacakravarti //
analyzed: prasūyate sā saḥ bhavati rājā bala cakravarti
translated: she will give birth to one with the best marks, he becomes a powerful universal monarch.

original: svapnāntare yā pramadā dadarśa candra nabhā kukṣimanupraviṣṭa /
analyzed: svapna antare yā pramadā dadarśa candra nabhā kukṣim anupraviṣṭa
translated: The woman who in a dream sees the moon enter her womb,

original: prasūyate sā naradevagarbha so bhavati rājā varacakravartī //
analyzed: prasūyate sā naradeva garbha saḥ bhavati rājā vara cakravartī
translated: she gives birth to a divine child, he becomes a supreme universal monarch.

original: svapnāntare yā pramadā dadarśa śveta gaja kukṣimanupraviṣṭa /
analyzed: svapna antare yā pramadā dadarśa śveta gaja kukṣim anupraviṣṭa
translated: The woman who in a dream sees a white elephant enter her womb,

original: prasūyate sā gajasattvasāra so bhavati buddho budhitārthadharmo //
analyzed: prasūyate sā gaja sattva sāra saḥ bhavati buddhaḥ
translated: she gives birth to the essence of the best of elephants, he becomes a Buddha, enlightened for the sake of the Dharma.

original: p / devī sa pṛccati //
analyzed: devī sa pṛccati
translated: The queen asked:

original: ki dharesi //
analyzed: ki dharesi
translated: What do you bear?

original: sā āha //
analyzed: sā āha
translated: She replied:

original: cakravartinti //
analyzed: cakravartinti
translated: A universal monarch.

original: kukṣi prabhāsayanta kanakavapu pravaralakṣaṇasamagi /
analyzed: kukṣi prabhāsayanta kanaka vapu pravara lakṣaṇa samagi
translated: Your womb shines, your golden body has the supreme marks,

original: dhāremi cakravarti varapuruṣa rājaśārdūla //
analyzed: dhāremi cakravarti vara puruṣa rāja śārdūla
translated: I bear a universal monarch, a supreme man, a lion among kings.

original: devā nabhe bhagavato ghoṣamudīrayensuḥ //
analyzed: devāḥ nabhe bhagavataḥ ghoṣam udīrayensuḥ
translated: The gods in the sky exclaimed the Blessed One's name:

original: buddho bhaviṣyati na rājā balacakravartī //
analyzed: buddhaḥ bhaviṣyati na rājā bala cakravartī
translated: He will be a Buddha, not a powerful universal monarch.

original: mahābrahmā gāthā bhāṣati //
analyzed: mahābrahmā gāthāḥ bhāṣati
translated: Great Brahma spoke this verse:

original: gaja ratnaśreṣṭha madanabalavegāpanayana pradīpa lokasya tamatimiramohāpanayana /
analyzed: gaja ratna śreṣṭha madana bala vega apanayana pradīpa lokasya
translated: The best jewel of an elephant, removing the force and speed of passion, a lamp for the world, removing the darkness and delusion of ignorance,

original: guṇānā koṣa tva aparimitaratnākaradhara dhareṣi rājarṣi apratihatacakra amararuci //
analyzed: guṇānā tva aparimita ratna ākara dhara dhareṣi rājarṣi apratihata cakra amara ruci
translated: You bear a treasure of qualities, a storehouse of immeasurable jewels, a royal sage with an invincible wheel, shining like an immortal.

original: devī āha //
analyzed: devī āha
translated: The queen said:

original: yatha mama na rāgadoṣā prasanti narendragarbhamupalabhya /
analyzed: mama na rāga doṣā narendra garbham upalabhya
translated: As passion and faults do not arise in me upon conceiving a human embryo,

original: niḥsaśaya bhaviṣyati samaruci yatha niścarati vācā //
analyzed: niḥsaśaya bhaviṣyati vācā
translated: There is no doubt that you will have the same radiance as the one who speaks thus.

analyzed: bodhisatvaḥ khalu punar mahāmaudgalyāyana mātuḥ kukṣi gataḥ na pittena vā śleṣmeṇa vā rudhireṇa vā anyena vā puna kenacid aśucinā apariśuddhaḥ tiṣṭhati  atha khalu ucchādita snāpita viśada gātraḥ bodhisatvaḥ mātuḥ tiṣṭhati  bodhisatvaḥ khalu punar mahāmaudgalyāyana mātuḥ kukṣi gataḥ paśyati
translated: “Again, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, when the Bodhisattva has entered his mother’s womb, he is not defiled by bile, phlegm, blood, or any other impure or unclean matter.🔽He is clean and pure in body, and remains so until he comes forth from his mother’s womb.🔽“Again, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, when the Bodhisattva has entered his mother’s womb, she sees him within her body like a figure of gold.

original: bodhisatvamātāpi kukṣigata bodhisatva paśyati vigrahamiva jātarūpasya dṛṣṭvā ca bhavati āttamanā kukṣi obhāsenta vigrahamiva jātarūpasya
analyzed: bodhisatva mātā api kukṣi gata bodhisatva paśyati vigraham iva jātarūpasya dṛṣṭvā ca bhavati ātta manāḥ vigraham iva jātarūpasya
translated: And the Bodhisattva’s mother, beholding the Bodhisattva within her body like a figure of gold, is enraptured, and her body is suffused with joy and happiness.

original: yathā veruliyasya maṇi sphāṭikasamudgasmi nihito asyā evameva bodhisatva paśyati mātā kukṣimobhāsenta vigrahamiva jātarūpasya //
analyzed: yathā veruliyasya maṇi nihitaḥ asyāḥ evam eva bodhisatva paśyati mātā vigraham iva jātarūpasya
translated: Just as a cat’s-eye gem, set in a diadem on the head of a noble man or a noble woman, shines and radiates, so did the Bodhisattva appear in his mother’s womb, shining and radiant.

original: p / bodhisatve khalu punarmahāmaudgalyāyana mātuḥ kukṣigate devasaghāḥ sukharātri sukhadivasa pṛcchakā āgacchanti /
analyzed: bodhisatve khalu punar mahāmaudgalyāyana mātuḥ kukṣi gate deva saghāḥ sukha rātri sukha divasa pṛcchakāḥ āgacchanti
translated: Again, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, when the Bodhisattva has entered his mother’s womb, a throng of devas comes to ask after her health.

original: tā ca bodhisatvo abhinandati dakṣiṇakaramutkṣipya mātaramabādhamāno //
analyzed: tā ca bodhisatvaḥ abhinandati dakṣiṇa karam utkṣipya mātaram a bādhamānaḥ
translated: And the Bodhisattva greets them by raising his right hand, but without hurting his mother.

original: bodhisatva khalu punarmahāmaudgalyāyana mātuḥ kukṣigata devā nāgā yakṣā dānavā rākṣasā piśācā na jahanti divā vā rātri vā na cātra āsagakathā
analyzed: bodhisatva khalu punar mahāmaudgalyāyana mātuḥ kukṣi gata devāḥ nāgāḥ yakṣāḥ dānavāḥ rākṣasāḥ piśācāḥ na jahanti divā vā rātri vā na ca atra āsaga kathā  /
translated: Again, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, when the Bodhisattva has entered his mother’s womb, devas, Nāgas, Yakṣas, Dānavas, Rākṣasas, and Piśācas never leave her, night or day,

original: kathīyati kāmopasahitā vā anyā vā asatyā kathā /
analyzed: kathīyati kāma upasahitā vā anyā vā asatyā kathā
translated: and no idle talk is heard there.

original: nānyatra bodhisatvavarṇameva bhāṣanti rūpataḥ sattvataḥ tejataḥ varṇataḥ yaśataḥ kuśalamūlataḥ //
analyzed: na anyatra bodhisatva varṇam eva bhāṣanti rūpataḥ sattvataḥ tejataḥ varṇataḥ yaśataḥ kuśala mūlataḥ
translated: They talk only of the Bodhisattva, of his beauty, his strength, his splendour, his colour, his glory, and his roots of goodness.

original: bodhisatvasya mātuḥ kuṣigatasya pūjā noparamati //
analyzed: bodhisatvasya mātuḥ kuṣi gatasya pūjā na uparamati
translated: And the worship of the Bodhisattva in his mother’s womb never ceases.

original: divyāni tūryāṇi vādyanti divyāni agurudhūpāni dhūpenti divya puṣpavarṇa varṣati divya cūrṇa varṣati //
analyzed: divyāni tūryāṇi vādyanti divyāni aguru dhūpāni dhūpenti divya puṣpa varṇa varṣati divya cūrṇa varṣati
translated: Divine musical instruments were played, divine incense of aloeswood was burnt, and a rain of divine flowers and powders fell.

original: apsarasahasrāṇi ca upagāyanti upanṛtyanti pi //🔽bodhisatve khalu punarmahāmaudgalyāyana mātuḥ kukṣigate bodhisatvamātā devakanyāsahasrehi sārdha abhyābhavati hāsya ca kathā ca //
analyzed: apsara sahasrāṇi ca upagāyanti upanṛtyanti pi  bodhisatve khalu punar mahāmaudgalyāyana mātuḥ kukṣi gate bodhisatva mātā deva kanyā sahasrehi sārdha abhyābhavati ha asya ca kathā ca
translated: Thousands of Apsarases sang and danced before her.🔽Again, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, when the Bodhisattva has entered his mother’s womb, she becomes possessed of a deva’s beauty, and she is attended by thousands of deva maidens, and she is happy and well.

original: prasuptā ca punarbodhisatvamātara devakanyā māndāravadāmena parivījenti bodhisatvasya tejena //
analyzed: prasuptā ca punar bodhisatva mātara deva kanyāḥ māndārava dāmena bodhisatvasya tejena
translated: And when the Bodhisattva’s mother falls asleep, deva maidens fan her with flower garlands.

original: aya ca punarmahāmaudgalyāyana trisāhasramahāsahasrāyā lokadhātūyamanuttarā garbhākrāntipāramitā //
analyzed: ca punar mahāmaudgalyāyana tri sāhasra mahā sahasrāyāḥ lokadhātu iyam anuttarā garbha ākrānti pāramitā
translated: And this, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, is the perfection of the conception of the Supreme of Men in the world with its devas and men.

original: anya ca dāni paśyatha āścarya tasyā devaparṣāye /
analyzed: anya ca dāni paśyatha āścarya tasyāḥ devaparṣāye
translated: And now behold the marvel in the deva assembly.

original: tāva vipulāye yā kathā abhū paramaharṣasajananī //🔽na ca kāmakathānyā vā nāpyapsarasā kathā na gītakathā /
analyzed: yā  na ca kāma kathā anyā vā na api apsarasā kathā na gīta kathā
translated: So great was the talk that arose, causing the utmost joy.🔽There was no talk of sensual pleasures, nor of the Apsarases, nor of singing,

original: na ca vādyakathā teṣā na pi buktakathā na pānakathā //
analyzed: na ca vādya kathā teṣām na bukta kathā na pāna kathā
translated: nor of music, nor of eating, nor of drinking.

original: nābharaṇakathā teṣā na pi vastrakathā pravartati kadācit /
analyzed: na ābharaṇa kathā teṣām vastra kathā pravartati kadācid
translated: They do not talk about ornaments, nor about clothes, ever.

original: p / yānodyānakathā vā manasāpi na jāyate teṣā //
analyzed: yāna udyāna kathā vā manasā api na jāyate teṣām
translated: They do not even think about talk about vehicles, gardens, or parks.

original: sādhū puṇyabalavato dyutī anupamā sadevaka loka /
analyzed: sādhū puṇya balavataḥ dyutī anupamā sa devaka
translated: The virtuous ones, powerful in merit, have incomparable radiance in the world with its gods.

original: abhabhavati nāyakasya vikasati eṣā kathā tatra //
analyzed: abhabhavati nāyakasya vikasati eṣā kathā tatra
translated: This talk unfolds there for the leader.

original: sādhu garbhāvakramaṇamanopama rūpapāramigatasya /
analyzed: sādhu garbhāvakramaṇa manaḥ upama rūpa pārami gatasya
translated: It is good that the one who has attained the perfection of form enters the womb in an incomparable way.

original: iti vikasati bahuvidhā kathā pariṣāmadhye etasmi //
analyzed: iti vikasati bahuvidhā kathā pariṣā madhye
translated: Thus, this talk unfolds in many ways in the midst of the assembly.

original: sādhūhi nirāmiṣehi sajñāpadehi kṣapenti ta kāla /
analyzed: nirāmiṣehi sajñāpadehi kṣapenti ta kāla
translated: The virtuous ones, free from worldly desires, spend that time with words of truth.

original: varabuddhino iya api kathā vikasati pariṣāmadhye //
analyzed: varabuddhinaḥ iya api kathā vikasati pariṣā madhye
translated: This talk also unfolds in the midst of the assembly for the one with excellent wisdom.

original: eva ca bahuprakārā kathā kathentā ramanti devagaṇā /
analyzed: eva ca bahu prakārā kathā kathentā ramanti deva gaṇā
translated: In this way, the assemblies of gods delight in telling many kinds of stories.

original: rūpa varṇa teja bala ca virajasya kathayantā //
analyzed: rūpa varṇa teja bala ca virajasya kathayantā
translated: They tell stories about the one who is dust-free in terms of form, color, radiance, and strength.

original: sarveṣā bodhisatvānā mātaro paripūrṇe daśame māse prasūyanti //
analyzed: sarveṣā bodhisatvānā mātaraḥ paripūrṇe daśame māse prasūyanti
translated: All Bodhisattvas give birth in the tenth month, when it is complete.

original: daśame māse pūrṇe sudīpā nāma devī rājānamarcima āha /
analyzed: daśame māse pūrṇe sudīpā nāma devī rājānam arcimaḥ āha
translated: When the tenth month was complete, Queen Sudipā said to King Arcimat:

original: deva abhiprāyo me pradmavana ydyāna nirgantu //
analyzed: deva abhiprāyaḥ me pradma vana nirgantu
translated: Your Majesty, I have a desire to go out to the pleasure garden.

original: rājā devīye sudīpāye śrutvā amātyānāha //🔽padmavanamudyāna sāntaḥpuro niṣkramiṣyāmi krīḍārthamiti //🔽padminivana sucapala apagatatṛṇakhaṇḍapatrasaskāra /
analyzed: rājā devīye sudīpāye śrutvā amātyān āha  padmavanam udyāna sa antaḥpuraḥ niṣkramiṣyāmi krīḍā artham iti  su capala apagata tṛṇa khaṇḍa patra saskāra
translated: When King Sudīpa heard this, he said to his ministers,🔽I will go out to the pleasure garden of the lotus grove with my harem for amusement.🔽In the lotus grove, make it swift and clean, free of grass, twigs, leaves, and impurities.

original: varasurabhikusumanikara karotha gandhodakasugandha //🔽padminivane ca vātā tamālapatragandhavāsitaśarīrā /
analyzed: vara surabhi kusuma nikara karotha gandha udaka sugandha  padmini vane ca vātā tamāla patra gandha vāsita śarīrā
translated: Make heaps of the finest fragrant flowers, scented with fragrant water.🔽In the lotus grove, let the breezes, their bodies perfumed with the scent of tamāla leaves,

original: siñcantu amṛtagandhā madajananā ca palāyantu //🔽agaruvaradhūpagarbhā samonamantu nabhato jaladharā ta /
analyzed: siñcantu amṛta gandhāḥ mada jananā ca palāyantu  agaru vara dhūpa garbhā samas namantu nabhataḥ jaladharā te
translated: sprinkle nectar-scented water, and let the maddening breezes blow.🔽Let the clouds, filled with the finest agaru incense, gather in the sky

original: padminivana chādetu varacūrṇarasākula kṣipra //
analyzed: chādetu vara cūrṇa rasa ākula kṣipra
translated: and quickly cover the lotus grove with a canopy of the finest scented powders.

original: p / ekaika ca drumavara dukūlapaṭṭorṇakośikārehi /
analyzed: ekaika ca
translated: Let each of the finest trees be draped with silk, cotton, and woolen cloths.

original: kalpayatha kalpavṛkṣān yatha divi devapradhanasya //
analyzed: kalpayatha kalpavṛkṣān yatha divi deva pradhanasya
translated: Make them like the wish-fulfilling trees in the realm of the gods.

original: devā ca devakanyā ca gandhamālyā gṛhya padminivanaudyānamarcimato āgacchanti //
analyzed: devā ca deva kanyā ca gandha mālyā gṛhya āgacchanti
translated: The gods and the daughters of the gods, carrying perfumes and garlands, come to the radiant lotus grove garden.

original: sphaṭikamaṇikuṇḍadharā vigalitavasanā pralambamaṇihārā /
analyzed: sphaṭika maṇi kuṇḍa dharā vigalita vasanā pralamba maṇi hārā
translated: Holding crystal and jewel bowls, their garments flowing, their pearl necklaces hanging down,

original: ādāya gandhamālya gaganapathagatā olīyanti //
analyzed: ādāya gandha mālya gagana patha gatāḥ olīyanti
translated: they fly through the sky, carrying perfumes and garlands, and hover in the air.

original: māndāravāṇa bharitā kācitsageriyo bharitvāna /
analyzed: bharitā kācid sageriyaḥ
translated: Some, filled with coral trees, and some with wish-fulfilling trees,

original: haricandanasya kacitkāci punaḥ kalpaduṣyāṇā //
analyzed: haricandanasya kacid kāci punar
translated: some with fragrant sandalwood, and some with celestial maidens.

original: sthalajajalaja ca mālya gṛhītvā apsarā muditacittā /
analyzed: sthala ja jala ja ca mālya gṛhītvā apsarāḥ mudita cittā
translated: The celestial nymphs, joyfully holding garlands of land and water flowers,

original: ratanā ābharaṇāni ca jambudvīpa abhimukhīyo //
analyzed: ratanā ābharaṇāni ca jambudvīpa
translated: and jewels and ornaments, are facing towards Jambudvipa.

original: caturaśītimanūna catrasahasrāṇi devakanyāyo /
analyzed: catra sahasrāṇi
translated: The celestial maidens, not less than eighty-four thousand,

original: kanakaratanāmayāni ādāya nabhe pralīyanti //🔽kūṭāgāraśatehi sphaṭikamaṇicitrehi lepanelepitaiḥ /
analyzed: kanaka ratana āmayāni ādāya nabhe pralīyanti  kūṭāgāra śatehi sphaṭika maṇi citrehi lepane lepitaiḥ
translated: carrying golden and bejeweled parasols, are disappearing into the sky.🔽With a hundred storied buildings, adorned with crystal and jewels, plastered with clay,

original: bharitamapi antarikṣa duṣyaśatasamucchritapatāka //
analyzed: bharitam api antarikṣa duṣya śata samucchrita patāka
translated: the sky is filled, with banners raised a hundred duṣyas high.

original: gajaśvasanasannikāśā śāradameghā cābhivirocanti /
analyzed: gaja śvasana sannikāśā śārada meghā ca abhivirocanti
translated: They shine like autumn clouds tinged with the breath of elephants,

original: varasurabhikusumagandhā kamalotpalacampakavimiśrā //
analyzed: vara surabhi kusuma gandhā kamala utpala campaka vimiśrā
translated: with the fragrance of the finest incense, mixed with lotuses, blue lotuses, and campaka flowers.

original: bhujagapatino pi muditā meghehi sugandhatoyabharitehi /
analyzed: bhujaga patinaḥ pi muditāḥ meghehi sugandha toya bharitehi
translated: The lords of the nāgas, too, are delighted, with clouds filled with fragrant water,

original: abhyokiranti gagaṇa anyāni ca adbhutaśatāni //
analyzed: abhyokiranti gagaṇa anyāni ca adbhutaśatāni
translated: sprinkling the sky, and other hundreds of wonders.

original: atha mahāmaudgalyāyana rājā arcimo mahatā rājānubhāvena mahatā rājaṛddhiye mahatīye vibhūṣāye sāntaḥpuro padminīvanamudyāna niryāsi //
analyzed: atha mahāmaudgalyāyana rājā mahatā rāja anubhāvena mahatā rāja ṛddhiye mahatīye vibhūṣāye sa antaḥpuraḥ padminīvanam udyāna niryāsi
translated: Then, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, King Arcimat with great royal pomp, splendour and magnificence, and with his harem, went out to the pleasure garden of the Lotus Grove.

original: p / avagāhya ta vanavara devī sakhiparivṛtā jinajanetrī /
analyzed: avagāhya devī sakhī parivṛtā jina ja netrī
translated: The queen, mother of the Conqueror, surrounded by her friends,

original: vicarati vitrarathe devi amaravadhu yathā ratividhijñā //
analyzed: vicarati vitrarathe devi amara vadhu yathā rati vidhi jñā
translated: went down to the lake and bathed, O queen, in the beautiful boat, like a celestial maiden who knows the rules of love.

original: atha mahāmaudgalyāyana sudīpā devī sakhīhi saparivṛtā padminīye purimapaścimavedihi vitatavitānehi vicitraduṣyaparikṣiptehi osaktapaṭṭadāmakalāpehi
analyzed: atha mahāmaudgalyāyana sudīpā devī sakhīhi sa parivṛtā padminīye purima paścima vedihi vitata vitānehi vicitra duṣya parikṣiptehi osakta paṭṭa dāma kalāpehi
translated: Then, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, Queen Sudīpā, surrounded by her friends, sported in the boat on the lake in the Lotus Grove, on the eastern and western terraces, which were draped with silken cloths, covered with woven silk, hung with silken tassels,

original: lepanalepitehi dhūpanadhūpitehi muktapuṣpāvakīrṇehi vedikājālasapratikṣiptehi ucchritacchatradhvajapatākehi nāvāyānehi prakīḍitā //
analyzed: lepana lepitehi dhūpana dhūpitehi mukta puṣpa avakīrṇehi vedikā jāla sa pratikṣiptehi ucchrita chatra dhvaja patākehi nāvā āyānehi prakīḍitā
translated: smeared with scented ointment, fumigated with incense, strewn with bright flowers, enclosed with lattice-work, and with sunshades, flags and banners set out.

original: atha sudīpāye devīye nāvāyānena kaḍḍhīyantiye kila citta utpanna /
analyzed: atha sudīpāye devīye nāvāyānena kaḍḍhīyantiye kila citte utpanna
translated: And when Queen Sudīpā was being drawn along in the boat, it is said that she conceived the thought:

original: nāvāto otariṣyāmīti //
analyzed: na avātaḥ otariṣyāmi iti
translated: “I will get out of the boat.”

original: bodhisatvānubhāvena ca madhye taḍāgasya dvīpo prādurbhūto samo aviṣamo suvarṇavālikāsastṛto tṛṇāni ca jātāni mṛdūni nīlāni tūlasasparśopamāni
analyzed: bodhisatva anubhāvena ca madhye taḍāgasya dvīpaḥ prādurbhūtaḥ samaḥ aviṣamaḥ suvarṇa vālikā sastṛtaḥ tṛṇāni ca jātāni mṛdūni nīlāni tūla sa sparśa upamāni
translated: And by the power of the Bodhisattva an island appeared in the middle of the lake, even, not uneven, covered with golden sand, and grass grew there, soft, blue, like the finest cotton,

original: mayūragrīvāsannikāśāni caturaṅgula pṛthivīto nikṣipto pade onamanti vṛkṣāṇi cātra prādurbhūtāni phalopetāni sumanojñāni //
analyzed: mayūra grīvā sannikāśāni pade onamanti vṛkṣāṇi ca atra prādurbhūtāni phala upetāni su manojñāni
translated: and the grass bent down to the ground when trodden on by the feet, and trees appeared there, bearing fruit, very delightful.

original: devī tamhi dvīpe pratiṣṭhitā //
analyzed: devī tamhi dvīpe pratiṣṭhitā
translated: The queen stood on that island.

original: na khalu punarmahāmaudgalyāyana bodhisatvamātā śayānā niṣaṇikā vā bodhisatva janeti /🔽na khalu mahāmaudgalyāyana bodhisatvamātā bodhisatva pittena vā śleṣmeṇa vā rudhireṇa vā anyatarānyatareṇa vā aśucināpariśuddha janeti atha
analyzed: na khalu punar mahāmaudgalyāyana bodhisatva mātā śayānā niṣaṇikā vā bodhisatva jana iti  na khalu mahāmaudgalyāyana bodhisatva mātā bodhisatva pittena vā śleṣmeṇa vā rudhireṇa vā anyatara anyatareṇa vā aśucinā apariśuddha jana iti atha
translated: Again, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, the Bodhisattva’s mother does not give birth to him as she lies or sits down.🔽Again, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, the Bodhisattva’s mother does not give birth to him with bile, phlegm, blood or any other kind of impurity, but

original: khalu ucchāditasnāpitaviśadagātra yeva bodhisatva janeti //🔽sā parikilantakāyā drumasya śākhā bhujāya avalambya /
analyzed: khalu ucchādita snāpita viśada gātra yā iva bodhisatva jana iti  sā parikilantakāyāḥ drumasya śākhā bhujāya avalambya
translated: on the contrary, she gives birth to him with a pure body, and his body is washed with warm water.🔽She, with her body weary, leans on the branch of a tree,

original: pravijṛmbhitā salīlā tasya yaśavato jananakāle //
analyzed: pravijṛmbhitā sa līlā tasya yaśavataḥ janana kāle
translated: and stretches herself gracefully at the time of giving birth to him who is full of glory.

original: atha viśati sahasrā marukanyā āśureva sannipatitā /
analyzed: atha viśati sahasrāḥ maru kanyāḥ āśuḥ eva sannipatitā
translated: Then twenty thousand daughters of the gods gathered together,

original: p / devī kṛtājalipuṭāḥ idamavaca prasannasakalpāḥ //
analyzed: devī kṛta ajalipuṭāḥ prasanna sakalpāḥ
translated: the goddesses with folded hands, spoke this, with serene minds:

original: adya jarāvyādhimathana janayiṣyasi amaragarbhasukumāra /
analyzed: adya jarā vyādhi mathana janayiṣyasi amara garbha su kumāra
translated: Today you will give birth to one who conquers old age and sickness, tender like a divine embryo,

original: devī divi bhuvi mahita hita hitakara naramarūṇā //
analyzed: devī divi bhuvi mahita hita hita kara nara marūṇā
translated: O goddess, honored in heaven and on earth, benefactor of gods and humans.

original: mā khu janayī viṣāda parikarma vaya tava kariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: mā khu janayī viṣāda parikarma vaya tava kariṣyāmaḥ
translated: Do not give rise to despair, we will attend to you.

original: ya kartavyamudīraya dṛśyatu kṛtameva tatsarva //
analyzed: kartavyam udīraya dṛśyatu kṛtam eva tat sarva
translated: Whatever needs to be done, speak, and let it all be seen as done.

original: atha caturi lokapālā saparivārā āśureva sannipatitā /
analyzed: atha caturi lokapālā sa parivārā āśuḥ eva sannipatitā
translated: Then the four world guardians, along with their retinues, gathered together,

original: divyapraveṇihastā devimupagatā pradakṣiṇato //
analyzed: divya praveṇi hastā devim upagatā pradakṣiṇatas
translated: with divine lamps in their hands, they approached the goddess and circumambulated her.

original: sarve pi devasaghā devī parivārayitva ākāśe /
analyzed: sarve pi deva saghāḥ devī parivārayitvaḥ ākāśe
translated: All the hosts of gods, having surrounded the goddess in the sky,

original: sthitā mālyagandhahastā svaparivāreṇopaśobhanti //
analyzed: sthitā mālya gandha hastā sva parivāreṇa upaśobhanti
translated: stood with garlands and perfumes in their hands, shining with their own retinues.

original: bodhisatvo smṛto saprajāno mātaramabādhamāno dakṣiṇena pārśvena prādurbhavati //🔽dakṣiṇena hi pārśvena jāyante puruṣottamāḥ /
analyzed: bodhisatvaḥ smṛtaḥ sa prajānaḥ mātaram a bādhamānaḥ dakṣiṇena pārśvena prādurbhavati  dakṣiṇena hi pārśvena jāyante puruṣa uttamāḥ
translated: The Bodhisattva, mindful and aware, emerged from his mother's right side without harming her.🔽For it is from the right side that the best of men are born,

original: sarve puruṣaśārdūlā bhavantyatravihāriṇaḥ //
analyzed: sarve puruṣa śārdūlāḥ bhavanti atravihāriṇaḥ
translated: all the tigers among men, who dwell here in this world.

original: kinta na bhidyate pārśva tasyā jinajanetriye /
analyzed: kinta na bhidyate tasyāḥ jina ja netriye
translated: Why is it that the side of the mother of the Victorious Ones does not split open?

original: janentiye naraśreṣṭha vedanā ca na jāyati //
analyzed: janentiye nara śreṣṭha vedanā ca na jāyati
translated: When giving birth to the best of men, no pain is experienced.

original: manomayena rūpeṇa prādurbhonti tathāgatā /
analyzed: manaḥ mayena rūpeṇa prādurbhonti tathāgatāḥ
translated: The Tathagatas appear in a form made of mind.

original: eva na bhidyate pārśva vedanā ca na jāyate //
analyzed: eva na bhidyate pārśva vedanā ca na jāyate
translated: In this way, the side does not split open and no pain is experienced.

original: garbhāvāsapariśrānto saptadhā vikramate bhuvi /
analyzed: garbhāvāsa pariśrāntaḥ saptadhā vikramate bhuvi
translated: Exhausted from dwelling in the womb, he takes seven steps on the ground.

original: diśā ca praviloketi mahāhāsa ca ūhati //
analyzed: diśā ca pravilokā iti mahā hāsa ca ūhati
translated: He looks in the directions and laughs a great laugh.

original: atra ki kāraṇamukta ya sapta kramate kramān /
analyzed: atra ki kāraṇam ukta yaḥ sapta kramate kramān
translated: What is the reason here that he takes seven steps?

original: na ca aṣṭa na ca ṣaṣṭi atra āgamana śṛṇu //
analyzed: na ca aṣṭa na ca ṣaṣṭi atra āgamana śṛṇu
translated: Not eight, not six, listen to the reason here.

original: p / garbhāsapariśrānto sarvalokahito muniḥ /🔽paścimo garbhāvāso ya atha vegena prakrami //
analyzed: sarva loka hitaḥ muniḥ  paścimaḥ garbhāvāsaḥ yaḥ atha vegena
translated: Exhausted from dwelling in the womb, the Sage, for the welfare of the whole world,🔽after his last dwelling in the womb, quickly takes seven steps.

original: bhūmau saptakrame nyaste devasaghā nilīyatha /
analyzed: bhūmau sapta krame nyaste deva saghāḥ nilīyatha
translated: When the seven steps on the ground are taken, the assembly of gods gathers.

original: sahasā lokapālānāmakehi dharito muniḥ //
analyzed: sahasā dharitaḥ muniḥ
translated: The Sage is held up by the hands of the Lokapalas.

original: atha varṣa samutpadyi divyakusumaśīkaraḥ /
analyzed: atha divya kusuma śīkaraḥ
translated: Then a rain of divine flowers and drops falls,

original: mandāravarajākīrṇa divyacandanasakula //
analyzed: mandāra varaja ākīrṇa divya candana sakula
translated: mixed with the best of mandara flowers, and divine sandalwood.

original: dīrghakāla udagrāśca suramukhyāgradhūpana /
analyzed: dīrgha kāle udagrāḥ ca sura mukhya agra dhūpana
translated: For a long time, the foremost of the gods release the best incense.

original: pramuciṣu vibhūṣārtha tasya uttamabuddhinaḥ //
analyzed: pramuciṣu vibhūṣā artha tasya uttama buddhinaḥ
translated: They release it for the sake of adorning the one with supreme wisdom.

original: yadarthañca viloketi diśā apratipudgalaḥ /
analyzed: yad artham ca vilokā iti diśā apratipudgalaḥ
translated: For what purpose does the peerless one look in the directions?

original: tatrāhamāgama vakṣye upadeśa manorama //
analyzed: tatra aham āgama vakṣye upadeśa manorama
translated: There I will speak of the delightful teaching.

original: na so vidyati satvānā deveṣu manujeṣu ca /
analyzed: na saḥ vidyati satvānā deveṣu manujeṣu ca
translated: There is no being found among the gods or humans,

original: yasyaiva sabhavo bhavet garbhokramaṇameva ca //
analyzed: yasya eva sabhavaḥ bhavet garbha ukramaṇam eva ca
translated: who would have the same nature as him, or the same entry into the womb.

original: khadyotakanakanirbhāsa pārśva jinajanetriye /
analyzed: khadyota kanaka nirbhāsa pārśva jina janetriye
translated: The side of the Victorious One's mother shines like a golden lamp,

original: jāyate yadā sarvajñaḥ jāyanto carame bhave //
analyzed: jāyate yadā sarvajñaḥ jāyanto carame bhave
translated: when the Omniscient One is born, in his final existence.

original: jātamātrasya taccitta abhūtpravaravādino /🔽asti kaścitsamabuddhi me ccetta tarka nivartitu //
analyzed: jāta mātrasya abhūt pravara vādinaḥ  asti me
translated: As soon as he is born, the mind of the supreme speaker becomes🔽Is there anyone equal to me? If so, let him refute me.

original: kecitsasārapāśena arttiyantye yathā aha /
analyzed: kecid sasāra pāśena yathā aha
translated: Some are tormented by the noose of existence, just as I was.

original: ityartha puruṣādityo diśā sarvā nirīkṣati //
analyzed: puruṣa ādityaḥ diśā sarvāḥ nirīkṣati
translated: For this purpose, the Sun among Men looks in all directions.

original: atha diśā vilokento paśyati vadatā varo /
analyzed: atha paśyati vadatā varaḥ
translated: Then, looking in the directions, he sees the best of speakers,

original: devakoṭisahasrāṇi tasmāt hāsa pramucati //
analyzed: deva koṭi sahasrāṇi tasmāt hāsa pramucati
translated: and from that, he emits a smile, for thousands of millions of gods.

original: p / ta jātamātramityāhu devatā mārakāyikā /
analyzed: jāta mātram iti āhu devatā māra kāyikā
translated: Then the gods of Mara's realm say to him, as soon as he is born:

original: cāturdvīpo mahākośo cakravartī bhaviṣyasi //
analyzed: cāturdvīpaḥ mahākośo cakravartī bhaviṣyasi
translated: You will be a universal monarch, with a great treasury over the four continents.

original: athāsya hāso sabhavati na mama satvābhijānatha /
analyzed: atha asya ha āsaḥ sabhavati na mama satvā abhijānatha
translated: Then he smiles, thinking, They do not recognize me as a being.

original: sarvajño sarvadarśī ca bhaviṣya puruṣottamaḥ //
analyzed: sarva darśī ca bhaviṣya puruṣottamaḥ
translated: will become omniscient, all-seeing, and supreme among men.

original: evemeta praśasanti viśeṣā upadeśakāḥ /
analyzed: eva ime eta praśasanti viśeṣāḥ upadeśakāḥ
translated: Thus do the teachers praise the special qualities,

original: tathā hi narasihānā śāsana saprakāśita //🔽ya tiṣṭhantī janaye vīra sakusumiteṣu śāleṣu /
analyzed: tathā hi narasihānā śāsana saprakāśita  ya tiṣṭhantī janaye vīra sa kusumiteṣu śāleṣu
translated: as it has been proclaimed in the teachings of the lion-like men.🔽Those who are born when the sal trees are in full bloom,

original: śarīramavalambyamānā ta anativara jina vande //
analyzed: śarīram avalambyamānā te anativara jina vande
translated: supported by the body, I pay homage to those supreme victors.

original: sapratijāto sugato samehi padehi dharaṇi avatiṣṭhet /
analyzed: sa pratijātaḥ sugataḥ samehi padehi dharaṇi avatiṣṭhet
translated: The Well-Gone One, having been born, stood on the ground with even feet,

original: sapta ca padāni agamā sarvā ca diśā vilokesi //
analyzed: sapta ca padāni agamā sarvā ca diśā
translated: and took seven steps in each direction, surveying all.

original: ta sāma cakramantamanvāgami vījana ca cchatra ca /
analyzed: ta sāma cakramantam anvāgami vījana ca chatra ca
translated: The wheel of Dharma followed him, along with a fan and an umbrella.

original: mā varaviduno kāye daśā maśakā ca nipatensuḥ //
analyzed: mā kāye daśā maśakā ca nipatensuḥ
translated: May no flies or mosquitoes alight on the body of the supreme knower.

original: sapratijāta sugata devā prathama jina pratigṛhṇe /
analyzed: sapratijāta sugata devā prathama jina pratigṛhṇe
translated: The gods first received the Well-Gone One who was born,

original: paścācca ta manuṣyāḥ anativara aṅke dhārensuḥ //
analyzed: paścāt ca ta manuṣyāḥ anativara aṅke dhārensuḥ
translated: and later the humans held the supreme one on their laps.

original: pratyagrahensu devāḥ sugata dvātriśalakṣaṇapradarśi /
analyzed: devāḥ sugata dvātriśa lakṣaṇa pradarśi
translated: The gods received the Well-Gone One, who displays the thirty-two marks,

original: paścācca ta manuṣyā anativara ake dhārensuḥ //
analyzed: paścāt ca ta manuṣyāḥ anativara ake
translated: and later the humans held him on their laps.

original: nirvāyensu pradipā mānuṣakā obhāsitabhūlloka /
analyzed: nirvāyet su pradipā
translated: Human lamps were extinguished, the world illuminated,

original: sapratijāte sugate jñātī udakarthikā pradhāvinsuḥ //
analyzed: sa pratijāte sugate jñātī
translated: When the Sugata was born, his kinsfolk ran to fetch water for the lying-in.

original: atha purato udupānā pūrā mukhato viṣyandensu //
analyzed: atha puratas udupānā pūrā mukhataḥ viṣyanden
translated: Then in front of them a spring of water welled up, and water flowed from it.

original: p / dvi vāridhārā udgami ekā śītasya ekā uṣṇasya /
analyzed: dvi vāridhārā udgami ekā śītasya ekā uṣṇasya
translated: Two streams of water flowed from the sky, one cold, the other hot,

original: yatra snapayensu sugata vigraha iva jātarūpasya //🔽sapratijāte sugate bodhisatvamātā akṣatā caiva abhūṣi avraṇā ca bodhisatvasyaiva tejena //
analyzed: yatra snapayet su sugata vigrahaḥ iva jātarūpasya  sa pratijāte sugate bodhisatva mātā akṣatā ca eva abhūṣi avraṇā ca bodhisatvasya eva tejena
translated: in which the kinsfolk bathed the Sugata’s body, which was like refined gold.🔽When the Sugata was born, the mother of the Bodhisattva was unharmed and suffered no hurt, by virtue of the Bodhisattva.

original: sapratijāte khalu punarmahāmaudgalyāyana bodhisatve bodhisatvamātuḥ kukṣi pratipūrṇā yeva abhūṣi anārabdhā ca bodhisatvasyaiva tejena //
analyzed: sa pratijāte khalu punar mahāmaudgalyāyana bodhisatve bodhisatva mātuḥ kukṣi pratipūrṇā yā iva abhūṣi anārabdhā ca bodhisatvasya eva tejena
translated: When the Bodhisattva was born, the mother of the Bodhisattva was not harmed or injured, by virtue of the Bodhisattva.

original: sapratijāte khalu punarmahāmaudgalyāyana bodhisatve antaradvīpe candanavana prādurbhave bodhisatvasya upabhogaparibhogamāgacche bodhisatvasyaiva 🔽tejena //
analyzed: sa pratijāte khalu punar mahāmaudgalyāyana bodhisatve antara dvīpe candana vana prādurbhave bodhisatvasya upabhoga paribhogam āgacche bodhisatvasya eva  tejena
translated: When the Bodhisattva was born, on the island of Jambu there appeared a forest of sandal-wood trees, which came to be enjoyed and used by the Bodhisattva, by virtue of the Bodhisattva.

original: tatra devaputraśatasahasrāṇi saha gacchanti gandhamālyāhastā bodhisatvasya pūjārtha //
analyzed: tatra devaputra śata sahasrāṇi saha gacchanti bodhisatvasya pūjā artha
translated: There hundreds of thousands of devas went together, bearing fragrant garlands, for the honouring of the Bodhisattva.

original: devaputro devaputra pṛcchati kahi gamiṣyasīti //
analyzed: deva putraḥ deva putra pṛcchati kahi gamiṣyasi iti
translated: A deva son asked him: Son of a deva, where are you going?

original: so tānāha //
analyzed: sā u tān āha
translated: He replied to them:

original: eṣā prasūṣyati narendravadhūttama ta vatsa vibuddhavarapuṣkaragarbhagaura /
analyzed: eṣā prasūṣyati narendra vadhū uttama vatsa vibuddha vara puṣkara garbha gaura
translated: This excellent queen of men is about to give birth, O child, to one whose body is white like a lotus in the best of lakes.

original: yo prāpsyate dharaṇimaṇḍatottamārtha māra nihatya sabala tamupemi vīra //
analyzed: prāpsyate dharaṇi maṇḍa tā uttama artha māra nihatya sa bala tam upemi vīra
translated: He will attain the highest goal on the surface of the earth, O Māra, having defeated you and your army, I will go to that hero.

original: amrakṣitā garbhamalena gātrā jāta jale pakajamuttama vā /
analyzed: amrakṣitāḥ garbha malena gātrāḥ jāta jale vā
translated: His body is unstained by the impurities of the womb, he is born in the water like an excellent lotus.

original: vapuṣmato bālaraviprakāśo sabrahmakānamarānabhibhoti //
analyzed: vapuṣmataḥ bāla ravi prakāśaḥ sa brahmakān amarān abhibhoti
translated: He is radiant, shining like the rising sun, and outshines the devas along with Brahmā.

original: tato jātamātro kule arcimasya atikramya dhīro padānīha sapta /
analyzed: tatas jāta mātraḥ kule arcimasya atikramya dhīro padāni iha sapta
translated: Then, as soon as he was born in the family of Arcimat, the resolute one took seven steps on this earth.

original: samolokayitvā diśā ūhasāsi aya dānimeko bhavo paścimo ti //
analyzed: samolokayitvā diśaḥ ūhasāsi aya dānim ekaḥ bhavaḥ paścimaḥ ti
translated: Having looked in all directions, he laughed and said: This is my last existence.

original: p / tataśca cchatra eka vibhrājamāna maṇīmuktaśreṣṭha parābhāvibhrāja /
analyzed: tatas ca vibhrājamāna maṇīmukta śreṣṭha parābhā vibhrāja
translated: Then a single shining parasol, the best of jewels, outshining all,

original: vidhūtena dāmena mandāravāṇā bahū devaputrā nabhe dhārayensuḥ //
analyzed: vidhūtena dāmena mandāra vāṇāḥ bahū deva putrāḥ nabhe dhārayensuḥ
translated: was held in the sky by many devas, with a garland of pearls and coral.

original: sabālārkaśakhapratīkāśavarṇa vara hemacchatra nabhe dhārayensuḥ //
analyzed: vara hema chatra nabhe
translated: They held a golden parasol in the sky, the color of the rising sun, the best of gold.

original: tato vījanīyo visṛṣṭā bhramensuḥ kareṇa gṛhītvā jina vījayensuḥ //
analyzed: tatas vījanīyaḥ visṛṣṭāḥ bhramensuḥ kareṇa gṛhītvā
translated: Then the scattered flowers were wafted by the wind and fell on the Conqueror’s body.🔽

original: tato puṇyagandhā sukhoṣṇā prabhūtā lahu premaṇīyā hitā mānuṣāṇā /
analyzed: puṇya gandhā sukha uṣṇā prabhūtā lahu premaṇīyā hitā mānuṣāṇā
translated: Then a refreshing breeze, fragrant, warm, and abundant, light, pleasant, and beneficial to humans,

original: śivā nandanīyā tuṣārānubaddhā duve vāridhārā nabhe udgatāsuḥ //
analyzed: śivā nandanīyā tuṣāra anubaddhā vāri dhārāḥ nabhe udgatāsuḥ
translated: a gentle and delightful breeze, accompanied by dew, two streams of water rose up into the sky.

original: tato meruśṛgādanekaprakārā pramuktottarīyā samantormijātā /
analyzed: tatas meru śṛgāt aneka prakārā pramukta uttarīyā samanta ūrmi jātā
translated: Then from the peak of Mount Meru, various kinds of garments were released, forming waves all around.

original: bhṛśa viśvagandhādhivāsānuvātā dṛḍha ṣaḍvikāra mahī kampayensuḥ //🔽suvarṇasya rūpyamaṇīnā śubhānā vimāneṣu devā satūryāvighuṣṭā /
analyzed: bhṛśa viśva gandha adhivāsa anuvātā dṛḍha ṣaṣ vikāra mahī kampayensuḥ  suvarṇasya rūpya maṇīnā vimāneṣu devā sa tūrya a vighuṣṭā
translated: The earth shook strongly in six ways, with a breeze blowing the fragrance of the universe.🔽In the golden, silver, and jeweled palaces, the devas, with their musical instruments playing,

original: sujātānujāta jina prekṣamāṇā sacandrārkatāra nabha śobhayensuḥ //
analyzed: sujāta anujāta jina prekṣamāṇā sa candra arka tāra nabha
translated: looking at the Victoriously Born One, made the sky with its moon, sun, and stars shine.

original: aya so sadeva sanāga sayakṣa p / mahogha maharṣī jaga uttaritvā /
analyzed: aya saḥ sa deva sa nāga sa yakṣa mahā ogha mahā ṛṣī jagaḥ uttaritvā
translated: This one, having crossed over the great flood and the great seers, together with the devas, nāgas, and yakṣas,

original: tataḥ kṣemamekā diśa prāpsyatīti prahṛṣṭāsya devā nabhe vyāharensuḥ //
analyzed: tatas kṣemam ekā diśa prāpsyati iti prahṛṣṭāḥ asya devāḥ nabhe
translated: will attain the one direction of peace. Thus the devas spoke with joyful faces in the sky.

original: rājā arcimo āṇāpesi //
analyzed: rājā arcimaḥ āṇāpesi
translated: King Arcimat ordered:

original: kumāra imāye va devīye pādavandana netha //
analyzed: kumāra imāye vaḥ devīye pāda vandana
translated: Take the prince to the feet of this queen for worship.

original: kīdṛśena yānena kumāro abhiniṣīdatīti //
analyzed: kīdṛśena yānena kumāraḥ abhiniṣīdati iti
translated: On what kind of vehicle will the prince sit?

original: devehi ratanāmayī śivikā nirmitā //
analyzed: rata nāmayī śivikā nirmitā
translated: The gods created a jeweled palanquin.

original: ko imā śivikā vahiṣyatīti //🔽catvāro mahārājā upasthitā //
analyzed: kaḥ imāḥ śivikāḥ vahiṣyati iti  catvāraḥ mahā rājāḥ
translated: Who will carry this palanquin?

original: vaya satvasāra vahiṣyāma bodhisatva sudīpā ca devī dhātrī ca bodhisatvasya //
analyzed: vaya satva sāra vahiṣyāma bodhisatva sudīpā ca devī dhātrī ca bodhisatvasya
translated: The Four Great Kings appeared, saying, We will carry the palanquin of the Bodhisattva, the essence of beings, and Queen Sudīpā will be the Bodhisattva's wet-nurse.

original: śivikāmārūḍhā śakro ca devānāmindro mahābrahmā ca utsāraṇa karonti //
analyzed: śivikām ārūḍhā ca devānām indraḥ mahābrahmā ca
translated: When the Bodhisattva was placed in the palanquin, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, and Great Brahmā cleared the way.

original: eva bodhisatvo mahatīye vibhūṣāye mahatīye samṛddhīye mahatīye devaṛddhīye mahatīye rājaṛddhīye padminīvanāto udyānāto dīpavatī rājadhānī
analyzed: eva bodhisatvaḥ mahatīye vibhūṣāye mahatīye samṛddhīye mahatīye devaṛddhīye mahatīye rājaṛddhīye padminī vanātaḥ udyānātaḥ dīpavatī rājadhānī  /
translated: Thus the Bodhisattva, with great adornment, great prosperity, great divine prosperity, and great royal prosperity, entered the capital city of Dīpavatī from the park in the lotus grove.

original: praveśīyati devīye kalamupanītaḥ //
analyzed: devīye kalam upanītaḥ
translated: The queen held him in her lap.

original: naro cetiyeṣu praviṣṭo akāmo mahālokanātho narendrāṇa śāstā /
analyzed: naraḥ cetiyeṣu praviṣṭaḥ akāmaḥ mahā loka nāthaḥ śāstā
translated: The one who entered the shrines, the unwilling great lord of the world, the teacher of men, the lord of men,

original: yadā uttamāgena vandāpayensuḥ tato asya pādāni prādurbhavensu //
analyzed: yadā uttamāgena vandāpayensuḥ tatas asya pādāni prādurbhavensu
translated: when they wanted to have him worshipped with the highest worship, then his feet appeared.

original: tato devatā devatā ityavocat na eṣo nurūpo mama vandamāno /
analyzed: tatas devatāḥ devatāḥ iti avocat na eṣaḥ nurūpaḥ mama vandamānaḥ
translated: Then the gods said to the gods, This is not suitable for me to worship.

original: praṇāma ca eṣo yadyanyasya kuryāt dṛḍha saptadhā asya mūrdhna phaleyā iti //
analyzed: praṇāma ca eṣaḥ yadi anyasya kuryāt dṛḍha saptadhā asya mūrdhna phaleyāḥ iti
translated: If he would pay homage to another, his head would surely split into seven pieces.

original: jātamātre kumārerthasiddhī sukhī sarve satvā abhūdyāvadavīci /
analyzed: jāta mātre kumāra irtha siddhī sukhī sarve satvāḥ abhūt yāvat avīci
translated: As soon as the prince was born, all beings became prosperous and happy, down to the Avīci hell.

original: praṇāma ca kurvī devāḥ /
analyzed: praṇāma ca kurvī devāḥ
translated: And the gods paid homage to him.

original: tasya sarve prahṛṣṭāḥ //
analyzed: tasya sarve prahṛṣṭāḥ
translated: All of them were delighted.

original: p / rājakula ca kumāre praviṣṭe uvāca purohita nṛpatiḥ /
analyzed: rājakula ca kumāre praviṣṭe uvāca purohita nṛpatiḥ
translated: When the prince entered the royal palace, the king said to the priest:

original: lakṣaṇavidhiguṇakuśalā viprānparyeṣatha śīghra //
analyzed: lakṣaṇa vidhi guṇa kuśalāḥ viprān paryeṣatha śīghra
translated: Seek out quickly brahmins skilled in the rules of the marks!

original: ta vijñāya ca devā maheśvarā nāma cittavaśavartī /
