analyzed: ta vijñāya ca devāḥ maheśvarāḥ nāma citta vaśavartī
translated: And the gods, knowing this, the Maheśvaras named Cittarājās,

original: mā lakṣaṇā akuśalā vikalpayiṣyanti dvijasaghā //
analyzed: mā lakṣaṇāḥ akuśalāḥ vikalpayiṣyanti dvijasaghā
translated: Do not let the assemblies of brahmins speculate about the unfavorable marks!

original: vigatamadamānadarpāḥ aṣṭa sahasrā maheśvaravarāṇā /
analyzed: vigata mada māna darpāḥ aṣṭa sahasrāḥ maheśvara varāṇām
translated: The eight thousand excellent Maheśvaras, free from conceit, pride, and arrogance,

original: devagaṇehi gurukṛta sapratijāta upagamensuḥ //🔽te rājakuladvāre śucivasanavarasthitā stimitaśabdā /
analyzed: deva gaṇehi gurukṛta sa pratijātaḥ upagamensuḥ  te rājakula dvāre śuci vasana vara sthitā stimita śabdā
translated: approached the one who had been born with the honor of the gods.🔽They stood at the gate of the royal palace, well-dressed and silent,

original: pratihārarakṣamabravītsumadhurakaravikarutaghoṣāḥ //
analyzed: pratihāra rakṣam abravīt su madhura karavika ruta ghoṣāḥ
translated: and with a voice sweet, soft, and pleasant, they said to the doorkeeper:

original: rājavara upagamya brūvīhi ime lakṣaṇaguṇavidhijñāḥ /
analyzed: rāja varaḥ upagamya brūvīhi ime lakṣaṇa guṇa vidhi jñāḥ
translated: Approach the excellent king and tell him that these ones skilled in the rules of the marks

original: tiṣṭhanti aṣṭasahasra praviśensuḥ yadi anumatante //
analyzed: tiṣṭhanti aṣṭasahasra praviśensuḥ yadi anumatante
translated: stand here. If it is agreeable to him, let them enter.

original: sādhūti pratiśrutvā pratihārarakṣo praviśya rājakula /
analyzed: sādhu uti pratiśrutvā pratihāra rakṣo praviśya
translated: The doorkeeper, having agreed, entered the royal palace and said to the king:

original: abravītkṛtājalipuṭo prītimanaso pṛthivīpāla //
analyzed: abravīt kṛta ājali puṭaḥ prīti manasaḥ pṛthivīpāla
translated: With a joyful mind, he joined his palms and said to the king:

original: atulabala dīptayaśasā kāraya rājya cira nihataśatruḥ /
analyzed: atula bala dīpta yaśasā kāraya rājya cira nihata śatruḥ
translated: O King of incomparable strength, rule your kingdom for a long time, with your enemies destroyed.

original: dvāre te amarasadṛśāstiṣṭhanti praveṣṭumicchanti //
analyzed: dvāre te amara sadṛśāḥ tiṣṭhanti praveṣṭum icchanti
translated: At your gate stand those who are like gods, wishing to enter.

original: pratipūrṇavimalanayanā madhurasvaramattavāraṇavicārī /
analyzed: pratipūrṇa vimala nayanā madhura svara matta vāraṇa vicārī
translated: With eyes full of purity and clarity, with a sweet voice, they are like intoxicated elephants.

original: bhavati mama teṣu sakā na te manujā devaputrā te //
analyzed: bhavati mama teṣu sakāḥ na te manujāḥ deva putrā te
translated: I have affection for them, but they are not human, they are sons of gods.

original: paricakramatā teṣā dharaṇirajo kramavarā na sakirati /
analyzed: paricakramatā teṣām dharaṇiḥ ajaḥ krama varā na
translated: As they walk, the dust of the earth does not soil their excellent feet.

original: na ca sāna paśyāmi pada pṛthyāmida api āścarya //
analyzed: na ca sāna paśyāmi pada pṛthyāmida api āścarya
translated: And I do not see any footprints of theirs on the ground, which is also a wonder.

original: gambhīrastimitaceṣṭā āryākārā praśāntadṛṣṭipathā /
analyzed: gambhīra stimita ceṣṭā ārya ākārā praśānta dṛṣṭi pathā
translated: They move with a deep and still gait, with noble forms and a peaceful gaze.

original: vipulā janenti prīti janasya samudīkṣamāṇasya //
analyzed: vipulā prīti janasya samudīkṣamāṇasya
translated: They inspire great joy in the people who see them.

original: anya ca dāni adbhuta śarīracchāyā na dṛśyate teṣā /
analyzed: anya ca dāni adbhuta śarīra chāyā na dṛśyate teṣām
translated: Moreover, their bodily shadows are not seen,

original: p / na ca teṣu sandhiśabdo cakramatā śrūyate kaścit //🔽niḥsaśaya upagatā putravara tava naravarādhipa draṣṭu /
analyzed: na ca teṣu cakramatā śrūyate kaścid  niḥsaśayaḥ upagatā putra vara tava nara vara adhipa draṣṭu
translated: and no sound of their joints is heard as they walk.🔽O best of men, O lord of men, there is no doubt that they have come to see your son.

original: abhinandya ca abhivandya ca paśyāsi ayonijā devā //
analyzed: abhinandya ca abhivandya ca paśyāsi ayonijā devā
translated: Having greeted and paid homage to him, you will see the gods born from the womb.

original: varamālyagandhahastā līlāceṣṭā manoramaśarīrā /
analyzed: vara mālya gandha hastā līlā ceṣṭā manorama śarīrā
translated: With garlands, fragrances, and hands, with graceful movements, with a delightful body,

original: dīpyantā iva śiriye asaśaya pravaramarutaste //🔽ta arcimo niśāmya vacanamida harṣakampitaśarīro /
analyzed: dīpyantaḥ iva śiriye asaśaya pravara marutaḥ te  te niśāmya harṣa kampita śarīraḥ
translated: Their hands adorned with garlands, perfumes, and jewels, their graceful movements delightful, their bodies radiant with splendor, undoubtedly they are the most excellent of gods.🔽Having heard this speech, which brought joy, his body trembling with delight,

original: abravīdbhaṇe sucapala praviśantu niveśanamudāra //
analyzed: abravīt bhaṇe su capala praviśantu niveśanam udāra
translated: he said, Speak quickly! Let them enter the magnificent palace.

original: ki kāraṇa na edṛśāḥ prākṛtapuruṣāṇa bhonti ākārāḥ /
analyzed: ki kāraṇa na edṛśāḥ prākṛtapuruṣāṇa bhonti ākārāḥ
translated: What is the reason that such are the appearances of ordinary men?

original: na pi mānuṣāṇa edṛśī ṛddhi bhavati yādṛśī bhaṇasi //
analyzed: na pi mānuṣāṇaḥ edṛśī ṛddhi bhavati yādṛśī bhaṇasi
translated: And such is not the power of men as you speak of.

original: atha so pratihārarakṣo upagamya maheśvarānidamavocat /
analyzed: atha saḥ pratihāra rakṣaḥ upagamya maheśvarān idam avocat
translated: Then that doorkeeper approached and said this to the Maheśvaras:

original: prahvo kṛtājalipuṭo praṇamya hṛṣṭo muditacitto //🔽abhinandate narapatiḥ praviśantu bhavanto devapurakalpa /
analyzed: prahvaḥ kṛta ājali puṭaḥ praṇamya hṛṣṭaḥ mudita cittaḥ  abhinandate narapatiḥ praviśantu bhavantaḥ deva pura kalpa
translated: Humble, with palms joined in respect, bowing down, delighted, with a joyful mind,🔽the king welcomes them. Let them enter, like gods, into the palace

original: rājavṛṣabhasya veśma narādhipatinā anujñātāḥ //
analyzed: rāja vṛṣabhasya veśma narādhipatinā anujñātāḥ
translated: of the bull among kings, the lord of men, with the permission of the king.

original: eta śrutvā vacana aṣṭasahasra maheśvaravarāṇā /
analyzed: eta śrutvā vacana aṣṭa sahasra maheśvara varāṇā
translated: Having heard this speech, the eight thousand excellent Maheśvaras

original: praviśanti pārthivakula anihatakulavaśamukhyasya //
analyzed: praviśanti pārthiva kula a nihata kula vaśa mukhyasya
translated: entered the royal palace, the foremost of the unconquered family.

original: atha arcimo pi rājā maheśvarā dūrato niśāmetvā /
analyzed: atha arcimaḥ pi rājā maheśvarāḥ dūratas niśām etvā
translated: Then King Arcimat, seeing the Maheśvaras from afar,

original: pratyutthito saparivāro gauravabalabhāvitaśarīro //
analyzed: pratyutthitaḥ sa parivāraḥ gaurava bala bhāvita śarīraḥ
translated: He rose to meet them, his body filled with the power of respect.

original: tānavaca rājavṛṣabho svāgatamanurāgata vaḥ sarveṣā /
analyzed: tān avaca rāja vṛṣabho svāgatam anurāgata vaḥ
translated: The king, the bull among men, said, Welcome to all of you!

original: prīto smi darśanena praśamadamabalena ca bhavatā //
analyzed: prītaḥ smi darśanena praśama dama balena ca bhavatā
translated: I am pleased by your appearance, by your power of tranquility and self-control.

original: savidyante imāni asmāka āsanapradhānāni /
analyzed: savidyante imāni asmākam āsanapradhānāni
translated: These are our chief seats, adorned with various jewels.

original: āstā tāva bhavanto asmākamanugrahārthāya //
analyzed: tāva bhavantaḥ asmākam anugraha arthāya
translated: Please sit down, sirs, for the sake of showing us favor.

original: atha te teṣvāsaneṣu bahuratanaviśuddhacitrapādeṣu /
analyzed: atha te teṣu āsaneṣu bahu ratana viśuddha citra pādeṣu
translated: Then they sat down on those seats, the feet of which were adorned with various jewels,

original: p / vigatamadamānadarpā niṣīdi anavadyakarmāntāḥ //
analyzed: vigata mada māna darpāḥ anavadya karmāntāḥ
translated: free from pride, conceit, and arrogance, their actions irreproachable.

original: te kacideva kāla āgamayitvā narādhipamavocat /
analyzed: te kacid eva kāle āgamayitvā narādhipam avocat
translated: After some time had passed, they said to the king:

original: śṛṇvatu bhavā prayojana ya asmākamiha gamanāye //🔽sarvānavadyagātraḥ utpanno lokasundaro tuhya /
analyzed: śṛṇvatu bhavā asmākam iha  sarva anavadya gātraḥ utpannaḥ
translated: Listen, Your Majesty, to the reason for our coming here.🔽You have a son, O Lord of men, who is born faultless in body, the beauty of the world,

original: putro kila manujapate lakṣaṇaguṇapāramīprāpto //
analyzed: putraḥ kila manuja pate lakṣaṇa guṇa pāramī prāptaḥ
translated: and has attained perfection in the qualities of the marks.

original: vayamapi lakṣaṇakuśalāḥ samarthā guṇadoṣalakṣaṇa jñātu /
analyzed: vayam api lakṣaṇa kuśalāḥ samarthāḥ
translated: We too are skilled in the marks and are able to know the good and bad qualities by their marks.

original: yadi na gurutva bhavato paśyema mahāpuruṣarūpa //
analyzed: yadi na guru tva bhavato paśyema mahā puruṣa rūpa
translated: If it is not burdensome for you, we would like to see that great being.

original: so avaca hata paśyatha suvyapadeśakṣema mama putra /
analyzed: saḥ avaca hata paśyatha su vyapadeśa kṣema mama putra
translated: He said, You may see my son, who is well-known for his auspiciousness.

original: marumanujaharṣajanana lakṣaṇaguṇapāramiprāpta //
analyzed: maru manuja harṣa janana lakṣaṇa guṇa pārami prāpta
translated: who brings joy to gods and men, who has attained perfection in the characteristics and qualities.

original: atha sa mṛdukācilindikaprveṇiya guṇadhara grahetvāna /
analyzed: atha sa guṇadhara
translated: Then he, the bearer of the soft kācilindika-like virtues, having taken hold of

original: akena vādicandra upanāmayati suravarāṇā //
analyzed: akena vādi candraḥ upanāmayati sura varāṇā
translated: the moon of speakers, presents him to the best of the gods.

original: ālokayitva dūrāt maheśvarāḥ varakramāndaśabalasya /
analyzed: ālokayitva dūrāt maheśvarāḥ vara kramān daśabalasya
translated: The great lords, having seen from afar the ten powers of the one with excellent steps,

original: mūrdhni vigalitamukuṭā nipatensu mahītale hṛṣṭā //
analyzed: mūrdhni vigalita mukuṭā nipatet su mahī tale hṛṣṭā
translated: with their crowns fallen off, joyfully fall to the ground.

original: te dāni rājānamārocenti //
analyzed: te dāni rājānam ārocenti
translated: They then inform the king:

original: lābhā te mahārāja sulabdhā yasya te ya mahāpuruṣo kule utpanno dvātriśatīhi mahāpuruṣalakṣaṇehi samanvāgato //
analyzed: lābhā te mahā rāja su labdhā yasya te ya mahā puruṣaḥ kule utpannaḥ dvātriśatīhi mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇehi samanvāgataḥ
translated: Great king, you have gained great profit, in that this great man has been born in your family, endowed with the thirty-two marks of a great man.

original: tadyathā //
analyzed: tat yathā
translated: Namely:

original: samā heṣṭā ca dīrghā ca āyatā ca ucchaga pacamā /🔽eṇi bṛhacca tiṣṭhanto kośa nyagrodha te daśā //
analyzed: samā ha iṣṭā ca dīrghā ca āyatā ca ucchaga pacamā  eṇi bṛhat ca kośa nyagrodha te daśā
translated: Even, long, and extended, with a prominent navel.🔽With rounded calves, and standing with knees not bent, with testicles like a nyagrodha tree.

original: mṛdu jālā ca pratipūrṇā ekā ūrdhvāgra pacamā /
analyzed: mṛdu jālā ca pratipūrṇā ekā ūrdhva agra pacamā
translated: Soft, webbed, and full, with a single tuft of hair pointing upwards.

original: ślakṣṇacchavi hasāntarā ca utsadā ca te daśa //
analyzed: ślakṣṇa chavi hasāntarā ca utsadā ca te daśa
translated: Smooth skin, with a space between the breasts, and protruding, these are the ten.

original: p / rasa suvarṇa sīho ca samā śuklā ca pacamā /
analyzed: rasa suvarṇa sīho ca samā śuklā ca pacamā
translated: With taste, golden, and lion-like, even, abundant, with white teeth.

original: samā prabhūtā brahmā ca nīlā gopakṣma te daśa /
analyzed: samā prabhūtā brahmā ca nīlā gopakṣma te daśa
translated: Even, with many, with Brahmā, with dark eyelashes, these are the ten.

original: ūrṇā uṣṇīṣa śīrṣa ca nātho dvātriśalakṣaṇo //
analyzed: ūrṇā uṣṇīṣa śīrṣa ca
translated: He is the Lord with the hair in the middle of the forehead, the top-knot on the head, and the thirty-two marks of excellence.

original: te dāni brāhmaṇā rājñā arcimena ucyanti //
analyzed: te dāni brāhmaṇāḥ rājñā arcimena ucyanti
translated: Then King Arcimat said to the brāhmans,

original: ya kumārasya nāma anurūpa ta karotha //
analyzed: ya kumārasya nāma anurūpa ta karotha
translated: Make a name for the boy that shall befit him.

original: te brāhmaṇā āhansu //
analyzed: te brāhmaṇāḥ āhansu
translated: The brāhmans replied,

original: mahārāja kumāre jāyamāne dīpo prādurbhūto mahā obhāso tasmātkumāro dīpakaro nāma bhavatu //
analyzed: mahā rāja kumāre jāyamāne dīpo prādurbhūtaḥ mahā obhāsaḥ tasmāt kumāraḥ dīpakaraḥ nāma bhavatu
translated: Your majesty, when the boy was born a light appeared, a great radiance, therefore let the boy be called Dīpaṃkara.

original: eva kumārasya śuddhāvāsehi devehi brāhmaṇaveṣa nirmiṇitvā dīpakaro ti nāma kṛta //
analyzed: eva kumārasya śuddhāvāsehi devehi brāhmaṇa veṣa nirmiṇitvā dīpakaraḥ ti nāma kṛta
translated: So the boy was named Dīpaṃkara by the Śuddhāvāsa devas who had assumed the form of brāhmans.

original: tasya sadṛśīyo dhātrīyo kumāra upasthihanti savardhayanti //🔽yadā ca bodhisatvo yauvanaprāpto rājñā trayo prāsādā kāritā kumārasya krīḍārtha paricārārtha vistīrṇa ca antaḥpura upasthāpita //
analyzed: tasya kumāraḥ upasthihanti savardhayanti  yadā ca bodhisatvaḥ yauvana prāptaḥ rājñā trayaḥ prāsādā kāritā kumārasya krīḍā artha paricāra artha vistīrṇa ca antaḥpure upasthāpita
translated: And nurses equal to the task were appointed to tend the boy and rear him.🔽And when the Bodhisattva had grown up, King Arcimat had three palaces built for the boy to divert, enjoy and amuse himself in, and a harem of women was provided for him.

original: bodhisatvo mahatā rājānubhāvena mahatā rājaṛddhīye mahatā rājavibhūṣāye sāntaḥpuro padminīvanamudyānabhūmi nirgato krīḍārtha //
analyzed: bodhisatvaḥ mahatā rāja anubhāvena mahatā rāja ṛddhīye mahatā rāja vibhūṣāye sa antaḥpuraḥ padminī vanam udyāna bhūmi nirgataḥ krīḍā artha
translated: Then the Bodhisattva, with great royal pomp, splendour and magnificence, went out from the city of Dīpavatī with the women of the harem to the pleasure garden of Pāruṣyaka, to divert, enjoy and amuse himself.

original: rājñā arcimenāntaḥpuramāṇatta /
analyzed: rājñā arcimena antaḥpuram āṇatta
translated: King Arcimat gave instructions to the women of the harem, saying,

original: suṣṭhu kumāra krīḍāpetha //
analyzed: suṣṭhu kumāra krīḍāpetha
translated: Take good care of the prince.

original: bodhisatvo nāvāyānehi purimapaścimavedihi vedikājālehi vedikājālaparikṣiptehi vitatavitānehi citraduṣyaparikṣiptehi osaktapaṭṭadāmakalāpehi 🔽dhūpanadhūpitehi muktapuṣpāvakīrṇehi hārādhahāracandrasucitrehi ucchritacchatradhvajapatākehi nāvāyānehi niṣpuruṣe taṭe otarati //
analyzed: bodhisatvaḥ nāvāyānehi purima paścima vedihi vedikā jālehi vedikā jāla parikṣiptehi vitata vitānehi citra duṣya parikṣiptehi osakta paṭṭa dāma kalāpehi  dhūpana dhūpitehi mukta puṣpa avakīrṇehi hāra adhahāra candra su citrehi ucchrita chatra dhvaja patākehi nāvā āyānehi niṣpuruṣe taṭe otarati
translated: The Bodhisattva descended on the shore, free from men, by a boat with oars in front and behind, with railings and balustrades, covered with a canopy, surrounded by a silken curtain,🔽perfumed with incense, strewn with garlands of flowers, adorned with strings of pearls and half-moons, with raised umbrellas, flags, and banners.

original: kilānta antaḥpuramāsupta kāci hanukāmupagrahiyuāṇa kācitpaṇavamupaguhya kācidveṇu kācidvīṇā kācidvallakī kācitsughoṣakī kācinnūpura
analyzed: antaḥpuram āsupta kāci kācid paṇavam upaguhya kācid veṇu kācid vīṇā kācid vallakī kācid sughoṣakī kācid nūpura
translated: Some of the women of the harem were tired and slept, some holding their chins, some embracing their drums, some their flutes, some their lutes, some their vallakīs, some their sughoṣakas, some their ankle bells,

original: kācit mṛdaga kācillālāgharanti //
analyzed: kācid
translated: some their mṛdaṅgas, and some their lālāgharas.

original: bodhisatvasya tā dṛṣṭvā śamśānasajñā prādurbhūtā //
analyzed: bodhisatvasya tāḥ dṛṣṭvā śamśāna sajñā prādurbhūtā
translated: When the Bodhisattva saw them, the perception of a charnel ground arose in him.

original: madhye puṣkaraṇīye padma prādurbhūta rathacakramātrāhi karṇikāhi aparehi padmasahasrehi anuparivārita //
analyzed: madhye puṣkaraṇīye padma prādurbhūta ratha cakra mātrāhi karṇikāhi aparehi padma sahasrehi anuparivārita
translated: In the middle of a pond, a lotus appeared, with a pericarp the size of a chariot wheel, surrounded by another thousand lotuses.

original: p / bodhisatvo tatpadume paryaṅkena niṣaṇo ta ca paduma sakucita kūṭāgāre sasthita //
analyzed: bodhisatvaḥ tad padume paryaṅkena niṣaṇaḥ ta ca paduma sa kucita kūṭāgāre sasthita
translated: The Bodhisattva sat cross-legged on that lotus, and that lotus remained in the closed state of a peaked roof.

original: bodhisatvasya sarva gṛhiligamantarhita kāṣāyāṇi prādurbhūtāni //🔽atha khalu mahāmaudgalyāyana dīpakaro bodhisatvo vivikta kāmehi vivikta pāpakairakuśalairdharmaiḥ savitarka savicāra vivekaja prītisukha
analyzed: bodhisatvasya kāṣāyāṇi prādurbhūtāni  atha khalu mahāmaudgalyāyana dīpakaraḥ bodhisatvaḥ vivikta kāmehi vivikta pāpakaiḥ akuśalaiḥ dharmaiḥ sa vitarka sa vicāra viveka ja prīti sukha
translated: The Bodhisattva’s lay garments disappeared and he was seen in the ochre robes.

original: prathama dhyānamupasapadya viharesi //
analyzed: dhyānam upasapadya viharesi
translated: Then, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, the Bodhisattva Dīpaṃkara, having become secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unwholesome things, entered and dwelled in the first meditation, which is accompanied by thought conception and sustained thought, is born of seclusion, and is filled with rapture and joy.

original: savitarkavicārāṇā vyupasamādadhyātmasaprasādāccetasaḥ ekotībhāvādavitarkamavicāra samādhija prītisukha dvitīya dhyānamupasapadya viharesi🔽sa prītervirāgādupekṣakaśca viharati smṛtaḥ saprajāna sukha ca kāyena pratisavedayati /
analyzed: vyupasamādadhi ātma sa prasādāt cetasaḥ ekotībhāvāt a vitarkam a vicāra samādhi ja prīti sukha dvitīya dhyānam upasapadya viharesi  sa prīteḥ virāgāt upekṣakaḥ ca viharati smṛtaḥ ca kāyena pratisavedayati
translated: Having become secluded from thought conception and sustained thought, he entered and dwelled in the second meditation, which is born of concentration, is filled with rapture and joy, and is without thought conception and sustained thought.🔽Having become secluded from rapture, he dwelled equanimous, and mindful and clearly knowing, he experienced happiness with his body; he entered and dwelled in the third meditation, which the noble ones declare to be “equanimous, mindful, and happy.”

original: yatta āryā ācakṣate upekṣakaḥ smṛtimā sukhavihārī niṣprītika tṛtīya dhyānamupasapadya viharati //
analyzed: yat te āryāḥ ācakṣate upekṣakaḥ smṛtimā sukha vihārī niṣprītika dhyānam upasapadya viharati
translated: Having given up pleasure, given up pain, and dispelled elation and depression, he entered and dwelled in the fourth meditation, which is without pain or pleasure and is purified in equanimity and mindfulness.

original: sukhasya ca prahāṇā duḥkhasya ca prahāṇātpūrva ca saumanasyadaurmanasyayorastagamāt aduḥkhāsukhamupekṣāsmṛtipariśuddha caturtha dhyānamupasapadya
analyzed: sukhasya ca prahāṇā duḥkhasya ca prahāṇāt pūrva ca saumanasya daurmanasyayoḥ asta gamāt aduḥkha asukham upekṣā smṛti pariśuddha caturtha dhyānam upasapadya
translated: Having abandoned pleasure, abandoned pain, and previously abandoned joy and grief, he dwells having attained the fourth meditation, which is neither painful nor pleasant and has purification of mindfulness through equanimity.

original: viharesi //
analyzed: viharesi
translated: He dwells having attained this.

original: so tathā samāhitena cittena pariśuddhena paryavadātena anagaṇena vigatopakileśena mṛdunā karmaṇyena sthitenānijyaprāptena rātrīye purime
analyzed: saḥ tathā samāhitena cittena pariśuddhena paryavadātena an agaṇena vigata upa kileśena mṛdunā karmaṇyena sthitena an ijya prāptena rātrīye purime
translated: With his mind thus concentrated, purified, bright, unblemished, free from defilements, malleable, workable, steady, and attained to imperturbability, he directs and inclines it to the knowledge of the destruction of the taints.

original: yāme divyacakṣudarśanapratilābhāya cittamabhinirharesi nirṇāmesi //
analyzed: yāme divya cakṣu darśana pratilābhāya cittam abhinirharesi nirṇāmesi
translated: In the first watch of the night, he resolves and directs his mind to the attainment of the divine eye.

original: so divyena cakṣuṣā satvānpaśyati cyavantā upapadyantā suvarṇā durvarṇā sugatā durgatānyathākarmopagānsatvānprajānāti /
analyzed: saḥ divyena cakṣuṣā satvān paśyati cyavantā upapadyantā suvarṇā durvarṇā sugatā durgatān yathā karma upagān satvān prajānāti
translated: With the divine eye, which is purified and surpasses the human, he sees beings passing away and being reborn, inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, fortunate and unfortunate, and he understands how beings fare in accordance with their kamma.

original: so tathā samāhitena cittena pariśuddhena paryavadātena anagaṇena vigatopakleśena mṛdunā karmaṇyena sthitenānijyaprāptena rātriye madhyame
analyzed: saḥ tathā samāhitena cittena pariśuddhena paryavadātena an agaṇena vigata upakleśena mṛdunā karmaṇyena sthitena an ijya prāptena rātriye madhyame
translated: With his mind thus concentrated, purified, bright, unblemished, free from defilements, malleable, workable, steady, and attained to imperturbability, he directs and inclines it to the recollection of his various previous abodes, that is,

original: yāme anekavidha pūrvanivāsa samanusmaret /
analyzed: yāme anekavidha pūrvanivāsa samanusmaret
translated: one birth, two births, three births, four births, five births, ten births, twenty births, thirty births, forty births, fifty births, a hundred births, a thousand births, a hundred thousand births, many eons of world-dissolution, many eons of world-evolution, many eons of world-dissolution and evolution.

original: sayyathīda ekā vā jāti dvau vā jāti trayo vā jāti catvāri vā jāti paca vā jāti daśa vā viśadvā triśaccatvāriśa vā pacāśa vā jātīśata
analyzed: ekā vā jāti dvau vā jāti trayaḥ vā jāti catvāri vā jāti paca vā jāti daśa vā viśat vā triśat catvāriśa vā pacāśa vā
translated: Namely, one birth, two births, three births, four births, five births, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty births,🔽a hundred births, a thousand births, many hundreds of births, many thousands of births, many hundreds of thousands of births,

original: vā jātīsahasra vā anekāni ca jātīśatāni p / anekāni jātīsahasrāṇi anekānyapi jātīśatasahasrāṇi savartakalpā vā vivartakalpā vā savartavivartakalpā
analyzed: vā anekāni ca jātī śatāni anekāni jātī sahasrāṇi anekāni api jātī śata sahasrāṇi savarta kalpāḥ vā vivarta kalpāḥ vā savarta vivarta kalpāḥ
translated: eons of world contraction, eons of world expansion, eons of world contraction and expansion,

original: vā anekā pi savartā anekā pi vivartā anekā pi savartavivartāni kalpāni //
analyzed: vai anekā pi savartā anekā pi vivartā anekā pi savarta vivartāni
translated: many contractions, many expansions, many eons of contraction and expansion.

original: amutrāha āsi evanāmo evagotro evajātyo evamāhāro evamāyuḥparyanto evasukhaduḥkhapratisavedī iti sākāra soddeśa anekavidha pūrvanivāsa 🔽samanusmarati //
analyzed: amutra ahaḥ āsi eva nāmaḥ eva gotraḥ eva jātyaḥ evam āhāraḥ evam āyuḥ paryantaḥ eva sukha duḥkha pratisavedī iti sa ākāra sa uddeśa anekavidha pūrvanivāsa  samanusmarati
translated: I was there in such and such a place, of such and such a name, of such and such a family, of such and such a caste, of such and such a diet, experienced such and such pleasure and pain, lived for such and such a length of time.🔽Having passed away from there, I was born in such and such a place. Thus he remembers his various past abodes with their aspects and details.

original: so tathā samāhitena cittena pariśuddhena paryavadātena anagaṇena vigatopakileśena sthitenānijyaprāptena rātrīye paścime yāme nandīmukhāyā
analyzed: saḥ tathā samāhitena cittena pariśuddhena paryavadātena an agaṇena vigata upa kileśena sthitena an ijya prāptena rātrīye paścime yāme nandīmukhāyā
translated: With his mind thus concentrated, purified, and bright, unblemished, free from defects, pliant, malleable, steady, and attained to imperturbability, he directs and inclines it to the knowledge of the passing away and arising of beings.🔽He sees beings passing away and arising:

original: rajanyā anuṇopaghāṭakālasamaye yatkicitpuruṣanāgena puruṣasihena puruṣarṣabheṇa puruṣapadumena puruṣapuṇḍarīkeṇa puruṣadhaureyeṇa puruṣeṇa
analyzed: rajanyāḥ yat kicid puruṣa nāgena puruṣasihena puruṣa ṛṣabheṇa puruṣapadumena puruṣapuṇḍarīkeṇa puruṣa dhaureyeṇa puruṣeṇa
translated: at the time when the night was ending, whatever was to be known, to be attained, to be experienced, to be realized, by a man, a bull, a bull among men, an elephant, a lotus among men, a white lotus among men, a leader of men,

original: satpuruṣeṇa puruṣājāneyena anuttareṇa puruṣadamyasārathinā gatimena smṛtimena dhṛtimena matimena sarvaśo sarvatratāye jñātavya prāptavya boddhavya
analyzed: sat puruṣeṇa puruṣa ājāneyena anuttareṇa puruṣa damya sārathinā gatimena smṛtimena dhṛtimena matimena sarvaśas jñātavya prāptavya boddhavya
translated: a good man, a man to be known by men, the unsurpassed driver of tameable men, one of good conduct, one of good memory, one of good resolve, one of good understanding, by all means, in all ways,

original: abhisaboddhavya sarvantamekacittakṣaṇasamāyuktayā prajñayā anuttarā samyaksabodhimabhisabuddho //
analyzed: abhisaboddhavya sarvantam eka citta kṣaṇa samāyuktayā prajñayā anuttarā samyaksabodhim abhisabuddhaḥ
translated: he fully awakened to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment in a single moment of thought endowed with wisdom.

original: iya ca mahāpṛthivī ṣaḍvikāra kampe saprakampe bhūmyā ca devā ghoṣamudīrayensuḥ śabda nabhe śrāvayensu /
analyzed: iya ca mahā pṛthivī ṣaṣ vikāra kampe sa prakampe bhūmyā ca devāḥ ghoṣam udīrayensuḥ śabda nabhe śrāvayensu
translated: And this great earth shook in six ways, trembled, trembled strongly, and the gods of the earth cried out and made their voices heard in the sky:🔽Friends, this Blessed One Dīpaṃkara will fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, for the benefit and welfare of devas and humans.

original: eṣa māriṣa bhagavā dīpakaro anuttarā samyaksabodhimabhisabuddho bhaviṣyati bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukapāya mahato janakāyasyārthāya
analyzed: eṣa māriṣa bhagavā dīpakaraḥ anuttarā samyaksabodhim abhisabuddhaḥ bhaviṣyati bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya loka anukapāya mahataḥ jana kāyasya arthāya
translated: For the benefit, welfare, and happiness of great multitudes,

original: hitāya sukhāya devānā ca manuṣyāṇā ca //
analyzed: hitāya sukhāya devānā ca manuṣyāṇā ca
translated: for the sake of devas and humans.

original: bhūmyānā devānā ghoṣa śrutvā antarīkṣecarā devā trāyastriśā yāmā tuṣitā nirmāṇaratayaḥ paranirmitavaśavartina iti tatkṣaṇantanmurhūta
analyzed: devānām ghoṣa śrutvā antarīkṣecarāḥ devāḥ trāyastriśāḥ yāmā tuṣitāḥ nirmāṇaratayaḥ paranirmitavaśavartinaḥ iti
translated: Having heard the sound of the earth gods, the gods who move in the sky, the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, the Yāma gods, the Tuṣita gods, the Nirmāṇarati gods, and the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods immediately proclaimed:

original: yāvadbrahmakāya ghoṣamabhyudgacchet //🔽eṣa māriṣa bhagavā dīpakaro samyaksabuddho bhaviṣyati ta bhaviṣyati bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukapāya mahato janakāyasyārthāya
analyzed: yāvat brahmakāya ghoṣam abhyudgacchet  eṣa māriṣa bhagavā dīpakaraḥ samyaksabuddhaḥ bhaviṣyati bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya loka anukapāya mahataḥ jana kāyasya arthāya
translated: At that very moment, the sound rose up as far as the Brahma realm.

original: hitāya sukhāya devānā ca manuṣyāṇā ca //
analyzed: hitāya sukhāya devānā ca manuṣyāṇā ca
translated: Friends, this Blessed One Dīpaṃkara will become a perfectly awakened Buddha. That will be for the benefit of many people, for the happiness of many people, out of compassion for the world, for the welfare, benefit, and happiness of gods and human beings.

original: aprameyasya udārasya mahato vabhāsasya loke prādurbhāvo abhūṣi //
analyzed: aprameyasya udārasya mahataḥ vabhāsasya loke prādurbhāvaḥ
translated: There appeared in the world an immeasurable, vast, great light.

original: yāvatā loke lokāntarikā andhakārā andhakārārpitā tamisrā tamasārpitā aghā p / aghasabhūtapūrvā yatra ime pi candrasūryā eva maharddhikā
analyzed: yāvatā loke loka āntarikā andhakārāḥ andhakāra arpitā tamisrā tamasā arpitā aghā yatra ime pi candra sūryāḥ eva maharddhikā
translated: As far as the interspaces between worlds in the world system, which are dark, enveloped in darkness, gloomy, and thought of as deep darkness, where even the sun and moon, with their great power

original: eva mahānubhāvā ābhayā ābhā nābhisabhuṇanti ālokena vā āloka na spharanti te pi tena obhāsena sphuṭā abhūnsuḥ //
analyzed: eva mahā anubhāvāḥ ābhayā ābhāḥ na abhisabhuṇanti ālokena vā āloka na spharanti te pi tena obhāsena sphuṭāḥ abhūnsuḥ
translated: and great might, with their great splendor cannot reach with their splendor, or with their light cannot illuminate with their light, even there that radiance became manifest.🔽And the beings who were in those interspaces between worlds, they recognized each other by that radiance:

original: ye pi tatra satvā upapannā te pi anyamanya sajānensuḥ anye pi kila iha bho satvā upapannā anye pi kila bho satvā upapannā anye pi kila bho
analyzed: ye pi tatra satvāḥ upapannā te pi anyam anya sajānensuḥ anye pi kila iha bho satvāḥ upapannāḥ anye pi kila bho satvāḥ upapannāḥ anye pi kila bho
translated: And the beings who had been reborn there recognized each other and said: 'Other beings have been reborn here, other beings have been reborn here,

original: satvā upapannāḥ //
analyzed: satvāḥ upapannāḥ
translated: other beings have been reborn here!'

original: ekāntasukhasamarpitā ca punastatkṣaṇa ta muhūrta sarve satvā abhūnsu //
analyzed: ekānta sukha samarpitā ca punar tad kṣaṇa sarve satvāḥ
translated: And all those beings became endowed with one-sided bliss.

original: ye pi avīce mahānarake upapannā atikrame va devānā devānubhāva nāgāna nāgānubhāva yakṣāṇā yakṣānubhāva //
analyzed: ye pi avīce mahānarake upapannāḥ atikrame devānā deva anubhāva nāgāna nāga anubhāva yakṣāṇā yakṣa anubhāva
translated: And in the great Avīci hell, the power of the gods, the power of the nāgas, and the power of the yakṣas prevailed.

original: dhyāmāni ca abhūnsuḥ mārabhavanāni niṣprabhāṇi nistejāni nirabhiramyāṇi /
analyzed: dhyāmāni ca abhūnsuḥ māra bhavanāni niṣprabhāṇi nistejāni nirabhiramyāṇi
translated: And Māra's abodes became gloomy, lusterless, joyless,

original: krośikānyapi tatra khaṇḍāni prapatensuḥ dvikrośikānyapi tatra khaṇḍāni prapatensu dhvajāgrāṇyapi prapatensu //
analyzed: krośikāni api tatra khaṇḍāni prapatensuḥ dvi krośikāni api tatra khaṇḍāni prapatensu dhvaja agrāṇi api prapatensu
translated: and the peaks of the mountains crumbled and fell down, and the tops of the banners fell down.

original: māro ca pāpīmā duḥkhī durmano vipratisārī antośalyaparidāghajāto abhūṣi //
analyzed: duḥkhī durmanaḥ vipratisārī
translated: And Māra the evil one became afflicted, miserable, remorseful, and his inner organs were scorched.

original: tatraiva ca maudgalyāyana padmakūṭāgāre bhagavā dīpakaro caturhi mahārājehi śakreṇa ca devānāmidreṇa suyāmena ca devaputreṇa satuṣitena
analyzed: tatra eva ca maudgalyāyana padmakūṭāgāre bhagavā dīpa karaḥ catur hi mahā rājehi śakreṇa ca devānāmidreṇa suyāmena ca devaputreṇa sa tuṣitena
translated: And there, Maudgalyāyana, in the lotus palace, the Blessed One Dīpaṃkara was surrounded by the four great kings, by Śakra, lord of the gods, by the god Suyāma, by the god Santuṣita,

original: ca devaputreṇa vaśavartinā ca devaputreṇa mahābrahmaṇā ca anekadevasaghaparivārehi savṛto //
analyzed: ca devaputreṇa vaśavartinā ca devaputreṇa mahābrahmaṇā ca aneka deva sagha parivārehi
translated: by the god Vaśavartin, by the great Brahmā, and by many groups of gods.

original: bhagavato dīpakarasya udārā pūjā kṛtā //
analyzed: bhagavataḥ dīpakarasya udārā pūjā kṛtā
translated: He made an excellent offering to the Blessed One Dīpaṃkara.

original: divyehi mandāravehi kusumehi mahāmandāravehi karṇikārehi rocamānehi bhīṣmehi mahābhīṣmehi samantagandhehi mahāsamantagandhehi candanacurṇehi
analyzed: divyehi mandāravehi kusumehi mahāmandāravehi karṇikārehi rocamānehi bhīṣmehi mahābhīṣmehi samantagandhehi mahāsamantagandhehi candana curṇehi
translated: With divine coral tree flowers, great coral tree flowers, white water lily flowers, rocamāna flowers, bhīṣma flowers, great bhīṣma flowers, all-around fragrant flowers, great all-around fragrant flowers, sandalwood powder,

original: agurucūrṇehi keśaracūrṇehi tamālapatracūrṇehi bhagavanta dīpakara okiritvā prakiritvā abhiprakiritvā divyehi tūryasahasrehi sapūjayitvā
analyzed: aguru cūrṇehi keśara cūrṇehi tamāla patra cūrṇehi bhagavanta dīpa karaḥ okiritvā prakiritvā abhiprakiritvā divyehi tūrya sahasrehi sapūjayitvā
translated: agaru powder, saffron powder, tamāla leaf powder, he scattered over the Blessed One Dīpaṃkara, sprinkled him, and covered him with it, and made offerings with a thousand divine musical instruments.

original: tatraiva mahābrahamaṇā yācito anuttara dharmacakra pravartanāya //
analyzed: tatra eva mahā brahamaṇā yācitaḥ anuttara dharmacakra pravartanāya
translated: There he was requested by the great Brahmā to turn the unsurpassed wheel of the Dharma.

original: adhivāsayati mahāmaudgalyāyana bhagavā dīpakaro mahābrahmaṇo tūṣṇībhāvena //
analyzed: adhivāsayati mahāmaudgalyāyana bhagavā dīpakaraḥ mahābrahmaṇaḥ tūṣṇībhāvena
translated: The Blessed One Dīpaṃkara, Maudgalyāyana, assented to the great Brahmā by remaining silent.

original: devā adhivāsanā viditvā hṛṣṭā tuṣṭā āttamanā pramudita p / prītisaumanasyajātā bhagavato dīpakarasya pādā śirasā vanditvā triṣkṛtyo
analyzed: devāḥ adhivāsanāḥ viditvā hṛṣṭā tuṣṭāḥ ātta manāḥ pramudita prīti saumanasya jātāḥ bhagavataḥ dīpakarasya pādā śirasā vanditvā
translated: The gods, knowing that they had been accepted, were delighted, satisfied, elated, joyful, and full of happiness and gladness. They bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One Dīpaṃkara, circumambulated him three times,

original: pradakṣiṇīkṛtvā tatraivāntarhāyensu //
analyzed: pradakṣiṇīkṛtvā tatra eva antarhāyet su
translated: and disappeared right there.

original: bhagavāntasyaiva rātryā atyayena pratisalayanādvyutthāya janapadeṣu cārikā prakramet //
analyzed: bhagavān tasya eva rātryāḥ atyayena prati salayanāt vyutthāya janapadeṣu cārikā prakramet
translated: The Blessed One, having arisen from his seclusion at the end of that night, set out on foot to wander through the countryside.

original: ādityo varavarṇo bālo abhyudgato yathākāśe /
analyzed: ādityaḥ vara varṇaḥ bālaḥ abhyudgataḥ yathā ākāśe
translated: The young one of excellent complexion, like the sun risen in the sky,

original: yojanaśata prabhāye dīpakaro bharitva asthāsi //
analyzed: yojana śata prabhāye dīpa karaḥ asthāsi
translated: Dīpaṃkara, filling a hundred yojanas with his radiance, stood.

original: bhagavā dīpakaro cārikā caramāṇo mahato janakāyasya devānā manuṣyāṇā ca arthacaryā caramāṇo aśītihi bhikṣusahasrehi sārdha dīpavatī
analyzed: bhagavā dīpakaraḥ cārikā caramāṇaḥ mahataḥ jana kāyasya devānā manuṣyāṇā ca artha caryā caramāṇaḥ aśītihi bhikṣu sahasrehi sārdha dīpavatī  /
translated: The Blessed One Dīpaṃkara, while wandering about, practicing the conduct that benefits the great multitude of gods and humans, together with eighty thousand monks,🔽approached the capital city of Dīpavatī

original: rājadhānī āgacchati pituḥ arcimato jñātīnā ca anukampārtha //
analyzed: rājadhānī āgacchati pituḥ arcimataḥ jñātīnā ca anukampā artha
translated: in order to show compassion to his father Arcimat and his relatives.

original: rājñā arcimena śruta //
analyzed: rājñā arcimena śruta
translated: King Arcimat heard

original: bhagavā dīpakaro aśītihi bhikṣusahasrehi sārdha dīpavatī rājadhānī āgacchati jñātīnāmanukampāyeti //
analyzed: bhagavā dīpakaraḥ aśītihi bhikṣu sahasrehi sārdha dīpavatī rājadhānī āgacchati jñātīnām anukampāya iti
translated: that the Blessed One Dīpaṃkara, together with eighty thousand monks, was approaching the capital city of Dīpavatī in order to show compassion to his relatives.

original: te ca yāvaddīpavatī yāva ca padminīvanamudyāna daśakrośamārga pratijāgṛhansuḥ aṣṭāpadasama aviṣama pāṇitalasama sikta samṛṣṭa vitatavitāna 🔽vicitraduṣyaparikṣipta osaktapaṭṭadāmakalāpa dhūpanadhūpita daśadiśehi ca naṭanartakaṛllamallapāṇisvaryālakṛta cakravartipura bhūyasya
analyzed: te ca yāvat dīpavatī ca padminī vanam udyāna daśa krośa mārga pratijāgṛhansuḥ aṣṭāpada sama aviṣama pāṇitala sama sikta samṛṣṭa vitata vitāna  vicitra duṣya parikṣipta osakta paṭṭa dāma kalāpa dhūpana dhūpita ca cakravarti pura bhūyasya
translated: They prepared the road from Dīpavatī up to the Lotus Grove park for ten yojanas, making it level like the palm of a hand, without unevenness or holes, sprinkled with sandalwood water, and covered with nets of gold.

original: ca śatapatrālakṛta //
analyzed: ca
translated: They hung silk tassels and garlands, burned incense, and arranged hundreds of parasols and canopies.🔽They made it like the city of a universal monarch.

original: rājñā arcimena prabhūta gandhamālya gṛhīta tathā gṛhīta mahājanakāyena samantāddvādaśayojanāto gandhamālya samudānīta //
analyzed: rājñā arcimena prabhūta gandha mālya gṛhīta tathā gṛhīta mahā jana kāyena samantāt dvādaśa yojanāt gandha mālya samudānīta
translated: King Arcimat, having taken much incense and garlands, and having taken them together with a great multitude, gathered incense and garlands from all around for twelve yojanas.

original: rājā aśītihi koṭṭarājasahasrehi sārdha anyāye ca janatāye bhagavanta dīpakara pratyudgato //
analyzed: rājā aśītihi koṭṭarāja sahasrehi sārdha anyāye ca bhagavanta dīpakara pratyudgataḥ
translated: The king, together with eighty thousand vassal kings and other people, went forth to meet the Blessed One Dīpaṃkara.

original: aparo śrotriyo ṣaḍaṅgavittrayāṇā vedānā pārago sākṣaraprabhedānāmitihāsapacamānā sanighaṇṭakaiṭabhānā māṇavakānā ācāryo kuśalo brāhmaṇakeṣu
analyzed: aparaḥ śrotriyaḥ ṣaḍaṅga vid trayāṇā vedānā pāragaḥ sa akṣara prabhedānām itihāsa pacamānām sa nighaṇṭa kaiṭabhānām māṇavakānām ācāryaḥ kuśalaḥ brāhmaṇakeṣu
translated: There was another learned brāhmaṇa who had mastered the three Vedas, including the phonology, the history, the fifth branch of study, and the nirvacana and śikṣā branches. He was a teacher of young brāhmaṇas, skilled in the brāhmaṇa rituals,

original: deveṣu paca māṇavakaśatāni vedamantrā vācayati //
analyzed: deveṣu paca māṇavaka śatāni veda mantrāḥ vācayati
translated: and taught a hundred young brāhmaṇas the Vedic mantras among the gods.

original: tahi dve māṇavakā samodikā priyamāṇā p / megho ca nāma māṇavako meghadatto ca //
analyzed: dve māṇavakā samodikā priyamāṇā meghaḥ ca nāma māṇavakaḥ meghadatto ca
translated: There were two young brāhman students who were friends and companions, named Megha and Meghadatta.

original: meghamāṇavako paṇḍito dhīro medhāvī tīkṣṇabuddhiko //
analyzed: paṇḍitaḥ dhīraḥ medhāvī tīkṣṇa buddhikaḥ
translated: The young brāhman Megha was clever, intelligent, thoughtful and keen-witted.

original: tena nacirasyaiva sarve mantrā adhītā //
analyzed: tena nacirasya eva sarve mantrāḥ adhītā
translated: In no long a time he had mastered all the Vedas.

original: so dāni adhītavedādhyayano anuhimavantā janapada okasto ācāryasya ācāryadhana paryeṣayiṣyāmi iti //
analyzed: saḥ dāni adhīta veda adhyayanaḥ anu himavantā janapadaḥ okastaḥ ācāryasya ācārya dhana paryeṣayiṣyāmi iti
translated: When he had finished his studies he went to the country of the Himalayas, thinking: I will seek the teacher’s fee for my teacher.

original: yaṣṭikamaṇḍalucchatra upānahāśca snānaśāṭi ādāya yasya grāmasya vā nagarasya vā nigamasya vā sīmāmākrāmati ta nirītika nirupadrava ca 🔽bhavati meghasya māṇavakasya tejodhātubhāvena //
analyzed: yaṣṭi kamaṇḍalu chatra upānahāḥ ca snāna śāṭi ādāya yasya grāmasya vā nagarasya vā nigamasya vā sīmām ākrāmati ta nirītika nirupadrava ca  bhavati meghasya māṇavakasya tejaḥ dhātu bhāvena
translated: Wherever he came, whether to a village or a town or a city, by the power of the young brāhman Megha’s virtue there was no plague or calamity.

original: tena yāyinā puruṣo vijñapto //
analyzed: tena yāyinā puruṣaḥ vijñaptaḥ
translated: When he was on his way a man asked him,

original: tenaiva paca purāṇaśatāni dinnāni //
analyzed: tena eva paca purāṇa śatāni dinnāni
translated: and he gave him a hundred purāṇas.

original: tasya dāni etadabhūṣi //
analyzed: tasya dāni
translated: Then he thought,

original: ya nūnāha āgatako yena dīpavatī rājadhānī cakravartipura saptaratanāmaya abhiramaṇīya paśyeyanti //
analyzed: āgatakaḥ yena dīpavatī rājadhānī cakravarti pura sapta rata nāmaya abhiramaṇīya paśyeyanti
translated: “What now if go to the royal city of Dīpavatī, the city of a universal king, which is delightful and made of the seven precious substances, and see it?”

original: so dāni dīpavatī rājadhānī praviṣṭo paśyati ca dīpavatī rājadhānī alakṛtā //
analyzed: saḥ dāni dīpavatī rājadhānī praviṣṭaḥ paśyati ca dīpavatī rājadhānī alakṛtā
translated: He entered the royal city of Dīpavatī and saw that it was decorated.

original: tasya etadabhūṣi //
analyzed: tasya etat abhūṣi
translated: He thought to himself:

original: kimida adya dīpavatīye rājadhānīye parva vā prayoga vā utsava vā //
analyzed: kimida adya dīpavatīye rājadhānīye parva vā prayoga vā utsava vā
translated: “What is the reason that the royal city of Dīpavatī is decorated today? Is it a festival, a holiday, or a celebration?”

original: atha rājño arcimasya śruta metho māṇavako adhītavedādhyayano anuhimavantāto janapadamokasto so dīpanatī rājadhānī āgamiṣyati /
analyzed: atha rājñaḥ arcimasya methaḥ māṇavakaḥ adhīta veda adhyayanaḥ saḥ dīpanatī rājadhānī āgamiṣyati
translated: Then he heard that the young brāhman Meṇḍeka had studied the Vedas and was coming from the country of the Okkākas in the Himalayas to the royal city of Dīpavatī.

original: tato ima nagaravaramalaākṛta ti //
analyzed: ti
translated: “Therefore,” he thought, “this best of cities is decorated.”

original: so puregāmī yojano praviśati so ta kacitpṛcchati //
analyzed: saḥ puregāmī yojanaḥ praviśati saḥ ta kacid pṛcchati
translated: He went on ahead a yojana and asked:

original: tahi aparā māṇavikā prāsādikā darśanīyā acapalā anuddhatā apragalbhā udakaghaṭamādāya sapta ca utpalāni gacchati //🔽sā tena pṛcchatā bhavati //
analyzed: aparā māṇavikā prāsādikā darśanīyā a capalā an uddhatā a pragalbhā udaka ghaṭam ādāya sapta ca utpalāni gacchati  sā tena pṛcchatā bhavati
translated: There he saw a young brāhman girl who was lovely, beautiful, graceful, and modest, not forward, but retiring, carrying a pitcher of water and seven lotuses.🔽He asked her:

original: adya nagare utsavo //
analyzed: adya nagare utsavaḥ
translated: “Is there a festival in the city today?”

original: atha khalu prakṛti māṇavikā megha māṇavaka gāthābhiradhyabhāṣe //
analyzed: atha khalu megha māṇavaka gāthābhiḥ adhyabhāṣe
translated: Then the young brāhman girl Pratikṛti spoke to the young brāhman Megha in verse:

original: api tu nāsi māṇavā ito anyapurādasi tva ihāgato /
analyzed: api tu na asi māṇavāḥ itas anya purāt asi tvaḥ iha āgataḥ
translated: “But, young man, you are not from this other city, you have come here from there.

original: yo lokahita prabhakara dīpavatī prāpta na budhyase //
analyzed: yaḥ loka hita prabha kara dīpavatī prāpta na budhyase
translated: You who are the light for the benefit of the world, you do not awaken to the city of Dipāvati.

original: p / dīpakara lokanāyako arcimato tanayo mahāyaśo /
analyzed: dīpa kara loka nāyakaḥ tanayaḥ mahā yaśas
translated: The Buddha Dīpaṃkara, the guide of the world, the son of Arcimat, of great fame,

original: buddho nagara pravekṣyati tasya kṛte nagara alakṛta //
analyzed: buddhaḥ nagara pravekṣyati tasya kṛte nagara alakṛta
translated: the Buddha will enter the city, for his sake the city is adorned.

original: sā tena pṛcchitā //
analyzed: sā tena pṛcchitā
translated: She was asked by him:

original: katha te bhavati imā utpalāni krītāni //
analyzed: katha te bhavati imā utpalāni krītāni
translated: How did you buy these lotuses?

original: sā ta āha //
analyzed: sā te āha
translated: She said to him:

original: pacahi purāṇaśatehi paca utpalāni krītāni dve ca me maitrāya labdhāni //
analyzed: paca hi purāṇa śatehi paca utpalāni krītāni dve ca me maitrāya labdhāni
translated: I bought the lotuses with a hundred old coins, and I got two more as a gift from a friend.

original: megho māṇavo āha //
analyzed: meghaḥ māṇavaḥ āha
translated: The young brahmin Megha said:

original: ahante paca purāṇaśatāni demi dehi me tāni paca utpalāni /
analyzed: ahante paca purāṇa śatāni demi dehi me tāni paca utpalāni
translated: I will give you a hundred old coins, give me those lotuses.

original: aha etehi pacahi utpalehi bhagavanta dīpakara pūjayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: aha etehi pacahi utpalehi bhagavanta dīpakara pūjayiṣyāmi
translated: With these lotuses I will worship the Blessed One Dīpaṃkara.

original: tva hi dvīhi pi arcaya //
analyzed: tva hi dvīhi pi arcaya
translated: You can worship with the two.

original: sā āha //
analyzed: sā āha
translated: She said:

original: samayato te paca utpalāni dadeha /
analyzed: te paca utpalāni dada iha
translated: I will give you the lotuses on one condition.

original: yadi mama bhāryāmupādiyasi yatrayatra upapadyasi aha ca tava bhāryā bhaveya tva ca mama svāmiko bhavesi //
analyzed: yadi mama bhāryām upādiyasi yatra yatra upapadyasi aha ca tava bhāryā bhaveya ca mama svāmikaḥ bhavesi
translated: If you take me as your wife, wherever we are reborn, I will be your wife and you will be my husband.

original: megho māṇavo āha //
analyzed: meghaḥ māṇavaḥ āha
translated: The young brahmin Megha said:

original: anuttarāye samyaksabodhaye cittamutpādayiṣyāmi katha sayoge cittamutpādayiṣyāmi //
analyzed: anuttarāye samyaksabodhaye cittam utpādayiṣyāmi katha sayoge cittam utpādayiṣyāmi
translated: I will generate the mind set on unsurpassed perfect enlightenment. How can I generate the mind set on union?

original: sā āha //
analyzed: sā āha
translated: She said:

original: utpādehi tuva tava na antarāya kariṣyāmi //
analyzed: utpādehi tuva tava na antarāya kariṣyāmi
translated: Generate it. I will not create obstacles for you.

original: tena meghena mānavakenābhyupagatā //
analyzed: tena meghena mānavakena abhyupagatā
translated: That young man Megha agreed:

original: upādiyāmi tava bhāryā teṣāmutpalānāmarthāye //
analyzed: tava bhāryā teṣām utpalānām arthāye
translated: I will take you as my wife for the sake of those blue lotuses.

original: bhagavanta dīpakara pūjayiṣyāmi anuttarāye ca samyaksabodhaye cittamutpādayiṣyāmi //
analyzed: bhagavanta dīpakara pūjayiṣyāmi anuttarāye ca samyaksabodhaye cittam utpādayiṣyāmi
translated: I will worship the Blessed One Dīpaṃkara and generate the mind set on unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: tena paca purāṇaśatāni dattvā pacotpalāni gṛhītā udāra ca se prītiprāmodya kāye utpanna buddhaśabda prakṛtiye māṇavikāye śrutvā //
analyzed: tena paca purāṇa śatāni dattvā paca utpalāni gṛhītā udāra ca se prīti prāmodya kāye utpanna buddha śabda prakṛtiye māṇavikāye śrutvā
translated: Having given six hundred purāṇas, he took six hundred blue lotuses. And that young woman, having heard the word Buddha,

original: yadicchasi pūjitu lokanāyaka jalajehi mālyehi manoramehi /
analyzed: yat icchasi loka nāyaka jala jehi mālyehi manoramehi
translated: If you wish to worship the Lord of the World with delightful water-born garlands,

original: upādiyāhi mamamadya bhāryā premnānuraktā satata ti bheṣya //
analyzed: bhāryā premnā anuraktā satata
translated: Take me as your wife today. I will always be filled with love for you.

original: udumbarasya yatha puṣpa dullabha kadācidutpadyati loke māṇava /
analyzed: udumbarasya kadācid utpadyati loke māṇava
translated: Just as the flower of the fig tree is rare, young man, it sometimes appears in the world.

original: p / emeva buddhāna mahāśayāna kadācidutpāda tathāgatānā //
analyzed: buddhāna mahā śayāna kadācid utpāda tathāgatānā
translated: In the same way, the Buddhas, the greatly compassionate ones, sometimes appear in the world, the Tathāgatas.

original: pūjehi buddha naradamyasārathi jalajehi mālyehi manoramehi /
analyzed: pūjehi buddha nara damya sārathi jala jehi mālyehi manoramehi
translated: Worship the Buddha, the charioteer who tames men, with beautiful water-born garlands,

original: bodhāya te bheṣyati hetubhūta bhāryā ca te bheṣyi aha tahitahi //
analyzed: bodhāya te hetu bhūta bhāryā ca te aha tahitahi
translated: and it will become a cause for your enlightenment. I will be your wife, as you wish.

original: megha āha //
analyzed: meghaḥ āha
translated: Megha said:

original: upādiyāmi tava adya bhāryā jalajāna arthāya manoramāṇā /
analyzed: upādiyāmi tava adya bhāryā jalajāna arthāya manoramāṇā
translated: I accept you today as my wife, for the sake of the beautiful water-born ones.

original: pūjeṣyi buddha naradamyasārathi bodhāya me bheṣyati hetubhūta //
analyzed: buddha nara damya sārathi bodhāya me hetu bhūta
translated: I will worship the Buddha, the charioteer who tames men, and it will become a cause for my enlightenment.

original: sā hṛṣṭā savṛttā adāsi utpalā snehana premṇānugata viditvā /
analyzed: sā hṛṣṭā sa vṛttā utpalā snehana premṇā anugata viditvā
translated: She, delighted and well-behaved, gave the lotuses, knowing that love and affection follow.

original: gacchantamena anugacchi cārikā śṛgāṭake yatra sthito hi māṇavo //
analyzed: anugacchi cārikā śṛgāṭake yatra sthitaḥ hi māṇavaḥ
translated: She followed him as he went, to the place where the young brahmin was standing in the village.

original: bhagavānaśītihi bhikṣusahasrehi parivṛto rājñā ca arcimena aśītihi ca koṭṭarājāna sahasrehi anekehi ca kṣatriyamahāśālasahasrehi śramaṇabrāhmaṇatīrthakarehi
analyzed: bhagavān aśītihi bhikṣu sahasrehi parivṛtaḥ rājñā ca arcimena aśītihi ca koṭṭarājāna sahasrehi anekehi ca kṣatriya mahāśāla sahasrehi śramaṇa brāhmaṇa tīrthakarehi
translated: The Blessed One, surrounded by eighty thousand monks, by King Arcimat, by eighty thousand petty kings, by many thousands of wealthy nobles, ascetics, brahmins, and leaders of other sects,

original: dīpavatī rājadhānī sasprasthito //
analyzed: dīpavatī rājadhānī sasprasthitaḥ
translated: set out from the capital city of Dīpavatī.

original: gamanasamaye bhagavato devasahasrāṇi sannipatitāni /
analyzed: gamana samaye bhagavataḥ deva sahasrāṇi sannipatitāni
translated: When the Blessed One was about to depart, thousands of gods assembled,

original: saptaratanāmayāni cchatrasahasrāṇi ādāya //
analyzed: sapta rata nāmayāni chatra sahasrāṇi ādāya
translated: and brought thousands of parasols made of the seven precious substances.

original: atha so mahāguṇadharo saprasthito agrato gaṇavarasya /
analyzed: atha saḥ mahā guṇa dharaḥ sa prasthitaḥ agratas gaṇa varasya
translated: Then the one possessing great qualities, set out in front of the excellent assembly,

original: mattagajakhelagāmī marīcijālāvatatakāyo //🔽p / verulikasphāṭikamayakācanadhanakanakasukṛtadaṇḍāni /
analyzed: matta gaja khela gāmī marīci jāla avatata kāyaḥ  verulika sphāṭika maya kācana dhana kanaka sukṛta daṇḍāni
translated: Walking like an intoxicated elephant, his body covered with a net of rays.🔽The sons of the gods hold parasols made of beryl, crystal, glass, silver, and well-crafted gold,

original: chatrāṇi devaputrā dhārenti viśuddhadevasya //
analyzed: chatrāṇi devaputrāḥ viśuddhadevasya
translated: For the one of pure divine nature.

original: devābhinirmitāni nabhe taruṇādityamaṇḍalanibhāni /
analyzed: deva abhinirmitāni nabhe taruṇa āditya maṇḍala nibhāni
translated: Created by the gods, in the sky, resembling the orb of the rising sun,

original: tapanīyakikiṇīyārucirā varanandighoṣāṇi //
analyzed: tapanīya kikiṇīya arucirāḥ vara nandi ghoṣāṇi
translated: Adorned with golden bells, with the sound of excellent joy.

original: saptaratanāmaya pi ca divya divyakusumamaṇḍitacchatra /🔽chatrādharasya loke dhārayi cchatra tridaśarājā //
analyzed: ca divya divya kusuma maṇḍita chatra  chatrādharasya loke
translated: And seven kinds of jewels, divine, adorned with divine flowers,🔽The king of the thirty-three holds a parasol for the one who holds a parasol.

original: trisahasrādhipati pi ca kācanaghanakanakasukṛtadaṇḍāye /
analyzed: tri sahasra adhipati ca kācana ghana kanaka sukṛta daṇḍāye
translated: And the lord of the three thousand, with a parasol made of pure gold,

original: varacāmarāye viraja vījenti narendra cānugatāḥ //
analyzed: viraja narendra ca anugatāḥ
translated: The dust-free attendants fan the lord of men with excellent yak-tail fans.

original: atyunnatā ca namati natāpi atyunnatā bhavati bhūmiḥ /🔽praviśantasya bhagavanto sama daśabalānubhāvena //
analyzed: ati unnatā ca namati natā api ati unnatā bhavati bhūmiḥ  praviśantasya bhagavantaḥ sama daśabala anubhāvena
translated: The earth, though very high, bows down, and though low, becomes very high,🔽When the Blessed One enters, by the power of the one with ten powers.

original: samantantara ca bhagavā dakṣiṇameva caraṇa kanakakamala /
analyzed: ca bhagavā dakṣiṇam eva caraṇa
translated: And the Blessed One, all around, with his golden lotus feet,

original: pariharati indrakīle tatra bhavati adbhuto ghoṣo //
analyzed: pariharati indrakīle tatra bhavati adbhutaḥ ghoṣaḥ
translated: At the threshold of Indra, there arises a wondrous sound.

original: āḍambarā mṛdaṅgā paṭahā asaghaṭṭitā pravādyanti /
analyzed: āḍambarāḥ mṛdaṅgāḥ paṭahāḥ pravādyanti
translated: The drums, kettledrums, and conches, without being struck, resound.

original: śakhā paṇavā ca veṇu praviśantisma naravarasmi //
analyzed: śakhā paṇavā ca veṇu praviśantisma
translated: The flutes, cymbals, and lutes play as the Best of Men enters.

original: yāni ratanāni nagare nihitāni peṭakakaraṇḍagatāni /
analyzed: yāni ratanāni nagare nihitāni peṭaka karaṇḍa gatāni
translated: The jewels that are kept in the city, in chests and baskets,

original: tāni pi saghaṭṭensuḥ ratanavaravidusmi praviśante //
analyzed: tāni pi praviśante
translated: Those too resound as the Knower of the Best Jewel enters.

original: atha mahārahāṇi mṛdūni vastrayugā mārge sastarayensu /
analyzed: atha mahārahāṇi mṛdūni vastra yugā mārge
translated: Then the most precious soft pairs of garments are spread out on the road,

original: bhagavato nānāvidhāni ragaraktā kāśikadukūlā //
analyzed: bhagavataḥ nānāvidhāni raga raktā kāśika dukūlā
translated: For the Blessed One, in various colors, red, yellow, and silk.

original: alakṛto lokanāyako kośikāraka kṣauma ya tūlā kācilindika ajinapraveṇi p / ca vanarustā tamakūṭātapakoṭṭavakasubhūmi toṣalakolamacirāvokodbhava
analyzed: ca
translated: The Leader of the World is adorned with silk, cotton, wool, and antelope skin, with vanarasta, tamalapatta, and cotton, with tośala, kola, and macirā.

original: āma raktaka pacavidhā naya lla //
analyzed: āma raktaka pacavidhā
translated: The seven kinds of red garments are worn.

original: yāva ca agrodyāna yāva ca antaḥpura mahipatisya /
analyzed: yāva ca agra udyāna yāva ca antaḥpura mahipatisya
translated: From the foremost garden up to the inner quarters of the Lord of the Earth,

original: śobhati narendramārgo duṣyaśatasahasrasastīrṇo //
analyzed: śobhati narendra mārgaḥ duṣya śata sahasra sastīrṇaḥ
translated: The road of the Lord of Men shines, covered with hundreds of thousands of duṣyas.

original: atha ca vanakhaṇḍaragatā pramadā adhyokiranti narasiha /
analyzed: atha ca vana khaṇḍara gatā pramadāḥ adhyokiranti narasiha
translated: And the women who dwell in the forest groves look down upon the Lion among Men.

original: kusumanikaraka grahetva kanakagirinibha abhikiranti //
analyzed: abhikiranti
translated: And scatter them, like a golden mountain, on the one whose body is like a golden mountain.

analyzed: tāni ca kara pramuktā surabhīṇi

analyzed: gagana pathe nirālambe abhyantara kaṇṭakāni surabhīṇi

analyzed: savartakā pi vātā yadi vivahensuḥ imā trisāhasrā

analyzed: na vikopaye kuto puna vahensu ta

analyzed: bhagavanta kanaka nibha kanaka vara mucchu sama varṇa dṛṣṭvā
translated: Having seen the Blessed One, who is like gold, with a color like the best of gold,

analyzed: divi maruṇa gaṇā tada udīrayensuḥ aho dharma
translated: The hosts of gods in the sky exclaimed: Ah, the Dharma!

analyzed: ca ca

analyzed: śobhanti ca kañcukam ākāśe

analyzed: hikkārā tūrya miśrā samantataḥ vartanti aho dharma

analyzed: puravara

translated: Mahāmaudgalyāyana, the young brāhmaṇa Megha saw the Blessed One Dīpaṃkara coming from afar, endowed with the thirty-two marks of a great man,

original: anuvyajanehi upaśobhitaśarīra aṣṭādaśehi āveṇikehi buddhadharmehi samanvāgata daśahi tathāgatabalehi balava caturhi vaiśāradyehi samanvāgata

analyzed: ca cetanā prādurbhāvaḥ

analyzed: aho punar pi bhaveya anāgatam adhvāna samyaksabuddhaḥ vidyā caraṇa sapannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ śāstā  /

analyzed: devānā ca manuṣyāṇā ca yathāya bhagavā dīpa karaḥ etarahi
translated: just as the Blessed One Dīpaṃkara is now.

translated: May I be endowed with the thirty-two marks of a great man, my body adorned with the eighty minor characteristics, endowed with the eighteen distinctive qualities of a Buddha,

translated: powerful with the ten powers of a Tathāgata, and very confident with the four forms of fearlessness, just as the Blessed One Dīpaṃkara is now.

analyzed: eva ca anuttara dharmacakra pravarteya yathāya bhagavā dīpa karaḥ etarahi
translated: May I turn the unsurpassed Dharma wheel just as the Blessed One Dīpaṃkara is now doing.

original: eva samagra śrāvakasagha parihareya /
analyzed: eva samagra śrāvaka sagha parihareya
translated: I would lead the entire assembly of disciples.

analyzed: eva ca deva manuṣyāḥ śrotavya p śraddhātavya manyensuḥ
translated: And thus gods and humans would think of me as one to be listened to and believed in,
