translated: just as the Blessed One Dīpaṃkara is now.

original: bhaveya bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya mahato janakāyasyārthāya hitāya sukhāya devānā ca manuṣyāṇā ca //
analyzed: bhaveya bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya loka anukampāya mahataḥ jana kāyasya arthāya hitāya sukhāya devānā ca manuṣyāṇā ca
translated: I would be for the benefit of many people, for the happiness of many people, out of compassion for the world, for the welfare, benefit, and happiness of gods and human beings.

original: atha mahāmaudgalyāyana bhagavāndīpakaro meghasya māṇavasya anuttareṇa buddhajñānena mahāsamudāgamana ca jñātvā kuśalamūlasambhāra ca cetopraṇidhāna
analyzed: atha mahāmaudgalyāyana bhagavān dīpa karaḥ meghasya māṇavasya anuttareṇa buddha jñānena mahā samudāgamana ca jñātvā kuśala mūla sambhāra ca cetaḥ praṇidhāna
translated: Then, Mahāmaudgalyāyana, the Blessed One Dīpaṃkara, knowing that the young brāhmaṇa Megha had attained the great realization of unsurpassed buddha-knowledge, and knowing his accumulation of the roots of virtue and his aspiration,

original: jñātvā akhaṇḍamacchidramakalmāṣamavraṇa anuttarāye samyaksabodhaye vyākārṣīt //
analyzed: jñātvā akhaṇḍam acchidram akalmāṣam avraṇa an uttarāye samyaksabodhaye vyākārṣīt
translated: and knowing that he was without fault, without blemish, without defect, and without flaw, prophesied his unsurpassed perfect awakening, saying:

original: bhaviṣyasi tva māṇava anāgatamadhvāna aparimite asakhyeye kalpe śākyānā kapilavastusmi nagare śākyamunirnāma tathāgato'rha samyaksabuddho
analyzed: bhaviṣyasi tva māṇava anāgatam adhvāna aparimite asakhyeye kalpe śākyānā kapilavastusmi nagare śākyamuniḥ nāma tathāgataḥ urha samyaksabuddhaḥ  /
translated: Young man, in the future, after an immeasurable, incalculable eon, you will become a tathāgata, an arhat, a perfectly enlightened buddha named Śākyamuni in the city of Kapilavastu in the Śākya clan.

original: vidyācarasapannaḥ sugato lokavidanuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ śāstā devānā ca manuṣyāṇā ca yathāpyahametarhi dvātriśatīhi mahāpuruṣalakṣaṇehi
analyzed: vidyā cara sapannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ śāstā devānā ca manuṣyāṇā ca yathā api aham etarhi dvātriśatīhi mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇehi
translated: endowed with knowledge and good conduct, a Well-Gone One, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed trainer of those who can be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, a Blessed One, just as I am now, endowed with the thirty-two marks of a great man,🔽with a body adorned with the eighty minor marks, endowed with the eighteen qualities exclusive to a Buddha, powerful with the ten powers of a Tathāgata,

original: samanvāgato aśītihi anuvyajanehi upaśobhitaśarīro aṣṭādaśehi āveṇikehi buddhadharmehi samanvāgato daśahi tathāgatabalehi balavā caturhi vaiśāradyehi 🔽suviśārado //
analyzed: samanvāgataḥ aśītihi anuvyajanehi upaśobhita śarīraḥ aṣṭādaśehi āveṇikehi buddha dharmehi samanvāgataḥ daśahi tathāgata balehi balavā caturhi vaiśāradyehi  su viśāradaḥ
translated: very confident with the four forms of fearlessness.

original: eva tīrṇo tārayiṣyasi mukto mocayiṣyasi āśvasto āśvāsayiṣyasi parinirvṛto parinirvāpayiṣyasi yathāpi ahametarhi /
analyzed: eva tīrṇaḥ tārayiṣyasi muktaḥ mocayiṣyasi āśvastaḥ āśvāsayiṣyasi parinirvṛtaḥ parinirvāpayiṣyasi yathā api aham etarhi
translated: Just as I am now, having crossed over, you will cause to cross over; being liberated, you will liberate; being comforted, you will comfort; being completely emancipated, you will completely emancipate.

original: eva cānuttara dharmacakra pravartayiṣyasi /
analyzed: eva ca anuttara dharmacakra pravartayiṣyasi
translated: And you will turn the unsurpassed wheel of the Dharma,

original: eva ca samagra śrāvakasagha parihariṣyasi /
analyzed: eva ca samagra śrāvaka sagha parihariṣyasi
translated: and you will lead the community of disciples to be completely united,

original: eva ca devamanuṣyā śrotavya śraddhātavya maniṣyanti /
analyzed: eva ca deva manuṣyā śrotavya śraddhātavya maniṣyanti
translated: and gods and humans will listen to and believe in you, just as they do to me now.

original: yathāpi ahametarhi ta bhaviṣyasi bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukapāya mahato janakāyasyārthāya hitāya sukhāya devānā ca manuṣyāṇā 🔽ca //
analyzed: yathā api aham etarhi ta bhaviṣyasi bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya loka anukapāya mahataḥ jana kāyasya arthāya hitāya sukhāya devānā ca manuṣyāṇā 🔽ca
translated: You will be for the benefit of many beings, for the happiness of many beings, out of compassion for the world, for the welfare, benefit, and happiness of a great multitude of beings, of gods and humans.

original: samantaravyākṛto ca mahāmaudgalyāyana bhagavatā dīpakareṇa megho māṇavo anuttarāye samayksabodhaye tālamātra vaihāyasamabhyudgamya ekāśīkṛto
analyzed: samantara vyākṛtaḥ ca mahāmaudgalyāyana bhagavatā dīpakareṇa meghaḥ māṇavaḥ anuttarāye samayksabodhaye tāla mātra vaihāyasam abhyudgamya ekāśīkṛtaḥ
translated: Immediately after the Blessed One Dīpaṃkara had prophesied, Mahāmaudgalyāyana, the young brāhmaṇa Megha rose up into the air to the height of a palm tree,

original: prāñjalīkṛto bhagavanta dīpakara saśrāvakasagha namasyamāno //
analyzed: prāñjalīkṛtaḥ bhagavanta dīpakara sa śrāvaka sagha namasyamānaḥ
translated: and with folded hands he paid homage to the Blessed One Dīpaṃkara and his assembly of disciples.

original: iya ca mahāpṛthivī tatkṣaṇa tatmurhūta atīva ṣaḍvikāra kampe sakampe /
analyzed: iya ca mahā pṛthivī atīva ṣaṣ vikāra kampe sa kampe
translated: And at that very moment, the great earth shook violently in six ways.

original: bhūmyā ca devā ghoṣad p / śrāvayensuḥ //
analyzed: bhūmyā ca devāḥ ghoṣat p
translated: And the gods of the earth proclaimed with a cry:

original: eva megho māṇavo bhagavatā dīpakareṇa anuttarāye samyaksabodhaye vyākṛto tadbhaviṣyati bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya mahato
analyzed: eva meghaḥ māṇavaḥ bhagavatā dīpakareṇa anuttarāye samyaksabodhaye tat bhaviṣyati bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya loka anukampāya mahataḥ
translated: Thus the young brāhmaṇa Megha has been prophesied by the Blessed One Dīpaṃkara to attain supreme perfect enlightenment. This will be for the benefit of many people, for the happiness of many people, out of compassion for the world,

original: janakāyasyārthāya hitāya sukhāya devānā ca manuṣyāṇā ca //
analyzed: jana kāyasya arthāya hitāya sukhāya devānā ca manuṣyāṇā ca
translated: for the sake of the great multitude, for the benefit and happiness of devas and humans.

original: bhūmyānā devānā ghoṣa śrutvā antarīkṣecarā devā cāturmahārājikā devā trāstriśā yāmā tuṣitā nirmāṇaratino paranirmitavaśavartino iti hi
analyzed: bhūmyānā devānā ghoṣa śrutvā antarīkṣecarāḥ devā cāturmahārājikāḥ devā iti hi
translated: Having heard the cry of the gods of the earth, the gods who move in the desire realm, the gods of the four great kings, the gods of the thirty-three, the Yāma gods, the Tuṣita gods, the Nirmāṇarati gods, and the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods,

original: tatkṣaṇa tatmurhūta yāva brahmakāya ghoṣamabhyudgame //
analyzed: tad kṣaṇa brahma kāya ghoṣam abhyudgame
translated: At that very moment, the sound of Brahmā's voice arose.

original: eva mārṣa megho māṇavo bhagavatā dīpakareṇa anuttarāye samyaksabodhaye vyākṛto ta bhaviṣyati bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukapāya
analyzed: eva mārṣa meghaḥ māṇavaḥ bhagavatā dīpakareṇa anuttarāye samyaksabodhaye bhaviṣyati bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya loka anukapāya
translated: Thus, friends, the young brāhmaṇa Megha has been prophesied by the Blessed One Dīpaṃkara to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment. That will be for the benefit of many people, for the happiness of many people, out of compassion for the world,

original: mahato janakāyasyārthāya hitāya sukhāya devānā ca manuṣyāṇā ca //
analyzed: mahataḥ jana kāyasya arthāya hitāya sukhāya devānā ca manuṣyāṇā ca
translated: for the sake of the great multitude, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and human beings.

original: aprameyasya ca udārasya mahato obhāsasya loke prādurbhāvo āsi //
analyzed: aprameyasya ca udārasya mahataḥ obhāsasya loke prādurbhāvaḥ āsi
translated: And there appeared in the world an immeasurable, vast, great light.

original: yā pi tā loke lokāntarikā andhakārā andhakārārpitā tamisrā tamasārpitā aghā aghasabhūtapūrvā yatra ime pi candramasūryā eva maharddhikā eva
analyzed: yā pi tā loke loka āntarikāḥ andhakārāḥ andhakāra arpitā tamisrā tamasā arpitā aghāḥ agha sa bhūta pūrvā yatra ime pi candrama sūryāḥ eva maharddhikāḥ eva
translated: Even those interspaces between the worlds that are dark, enveloped in darkness, where the moon and sun, powerful and majestic as they are,

original: mahānubhāvā ābhayā ābhā nābhisabhuṇanti ālokena vā āloka na spharanti te pi tena obhāsena sphuṭā abhūnsuḥ /
analyzed: mahā anubhāvāḥ ābhayā ābhāḥ na abhisabhuṇanti ālokena vā āloka na spharanti te pi tena obhāsena sphuṭāḥ abhūnsuḥ
translated: with their great splendor and glory cannot make their splendor and glory prevail, cannot spread their light—even those places became suffused with this radiance.

original: ye pi tatra satvā upapannāḥ te pi anyonya sajānensuḥ //
analyzed: ye pi tatra satvā upapannāḥ te pi anyonya sajānensuḥ
translated: And the beings who were reborn there became mutually aware of each other:

original: anye pi kila bho iha satvā upapannāḥ anye pi kila bho satvāḥ ihopapannā /
analyzed: anye pi kila bho iha satvāḥ upapannāḥ anye pi kila bho satvāḥ iha upapannā
translated: 'Apparently, other beings have also been reborn here. Apparently, other beings have also been reborn here.'

original: ekāntasukhasamarpitā ca tatkṣaṇa tatmuhūrta sarvasatvā abhūnsu //
analyzed: ekānta sukha samarpitā ca tad kṣaṇa tad muhūrta sarva satvāḥ
translated: and all beings were endowed with complete happiness at that moment and instant.

original: ye pi avīce mahānarake upapannā atikrame va devānā devānubhāva nāgānā nāgānubhāva yakṣāṇā yakṣānubhāva //
analyzed: ye pi avīce mahānarake upapannāḥ atikrame devānā deva anubhāva nāgānā nāga anubhāva yakṣāṇā yakṣa anubhāva
translated: Even those who had been reborn in the great hell Avīci surpassed the power of the gods, the power of the nāgas, and the power of the yakṣas.

original: dhyāmāni ca abhūnsuḥ mārabhavanāni niṣprabhāṇi nistejāni nirabhiramyāṇi /🔽krośikānyapyasya khaṇḍāni prapatensu /
analyzed: dhyāmāni ca abhūnsuḥ māra bhavanāni niṣprabhāṇi nistejāni nirabhiramyāṇi  krośikāni api asya khaṇḍāni prapaten su
translated: The abodes of Māra became gloomy, lusterless, joyless,🔽and the peaks of Mount Sumeru crumbled and fell down.

original: dvikrośikānyapyasya khaṇḍāni prapatensu /🔽trikrośikānyapyasya khaṇḍāni prapatensu /
analyzed: dvi krośikāni api asya khaṇḍāni prapaten  tri krośikāni api asya khaṇḍāni prapaten su
translated: The two-league peaks crumbled and fell down.🔽The three-league peaks crumbled and fell down.

original: yojanikānyapyasya khaṇḍāni prapatensu /
analyzed: yojanikāni api asya khaṇḍāni prapaten
translated: The ten-league peaks crumbled and fell down.

original: dhvajāgrāṇyapyasya prapatensuḥ //
analyzed: dhvaja agrāṇi api asya prapatensuḥ
translated: And the tops of the banners fell down.

original: māro ca pāpīmā duḥkhī durmanā vipratisārī antośalyaparidāghajāto abhūṣi //
analyzed: duḥkhī durmanāḥ vipratisārī
translated: And the evil Māra became sorrowful, dejected, remorseful, and his inner organs were scorched.

original: p / ajina prajñapayitvā kamaṇḍalu nikṣipayitva ekānte kṣipiyānutpalahasta nipate kramavarehi cakṣumato //
analyzed: ajina prajñapayitvā kamaṇḍalu nikṣipayitvā ekānte nipate
translated: Having spread out a deer skin and placed his water pot to one side, he threw down the blue lotus in his hand and fell at the feet of the one with eyes like lotuses.

original: tāni ca karapramuktā surabhīṇi pacavarṇo / / / / / / / / /
analyzed: tāni ca kara pramuktā surabhīṇi
translated: And those fragrant flowers released from his hands, five-colored,

original: sasthihati puṣpakacuko bhagavato lokanāthasya //
analyzed: sasthihati puṣpa kacukaḥ bhagavataḥ lokanāthasya
translated: The flower-garlands remain suspended over the Lord, the Protector of the world.

original: gaganapathe nirālambe abhyantarakaṇṭakāni surabhīṇi /🔽sthātu prādakṣiṇiye abhidakṣiye abhidakṣiṇa kṛtva kusumāni //
analyzed: gagana pathe nirālambe abhyantara kaṇṭakāni surabhīṇi  sthātu prādakṣiṇiye abhidakṣiye abhidakṣiṇa kṛtva kusumāni
translated: In the sky, without support, are fragrant flowers without stalks.🔽They remain, turning to the right, turning towards the right, having turned to the right.

original: gacchati anugacchanti tiṣṭhanti sthāti lokapradyote /
analyzed: gacchati anugacchanti tiṣṭhanti sthāti loka pradyote
translated: When the Light of the world goes, they follow; when he stands, they stand.

original: īryāpathamṛddhimato sarvābhibhuno na vijahante //
analyzed: īryāpatham ṛddhimataḥ sarva abhibhunaḥ na vijahante
translated: They do not leave the one with the miraculous power of conduct, the conqueror of all.

original: savartakā pi vātā yadi vivahensuḥ imā trisāhasrā /
analyzed: savartakā pi vātā yadi vivahensuḥ imā trisāhasrā
translated: Even if the winds that move the Sahasra-world were to blow,

original: na vikopaye kuto puna vahensu ta puṣpakacukaka //
analyzed: na vikopaye kuto puna vahensu ta
translated: they would not disturb the flower-garlands, let alone carry them away.

original: bhagavanta kanakanibha kanakavaramucchusamavarṇa dṛṣṭvā /
analyzed: bhagavanta kanaka nibha kanaka vara mucchu sama varṇa dṛṣṭvā
translated: Having seen the Blessed One, who is like gold, of the color of excellent gold,

original: divi marūṇa gaṇā tada udīrayensuḥ aho dharma //
analyzed: divi marūṇa gaṇā tada udīrayensuḥ aho dharma
translated: the hosts of gods in the sky exclaimed: Ah, Dharma!

original: atha sāgarāmbaramahī sakampe ca divi devasagheṣu /
analyzed: atha sāgara ambara mahī sa kampe ca divi deva sagheṣu
translated: Then the ocean, the sky, and the earth trembled, and in the assemblies of gods in the sky,

original: vyākaraṇasmi vyākṛte abhyudgami adbhuto ghoṣo //
analyzed: vyākṛte abhyudgami adbhutaḥ ghoṣaḥ
translated: when the prophecy was given, a marvelous sound arose.

original: eṣo megho bhavatā ekāntasubhāṣitocchritadhvajena /
analyzed: eṣaḥ meghaḥ bhavatā ekānta su bhāṣita ucchrita dhvajena
translated: This Megha, who has raised the banner of the excellent utterance,

original: dīpakareṇa muninā vyākṛto bhaviṣyasi jino tuva //
analyzed: dīpakareṇa muninā vyākṛtaḥ bhaviṣyasi
translated: has been prophesied by the sage Dīpaṃkara to become a Jina.

original: ta hitasukhāya kāhasi sabrahmasurāsurasya lokasya /
analyzed: ta hita sukhāya kā ahasi sa brahma sura asurasya lokasya
translated: You will be for the welfare and happiness of the world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmas,

original: hāyiṣyanti apāyā narakā maru savivardhanti //
analyzed: hāyiṣyanti apāyāḥ narakāḥ
translated: the lower realms will cease, the hells and animal realms will increase,

original: p / dīpa ca lena ca parāyaṇa ca dīpakaro nāma abhūṣi śāstā /
analyzed: ca ca ca dīpakaraḥ nāma śāstā
translated: and the Teacher named Dīpaṃkara will appear.

original: ito asakhyeyatarasmi kalpe svākhyātadharmo bhagavā nareśo //
analyzed: itas asakhyeyatarasmi kalpe su ākhyāta dharmaḥ bhagavā nareśaḥ
translated: Innumerable eons ago, the Blessed One, the Lord of men, the one with well-proclaimed teachings,

original: so uttamārtha abhigamya paṇḍito viśārada vartayi dharmacakra /
analyzed: saḥ uttama artha abhigamya paṇḍitaḥ viśārada
translated: having attained the highest goal, the wise one, fearless, will turn the wheel of Dharma.

original: satye na dharme ca smṛto pratiṣṭhito mahadbhayādviṣamāduddhare prajā //
analyzed: satye na dharme ca smṛtaḥ pratiṣṭhitaḥ mahat bhayāt viṣamāt uddhare prajāḥ
translated: He will be remembered as established in truth and Dharma, and will deliver beings from the great fear of the uneven path.

original: megho'nddaśā śramaṇagaṇasya nāyaka dīpakara paramavicitralakṣaṇa /
analyzed: śramaṇa gaṇasya nāyaka dīpa kara parama vicitra lakṣaṇa
translated: The cloud, the guide of the assembly of ten thousand ascetics, Dīpaṃkara, who possesses the most wondrous marks,

original: citta prasādetva jina avandi ca so vandamāno praiṇidhi akāsi //
analyzed: citta
translated: having gained faith in the Jina, bowed down. While bowing, he made this aspiration:

original: eva aha lokamima careya yathā aya carati asagamānaso /
analyzed: eva aha careya yathā aya carati asaga mānasaḥ
translated: May I practice in this world as he practices, with an untroubled mind.

original: cakra pravarteyamananyasādṛśa susaskṛta devamanuṣyapūjita //🔽artha careya loke devamanuṣyā deśeya dharma /
analyzed: cakra su saskṛta deva manuṣya pūjita  artha careya loke deva manuṣyāḥ deśeya dharma
translated: May I turn the unsurpassed wheel, well-practiced, worshipped by gods and humans.🔽May I practice for the sake of the world, teaching the Dharma to gods and humans.

original: eva vineya satvā yathā aya lokapradyoto //
analyzed: eva vineya satvā yathā aya loka pradyoto
translated: May I guide beings as this Light of the World does.

original: praṇidhi ca jñātvāna asagasagata sarvehi hetūhi upasthita jino /🔽akhaṇḍamacchidramakalmāṣāvraṇa matimā / / /vyākare arthadarśī //
analyzed: praṇidhi ca jñātvāna sarvehi hetūhi upasthita jino  akhaṇḍam acchidram akalmāṣa avraṇa artha darśī
translated: And knowing his vow, the Jina, who is the refuge of all,

original: p / buddho tuva bheṣyasi megha māṇava anāgate aparimitasmi kalpe /
analyzed: buddhaḥ megha māṇava anāgate aparimitasmi kalpe
translated: declared to him, You will become a Buddha, O Megha, in the future, after innumerable aeons,

original: kapilāhūye ṛṣibhavanasmi śākiyo tadā tva pi praṇidhivipākameṣyasi //
analyzed: śākiyo tadā tva pi praṇidhi vipākam eṣyasi
translated: in the city of Kapila, in the abode of the Rishi, when you will be a Shakya, then you will attain the fruit of your vow.

original: tena aparāṇi paca purāṇaśatāni preṣitāni ācāryasya //
analyzed: tena aparāṇi paca purāṇa śatāni preṣitāni ācāryasya
translated: He sent another five hundred old men to the teacher.

original: niryātetvā evavidha sarva meghadattasya ācikṣati //
analyzed: evavidha sarva meghadattasya ācikṣati
translated: Having sent them, he said to Megha:

original: eva maye bhagavā dīpakaraḥ pūjito anuttarāye samyaksabodhaye vyākṛto //
analyzed: eva maye bhagavā dīpakaraḥ pūjitaḥ anuttarāye samyaksabodhaye vyākṛtaḥ
translated: Thus I worshipped the Blessed One Dīpaṃkara and was predicted to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: gacchāma tahi bhagavato dīpakarasya santike brahmacarya cariṣyāma tā ca samitimanubhaviṣyāmaḥ //
analyzed: gacchāma bhagavataḥ dīpakarasya santike brahmacarya cariṣyāma tā ca samitim anubhaviṣyāmaḥ
translated: Let us go to the Blessed One Dīpaṃkara and lead the holy life in his presence and experience that bliss.

original: so āha //
analyzed: sā u āha
translated: He said:

original: aha tāva asamāptavedo tatra na śakyāmi gantu //
analyzed: aha tāva asamāptavedo tatra na śakyāmi gantu
translated: I am not yet finished with the Vedas, I cannot go there.

original: gathā kāṣṭha vivahyate mahante udakārṇave /
analyzed: gathā kāṣṭha vivahyate mahante udakārṇave
translated: Just as a log is carried away by the great flood of water,

original: saghaṭṭito vinaśyati eva priyasamāgamo //
analyzed: sa ghaṭṭitaḥ vinaśyati eva
translated: so is the union with a loved one destroyed by separation.

original: megho gatvā bhagavato dīpakarasya santike pravrajito //
analyzed: meghaḥ gatvā bhagavataḥ dīpakarasya santike pravrajitaḥ
translated: Megha went to the Blessed One Dīpaṃkara and became a monk.

original: te tādṛśā kalyāṇamitrāṇāgamya buddhasahasrakoṭiyo aparimeyā asakhyeyā ārādhetvā pūjayitvā ca saśrāvakasaghā aprameyāni ca pratyekabuddhakoṭiniyutā
analyzed: te buddha sahasra koṭiyaḥ aparimeyāḥ asakhyeyāḥ pūjayitvā ca sa śrāvaka saghāḥ aprameyāni ca pratyekabuddha koṭi niyutā
translated: Having thus obtained such spiritual friends, they propitiated and worshipped countless and innumerable thousands of koṭis of Buddhas, together with their assemblies of disciples, and innumerable koṭis of nayutas of Pratyekabuddhas,

original: pūjayitvā divyamānuṣikā sapattimanubhavanti yāvadanuttarā samyaksabodhimabhisabuddhā //
analyzed: pūjayitvā sapattim anubhavanti yāvat anuttarā samyaksabodhim abhisabuddhā
translated: and having worshipped them, they experienced heavenly and human happiness until they fully awakened to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: yo rūpa naradamyasārathi śrutvā na rūpa na upādi gaccheha upādeha ca //
analyzed: yaḥ rūpa nara damya sārathi gaccha iha upāda iha ca
translated: O Charioteer of the people to be tamed, having heard this, do not go to form, do not go to appropriation, do not go to appropriation here.

original: so tvāha //
analyzed: sā u tu āha
translated: He said:

original: śiraḥpraṇāmāye eṣa atīva pravaṇo megho vartate //
analyzed: eṣa atīva pravaṇaḥ meghaḥ vartate
translated: This Megha is very much inclined to bow his head.

original: meghasya māṇavasya sakāśāto buddhaśabda śruṇitvā na hṛṣṭo /
analyzed: meghasya māṇavasya sakāśātas buddha śabda śruṇitvā na hṛṣṭaḥ
translated: Having heard the word Buddha from the young man Megha, he was not delighted.

original: pāpamitrasamagitāye pacānantaryāṇi kṛtāni //
analyzed: paca ānantaryāṇi kṛtāni
translated: Because of associating with evil friends, he committed the five acts of immediate retribution.

original: paradāre prasakto tatra kāle vā vi p / kāle vā gacchati //
analyzed: paradāre tatra kāle vā vi kāle vā gacchati
translated: He was attached to others' wives and went to them at the right time or the wrong time.

original: ta mātā putrasnehena nivāreti mā tatra pāradāriko ti kṛtvā ghātayiṣyati //
analyzed: ta mātā putra snehena nivāreti mā tatra kṛtvā ghātayiṣyati
translated: His mother, out of love for her son, tried to stop him, saying, Do not let them kill you, thinking you are a wife-stealer.

original: rakto artha na jānāti rakto dharma na paśyati /
analyzed: raktaḥ artha na jānāti raktaḥ dharma na paśyati
translated: The man who is in love does not know what is good for him, nor does he see what is right.

original: andhakāre tadā bhavati ya rāgo sahate naraḥ //
analyzed: andhakāre tadā bhavati yaḥ rāgaḥ sahate naraḥ
translated: Then there is darkness for the man who endures passion.

original: so tā mātara ghātayitvā tasyā istrikāye sakāśa gato yatra prasakto hasyaiva tā prakṛtimācikṣati //
analyzed: saḥ u tā mātara ghātayitvā tasyāḥ istri kāye sakāśa gataḥ yatra prasaktaḥ hasya eva tā prakṛtim ācikṣati
translated: He killed his mother and went to his wife, to whom he was attached. He laughed and told her the whole story.

original: eva tva mama iṣṭā ya mayā tava kāraṇā mātā jīvitādyaparopitā //
analyzed: eva tva mama iṣṭā mayā tava kāraṇā mātā jīvita ādi aparopitā
translated: She said: You are dear to me, because it was for your sake that I killed my mother.

original: sā strī udvignā savṛttā //
analyzed: sā strī udvignā sa vṛttā
translated: The woman was alarmed and turned away.

original: tāya ukto //
analyzed: tāyaḥ uktaḥ
translated: He said to her:

original: mā me bhūyo āgacchasi //
analyzed: mā me bhūyas āgacchasi
translated: Do not come to me again.

original: aparamātara prasakto //
analyzed: apara mātara
translated: He was attached to another mother.

original: tato ta sā aparamātā āha //
analyzed: āha
translated: Then that other mother said:

original: etha pitara jīvitādvyaropehi tva ca me svāmiko bhaviṣyasīti //
analyzed: pitara jīvitāt vyaropehi tva ca me svāmikaḥ bhaviṣyasi iti
translated: Come, kill your father and you will be my husband.

original: tena dāni so pitā jīvitādvyaparopito //
analyzed: tena dāni saḥ pitā jīvitāt vyaparopitaḥ
translated: Then he killed his father.

original: so tatra adhiṣṭhāne jugupsito sakṛtto //
analyzed: saḥ tatra adhiṣṭhāne jugupsitaḥ sakṛttas
translated: He was despised in that place.

original: mitrajñātikā parivarjenti //
analyzed: mitra jñātikā
translated: Friends and relatives avoided him.

original: so tato adhiṣṭhānāto anyamadhiṣṭhāna sakrānto atra me na koci jāniṣyati //
analyzed: saḥ tatas adhiṣṭhāna atas anyam adhiṣṭhāna sa krāntaḥ atra me na koci jāniṣyati
translated: He left that place and went to another place, thinking: No one here knows me.

original: tasya yo mātāpitṝṇā bhikṣu kulopako āsi arahā mahānubhāvo so janapadacārikā caramāṇo tamadhiṣṭhānamanuprāpto //
analyzed: tasya yaḥ mātā pitṝṇā bhikṣu kula upakaḥ āsi arahā mahā anubhāvaḥ saḥ caramāṇaḥ tam adhiṣṭhānam anuprāptaḥ
translated: The monk who was the benefactor of his parents, who was an Arhan of great power, came to that place on his wanderings through the provinces.

original: tena dāni so dānapatiputro bhikṣuṇā tahi adhiṣṭhāne dṛṣṭo //
analyzed: tena dāni saḥ dānapati putraḥ bhikṣuṇā tahi adhiṣṭhāne dṛṣṭaḥ
translated: The monk saw the householder’s son in that place.

original: so pi ta bhikṣu dṛṣṭvā śakī savṛtto mā me bhikṣu imahi adhiṣṭhānahi dūṣayatīti //
analyzed: saḥ pi ta bhikṣu dṛṣṭvā śakī sa vṛttaḥ mā me bhikṣu dūṣayati iti
translated: And the householder’s son, seeing the monk, was afraid lest the monk should denounce him in that place.

original: tena dāni so pi arahā bhikṣu jīvitādvyaparopito //
analyzed: tena dāni saḥ pi arahā bhikṣu jīvitāt vyaparopitaḥ
translated: So he, too, was deprived of life by that Arhan.

original: so dāni yo tadā āsi samyaksabuddho tasya śāsane pravrajito //
analyzed: saḥ dāni yaḥ tadā āsi samyaksabuddhaḥ tasya śāsane pravrajitaḥ
translated: He who was then the monk in the dispensation of the exalted Samyaksaṃbuddha,

original: tena dāni śāsane pravrajitvā sagho ca bhinno buddhasya rudhira utpādita //
analyzed: tena dāni śāsane pravrajitvā saghaḥ ca bhinnaḥ buddhasya rudhire utpādita
translated: having gone forth in that dispensation, caused a schism in the Order and shed the blood of a Buddha.

original: etāni pacānantaryāṇi karmāṇi kṛtvā mahānarakeṣupapanno //
analyzed: etāni paca ānantaryāṇi karmāṇi kṛtvā
translated: Having committed these five crimes entailing immediate retribution, he was reborn in the great hells.🔽For a long time he wandered and roamed through the eight great hells and the sixteen secondary hells.

original: so aṣṭasu mahānarakeṣu ṣoḍaśotsadeṣu sucira dīrghamadhvāna sadhāvitvā sasaritvā p / yadā bhagavatā śākyamuninā anuttarā samyaksabodhirabhisabuddhā
analyzed: saḥ aṣṭasu mahānarakeṣu ṣoḍaśa utsadeṣu su cira dīrgham adhvāna sa dhāvitvā sa saritvā  /
translated: When the exalted Śākyamuni had awakened to perfect enlightenment,

original: pravṛttaḥ so mahāsamudre timitimigilo nāma matsyajāti āyāmato bahuyojanaśatikena ātmabhāvena //
analyzed: pravṛttaḥ saḥ mahā samudre timitimigilaḥ nāma matsya jāti āyāmataḥ bahu yojana śatikena ātma bhāvena
translated: He had entered the great ocean, a fish called Timitimiṅgila, many hundreds of yojanas long.

original: yadā thapakarṇi gṛhapati sayānapātro pacaśataparivāro tena mahāsamudra okasto tadā tena makarabhūtena bubhukṣitena mukha ucchvāsita bhojanārthikena
analyzed: yadā thapakarṇi gṛhapati sa yānapātraḥ paca śata parivāraḥ tena mahā samudraḥ tadā tena makara bhūtena bubhukṣitena mukhe bhojana arthikena
translated: When the householder Thapakarṇi, with his ship and his retinue of five hundred, had entered the great ocean, then that hungry Timitimiṅgila, having become a makara, opened its mouth for food.

original: tato yānapātrāṇi sthapakarṇikasya gṛhapatisya yena ta makaramukha tena pradhāvitā //
analyzed: tatas yānapātrāṇi sthapa karṇikasya gṛhapatisya yena ta makaramukha tena pradhāvitā
translated: Then the ships of the householder Thapakarṇi were carried by the wind to where the makara's mouth was.

original: niryātamukha āha //
analyzed: niryāta mukhaḥ āha
translated: The makara said:

original: gṛhapati imāni yānapātrāṇi baḍavāmukhe patitāni ya dāni karaṇīya ta karotha nāsti dāni vo jīvita //
analyzed: gṛhapati imāni yānapātrāṇi baḍavāmukhe patitāni ya dāni karaṇīya ta karotha na asti dāni vaḥ jīvita
translated: Householder, these ships have fallen into the mouth of a whale. Now do what you have to do, for there is no life for you now.

original: te dāni devadevatā namasyanti svakasvakāni /
analyzed: te dāni deva devatāḥ namasyanti svaka svakāni
translated: Then they paid homage to the gods of their own deities.

original: kecicchiva kecidvaiśravaṇa kecitskandha kecidvaruṇa kecidyama keciddhṛtarāṣṭra kecidvirūḍhaka kecidvirūpākṣa kecidindra kecidbrahma
analyzed: kecid śiva kecid vaiśravaṇa kecid skandha kecid varuṇa kecid yama kecid dhṛtarāṣṭra kecid virūḍhaka kecid virūpākṣa kecid indra kecid brahma
translated: Some to Śiva, some to Vaiśravaṇa, some to Skandha, some to Varuṇa, some to Yama, some to Dhṛtarāṣṭra, some to Virūḍhaka, some to Virūpākṣa, some to Indra, some to Brahmā,

original: kecitsamudradevatā /
analyzed: kecid samudra devatā
translated: some to the gods of the ocean.

original: yāvadāyuṣmā pūrṇako samanvāharati paśyati sthapakarṇika gṛhapati pacaśataparivāra saśayaprāpta //
analyzed: yāvat āyuṣmā pūrṇakaḥ samanvāharati paśyati sthapakarṇika gṛhapati paca śata parivāra saśaya prāpta
translated: As long as the Venerable Pūrṇa was reflecting, he saw that Sthavara Karṇin, the householder with a retinue of five hundred, had become doubtful.

original: so tuṇḍaturikāto parvatāto vaihāyasamabhyudgamya mahāsamudre thapakarṇikasya yānapātra upari vaihāyasamantarīkṣe asthāsi //
analyzed: saḥ parvatātaḥ vaihāyasam abhyudgamya mahā samudre thapakarṇikasya yānapātre upari vaihāyasam antarīkṣe asthāsi
translated: He rose up into the sky from the Tuṇḍaturika mountain and stood in the sky above the ship of Sthavara Karṇin in the great ocean.

original: te sarve paca vāṇijaśatāni prāñjali kṛtvā utthitā bhagava bhagava tava śaraṇagatā sma //
analyzed: te sarve paca vāṇija śatāni prāñjali kṛtvā utthitāḥ bhagava bhagava tava śaraṇa gatā sma
translated: All those five hundred merchants, with palms joined, said, Blessed One, we go for refuge to you.

original: sthaviro āha //
analyzed: sthaviraḥ āha
translated: The elder said,

original: nāha bhagavā śrāvako'hamasmi /
analyzed: na āha bhagavā śrāvakaḥ uham asmi
translated: I am not the Blessed One, I am his disciple.

original: sarve ekakaṇṭhā namo buddhasyeti udīretha //
analyzed: sarve eka kaṇṭhāḥ namaḥ buddhasya iti udīretha
translated: All of you, with one voice, exclaim 'Homage to the Buddha.'

original: tehi sarvehi pañcehi vaṇijaśatehi namo buddhasyeti vighuṭṭha //
analyzed: tehi sarvehi pañcehi vaṇija śatehi namaḥ buddhasya iti vighuṭṭha
translated: All those five hundred merchants exclaimed Homage to the Buddha.

original: tasya timitimigilasya buddhaśabdaḥ karṇapatha gato //
analyzed: tasya timitimigilasya buddha śabdaḥ karṇa patha gataḥ
translated: That sound of Buddha reached the ears of the Timitimiṅgila.

original: tasya ta śabda śrutvā yo aprameye asakhyeye kalpe meghasya māṇavasya sakāśāto dīpakarabuddhaśabdo śruto ta mahāsamudre timitimigilabhūtasya
analyzed: tasya te śabda śrutvā yaḥ aprameye asakhyeye kalpe meghasya māṇavasya sakāśātas dīpa kara buddha śabdaḥ śrutaḥ ta mahā samudre timitimigila bhūtasya  /
translated: Having heard that sound, in that immeasurable and incalculable eon, from the young brahmin Megha, he had heard the sound of the Buddha Dīpaṃkara. In the great ocean, having become a Timitimiṅgila fish,

original: āmūkhībhūto //
analyzed: āmūkhībhūtaḥ
translated: he became mute.

original: amogho buddhaśabdo ti //
analyzed: amoghaḥ buddha śabdaḥ ti
translated: The sound of the Buddha is infallible.

original: tasya dāni timitimigilasya bhūtasya etadabhūṣi //
analyzed: tasya dāni timitimigilasya bhūtasya
translated: Then this thought occurred to the ghost Timitimiṅgila:

original: buddho loke prādurbhūto vaya ca apāyagatā //
analyzed: buddhaḥ loke prādurbhūtaḥ ca apāya gatā
translated: The Buddha has appeared in the world, but we are doomed to the lower realms.

original: tena dāni savignena punarapi mukha samīlita //
analyzed: tena dāni sa vignena punar api mukha samīlita
translated: Then, troubled, he closed his mouth again.

original: anāhāro kālagato ta buddhaśabda samanusmaranto samanantarakālagato śrāvastyā mahā p / nagaryā brāhmaṇakule upapanno tena kālena tena
analyzed: anāhāraḥ kālagataḥ ta buddha śabda samanusmarantaḥ samanantara kālagataḥ śrāvastyāḥ mahā nagaryāḥ brāhmaṇa kule upapannaḥ tena kālena tena
translated: Having died without food, he was reborn in the great city of Śrāvastī in the family of a brāhmaṇa, immediately after his death, while remembering the words of the Buddha.

original: samayena prajāto dārako jāto //
analyzed: samayena prajātaḥ dārakaḥ jātaḥ
translated: At that time, a son was born to him.

original: yathokta bhagavatā nāha bhikṣavo karmato nyadvademi iti //
analyzed: yathā ukta bhagavatā na āha bhikṣavaḥ karmataḥ nyadvademi iti
translated: As it was said by the Blessed One: Monks, I do not say that there is anything other than karma.

original: tasya dāni dārakasya dharmarucināma kṛta //
analyzed: tasya dāni dārakasya dharmaruci nāma kṛta
translated: The name Dharma-Ruchi was given to the boy.

original: yadā mahanto savṛtto tadā bhagavataḥ śāsane pravrajito //
analyzed: yadā mahantaḥ sa vṛttaḥ tadā bhagavataḥ śāsane pravrajitaḥ
translated: When he grew up and became a man, he went forth in the teaching of the Blessed One.

original: prayujyantena ghaṭantena vyāyamantena tisro vidyā ṣaḍabhijñā balavaśībhāva sākṣātkṛta //
analyzed: tisraḥ vidyā ṣaḍabhijñāḥ bala vaśībhāva sākṣātkṛta
translated: Through application, effort, and exertion, he realized the three knowledges, the six supernormal knowledges, and mastery of the powers.

original: trikhutto divasasya bhagavataḥ pādavandane upasakramati /
analyzed: trikhuttaḥ divasasya bhagavataḥ pāda vandane upasakramati
translated: Three times a day he approached to pay homage at the feet of the Blessed One.

original: yattakamupasakramati tattaka bhagavā codeti smāreti cirasya dharmaruci sucirasya dharmaruci //
analyzed: yattakam upasakramati tattaka bhagavā coda iti smāra iti cirasya dharmaruci su cirasya dharmaruci
translated: As many times as he approached, so many times the Blessed One reproached him, saying, After a long time, Dharmaruci, after a very long time, Dharmaruci.

original: so pi āha //
analyzed: saḥ pi āha
translated: He also said:

original: evameta bhagava evameta sugata /
analyzed: evam eta bhagavaḥ evam eta sugata
translated: So it is, Blessed One, so it is, Sugata.

original: cirasya bhagava sucirasya sugata //
analyzed: cirasya bhagava su cirasya sugata
translated: After a long time, Blessed One, after a very long time, Sugata.

original: bhikṣu saśayena bhagavanta pṛccanti //
analyzed: bhikṣu saśayena bhagavanta pṛccanti
translated: The monks, out of doubt, asked the Blessed One:

original: trikhutto divasasya dharmarucirbhagavantamupasakramati bhagavāñca tamevamāha cirasya dharmaruci sucirasya dharmarucīti bhagavantamevamāha
analyzed: trikhuttaḥ divasasya dharmaruciḥ bhagavantam upasakramati bhagavān ca tam evam āha cirasya dharmaruci su cirasya dharmaruci iti bhagavantam evam āha
translated: Three times a day Dharmaruci approaches the Blessed One, and the Blessed One says to him, 'After a long time, Dharmaruci, after a very long time, Dharmaruci.' He also says to the Blessed One:

original: evameta bhagava evameta sugata cirasya bhagava sucirasya sugata na ca punarbhagava vayamimasya bhāṣitasya arthamājānāma //
analyzed: evam eta bhagava evam eta sugata cirasya bhagava su cirasya sugata na ca punar bhagava vayam imasya bhāṣitasya artham ājānāma
translated: 'So it is, Blessed One, so it is, Sugata. After a long time, Blessed One, after a very long time, Sugata.' But, Blessed One, we do not understand the meaning of what he says.

original: teṣā bhagavā bhikṣūṇā etā prakṛti vistareṇārocayati dīpakaramupādāya //
analyzed: teṣām bhagavā bhikṣūṇām etā prakṛti vistareṇa ārocayati dīpa karam upādāya
translated: The Blessed One then explained to those monks in detail the natural outcome, starting from Dīpaṃkara:

original: aha ca megho māṇavo nāmena āsi eṣo ca dharmaruci meghadatto //
analyzed: aha ca meghaḥ māṇavaḥ nāma inaḥ āsi ca dharmaruci meghadattaḥ
translated: And I was the young brahmin named Megha, and this Dharmaruci was Meghadatta.

original: eva bhikṣavo amogho buddhaśabdo yāvadduḥkhakṣayāya savartati //
analyzed: eva bhikṣavaḥ amoghaḥ buddha śabdaḥ yāvat duḥkha kṣayāya savartati
translated: Thus, monks, the word 'Buddha' is not in vain, but leads to the destruction of suffering.

original: tena samayena sthaviro dharmaruci upāgamesi śāstāra /
analyzed: tena samayena sthaviraḥ dharmaruci śāstāra
translated: At that time, the elder Dharmaruci came to the Teacher.

original: pādau jinasya vandati āha pi sucirasya dharmaruci //
analyzed: pādau jinasya vandati āha su cirasya dharmaruci
translated: He bowed at the feet of the Victorious One and said: After a long time, Dharmaruci.

original: sucirasya lokanāyaka dharmaruci pratibhaṇāti śāstāra /
analyzed: su cirasya loka nāyaka dharmaruci śāstāra
translated: After a long time, O Leader of the World, Dharmaruci has the opportunity to speak to the Teacher.

original: jānanta pṛcchati jino kikāraṇa brusi sucirasya //
analyzed: pṛcchati jinaḥ kikāraṇa brusi sucirasya
translated: The Victorious One, knowing, asked: Why do you say 'after a long time'?

original: so punarāha pure aha lavaṇajale timitimigilo āsi /
analyzed: saḥ punar āha pure aha lavaṇa jale timitimigilaḥ āsi
translated: He replied: Formerly, I was a timitimiṅgila fish in the salty ocean,

original: kṣudhādaurbalyaparigato viparimuṣa bhojanārthāye //
analyzed: kṣudhā daurbalya parigataḥ bhojana arthāye
translated: Overcome by hunger and weakness, wandering about for the sake of food.

original: p / tatra bahu prāṇanayutā praviśensuḥ tada śarīradeha me /
analyzed: tatra bahu
translated: There, many millions of living beings entered my body,

original: vāṇijakaśatāni paca praviśensu tathaiva yānena //
analyzed: vāṇijaka śatāni paca praviśet su tathā eva yānena
translated: And hundreds of merchants entered there in the same way by ship.

original: pātre ca praviśamāne atrāṇabhayārditā vyasanaprāptā /
analyzed: pātre ca praviśamāne atrāṇa bhaya arditā vyasana prāptā
translated: While entering the boat, they were afflicted by fear and distress, having no protector.

original: sarve ekavācamavaci namo daśabalasya buddhasya //
analyzed: sarve eka vācam avaci namaḥ daśabalasya buddhasya
translated: All of them spoke with one voice: Homage to the Buddha, the One with Ten Powers!

original: buddheti śrutva ghoṣa aśrutapūrvamabhūṣimaha prīto /
analyzed: buddha iti
translated: Hearing the previously unheard sound Buddha, I became greatly delighted.

original: hṛṣṭo udagaracitto tvarita samīlayesi mukha //
analyzed: hṛṣṭaḥ tvarita samīlayesi mukha
translated: Joyful and uplifted in mind, I quickly closed my mouth.

original: sanensu prāṇanayutāni tiryagyonigatā vaṇijaśatāna /
analyzed: prāṇana yutāni tiryagyoni gatā
translated: Millions of living beings in the animal realm and hundreds of merchants

original: ghoṣeṇa daśabalasya vyutthito tadāhamapāyeṣu //
analyzed: ghoṣeṇa daśabalasya tadā aham apāyeṣu
translated: I was awakened by the sound of the Ten-Powered One from those lower realms.

original: tena kuśalena bhagava ida me āropita manuṣyatva /
analyzed: tena kuśalena bhagava idam me āropita manuṣya tva
translated: By that wholesome action, Blessed One, I was reborn as a human.

original: sucaritaphalena tena dharmarucīti mama samājñā //
analyzed: su carita phalena tena dharmaruci iti mama samājñā
translated: By the fruit of that good conduct, I am known as Dharmaruci.

original: tenaivāha hetunā pravrajito tava svayabhu prāvacane /
analyzed: tena eva āha hetunā pravrajito tava prāvacane
translated: For that very reason, I went forth in your own teaching, Self-Existent One.

original: nacirasya pravrajitvā abhūṣi arahā dhutakleśo //
analyzed: nacirasya pravrajitvā abhūṣi arahā dhuta kleśaḥ
translated: Not long after going forth, I became an arhat, my defilements destroyed.

original: bahukalpakoṭinayutā sasāra sasaritvāna ananta /
analyzed: sasāra ananta
translated: For many quintillions of eons, I wandered in samsara, endless.

original: anusmārento sugata bhaṇāmi sucirasya lokahita //
analyzed: sugata bhaṇāmi su cirasya loka hita
translated: Remembering the Sugata, I say: For a long time, for the benefit of the world.

original: sucirasya dharmacakṣurviśodhita dharmasaśaya chinna /
analyzed: su cirasya dharma cakṣuḥ viśodhita dharma saśaya chinna
translated: For a long time, the eye of Dharma was purified, doubts about the Dharma were cut.

original: mohatimirāvajaddha uṣito smi cira apāyeṣu //
analyzed: uṣitaḥ smi cira apāyeṣu
translated: I dwelt for a long time in the darkness of delusion and in the lower realms.

original: tena kuśalena timira prahīna rāgadveṣā ca ūhatā /
analyzed: tena kuśalena timira prahīna rāga dveṣā ca ūhatā
translated: By that wholesome action, the darkness was removed, and attachment and aversion were destroyed.

original: aśeṣā bhavanetrisaritā ucchoṣitā ayamiha jātiḥ //
analyzed: aśeṣāḥ bhava netri saritāḥ ucchoṣitāḥ ayam iha jātiḥ
translated: The river of the three existences was completely dried up, this is my last birth.

original: asya pi timitimigilasya buddhaśravaṇa mahatphala āsi /
analyzed: asya pi timitimigilasya buddha śravaṇa mahat phalaḥ āsi
translated: Even for this Timitimiṅgila, hearing the Buddha's teachings had great fruit.

original: ki puna idāni bhagava ida śruta nāvahedamṛta //
analyzed: ki punar idāni bhagavaḥ ida śruta
translated: How much more so now, Blessed One, if this nectar is heard?

original: p / tasmādvivarjayitvā nīvaraṇā paca cetasāvaraṇā /
analyzed: tasmāt vivarjayitvā nīvaraṇā paca cetasā āvaraṇā
translated: Therefore, having abandoned the hindrances and the obscurations of the mind,

original: śrotavya buddhavacana dullabhasajñāmupajanetvā //
analyzed: śrotavya buddha vacana dullabha sajñām upajanetvā
translated: Having generated the rare cognition of listening to the Buddha's word,

original: kṛcchro manuṣyalābho vivarjanā ca asārarūpavanāt /
analyzed: kṛcchraḥ manuṣya lābhaḥ vivarjanā ca asāra rūpa vanāt
translated: The attainment of human birth is difficult, and the abandonment of the forest of worthless forms,

original: buddhāna ca utpādo śraddhā ca bhaveya ca nirvṛtiḥ //
analyzed: buddhāna ca utpādaḥ śraddhā ca bhaveya ca nirvṛtiḥ
translated: And the arising of the Buddhas, and the faith, and the attainment of nirvana,

original: iti śrīmahāvastu avadāne dīpakaravastu samāpta //
analyzed: iti śrī mahā vastu avadāne dīpakara vastu
translated: Thus ends the chapter on Dīpaṃkara in the Mahāvastu-Avadāna.

original: ito mahāmaudgalyāyana bhadrakalpāto aparimite aprameye asakhyeye kalpe dīpakarāto anantara maṅgalo nāma tathāgato'rha samyaksabuddho udapāsi
analyzed: itas mahāmaudgalyāyana bhadra kalpātaḥ aparimite aprameye asakhyeye kalpe dīpakara atas anantara maṅgalaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ha samyaksabuddhaḥ udapāsi
translated: After this Bhadrakalpa, O Mahāmaudgalyāyana, in an immeasurable, incalculable, inconceivable, immeasurable kalpa, immediately after Dīpaṃkara, there appeared a Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One named Maṅgala.

original: maṅgalasya mahāmaudgalyāyana samyaksabuddhasya varṣakoṭīśatasahasra manuṣyāṇāmāyuḥpramāṇabhūṣi //
analyzed: maṅgalasya mahāmaudgalyāyana samyaksabuddhasya varṣa koṭī śata sahasra manuṣyāṇām āyuḥ pramāṇa bhūṣi
translated: The lifespan of the Perfectly Awakened One Maṅgala, O Mahāmaudgalyāyana, was one hundred thousand koṭis of years of men.

original: maṅgalasya mahāmaudgalyāyana samyaksabuddhasya trayaḥ śrāvakasannipātā abhūnsuḥ //
analyzed: maṅgalasya mahāmaudgalyāyana samyaksabuddhasya trayaḥ śrāvaka sannipātāḥ abhūnsuḥ
translated: The Perfectly Awakened One Maṅgala, O Mahāmaudgalyāyana, had three assemblies of disciples.

original: prathame śrāvakasannipāte koṭīśatasahasramabhūṣi sarveṣāmarhatā kṣīṇāśravāṇāmuṣitavratānā samyagājñāsuvimuktacittānā parikṣīṇabhavasayojanānāmanuprāptasvakārthānā
analyzed: prathame śrāvaka sannipāte koṭī śata sahasram abhūṣi sarveṣām arhatā kṣīṇa āśravāṇām uṣita vratānām samyagājñā su vimukta cittānā parikṣīṇa bhava sayojanānām anuprāpta svaka arthānām
translated: In the first assembly of disciples there were one hundred thousand koṭis, all of them arhats whose defilements were exhausted, who had laid down the burden, attained their own goal, destroyed the fetters that bound them to existence, and by perfect knowledge of right wisdom, were completely liberated.

original: dvitīyo śrāvakasannipāto navati koṭīyo abhunsuḥ sarveṣā arhatā kṣīṇāśravāṇā uṣitavratānā samyagājñāsuvimuktacittānā parikṣīṇabhavasayojanānā
analyzed: dvitīyaḥ śrāvaka sannipātaḥ navati sarveṣā arhatā kṣīṇa aśravāṇā uṣita vratānā samyagājñā su vimukta cittānā parikṣīṇa bhava sayojanānā
translated: The second assembly of disciples consisted of ninety koṭis, all of whom were arhans who had destroyed the āśravas, had kept the observances, had liberated their minds perfectly by right wisdom, had laid aside the burden, had won their own ends,

original: anuprāptasvakārthānā /
analyzed: anuprāpta svaka arthānā
translated: and had destroyed the fetters that bound them to existence.

original: tṛtīyo śrāvakasannipāto aśīti koṭīyo abhunsu sarveṣāmarhatā kṣīṇāśravāṇāmuṣitavratānā samyagājñāsuvimuktacittānā parikṣīṇabhavasayojanānā
analyzed: tṛtīyaḥ śrāvaka sannipātaḥ sarveṣām arhatā kṣīṇa āśravāṇām uṣita vratānām samyagājñā su vimukta cittānā parikṣīṇa bhava sayojanānām
translated: The third assembly of disciples consisted of eighty koṭis, all of whom were arhans who had destroyed the āśravas, had kept the observances, had liberated their minds perfectly by right wisdom, had laid aside the burden,

original: anuprāptasvakārthānā //
analyzed: anuprāpta svaka arthānā
translated: had won their own ends, and had destroyed the fetters that bound them to existence.

original: maṅgalasya khalu punarmahāmaudgalyāyana samyaksabuddhasya sudevo ca dharmadevo ca nāma śrāvakayugo abhūṣi agrayugo ca bhadrayugo ca /

translated: Now, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, the two chief disciples of the perfect Buddha Maṅgala were the monks named Sudeva and Dharma-deva. They were a noble pair, a fine pair.

original: eko agro prajñāye aparo agro ṛddhīye //
analyzed: ekaḥ agro prajñāye aparaḥ agro ṛddhīye
translated: The one was chief in wisdom, the other in magic power.

original: maṅgalasya khalu punarmahāmaudgalyāyana samyaksabuddhasya śīvālī ca nāma bhikṣuṇī aśokā ca agraśrāvikā abhunsuḥ /
analyzed: maṅgalasya khalu punar mahāmaudgalyāyana samyaksabuddhasya śīvālī ca nāma bhikṣuṇī aśokā ca agraśrāvikāḥ abhunsuḥ
translated: Now, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, the chief nuns of the perfect Buddha Maṅgala were the nuns named Śīvālī and Aśokā.

original: ekā agrā prajñāye aparā ṛddhīye //
analyzed: ekā agrā prajñāye aparā ṛddhīye
translated: The one was chief in wisdom, the other in magic power.

analyzed: maṅgalasya khalu mahāmaudgalyāyana samyaksabuddhasya pālitaḥ nāma bhikṣu puasthāyakaḥ

analyzed: maṅgalasya khalu punar mahāmaudgalyāyana samyaksabuddhasya nāgavṛkṣaḥ bodhi

analyzed: maṅgalasya khalu mahāmaudgalyāyana samyaksabuddhasya uttara nāma nagara abhūṣi
translated: Now, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, the Tathāgata, the Arhan, the perfect Buddha Maṅgala had a city named Uttarā.

analyzed: saptahi dīrghikāhi parikṣipta abhūṣi citrāhi darśanīyāhi saptānā varṇānā suvarṇasya rūpyasya muktāyāḥ vaiḍūryasya sphaṭikasya musāgalvasya  / lohitikāyā

translated: “Now, Mahā-Maudgalyāyana, the mother of the exalted Saṃkusumita was a queen named Saṃkusumitarati.
