original: tārayi bahujanatā vaistārika kṛtva śāsana /
analyzed: tārayi bahu janatā vaistārika kṛtva śāsana
translated: Having liberated many people and spread the teaching,

original: jvalito agniskandho vā suriyo vā samudgato //
analyzed: jvalitaḥ agni skandhaḥ vā suriyaḥ vā samudgataḥ
translated: Like a blazing mass of fire or the rising sun,

original: yathā sāgarasya ūrmiyo na śakiya gaṇayitu /
analyzed: yathā sāgarasya ūrmiyaḥ na gaṇayitu
translated: Just as the waves of the ocean cannot be counted,

original: tathaiva bhagavato putrā na śakiya gaṇayitu /
analyzed: tathā eva bhagavataḥ putrāḥ na gaṇayitu
translated: In the same way, the sons of the Blessed One cannot be counted.

original: so ca buddho mahābhāgo saddharmo ca gaṇottamo /
analyzed: saḥ ca buddhaḥ mahābhāgaḥ saddharmaḥ ca gaṇa uttamaḥ
translated: That Buddha was greatly fortunate, the true Dharma was the best of assemblies,

original: sarve samanantarātītā anuriktā eva saskārāḥ //
analyzed: sarve samanantara atītāḥ anuriktāḥ eva saskārāḥ
translated: all of them immediately passed away, and their conditioned existence ended.

original: iti śrīmahāvastu avadāne magalasya vastu samāpta //
analyzed: iti śrī mahāvastu avadāne magalasya vastu samāpta
translated: Thus ends the chapter on auspicious things in the Mahāvastu-Avadāna.

original: p / atha cchatravastuke ādi //
analyzed: atha chatra vastuke ādi
translated: Now begins the chapter on the umbrella in the beginning.

original: anuhimavante kuṇḍalā nāma yakṣiṇī prativasati //🔽sā dāni sama sama ca putraśatā paca prajāyati /
analyzed: anu himavante kuṇḍalā nāma yakṣiṇī prativasati  sā dāni sama sama ca putra śatā paca prajāyati
translated: In the Himalayas there lived a Yakṣiṇī named Kuṇḍalā.🔽She gave birth to a hundred sons at a time,

original: putrasahasra prajātā sā kāla karoti //
analyzed: putra sahasra prajātā sā kāla karoti
translated: and when she gave birth to a thousand sons, she died.

original: te pi vaiśāli ojohārakā preṣitā //
analyzed: te pi vaiśāli ojaḥ hārakā preṣitā
translated: They were also sent as vitality-stealers to Vaiśālī.

original: vaiśāli gatvā manuṣyāṇāmoja haranti //
analyzed: vaiśāli gatvā manuṣyāṇām ojaḥ haranti
translated: Having gone to Vaiśālī, they took away the vitality of humans.

original: rogajātā ārddhā maṇḍalako ca adhivāso ca /
analyzed: roga jātāḥ ārddhāḥ maṇḍalakaḥ ca adhivāsaḥ ca
translated: There were diseases, half-circles, and dwelling places.

original: maṇḍalako rogajāto yahi kule nipatati na kici śeṣeti sarva harati /
analyzed: maṇḍalakaḥ roga jātaḥ kule nipatati na sarva harati
translated: The disease called maṇḍalaka, wherever it fell in a family, left nothing behind, it took away everything.

original: adhivāso nāma rogajāto pradeśa harati //
analyzed: adhivāsaḥ nāma roga jātaḥ pradeśa harati
translated: The disease called adhivāsa took away a region.

original: tadāni vaiśālikā adhivāsena rogajātena spṛṣṭā maranti //
analyzed: tadāni vaiśālikāḥ adhivāsena roga jātena spṛṣṭāḥ maranti
translated: Then the people of Vaiśālī, afflicted by the disease called adhivāsa, died.

original: te devadevā namasyanti //
analyzed: te deva devāḥ namasyanti
translated: They worshipped the gods.

original: teṣāmetadabhūṣi //
analyzed: teṣām etat abhūṣi
translated: This occurred to them:

original: kasminnu khavlāgate vaiśālakānāmābādho pratipraśāmyeyā //
analyzed: kasmin nu khavlāgate vaiśālakānām ābādho
translated: In whom, when he has come, will the plague of the Licchavis be allayed?

original: tehi dāni kāśyapasya pūraṇasya preṣita //
analyzed: tehi dāni kāśyapasya pūraṇasya preṣita
translated: They sent a message to Kāśyapa Pūraṇa:

original: āgacchāhi vaiśālakānāmamanuṣyavyādhi utpanno tvayi āgate pratipraśrabdho bhaviṣyati //
analyzed: āgacchāhi tvayi āgate pratipraśrabdhaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: “Come, when you have come the plague of non-human beings among the Licchavis will be allayed.”

original: kāśyapapūraṇo vaiśālimāgato na ca ta vyādhi pratiprasrabhyati //
analyzed: kāśyapapūraṇaḥ vaiśālim āgataḥ na ca
translated: Kāśyapa Pūraṇa came to Vaiśālī, but the plague was not allayed.

original: teṣāmetadabhūṣi //
analyzed: teṣām etat abhūṣi
translated: They thought:

original: āgato kāśyapo naiva ca vaiśālakānāmamanuṣyavyādhiḥ pratiprasrabhyati //
analyzed: āgataḥ kāśyapaḥ na eva ca vaiśālakānām amanuṣya vyādhiḥ pratiprasrabhyati
translated: “Kāśyapa has come, but the plague of non-human beings among the Licchavis has not been allayed.”

original: tehi dāni maskarisya gośāliputrasya preṣita //
analyzed: tehi dāni maskarisya gośāliputrasya preṣita
translated: They sent a message to Maskarī Gośālīputra:

original: so pi āgato na ca vaiśālikānāmamanuṣyavyādhiḥ pratiprasrabhyati //
analyzed: saḥ pi āgataḥ na ca vaiśālikānām amanuṣya vyādhiḥ pratiprasrabhyati
translated: He came, but the plague of non-human beings among the Licchavis was not allayed.

original: tehi dāni kakudasya kātyāyanasya preṣita //
analyzed: tehi dāni kakudasya kātyāyanasya preṣita
translated: They sent a message to Kakuda Kātyāyana:

original: so pi āgato na ca vaiśālikānāmanmanuṣyavyādhiḥ pratiprasrabhyati //
analyzed: saḥ pi āgataḥ na ca vaiśālikānām an manuṣya vyādhiḥ pratiprasrabhyati
translated: He came, but the plague of non-human beings among the Licchavis was not allayed.

original: tahi dāni ajitasya keśakambalasya preṣita //
analyzed: tahi dāni ajitasya keśakambalasya preṣita
translated: They sent a message to Ajita Keśakambala:

original: so pi āgato na ca vaiśālakānāmamanuṣyavyādhi pratiprasrabhyati //
analyzed: saḥ pi āgataḥ na ca vaiśālakānām amanuṣya vyādhi pratiprasrabhyati
translated: He came, but the plague of non-human beings among the Licchavis was not allayed.

original: tehi dāni sajayisya veraṭṭiputrasya preṣita /
analyzed: tehi dāni sajayisya veraṭṭiputrasya preṣita
translated: They then sent for Sāyika, the son of Veraṭṭi.

original: so pi āgato na ca vaiśālakānāmamanuṣyavyādhi pratiprasrabhyati //
analyzed: saḥ pi āgataḥ na ca vaiśālakānām amanuṣya vyādhi pratiprasrabhyati
translated: He came, but the plague among the people of Vaiśālī was not allayed.

original: tehi dāni nirgranthasya jñātiputrasya preṣita //
analyzed: tehi dāni nirgranthasya jñāti putrasya preṣita
translated: They then sent for Nirgrantha, the son of Jñāti.

original: so pi āgato na ca vaiśālakānāmamanuṣyavyādhiḥ pratiprasrabhyati //
analyzed: saḥ pi āgataḥ na ca vaiśālakānām amanuṣya vyādhiḥ pratiprasrabhyati
translated: He came, but the plague among the people of Vaiśālī was not allayed.

original: teṣā vaiśālakānā jñātisālohitā kālagatā devehi upapannā //
analyzed: teṣām vaiśālakānām jñātisālohitā kālagatā devehi upapannā
translated: Now the kinsmen and relatives of the people of Vaiśālī who had died were reborn among the devas.

original: teṣāmanyatarā devatā vaiśālakānāmāro p / cayati //
analyzed: teṣām anyatarā devatā vaiśālakānām āraḥ cayati
translated: One of these devas proclaimed to the people of Vaiśālī:

original: ye ete tubhyehi ānītā aśāstāro aśāstāravādino na ete śaktā vaiśālakānāmamanuṣyavyādhi pratiprasrabhayitu //
analyzed: ye ete tubhya ihi ānītāḥ a śāstāraḥ a śāstāra vādinaḥ na ete śaktāḥ vaiśālakānām a manuṣya vyādhi pratiprasrabhayitu
translated: “These men whom you have brought here are not teachers, nor are they the disciples of a teacher. They are not able to allay the plague among the people of Vaiśālī.

original: eṣa buddho bhagavā asakhyehi kalpehi samudāgato arhansamyaksabuddho apariśeṣajñānadarśano maharddhiko mahānubhāvo sarvajño sarvadarśāvī
analyzed: eṣa buddhaḥ bhagavā asakhyehi kalpehi samudāgataḥ arhan samyaksabuddhaḥ a pariśeṣa jñāna darśanaḥ maharddhikaḥ mahā anubhāvaḥ sarvajñaḥ sarva darśāvī
translated: This Buddha, this Sugata, has appeared in the world after an interval of incalculable length. He is an Arhan, a perfectly enlightened Buddha, who has knowledge and discipline, who is well-faring, a world-knower, a steersman, an unsurpassed trainer of men to be tamed, a teacher of gods and men, a Buddha, a blessed one. He has great magic and power, he is all-knowing and all-seeing.

original: yatra grāmakṣetrasīmāyā prativasati sarva tatra ītikalaha kalakala upadravā upasargā praśāmyanti //
analyzed: yatra grāma kṣetra sīmāyā prativasati sarva tatra īti kalaha kalakala upadravāḥ upasargāḥ praśāmyanti
translated: Wherever the confines of a village or town are within the range of his knowledge, all strife, brawling, calamities, misfortunes and oppression there are allayed.

original: tamānetha /
analyzed: tam ānetha
translated: Go to him.

original: tena āgatena vaiśālakānāmamanuṣyavyādhiḥ pratiprasrabhyate iti //
analyzed: tena āgatena vaiśālakānām amanuṣya vyādhiḥ pratiprasrabhyate iti
translated: By his arrival, the non-human disease of the people of Vaiśālī was pacified.

original: rājagṛhe mandirapure viharati varakamalagarbhasukumāro /
analyzed: rājagṛhe mandira pure viharati vara kamala garbha su kumāraḥ
translated: He dwells in the city of Rājagṛha, tender like a lotus bud.

original: sarvā kalikalahāni praśamayitāni jitakleśena //
analyzed: sarvā kali kalahāni praśamayitāni jita kleśena
translated: All quarrels and disputes are pacified by the one who has conquered afflictions.

original: sopadrava kāñcananibho ya prāpto grāmanigama nagara vā /
analyzed: kāñcana nibhaḥ yaḥ prāptaḥ grāma nigama nagara vā
translated: When he, golden-hued, arrives in a village, town, or city,

original: śāmayati tatra ītayo rajamiva balavā salilavṛṣṭi //
analyzed: śāmayati tatra ītayoḥ rajam iva balavā salila vṛṣṭi
translated: there he pacifies calamities like a strong wind a dust storm.

original: pāṇḍaravarṇa kāñcananibha dinakaraparipūrṇacārumukha /
analyzed: pāṇḍara varṇa kāñcana nibha dinakara paripūrṇa cāru mukha
translated: White-colored, golden-hued, with a beautiful face full like the sun,

original: varasurabhiśīlagandha ānetha śāmyati tu vyādhi //
analyzed: vara surabhi śīla gandhaḥ śāmyati tu
translated: bring the fragrance of excellent virtue, and the disease will be pacified.

original: vaiśālyā tomaro nāma lecchavimahattarako mahāpakṣo mahāparivāro paṇḍito ca //
analyzed: vaiśālyā tomaraḥ nāma leccha vimahattarakaḥ mahā pakṣaḥ mahā parivāraḥ ca
translated: In Vaiśālī, there was a great treasurer of the Licchavis named Toṇa, who had a large following and was very wealthy. He was also wise.

original: so gaṇena adhyeṣya preṣito //
analyzed: saḥ gaṇena adhyeṣya preṣitaḥ
translated: He was sent by the assembly after being requested.

original: gaccha rājagṛha tahi buddho bhagavā prativasati /
analyzed: gaccha rājagṛha buddhaḥ bhagavā prativasati
translated: Go to Rājagṛha, where the Buddha, the Blessed One, dwells.

original: śreṇiyasya bimbisārasya yācitavāso prativasati //
analyzed: śreṇiyasya bimbisārasya yācita vāsaḥ prativasati
translated: He dwells at the request of Śreṇiya Bimbisāra.

original: ta gatvā vaiśālakānā licchavīnā vacanena vandanā vadesi saparivārasya alpābādhatā ca alpātakatā ca sukhasparśavihāratā ca pṛcchesi
analyzed: ta gatvā vaiśālakānā licchavīnā vacanena vandanāḥ vadesi sa parivārasya alpa ābādha tā ca alpātaka tā ca sukha sparśavihāra tā ca pṛcchesi
translated: Having gone there, speak on behalf of the Licchavis of Vaiśālī, saying, We pay homage to the Blessed One and his assembly. We inquire about his health, well-being, ease, strength, and comfort.

original: eva ca vadesi //
analyzed: eva ca vadesi
translated: And say this:

original: vaiśālakānā bhagava licchavīnāmamanuṣyavyādhi utpanno bahūni prāṇasahasrāṇi anayavyasanamāpadyanti /
analyzed: vaiśālakānām bhagava licchavīnām amanuṣya vyādhi utpannaḥ bahūni prāṇa sahasrāṇi anaya vyasanam āpadyanti
translated: A non-human affliction has arisen among the Licchavis of Vaiśālī, causing many thousands of beings to fall into misfortune and disaster.

original: sādhu bhagavānarthakāmo hi p / taiṣī vaiśālimāgaccheyā anukampāmupādāya //
analyzed: sādhu bhagavān artha kāmaḥ hi taiṣī vaiśālim āgaccheyāḥ anukampām upādāya
translated: It would be good if the Blessed One, out of compassion, would come to Vaiśālī, as he desires the welfare of many people.

original: atha tomaro lecchavigaṇasya pratiśrutvā yathānurūpeṇa parivāreṇa sārdha bhadrāṇi yānāni āruhitvā vaiśālito nagarāto nargamya yena rājagṛha
analyzed: atha tomaraḥ leccha vigaṇasya pratiśrutvā yathā anurūpeṇa parivāreṇa sārdha bhadrāṇi yānāni āruhitvā vaiśālitaḥ nagarātaḥ nargamya yena rājagṛha
translated: Then Tomara, having heard the Licchavi assembly, together with a retinue befitting his status, mounted excellent vehicles and departed from the city of Vaiśālī,

original: nagara tena prayāsi //
analyzed: nagara tena prayāsi
translated: heading for the city of Rājagṛha.

original: atha khalu tomaro lecchavi rājagṛhanagara gatvā praviśitvā rājagṛhanagara yena veṇuvana kalandakanivāpa tena prakrami bhagavanta darśanāya
analyzed: atha khalu tomaraḥ rājagṛha nagara gatvā praviśitvā rājagṛha nagara yena veṇuvana kalandakanivāpa tena bhagavanta darśanāya  /
translated: Then Tomara, having gone to the city of Rājagṛha and entered, went to the Bamboo Grove, the Squirrels' Feeding Ground, in order to see the Blessed One,

original: upasakramaṇāya paryupāsanāya //
analyzed: upasakramaṇāya paryupāsanāya
translated: in order to approach and serve him.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena bhagavāntadaho poṣadhe pacadaśyā pūrṇāyā pūrṇamāsyā pañcānā bhikṣuśatānā anyāye ca janatāye anekasahasrāye
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena bhagavān tat aho poṣadhe pacadaśyā pūrṇāyā pūrṇamāsyā pañcānā bhikṣu śatānā anyāye ca janatāye aneka sahasrāye  /
translated: Then at that time, on that day of the posadha, the fifteenth day, the full moon, the Blessed One was teaching the Dharma to five hundred monks and to a multitude of many thousands of people.

original: pariṣāye dharma deśayati ādau kalyāṇa madhye kalyāṇa paryavasāne kalyāṇa svartha suvyañjana kevalaparipūrṇa pariśuddha paryavadāta
analyzed: pariṣāye dharma deśayati ādau kalyāṇa madhye kalyāṇa paryavasāne kalyāṇa su artha su vyañjana kevalaparipūrṇa pariśuddha paryavadāta  /
translated: He was expounding the Dharma that is good in the beginning, good in the middle, good in the end, with its own meaning, with its own phrasing, complete, pure, purified,

original: brahmacarya prakāśayati //
analyzed: brahmacarya prakāśayati
translated: and was revealing the holy life.

original: atha tomaro lecchavī yāvattakā yānasya bhūmiḥ tāvadyānena gatvā yānādavatīrya padmāmeva yena bhagavāstenopasakrami //
analyzed: atha tomaraḥ lecchavī yāvattakā yānasya bhūmiḥ tāvat yānena gatvā yānāt avatīrya padmām eva yena bhagavān tena upasakrami
translated: Then the Licchavi Tomara went as far as the ground allowed for a vehicle, and then descended from the vehicle and approached the Blessed One on foot.

original: so dāni maheśākhyā pariṣā sannipatitā na śaknoti prasahya bhagavantamupasakramitu //
analyzed: saḥ dāni maheśākhyā pariṣā sannipatitā na śaknoti prasahya bhagavantam upasakramitu
translated: But that great and famous assembly was gathered and he was not able to forcibly approach the Blessed One.

original: so dāni ekāsamuttarāsaga kṛtvā yena bhagavāstenājali praṇāmetvā bhagavanta gāthāye adhyabhāṣi //
analyzed: saḥ dāni eka āsam uttarāsaga kṛtvā yena bhagavān tena ajali praṇāmetvā bhagavanta gāthāye adhyabhāṣi
translated: So he arranged his upper robe over one shoulder, extended his joined palms toward the Blessed One, and addressed the Blessed One with this verse:

original: upoṣadhe pacadaśīviśuddhaye upāsitu te ṛṣayo samāgatā /
analyzed: upoṣadhe pacadaśī viśuddhaye te ṛṣayaḥ samāgatā
translated: On this posadha, the fifteenth day of purity, the seers have gathered to worship you.

original: śakro ca devo tridaśāna indro puraskṛto teṣu asahyasāhi //
analyzed: śakro ca devo tridaśānaḥ indro puraskṛtaḥ teṣu
translated: And Shakra, the lord of the thirty gods, is honored among them, O Unsurpassed One.

original: virocamāno bhāṣasi uttama pada dharmeṇa tarpesi bahu imā prajā /
analyzed: virocamānaḥ bhāṣasi uttama pada dharmeṇa tarpesi bahu imā prajā
translated: You shine, teaching the supreme state. You satisfy these people with the Dharma.

original: mahā va meghaḥ salilena medinī te tuhya śrutvā madhurāmimā girā //
analyzed: mahā va meghaḥ salilena medinī te tuhya śrutvā madhurām imā girā
translated: Like a great cloud with rain on the earth, they hear your sweet words.

original: anelikā dharayato mahāmune namaskṛtvā ajali vandamānā /
analyzed: anelikā dharayataḥ mahā mune namaskṛtvā ajali vandamānā
translated: The Anēlikas, O Great Sage, holding you, bow with folded hands.

original: p / śaraṇante gacchāma asahyasāhi teṣā sulabdha ca suāgata ca //
analyzed: śaraṇante gacchāma teṣām su labdha ca su āgata ca
translated: We go for refuge to you, O Unsurpassed One. For them, it is well-obtained and well-come.

original: sa tomarāṇāmahantike bhava ye te prasannā śaraṇa upenti /
analyzed: sa tomarāṇām ahantike bhava ye te prasannā śaraṇe upenti
translated: You become the destroyer of stakes for those who, delighted, go for refuge.

original: atha apramattā sugatasya śāsane kāhinti jātīmaraṇasya anta //
analyzed: atha apramattā sugatasya śāsane kāhinti jātīmaraṇasya anta
translated: Then, heedful in the Sugata's teaching, they will end birth and death.

original: gāthāparyavasāne mahatā janakāyena antaro dinno //
analyzed: gāthā paryavasāne mahatā jana kāyena antaraḥ dinnaḥ
translated: At the conclusion of the verse, a great crowd gave an interval offering.

original: atha khalu tomaro lecchavī yena bhagavāstenopasakramitvā bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā bhagavantametadavocat //
analyzed: atha khalu tomaraḥ lecchavī yena bhagavān tena upasakramitvā bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the Licchavi Tomara approached the Blessed One, bowed his head at the Blessed One's feet, and said this to the Blessed One:

original: vaiśālikā bhagava lecchaviyo savṛddhabālā abhyantaravaiśālakā ca bāhirakavaiśālakā ca bhagavataḥ pādā śirasā vandenti saśrāvakasaghasya sukha 🔽ca sparśavihāratā ca pṛcchenti eva ca vadenti //🔽vaiśālyā bhagavannamanuṣyavyādhi utpannaḥ bahūni prāṇisahasrāṇi anayavyasanamāpadyanti bhagavā ca anukampako kāruṇiko sadevakasya //
analyzed: vaiśālikāḥ bhagavant sa vṛddha bālāḥ abhyantara vaiśālakā ca bāhiraka vaiśālakā ca bhagavataḥ pādā śirasā vandenti sa śrāvaka saghasya  ca sparśavihāra tā ca pṛcchenti eva ca vadenti  vaiśālyāḥ bhagavan a manuṣya vyādhi utpannaḥ bahūni prāṇi sahasrāṇi anaya vyasanam āpadyanti bhagavā ca anukampakaḥ kāruṇikaḥ sa devakasya
translated: The Licchavis of Vaiśālī, young and old, the citizens of Vaiśālī, both those within and those without, bow at the feet of the Exalted One and his community of disciples, and wish them good fortune and happiness.🔽They ask after the Exalted One’s welfare and comfort, and say,🔽‘In Vaiśālī, Lord, a plague has broken out, and many thousands have fallen on misfortune and distress. The Exalted One is compassionate and merciful to all creatures.

original: sādhu bhagavā vaiśālimāgaccheya vaiśālikānāmanukampāmupādāya //
analyzed: sādhu bhagavā vaiśālim āgaccheya vaiśālikānām anukampām upādāya
translated: The Licchavis of Vesali, with their elders and their young men, the Vesalians within the city and those without, bow their heads at the feet of the Blessed One and of the community of monks, and ask after the Blessed One's well-being, comfort, ease, strength, and comfort in sleep, and they say: There has arisen in Vesali, Blessed One, a non-human affliction, by which many thousands of living beings are being led to destruction. The Tathagata is compassionate, and has pity on the world. It would be well if the Blessed One would come to Vesali out of pity for the Vesalians.

original: bhagavānāha //
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: tathāgato tomara rājño śreṇiyasya bimbisārasya yācitavāso vasati gacchamanujānāpehi //
analyzed: tathāgataḥ tomara rājñaḥ śreṇiyasya bimbisārasya yācita vāsaḥ vasati gaccham anujāna apehi
translated: The Tathagata, Tomara, is invited to stay by King Sreniya Bimbisara. Go and get permission.

original: atha khalu tomaro lecchavī bhagavato pādau śirasā vanditvā bhagavanta ca triṣkhutta pradakṣiṇīkṛtvā bhikṣusagha ca yena rājagṛha tena
analyzed: atha khalu tomaraḥ lecchavī bhagavatoḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā bhagavanta ca triṣkhutta pradakṣiṇīkṛtvā bhikṣu sagha ca yena rājagṛha tena
translated: Then Tomara the Licchavi, having bowed down at the feet of the Blessed One, circumambulated the Blessed One three times, and also the community of monks, and went to Rajagriha.

original: atha khalu tomaro lecchavī yena rājā śreṇiyo bimbisārastenopasakramitvā rājāna śreṇiya bimbisāra sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca pratisamodetvā etaduvāca
analyzed: atha khalu tomaraḥ lecchavī yena rājā śreṇiyaḥ bimbisāraḥ tena upasakramitvā rājāna śreṇiya bimbisāra sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca pratisamodetvā etat uvāca
translated: Then the Licchavi Tomara approached King Śreṇiya Bimbisāra, and after approaching and worshipping King Śreṇiya Bimbisāra well and properly, he said this:

original: vaiśālīya mahārāja amanuṣyavyādhi utpanno bahūni prāṇisahasrāṇi anayavyasanamāpadyanti //
analyzed: vaiśālīya mahā rāja amanuṣya vyādhiḥ utpannaḥ bahūni prāṇi sahasrāṇi anaya vyasanam āpadyanti
translated: Great King, in Vaiśālī a non-human disease has arisen, and many thousands of living beings are coming to ruin and disaster.

original: tahi ṣacchāstāro samatā ānītā kāśyapo ca pūraṇo maskarī ca gośālī ajito ca keśakambalī kakudo ca kātyā p / yano sajayī ca veraṭṭikaputro
analyzed: tahi ṣaṣ śāstāraḥ samatā ānītā kāśyapaḥ ca pūraṇaḥ maskarī ca gośālī ajitaḥ ca keśakambalī kakudaḥ ca kātyā yano sajayī ca veraṭṭikaputro
translated: There, six teachers have been brought together: Kāśyapa Pūraṇa, Maskarin Gośālīputra, Ajita Keśakambala, Kakuda Kātyāyana, Sañjayin Veraṭṭikaputra,

original: nirgrantho ca jñātiputro //
analyzed: nirgranthaḥ ca jñāti putraḥ
translated: and Nirgrantha Jñātiputra.

original: etehi āgatehi vaiśālakānāmamanuṣyavyādhi nopaśāmyati //
analyzed: etehi āgatehi vaiśālakānām amanuṣya vyādhi na upaśāmyati
translated: When they have come, the non-human disease of the people of Vaiśālī does not subside.

original: tato mahārāja lecchavīnā devatāhi ārocita //
analyzed: tatas mahā rāja leccha vīnā
translated: Then, Great King, the gods announced to the Licchavis:

original: eṣa uddho bhagavānasakhyeye dharmānubhāvena hi samudāgato sadevakasya lokasya leno trāṇo śaraṇo parāyaṇo devātidevo śāstā devamanuṣyāṇā nāgānāmasurāṇā
analyzed: eṣaḥ uddhaḥ bhagavān asakhyeye dharma anubhāvena hi samudāgataḥ sa devakasya lokasya lenaḥ trāṇaḥ śaraṇaḥ parāyaṇaḥ devātidevaḥ śāstā deva manuṣyāṇā nāgānām asurāṇā
translated: This Blessed One is the unsurpassed teacher, who has attained through the power of the Dharma, the refuge, the protector, the shelter, the final goal for the world with its gods, the god above the gods, the teacher of gods and humans, of nāgas, asuras,

original: yakṣāṇā rākṣasānā piśācānā kumbhāṇḍānā //
analyzed: yakṣāṇā rākṣasānā piśācānā kumbhāṇḍānā
translated: yakṣas, rākṣasas, piśācas, and kumbhāṇḍas.

original: yo ya grāmakṣetrasīmamākramati tatra sarve ītikalikakālakarṇī praśāmyanti buddhānubhāvena dharmānubhāvena saghānubhāvena //
analyzed: yaḥ yaḥ grāma kṣetra sīmam ākramati tatra sarve īti kalika kālakarṇī praśāmyanti buddha anubhāvena dharma anubhāvena sagha anubhāvena
translated: Wherever he goes, in that village or field, all epidemics, quarrels, famines, and ear diseases are pacified by the Buddha's power, the Dharma's power, and the Sangha's power.

original: tamāthena tena āgatena vaiśālyānāmamanuṣyavyādhiḥ praśāmyatīti //
analyzed: tamāthena tena āgatena vaiśālyānām amanuṣya vyādhiḥ praśāmyati iti
translated: By his mere arrival, the non-human disease in Vaishali is pacified.

original: sādhu mahārāja bhagavantamanujānāhi vaiśāli gamanāye anukampāmupādāya //
analyzed: sādhu mahā rāja bhagavantam anujānāhi vaiśāli gamanāye anukampām upādāya
translated: It is good, great king, please grant permission for the Blessed One to go to Vaishali out of compassion.

original: evamukto rājā śreṇiyo bimbisāro tomara lecchavimetaduvāca //
analyzed: evam uktaḥ rājā śreṇiyaḥ bimbisāraḥ tomara lecchavim etat uvāca
translated: When this was said, King Shrenya Bimbisara said this to Tomara the Licchavi:

original: sace vāsiṣṭha vaiśalakā lecchavayo bhagavato rājagṛhāto vaiśāli gacchantasya eva pratyudgamana karonti yāvatsvaka vijita yathāhamanuyāna
analyzed: sace vāsiṣṭha vaiśalakāḥ leccha vayaḥ bhagavataḥ rājagṛhātaḥ vaiśāli gacchantasya eva pratyudgamana karonti yāvat svaka vijita yathā aham anuyāna
translated: If, Vasishtha, the Licchavis of Vaishali come out to meet the Blessed One as far as their own territory, just as I do,

original: karomi yāvatsvakavijitametsye ha bhagavantamanujānaye rājagṛhāto vaiśāli gamanāya //
analyzed: karomi yāvat sva ka vijitam etsye ha bhagavantam anujānaye rājagṛhātaḥ vaiśāli gamanāya
translated: I will grant permission for the Blessed One to go from Rajagriha to Vaishali.

original: atha khalu tomaro lecchavī rājño śreṇiyasya bimbisārasya pratiśrutvā vaiśāli gaṇasya dūtā preṣayasi //
analyzed: atha khalu tomaraḥ lecchavī rājñaḥ śreṇiyasya bimbisārasya pratiśrutvā vaiśāli gaṇasya dūtā preṣayasi
translated: Then Tomara the Licchavi, having received the promise from King Shreniya Bimbisara, sent messengers to the assembly of Vaishali:

original: eva vāsiṣṭhāho rājā śreṇiyo bimbisāro jalpati //
analyzed: eva vāsiṣṭhāhaḥ rājā śreṇiyaḥ bimbisāraḥ jalpati
translated: Thus, Vasishthas, King Shreniya Bimbisara says:

original: atha khalu te dūtā tomarasya lecchavisya pratiśrutvā vaiśāli gatvā lecchavigaṇasya ārocesi //
analyzed: atha khalu te dūtā tomarasya leccha visya pratiśrutvā vaiśāli gatvā leccha vi gaṇasya ārocesi
translated: Then the messengers, having heard this from the Licchavi Tomara, went to Vaiśālī and reported to the Licchavi assembly:

original: eva vāsiṣṭhāho rājā śreṇiko bimbisāro tomarasya lecchavisya jalpati /🔽sace vaiśālakā lecchavayo bhagavato rājagṛhāto vaiśāli gacchantasya eva pratyudgamana karonti yāvatsvaka vijita yathā ahamanuyāna karomi
analyzed: eva vāsiṣṭhāhaḥ rājā śreṇikaḥ bimbisāraḥ tomarasya jalpati  sace vaiśālakāḥ leccha vayaḥ bhagavataḥ rājagṛhātaḥ vaiśāli gacchantasya eva pratyudgamana karonti yāvat svaka vijita yathā aham anuyāna karomi  /
translated: Thus, O sons of Vasiṣṭha, King Śreṇiya Bimbisāra says to the Licchavi Tomara:🔽If the Licchavis of Vaiśālī go out to meet the Blessed One when he is coming from Rājagṛha to Vaiśālī, as far as their own territory, just as I would accompany him,

original: yāvatsvaka vijita etsye ha bhagavantamanujāneya rājagṛhāto vaiśāli gamanāya //
analyzed: yāvat svaka vijite etsye ha bhagavantam anujāneya rājagṛhātaḥ vaiśāli gamanāya
translated: and if he will return to Rājagṛha from Vaiśālī, I will obtain permission for the Blessed One to go from Rājagṛha to Vaiśālī.

original: evamukte vaiśāleyakā lecchavayaḥ tādūtā / / / / / / / / //
analyzed: evam ukte vaiśāleyakāḥ leccha vayaḥ
translated: When this was said, the Licchavis of Vaiśālī said to the messengers:

original: etadvaktavyo vāsiṣṭhāho rājā śreṇiyo bimbisāro lecchavigaṇasya vacanena //
analyzed: etad vaktavyaḥ vāsiṣṭha ahaḥ rājā śreṇiyaḥ bimbisāraḥ leccha vigaṇasya vacanena
translated: You should say this to King Śreṇiya Bimbisāra on behalf of the Licchavi assembly:

original: kariṣyanti mahārāja vaiśālakā leccha p / vayo bhagavataḥ pratyudgamana yāvallecchavīnā vijita //
analyzed: kariṣyanti mahā rāja vaiśālakāḥ leccha vayaḥ bhagavataḥ pratyudgamana yāvat leccha vīnā vijita
translated: 'Great king, the Licchavis of Vaiśālī will go out to meet the Blessed One as far as the territory of the Licchavis.'

original: atha khalu te dūtā lecchavigaṇasya pratiśrutvā rājagṛha gatvā tomarasya ārocensuḥ //
analyzed: atha khalu te dūtāḥ leccha vigaṇasya pratiśrutvā rājagṛha gatvā tomarasya ārocensuḥ
translated: Then the messengers, having heard this from the Licchavi assembly, went to Rājagṛha and reported to Tomara:🔽Thus, O sons of Vasiṣṭha, King Śreṇiya Bimbisāra says to the Licchavi Tomara:🔽If the Licchavis of Vaiśālī go out to meet the Blessed One when he is coming from Rājagṛha to Vaiśālī, as far as their own territory, just as I would accompany him,🔽and if he will return to Rājagṛha from Vaiśālī, I will obtain permission for the Blessed One to go from Rājagṛha to Vaiśālī.

original: atha khalu tomaro lecchaviḥ dūtānā vacana pratiśrutvā yena rājā śreṇiko bimbisāro tenupasakramitvā rājāna śreṇina bimbisārametaduvāca
analyzed: atha khalu tomaraḥ lecchaviḥ dūtānā vacana pratiśrutvā yena rājā śreṇikaḥ bimbisāraḥ tena upasakramitvā rājāna śreṇina bimbisāram etat uvāca
translated: Then the Licchavi Tomara, having heard the words of the messengers, approached King Śreṇiya Bimbisāra and said this to King Śreṇiya Bimbisāra:

original: kariṣyanti mahārāja vaiśālakā lecchavayo bhagavataḥ pratyudgamana //
analyzed: kariṣyanti mahā rāja vaiśālakāḥ leccha vayaḥ bhagavataḥ pratyudgamana
translated: Great king, the Licchavis of Vaiśālī will go out to meet the Fortunate One.

original: sādhu bhagavantamanujānāhi vaiśāli gamanāya anukampāmupādāya //
analyzed: sādhu bhagavantam anujānāhi vaiśāli gamanāya anukampām upādāya
translated: It is good, having compassion, allow the Fortunate One to go to Vaiśālī.

original: bhagavā dāni rājñā śreṇiyena bimbisāreṇa anujñāto vaiśāli gamanāya amātyā ca āṇattā yāva ca rājagṛha yāva ca gagāyāḥ tīrtha mārga pratijāgṛtha
analyzed: bhagavā dāni rājñā śreṇiyena bimbisāreṇa anujñātaḥ vaiśāli gamanāya amātyā ca āṇattā yāva ca rājagṛha yāva ca gagāyāḥ tīrtha mārga pratijāgṛtha  /
translated: Then the Fortunate One, having been allowed by King Śreṇiya Bimbisāra to go to Vaiśālī, and the ministers having been ordered to guard the road from Rājagṛha as far as the bank of the Ganges,

original: aṣṭapadasamamaviṣama pāṇitalajāta vitatavitāna citraduṣyaparikṣipta osaktapaṭṭadāmakalāpa dhūpitadhūpana siktasamṛṣṭa muktapuṣpāvakīrṇa
analyzed: pāṇi tala jāta vitata vitāna citra duṣya parikṣipta osakta paṭṭa dāma kalāpa dhūpita dhūpana sikta samṛṣṭa mukta puṣpa avakīrṇa
translated: (they were to make it) like a checkerboard, without unevenness, like the palm of a hand, with a canopy spread above, surrounded by colorful silk, with streamers and garlands hung, perfumed with incense, sprinkled and cleaned, strewn with loose flowers,

original: nāvāsakrama bandhāpetha yena bhagavā saśrāvakasagho gagāyā tariṣyati vaiśāli gamanāya /
analyzed: yena bhagavā sa śrāvaka saghaḥ gagāyā tariṣyati vaiśāli gamanāya
translated: and to have a bridge made for the Fortunate One to cross the Ganges with his Saṅgha of disciples and go to Vaiśālī.

original: ardhayojanike ca antare maṇḍapasavidhāna kārāpetha annapānasavidhāna kārāpetha śayyāsanasavidhāna ca bhagavataḥ saśrāvakasaghasya
analyzed: ardha yojanike ca antare maṇḍapa savidhāna kārāpetha anna pāna savidhāna kārāpetha śayyā āsana savidhāna ca bhagavataḥ sa śrāvaka saghasya
translated: And in every half-yojana, have pavilions prepared, with provisions of food and drink prepared, and beds and seats prepared for the Blessed One and his community of monks.

original: sarva sukhopadhāna yathā bhagavā saśrāvakasagho rājagṛhāto sukha vaiśāli gaccheya bhikṣusaghaśca //
analyzed: sarva yathā bhagavā sa śrāvaka saghaḥ rājagṛhātaḥ sukha vaiśāli gaccheya bhikṣu saghaḥ ca
translated: So that the Blessed One and his community of monks can travel from Rājagṛha to Vaiśālī in comfort.

original: manasā devānā vacasā pārthivānā /
analyzed: manasā devānā vacasā pārthivānā
translated: The gods by their thoughts, the kings by their words,

original: nacireṇāḍhyānā karmaṇā daridrāṇāmiti //
analyzed: nacireṇa āḍhyānā karmaṇā daridrāṇām iti
translated: The rich by their actions, and the poor by their deeds.

original: rājñā ca āṇatta amātyehi ca sarva pratijāgṛta yathā āṇatta //
analyzed: rājñā ca āṇatta amātyehi ca sarva pratijāgṛta yathā āṇatta
translated: And the king ordered, and the ministers prepared everything as ordered.

original: bhagavā saprasthito sārdha bhikṣusaghena //
analyzed: bhagavā sa prasthitaḥ sārdha bhikṣu saghena
translated: The Blessed One set out with his community of monks.

original: rājā śreṇiyo bimbisāro sayugyabalavāhano sadevīkumārāmātyaparijano rājārhehi pacahi cchatraśatehi dhāryamāṇehi osaktapaṭṭadāmakalāpehi sadhvajapatākehi
analyzed: rājā śreṇiyaḥ bimbisāraḥ sa yugya bala vāhanaḥ sa devī kumāra amātya parijanaḥ rāja arhehi pacahi chatra śatehi dhāryamāṇehi osakta paṭṭa dāma kalāpehi sa dhvaja patākehi
translated: King Śreṇiya Bimbisāra, with his army of chariots and horses, with his queen, princes, ministers and attendants, with royal parasols and hundreds of umbrellas being held over him, with streamers, garlands and wreaths suspended, with flags and banners,

original: mahatā rājānubhāvena mahatā rājaṛddhīye mahatāye vibhūṣāye bhagavanta vaiśāli gacchanta samanuyāti ardhayojanikenāntarāvāsena yāvatsvaka
analyzed: mahatā rāja anubhāvena mahatā rājaṛddhīye bhagavanta vaiśāli gacchanta samanuyāti ardha yojanikena antarāvāsena yāvat svaka
translated: with great royal splendor, great royal wealth, and great magnificence, followed the Blessed One as he went to Vaiśālī, every half-yojana along the way, up to his own

original: viṣaya gagāyāḥ tīraḥ //
analyzed: viṣaya gagāyāḥ tīraḥ
translated: on the bank of the Ganges, the boundary of the realm.

original: aśroṣuḥ vaiśālakā lecchavikā edṛśāye vi p / dhīye rājā śreṇiyo bimbisāro bhagavato anuyāna karoti rājagṛhāto vaiśālimāgacchantasyeti //
analyzed: aśroṣuḥ vaiśālakāḥ lecchavikāḥ vi  /
translated: The Licchavis of Vaiśālī heard that King Śreṇiya Bimbisāra was following the Blessed One in this way, from Rājagṛha to Vaiśālī.

original: śrutvā ca punaḥ yāva ca vaiśālī yāva ca gagātīrtha vaiśālakānā lecchavīnā vijitamatrāntare mārga pratijāgrasu aṣṭapadasamamaviṣama pāṇitalajāta
analyzed: śrutvā ca punar yāva ca vaiśālī yāva ca gagā tīrtha vaiśāla kānā vijita matra antare mārga pratijāgrasu aṣṭa pada samama viṣama pāṇi tala jāta
translated: Having heard this, they guarded the road between Vaiśālī and the Ganges ford, making it even like a chequer-board, free from unevenness, like the palm of a hand,

original: siktasamṛṣṭa muktapuṣpāvakīrṇa vitatavitāna citraduṣyaparikṣipta osaktapaṭṭadāmakalāpa dhūpitadhūpana //
analyzed: sikta samṛṣṭa mukta puṣpa avakīrṇa vitata vitāna citra duṣya parikṣipta osakta paṭṭa dāma kalāpa dhūpita dhūpana
translated: watered, swept, strewn with garlands of flowers, with a canopy spread above, surrounded by variegated silk, with streamers and festooned garlands hanging down, perfumed with incense.

original: deśadeśehi na naṭanartanaṛllamallapāṇisvaryā sthāpayensu /
analyzed: deśa deśehi na sthāpayet su
translated: Here and there they placed dancers, mimes, athletes, wrestlers and musicians.

original: ardhayojanikena ca antareṇa maṇḍapasavidhāna ca kārayensu śayyāsanasavidhāna ca pānīyasavidhāna ca bhaktasavidhāna ca bhagavataḥ saśrāvakasaghasya
analyzed: ardha yojanikena ca antareṇa maṇḍapa savidhāna ca kārayen su śayyā āsana savidhāna ca pānīya savidhāna ca bhakta savidhāna ca bhagavataḥ sa śrāvaka saghasya
translated: Every half yojana they erected a pavilion, provided with beds, seats, drinks and food, for the Blessed One and his community of monks.

original: abhyantaravaiśālīto caturaśīti rathasahasrāṇi yajāpayitvā dvecaturaśīti rathasahasrāṇi yojāpayitvā savaijayantikāni sanandighoṣāṇi sapuṣpamālāni
analyzed: caturaśīti ratha sahasrāṇi yajāpayitvā dve caturaśīti ratha sahasrāṇi yojāpayitvā sa vaijayantikāni sa nandi ghoṣāṇi sa puṣpa mālāni
translated: From the inner part of Vaiśālī, they had 84,000 chariots prepared, and 84,000 chariots with flags, banners, and garlands,🔽with parasols, flags, and banners, and with abundant incense, garlands, and offerings,

original: sacchatradhvajapatākāni prathūta ca gandhamālyamādāya svakasvakāni bhadrāṇi yānānyabhiruhitvā mahatā rājānubhāvena mahatā rājaṛddhīye mahato
analyzed: sa chatra dhvaja patākāni ca gandha mālyam ādāya svaka svakāni bhadrāṇi yānāni abhiruhitvā mahatā rāja anubhāvena mahatā rājaṛddhīye mahataḥ
translated: having mounted their own fine vehicles with great royal pomp, great royal splendor,

original: janakāyasya hakkārahikkārabherīmṛdagamarupaṇavaśakhasanninādena vaiśālīto nagarāto niryātā bhagavanta pratyudgacchensu yāvadgagātīrtha
analyzed: jana kāyasya hakkāra hikkāra bherī mṛda ga maru paṇava śakha sanninādena vaiśālītaḥ nagarātaḥ niryātāḥ bhagavanta pratyudgacchet su yāvat gagā tīrtha
translated: and with the great crowd of people shouting Hā! Hā! and the sound of drums, kettledrums, conches, and flutes, they left the city of Vaiśālī and went to meet the Blessed One as far as the bank of the Ganges.

original: bhagavataḥ pajārtha //
analyzed: bhagavataḥ
translated: For the sake of the Blessed One.

original: teṣā pi ta eva savidhānarūpa abhūṣi //
analyzed: teṣām pi te eva sa vidhāna rūpa
translated: For them too, it was just as described.

original: santyatra lecchavayaḥ nīlāśvā nīlarathā nīlaraśmipratodā nīlayaṣṭī nīlavastrā nīlālakārā nīlauṣṇīṣā nīlacchatrā nīlakhaḍgamaṇipādukavālavyajanāḥ
analyzed: santi atra leccha vayaḥ nīla aśvāḥ nīla rathāḥ nīla raśmi pratodāḥ nīla yaṣṭī nīla vastrāḥ nīla alakārāḥ nīla oṣṇīṣāḥ nīla chatrāḥ nīla khaḍga maṇi pāduka vāla vyajanāḥ
translated: There were Licchavis with blue horses, blue chariots, blue reins and whips, blue staffs, blue garments, blue ornaments, blue turbans, blue parasols, blue swords, gems, shoes, yak tails, and fans.

original: tatredamiti ucyate //
analyzed: tatra idam iti ucyate
translated: Regarding this, it is said:

original: nīlāśvā nīla rathā nīlā raśmipratodamuṣṇīṣā /
analyzed: nīla aśvā nīla rathā nīlā raśmi pratodam uṣṇīṣā
translated: Blue horses, blue chariots, blue reins, whips, and turbans,

original: nīlā ca paca kakudā nīlā vastrā alakārā //
analyzed: nīlā ca paca kakudā nīlā vastrā alakārā
translated: with blue horses, blue chariots, blue reins, whips, and staffs, blue garments, and blue ornaments.

original: santyatra lecchavayaḥ pītāśvāḥ pītarathā pītaraśmipratodayaṣṭī pītavastrāḥ pītālakārā pītoṣṇīṣā pītacchatrā pītakaḍgamaṇipādukā //
analyzed: santi atra leccha vayaḥ pīta aśvāḥ pīta rathā pīta raśmi pratoda yaṣṭī pīta vastrāḥ pīta alakārā pīta uṣṇīṣā pīta chatrā pīta kaḍga maṇi pādukā
translated: Here there are Licchavis with yellow horses, yellow chariots, yellow reins, whips, and staffs, yellow garments, yellow ornaments, yellow headdresses, yellow umbrellas, yellow swords, jewels, and sandals.

original: tatredamucyate //
analyzed: tatra idam ucyate
translated: Regarding this, it is said:

original: p / pītāśvā pīta rathā pītā raśmipratodamuṣṇīṣā /🔽pītā ca paca kakudā pītā vastrā alakārā //
analyzed: pīta aśvā pīta rathā pītā raśmi pratoda muṣṇīṣā  pītā ca paca kakudā pītā vastrā alakārā
translated: Yellow horses, yellow chariots, yellow reins, whips, and headdresses,🔽with yellow horses, yellow chariots, yellow reins, whips, and staffs, yellow garments, and yellow ornaments.

original: santyatra lecchavayo majiṣṭāśvā majiṣṭharathā majiṣṭhāpratodayaṣṭī majiṣṭhavastrā majiṣṭhaalakārā majiṣṭhauṣṇīṣā majiṣṭhacchatrāḥ majiṣṭhamaṇipādukavālavyajanāḥ
analyzed: santi atra leccha vayaḥ majiṣṭa aśvāḥ majiṣṭha rathāḥ majiṣṭha apratoda yaṣṭī majiṣṭha vastrāḥ majiṣṭha alakārāḥ majiṣṭha oṣṇīṣāḥ majiṣṭha chatrāḥ majiṣṭha maṇi pāduka vāla vyajanāḥ
translated: Here there are Licchavis with the best horses, the best chariots, the best reins, whips, and staffs, the best garments, the best ornaments, the best headdresses, the best umbrellas, the best jewels, sandals, hair ornaments, and fans.

original: tatredamucyate //🔽majiṣṭhā aśvarathā mañjiṣṭha raśmipratodayaṣṭī ca /
analyzed: tatra idam ucyate  majiṣṭhāḥ aśva rathāḥ mañjiṣṭha raśmi pratoda yaṣṭī ca
translated: Regarding this, it is said:🔽The best horses and chariots, the best reins, whips, and staffs,

original: majiṣṭha paca kakudā majiṣṭha vastraalakārāḥ //
analyzed: majiṣṭha paca kakudā majiṣṭha vastra alakārāḥ
translated: with the best horses, the best chariots, the best reins, whips, and staffs, the best garments, and the best ornaments.

original: santyatra lecchavayo lohitāśvā lohitarathā lohitapratodayaṣṭī lohitavastrā lohitālakārā lohitauṣṇīṣā lohitacchatrāḥ lohitakhaḍgamaṇipādukavālavyajanāḥ
analyzed: santi atra leccha vayaḥ lohita aśvāḥ lohita rathāḥ lohita pratoda yaṣṭī lohita vastrāḥ lohita alakārāḥ lohita oṣṇīṣāḥ lohita chatrāḥ lohita khaḍga maṇi pāduka vāla vyajanāḥ
translated: There are Licchavis here with red horses, red chariots, red whips and staffs, red garments, red ornaments, red headdresses, red parasols, red swords, gems, shoes, fans,

original: tatredamucyate //
analyzed: tatra idam ucyate
translated: Regarding this, it is said:

original: lohitā aśvā rathā ca lohita raśmipratodayaṣṭī ca /🔽lohita ca paca kakudā lohita vastrā alakārāḥ //
analyzed: lohitā aśvā rathā ca lohita raśmi pratoda yaṣṭī ca  lohita ca paca kakudā lohita vastrā alakārāḥ
translated: Red horses, red chariots, red reins, whips and staffs,🔽Red garments, red ornaments,

original: santyatra lecchavayo śvetāśvā śvetarathā śvetapratodayaṣṭī ca śvetavastrāḥ śvetālakārāḥ śvetoṣṇīṣāḥ śvetacchatrāḥ śvetakhaḍgāḥ śvetamaṇipādukavālavyajanāḥ
analyzed: santi atra ca śveta vastrāḥ śveta alakārāḥ śveta uṣṇīṣāḥ śveta chatrāḥ śveta khaḍgāḥ śveta maṇi pāduka vāla vyajanāḥ
translated: There are Licchavis here with white horses, white chariots, white whips and staffs, white garments, white ornaments, white headdresses, white parasols, white swords, white gems, shoes, fans,

original: tatredamucyate //
analyzed: tatra idam ucyate
translated: Regarding this, it is said:

original: śvetāśvā śveta rathā śveta raśmipratodayaṣṭī ca /
analyzed: śveta aśvā śveta rathā śveta raśmi pratoda yaṣṭī ca
translated: White horses, white chariots, white reins, whips and staffs,

original: śvetā ca paca kakudā śvetā vastrā alakārāḥ //
analyzed: śvetā ca paca kakudā śvetā vastrā alakārāḥ
translated: White garments, white ornaments,

original: santyatra lecchavayo haritāśvā haritarathāḥ haritaraśmipratodayaṣṭī ca haritavastrā p / haritālakārā haritoṣṇīṣā haritacchatrā haritakhaḍgā
analyzed: santi atra leccha vayaḥ harita aśvāḥ harita rathāḥ harita raśmi pratoda yaṣṭī ca harita vastrā harita alakārā harita uṣṇīṣā harita chatrā harita khaḍgā  /
translated: There are Licchavis here with green horses, green chariots, green reins, whips and staffs, green garments, green ornaments, green headdresses, green parasols, green swords,

original: haritamaṇipādukavālavyajanāḥ //
analyzed: harita maṇi pāduka vāla vyajanāḥ
translated: with green horses, green chariots, green reins, whips, and staffs,

original: tatredamucyate //🔽haritāśvā harita rathā haritā raśmipratodayaṣṭī ca /
analyzed: tatra idam ucyate  harita aśvā harita rathā haritā raśmi pratoda yaṣṭī ca
translated: Regarding this, it is said:🔽Green horses, green chariots, green reins, whips, and staffs,

original: haritā ca paca kakudā haritā vastrā alakārāḥ //
analyzed: haritā ca paca kakudā haritā vastrāḥ alakārāḥ
translated: Green umbrellas, green ornaments, green clothes, and green decorations.

original: santyatra lecchavayo vyāyuktāśvā vyāyuktarathā vyāyuktaraśmipratodayaṣṭī vyāyuktavastrā vyāyuktālakārā vyāyuktauṣṇīṣā vyāyuktacchatrā vyāyuktakhaḍgā
analyzed: santi atra leccha vayaḥ vyāyukta aśvāḥ vyāyukta rathāḥ vyāyukta raśmi pratoda yaṣṭī vyāyukta vastrāḥ vyāyukta alakārāḥ vyāyukta oṣṇīṣāḥ vyāyukta chatrāḥ vyāyukta khaḍgāḥ
translated: Here there are Licchavis with unyoked horses, unyoked chariots, unyoked reins, whips, and staffs, unyoked clothes, unyoked ornaments, unyoked turbans, unyoked umbrellas, unyoked swords,

original: vyāyuktamaṇipādukavālavyajanāḥ //
analyzed: vyāyukta maṇi pāduka vāla vyajanāḥ
translated: unyoked jewels, sandals, fans, and whisks.

original: tatredamucyate //🔽vyāyuktā aśvarathā vyāyukta raśmipratodayaṣṭī ca /
analyzed: tatra idam ucyate  vyāyuktāḥ aśva rathāḥ vyāyukta raśmi pratoda yaṣṭī ca
translated: Regarding this, it is said:🔽Un-yoked horses and chariots, un-yoked reins, whips, and staffs,

original: vyāyukta paca kakudā vyāyukta vastraalakārāḥ //
analyzed: vyāyukta paca kakudā vyāyukta vastraalakārāḥ
translated: Un-yoked umbrellas, un-yoked ornaments, un-yoked clothes.

original: santyatra lecchavayo suvarṇacchatrehi kujarehi nānālakārabhūṣitehi //
analyzed: santi atra suvarṇa chatrehi kujarehi nānā alakāra bhūṣitehi
translated: Here there are Licchavis with golden umbrellas and golden water jars, adorned with various ornaments.

original: santyatra lecchavayo suvarṇaśivikāhi sarvaratanabhūṣitāhi //
analyzed: santi atra suvarṇa śivikā hi sarva ratana bhūṣitā hi
translated: Here there are Licchavis with golden palanquins adorned with all jewels.

original: santyatra lecchavayo suvarṇamayehi rathehi savaijayantehi sanandighoṣehi sakhurapravāśīhi ucchritacchatradhvajapatākehi //
analyzed: santi atra suvarṇa mayehi rathehi sa vaijayantehi sa nandighoṣehi sa khura pravāśīhi ucchrita chatra dhvaja patākehi
translated: Here there are Licchavis with golden chariots, with victory banners, with pleasant sounds, with clattering wheels, with raised umbrellas, flags, and banners.

original: evarūpeṇa anubhāvena evarūpāye vidhiye evarūpeṇa samudayena evarūpāye rājaṛddhīye evarūpāye samṛddhīye evarūpāye savṛttāye edṛśāye vibhūṣāye
analyzed: evarūpeṇa anubhāvena evarūpāye vidhiye evarūpeṇa samudayena evarūpāye rājaṛddhīye evarūpāye samṛddhīye evarūpāye savṛttāye edṛśāye vibhūṣāye  /
translated: with such majesty, with such splendour, with such an escort, with such royal pomp, with such royal majesty, with such royal splendour, with such adornment,

original: vaiśālakā lecchavayo dvecaturaśītihi yānasahasrehi gośṛgī ca āmrapālikā ca tadyathā so pi mahājanakāyo bhagavanta pratyudgatā yāvadgagāyā 🔽tīrtha //
analyzed: vaiśālakāḥ leccha vayaḥ dve caturaśītihi yāna sahasrehi gośṛgī ca āmrapālikā ca tat yathā saḥ pi mahā jana kāyaḥ bhagavanta pratyudgatā yāvadgagāyā  tīrtha
translated: the Licchavis of Vaiśālī went forth in two hundred and eighty thousand carriages, and Gośṛṅgī and Āmrapālī, just as that great crowd went forth to meet the Exalted One as far as the bank of the Ganges.🔽The Exalted One crossed the Ganges and went to the other shore.

original: bhagavā gagāye pārime kūle rājño śreṇiyasya bimbisārasya māgadhakānā brāhmaṇakānā dharmayā kathayā sadarśayitvā samuttejayitvā sapraharṣayitvā
analyzed: bhagavā gagāye pārime kūle rājñaḥ śreṇiyasya bimbisārasya māgadhakānā brāhmaṇakānā dharmayā kathayā sa darśayitvā samuttejayitvā sa praharṣayitvā
translated: The Exalted One, having instructed, inspired, fired and delighted King Śreṇiya Bimbisāra of Magadha and the brāhmaṇas and householders of Magadha with talk on dhamma as he went along,

original: māgadhakānā brāmhaṇakānā caturaśīti sahasrāṇi dharmābhisamaye pratiṣṭhāpetvā yena vaiśālakā leccha p / vayo tena viloketvā bhikṣūṇā āmantreti
analyzed: māgadhakānā brāmhaṇakānā caturaśīti sahasrāṇi dharma abhisamaye pratiṣṭhāpetvā yena vaiśālakāḥ leccha tena bhikṣūṇā āmantreti
translated: having established eighty-four thousand Magadhan brāhmaṇas and householders in the fruit of stream-entry, looked towards Vaiśālī, and addressed the monks, saying:

original: bhikṣavo na dṛṣṭapūrvā devā trāyastriśāḥ sudarśanāto nagarāto udyānabhūmimabhiniṣkramantā /
analyzed: bhikṣavaḥ na dṛṣṭa pūrvā devā trāyastriśāḥ sudarśanātaḥ nagarātaḥ udyāna bhūmim abhiniṣkramantā
translated: “Monks, never before have I seen such a gathering of devas as I have seen in Vaiśālī.

original: te etarahi vaiśālakā lecchavayo paśyatha //
analyzed: te etarahi vaiśālakāḥ leccha vayaḥ paśyatha
translated: Behold, monks, the Licchavis of Vaiśālī now!

original: tatkasya hetoḥ //
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: And why?

original: tādṛśāye va bhikṣavo ṛddhīye devā trāyastriśā sudarśanāto nagarāto udyānabhūmimabhiniṣkramanti //
analyzed: va bhikṣavaḥ ṛddhīye devā trāyastriśā sudarśanātaḥ nagarātaḥ udyāna bhūmim abhiniṣkramanti
translated: For such is the prosperity of the gods of the Thirty-three, monks, that they go out from the city of Sudarśana to the pleasure garden.

original: sphītāni rājyāni praśāmyamānā samyak rājyāni karonti jñātayo /
analyzed: sphītāni rājyāni praśāmyamānā samyak rājyāni karonti jñātayaḥ
translated: They make their kingdoms prosperous and peaceful, and their relatives are well-off.

original: tathā ime lecchavimadhye santo devehi śāstā upamāmakāsi //
analyzed: tathā ime leccha vimadhye santaḥ deva ihi śāstā upamāmakā asi
translated: In the same way, the Teacher, who is among the Licchavis, is compared to the gods.

original: trāyastriśā yehi na dṛṣṭapūrvā udyānabhūmi abhiniṣkramantā /
analyzed: trāyastriśā yā ihi na dṛṣṭa pūrvā udyāna bhūmi abhiniṣkramantā
translated: Those who have never before seen the Thirty-three going out to the pleasure garden,

original: etādṛśī samiti abhūṣi teṣā yathā iya samṛddhi lecchavīnā //
analyzed: etādṛśī samiti abhūṣi teṣā yathā iya samṛddhi lecchavīnā
translated: such was their assembly, as is this prosperity of the Licchavis.

original: suvarṇacchatrehi ca kujarehi śivikāhi sauvarṇamayīhi cānye /
analyzed: suvarṇa chatrehi ca kujarehi śivikāhi sauvarṇa mayīhi ca anye
translated: Some on golden parasols, some on golden palanquins,

original: rathehi sauvarṇamayehi cānye pratyudgama lecchavino karonti //
analyzed: rathehi sauvarṇa mayehi ca anye pratyudgama lecchavinaḥ karonti
translated: some on golden chariots, the Licchavis go out to meet them.

original: sarve sametvā saha jñātibandhavo daharā ca madhyā ca mahallakā ca /
analyzed: sarve sametvā saha jñāti bandhavaḥ daharā ca madhyā ca mahallakā ca
translated: All together with their relatives and kinsmen, the young, the middle-aged and the old,

original: alakṛtā laktakaraktavastrā pratyudgatā te ca vicitracārī //
analyzed: alakṛtā laktaka rakta vastrā pratyudgatā te ca vicitra cārī
translated: adorned, wearing red garments and red robes, they go out to meet them, with various amusements.

original: tahi dāni gagāyā rājño śreṇiyasya bimbisārasya nāvāsakrama abhyantaravaiśā p / lakānā nāvāsakrama bāhiravaiśālakānā nāvāsakrama
analyzed: tahi dāni gagāyāḥ rājñaḥ śreṇiyasya bimbisārasya nāvāsakrama abhyantara vaiśālakānā nāvāsakrama bāhira vaiśālakānā nāvāsakrama
translated: There, on the bank of the Ganges, was the royal camp of King Śreṇiya Bimbisāra, the camp of the Licchavis of Vaiśālī was on the other side of the Ganges,

original: gāgeyehi nāgehi kambalāśvatarehi nāvāsakramo kṛto //
analyzed: gāgeyehi nāgehi kambala aśvatarehi nāvāsa kramaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: and the camp of the Kāśyapas, the sons of the Nāga, was on the bank of the Ganges.

original: bhagavānasmadīyena uttariṣyatīti //
analyzed: bhagavān asmadīyena uttariṣyati iti
translated: The Blessed One will cross by ours.

original: śukena gośṛgīye vacanena bhagavā saśrāvakasagho śuvetanāya bhaktena upanimantrito tasya ca bhagavatā tūṣṇībhāvenādhivāsita //
analyzed: śukena gośṛgīye vacanena bhagavā sa śrāvaka saghaḥ śu vetanāya bhaktena upanimantritaḥ tasya ca bhagavatā tūṣṇībhāvena adhivāsita
translated: By the word of the parrot Gośṛṅgī, the Blessed One, together with the assembly of disciples, was invited to a meal by Śvetaketu, and the Blessed One accepted the invitation by remaining silent.

original: tena śukena bhagavatastūṣṇībhāvenādhivāsanā buddhānubhāvena vijñātā /
analyzed: tena śukena bhagavataḥ tūṣṇībhāvena adhivāsanā buddha anubhāvena vijñātā
translated: By the power of the Buddha, the parrot understood the Blessed One's acceptance by remaining silent.

original: so bahgavataḥ pādā śirasā vanditvā bhagavanta bhikṣusagha ca pradakṣiṇīkṛtvā pratyāgato //
analyzed: saḥ bahgavataḥ pādā śirasā vanditvā bhagavanta bhikṣu sagha ca pradakṣiṇīkṛtvā pratyāgataḥ
translated: It bowed its head at the feet of the Blessed One, circumambulated the Blessed One and the assembly of monks, and returned.

original: yena gośṛgī bhagavatī tenopasakramitvā āha //
analyzed: yena gośṛgī bhagavatī tena upasakramitvā āha
translated: It went to the place where the Blessed One was and said:

original: nimantrito so bhagavā tathāgato'rha samyaksabuddho saśrāvakasagho śuvetanāye bhaktena tvadvacanena adhivāsita tena bhagavatā tūṣṇībhāvena
analyzed: nimantritaḥ saḥ bhagavā tathāgatoḥ ha samyaksabuddho sa śrāvaka saghaḥ bhaktena tvad vacanena adhivāsita tena bhagavatā tūṣṇībhāvena
translated: The Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, together with the assembly of disciples, has been invited by you to a meal by Śvetaketu, and the Blessed One has accepted by remaining silent.

original: bhagavā nāvāsakrame ārūḍho //
analyzed: bhagavān na āvāsa krame ārūḍhaḥ
translated: The Fortunate One ascended the raft.

original: rājā śreṇiyo bimbisāro svake nāvāsakrame bhagavanta paśyati /🔽abhyantaravaiśālakā ca svake nāvāsakrame bhagavanta paśyanti saśrāvakasagha /
analyzed: rājā śreṇiyaḥ bimbisāraḥ svake nāvāsa krame bhagavanta paśyati  ca svake na āvāsa krame bhagavanta paśyanti sa śrāvaka sagha
translated: King Śreṇiya Bimbisāra saw the Fortunate One on his own raft.🔽The people of inner Vaiśālī saw the Fortunate One on their own raft, together with the Community of monks.

original: bāhiravaiśālakā svake nāvāsakrame bhagavanta paśyanti saśrāvakasagha /
analyzed: svake na āvāsa krame bhagavanta paśyanti
translated: The people of outer Vaiśālī saw the Fortunate One on their own raft, together with the Community of monks.

original: kambalāśvatarā pi gāgeyamahānāgā svake nāvāsakrame bhagavanta paśyanti saśrāvakasagha taramāṇa //
analyzed: kambala aśvatarā pi gāgeya mahā nāgā svake nāvāsa krame bhagavanta paśyanti sa śrāvaka sagha taramāṇa
translated: The great nāga elephants Kumbhīra and Aśvatīra saw the Fortunate One on their own raft, together with the Community of monks, crossing.

original: tehi kambalāśvatarehi gāgeyakehi rājño śreṇiyasya bimbisārasya paca cchatraśatāni dṛṣṭvā vaiśālakānā pi paca cchatraśatā dṛṣṭvā tehi bhagavato 🔽tarantasya paca cchatraśatāni pragṛhītāni /🔽yakṣehi pi paca cchatraśatāni pragṛhitāni /
analyzed: tehi kambalāśvatarehi gāgeyakehi rājñaḥ śreṇiyasya bimbisārasya paca chatra śatāni dṛṣṭvā vaiśālakānā pi paca chatra śatā dṛṣṭvā tehi bhagavataḥ  tarantasya paca chatra śatāni pragṛhītāni  yakṣehi pi paca chatra śatāni pragṛhitāni
translated: Those Kumbhīra and Aśvatīra, the nāgas of the Gagga clan, having seen the six hundred parasols of King Śreṇiya Bimbisāra, and having seen the six hundred parasols of the people of Vaiśālī, they held up six hundred parasols for the Fortunate One🔽as he was crossing.🔽The yakṣas also held up six hundred parasols.

original: cāturmahārājakehi pi paca cchatraśatāni pragṛhitāni /
analyzed: cāturmahārājakehi pi paca chatra śatāni pragṛhitāni
translated: The Four Great Kings also held up six hundred parasols.

original: sunirmitenāpi devaputreṇa tato viśiṣṭatara chatra pragṛhīta /
analyzed: sunirmitena api devaputreṇa tatas viśiṣṭatara chatra pragṛhīta
translated: The god Sunirmita held up a parasol even more excellent than that.

original: paranirmitavaśavartihi pi caturhi pi mahārājehi paca cchatraśatāni pragṛhītāni /🔽trāyastriśehi pi devehi paca cchatraśatāni pragṛhītāni /🔽śakreṇāpi devānāmindreṇa cchatra pragṛhīta /🔽suyāmenāpi devaputreṇa cchatra pragṛhīta /
analyzed: caturhi pi mahārājehi paca chatra śatāni pragṛhītāni  trāyastriśehi pi devehi paca chatra śatāni pragṛhītāni  śakreṇa api devānām indreṇa chatra pragṛhīta  suyāmena api deva putreṇa chatra pragṛhīta
translated: The Paranirmitavasavartin gods, the Caturmahārājika gods, and the Four Great Kings each held five hundred parasols.🔽The Trāyastriṃśa gods also held five hundred parasols.🔽Śakra, lord of the gods, also held a parasol.🔽The god Suyāma also held a parasol.

original: āhnikakarmikapārthivarājāna vaśanirvṛttārhanti /
analyzed: āhnika karmika pārthiva rājāna vaśa nirvṛttāḥ arhanti
translated: The daily-duty-performing earthly kings deserve a parasol.

original: arhanti ca mahābhāgo sa eṣa puruṣarṣabho chatra //
analyzed: arhanti ca mahābhāgaḥ saḥ eṣa puruṣa ṛṣabhaḥ
translated: And the greatly fortunate one, the best of men, deserves a parasol.

original: ye bāhirā jayitvā ripusaghā aśnanti ajitarājyā /
analyzed: ye bāhirāḥ jayitvā ripu saghāḥ aśnanti ajita rājyā
translated: Those who, having conquered external enemies, enjoy their unconquered kingdoms,

original: sapannā te pi narā chatramarhanti //
analyzed: sapannā te pi narā chatram arhanti
translated: Those men also deserve a parasol.

original: ki puna yena samantā sarvakleśā jitā niravaśeṣā /
analyzed: ki puna yena samantā sarva kleśāḥ jitāḥ niravaśeṣā
translated: How much more so he who has completely conquered all afflictions without exception,

original: api na namuci sasainyo na tu cchatraśatāraho bhagavā //
analyzed: api na namuci sa sainyaḥ na tu chatra śata arahaḥ bhagavā
translated: Even Namuci with his army does not deserve a hundred parasols, let alone the Blessed One.

original: tārakataralaprakāśāntārakarūpānapratibhāsā /
analyzed: tāraka tarala prakāśa an tāraka rūpa an apratibhāsā
translated: With a form that is the embodiment of the light of the stars, the moon, and the sun,

original: vaiḍūryaratanadaṇḍā chatraśatā paca ādāya //
analyzed: vaiḍūrya ratana daṇḍā chatra śatā pacaḥ ādāya
translated: Having taken a thousand parasols with handles of lapis lazuli,

original: rājā bimbisāro aṇvati pṛṣṭhato daśabalasya /
analyzed: rājā bimbisāraḥ aṇvati pṛṣṭhatas daśabalasya
translated: King Bimbisāra follows behind the One with Ten Powers.

original: saprasthito ca bhagavā vajji abhimukho saha gaṇena //
analyzed: sa prasthitaḥ ca bhagavā vajji abhimukhaḥ saha gaṇena
translated: And the Blessed One, having set out, is facing the Vajjis with his assembly.

original: nāvāya samabhirūḍho bhagavā bhavati bhavaugha uttīrṇo /
analyzed: nāvāya samabhirūḍhaḥ bhagavā bhavati bhava oghaḥ uttīrṇaḥ
translated: The Blessed One, having boarded the boat, has crossed the flood of existence,

original: pāre ca lecchavigaṇāḥ chatrāśatā paca dhārensuḥ //
analyzed: pāre ca leccha vigaṇāḥ chatrāśatā paca
translated: And on the other side, the Licchavi groups hold a thousand parasols.

original: atha paśyiyā mahīpati mahāmahīdharamahābalaniketā /
analyzed: atha paśyiyā mahīpati mahā mahīdhara mahā bala niketā
translated: Then, seeing the lord of the earth, the great abode of the powerful great mountain,

original: nāgā pi gaganilayā chatraśatā paca dhārensu //
analyzed: nāgā pi gaganilayā chatra śatā paca
translated: The nāgas dwelling in the sky also hold a thousand parasols.

original: ṛddhimanto dyutimanto dharaṇipathagatā mahābalaniketā /
analyzed: ṛddhimantaḥ dyutimantaḥ dharaṇi patha gatāḥ mahā bala niketā
translated: The Yakshas, too, with their great strength and power, their splendor and prosperity, who range the earth and the sky,

original: yakṣā pi tatra asurā muditā chatraśatā paca dhāreṇsu //
analyzed: yakṣā pi tatra asurā muditā chatraśatā paca dhāreṇsu
translated: and the Asuras, with their hundreds of parasols, were delighted and held them aloft.

original: āgalitamālyamuktā uḍupatiparipūrṇacārucandramukhā /
analyzed: āgalita mālya muktā uḍupati paripūrṇa cāru candra mukhā
translated: With garlands and pearls hanging down, their faces as beautiful as the full moon,

original: p / devā pi tatra muditā chatraśatā paca dhāreṇsuḥ //
analyzed: devā pi tatra muditā chatra śatā paca
translated: the gods, too, with their hundreds of parasols, were delighted and held them aloft.

original: caturo pi lokapālā pramuditamanasā vigatamadanamānā /
analyzed: caturaḥ pi lokapālā pramudita manasā vigata madana mānā
translated: The Four Great Kings, with joyful minds, free from pride and conceit,

original: naṭakarajavidhamanakarā dhārensu dharaṇidharasamasya //
analyzed: naṭa karaja vidhamana karāḥ dharaṇidhara samasya
translated: held aloft the parasol of the One Equal to the Holder of the Earth.

original: atha so tridaśādhipatiḥ kācanamaṇiratnasukṛtavarajāla /
analyzed: atha saḥ tridaśa adhipatiḥ
translated: Then the Lord of the Thirty-Three, with a well-made, excellent net of precious jewels and crystals,

original: raktakusumasukṛtadāma chatra jagāgrasya dhāresi //
analyzed: rakta kusuma su kṛta dāma chatra jaga agrasya
translated: and a garland well-made of red flowers, held aloft the parasol of the Foremost in the World.

original: yamavaruṇanāgavandita yāmādhipati upetya vasuyāmā /
analyzed: yama varuṇa nāga vandita yāma adhipati upetya vasu yāmā
translated: The Lord of the Yamas, having approached, with his body as white as autumn clouds and water,

original: śaradajalābhrapāṇḍara dhārayi dhanapavanagatisya //
analyzed: śarada jala abhra pāṇḍara dhārayi dhana pavana gatisya
translated: held aloft the parasol of the One with the Speed of the Wind and Wealth.

original: tuṣitabhavanādhivāsī puna bhagavato upagato apromoho /🔽savartitakharasamavapu dhārayi cchatra prasannamano //
analyzed: tuṣita bhavana adhivāsī puna bhagavataḥ upagataḥ a promohaḥ  sa vartita khara sama vapu
translated: The One Dwelling in the Tusita Abode, again, approached the Blessed One, not deluded,🔽and held aloft the parasol, with a body like a well-polished mirror, with a joyful mind.

original: vaiḍūryasukṛtadaṇḍa prāvāḍadaśaśataśalākācitra /
analyzed: vaiḍūrya su kṛta daṇḍa prāvāḍa daśa śata śalākā citra
translated: With a handle well-made of lapis lazuli, adorned with a thousand branches of coral,

original: phullakusumāsthitatala sunirmito dhāraye chatra //
analyzed: su nirmitaḥ dhāraye
translated: And hold a parasol adorned with the petals of blooming flowers.

original: paranirmitavaśavartī nirmiṇe varakanakabhārasachanna /
analyzed: para nirmita vaśavartī nirmiṇe
translated: The one who rules over the Paranirmita gods creates a parasol covered with the best of gold,

original: ratnahāralambadāma chatra trailokyakīrtisya //
analyzed: ratna hāra lamba dāma
translated: Adorned with hanging garlands of jeweled necklaces, for the one whose fame extends to the three worlds.

original: brahmā prasannamanaso pavanapathaviśuddhahṛdayasya /
analyzed: brahmā pavana patha viśuddha hṛdayasya
translated: Brahma, with a joyful mind, for one whose heart is purified by the path of the wind,

original: dhāresi candrasannibha chatra paravādimathanasya //
analyzed: candra sannibha
translated: Holds a parasol resembling the moon for the one who defeats opponents.

original: saptaratanāmaya puna divyakusumāmaya dāmamaṇḍita /
analyzed: sapta ratana āmaya punar divya kusuma āmaya dāma maṇḍita
translated: Again, made of the seven precious substances, adorned with garlands of divine flowers,

original: chatra chatrārahasya maheśvaro dhāraye chatra //
analyzed: chatra chatrā rahasya mahā īśvaraḥ dhāraye chatra
translated: Maheshvara holds a parasol for the one who deserves a parasol.

original: ityeṣa surādhipena kāmāvacaro sagho sannipatito /
analyzed: iti eṣa surādhipena kāmāvacaraḥ saghaḥ sannipatitaḥ
translated: Thus, this assembly of gods from the desire realm, gathered by the lord of gods,

original: mahā abhu maheśvareṇa atulabaladharasya pūjārtha //
analyzed: mahā maheśvareṇa atula bala dharasya
translated: Was greatly honored by Maheshvara for the one who possesses incomparable strength.

original: bhagavatā yattakāni tāni cchatrāṇi tattakā buddhā nirmitā //
analyzed: bhagavatā yattakāni tāni chatrāṇi tattakāḥ buddhāḥ nirmitā
translated: As many parasols as there were, that many Buddhas were created by the Blessed One.

original: te anyamanyasya na paśyanti //
analyzed: te anyam anyasya na paśyanti
translated: They did not see each other.

original: teṣā pratyekapratyeka etadabhūṣi //
analyzed: teṣām pratyeka pratyekaḥ
translated: Each one of them thought:

original: mama yeva cchatre nātho tiṣṭhati sugato niṣṭhati dhvajo tiṣṭhati //
analyzed: mama yā iva chatre nātho tiṣṭhati sugataḥ niṣṭhati dhvajaḥ tiṣṭhati
translated: The Lord, the Sugata, stands only on my parasol, the banner stands.

original: devā ca manuṣyā ca yāva akaniṣṭhabhavana paśyanti buddhānubhāvena //
analyzed: devā ca manuṣyā ca paśyanti buddha anubhāvena
translated: The gods and humans, up to the Akaniṣṭha realm, see the Buddhas by the power of the Buddha.

original: atha bhagavā puruṣacandro tānabhinirmiṇe sabuddhānṛddhi /
analyzed: atha bhagavā puruṣacandraḥ tān abhinirmiṇe sa buddhān ṛddhi
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Moon among Men, emanates those Buddhas and their miracles.

original: bhagavā vidarśaye na ca anyamanyasya paśyanti //
analyzed: bhagavān vidarśaye na ca anyam anyasya paśyanti
translated: The Blessed One displays them, but they do not see each other.

original: akaniṣṭhabhavanagatā tu daśabalabuddhā ambara prasadaniya /
analyzed: akaniṣṭha bhavana gatā tu daśa bala buddhāḥ
translated: But the Buddhas with the ten powers, dwelling in the Akaniṣṭha realm, in the clear sky,

original: śobhenti gagaṇatalagatā yūpamiva yathā ratanacitra //
analyzed: śobhenti gagaṇa tala gatāḥ yūpam iva yathā ratana citra
translated: shine like a sacrificial post adorned with jewels.

original: sarve suvarṇavarṇā sarve dvātriśalakṣaṇasamagī /
analyzed: sarve suvarṇa varṇā sarve dvātriśa lakṣaṇa sama gī
translated: All are golden-colored, all are endowed with the thirty-two marks,

original: sarve kanakagirinibhāḥ sarveṣā śobhate prabhājāla /🔽sarve manāpākārāḥ sarveṣā śobhate prabhājāla /
analyzed: sarve kanaka giri nibhāḥ sarveṣām śobhate  sarve manāpākārāḥ sarveṣām śobhate
translated: all are like golden mountains, the net of light shines on all of them.🔽All are pleasing in appearance, the net of light shines on all of them.

original: sarve amitaguṇadharāḥ sarve prāmodyasajananāḥ //
analyzed: sarve amita guṇa dharāḥ sarve prāmodya sa jananāḥ
translated: All are bearers of immeasurable qualities, all generate great joy.

original: doṣṭvāna devamanujā gaganatala śobhanta daśabalehi /
analyzed: deva manujāḥ gagana tala śobhanta
translated: Having seen the sky adorned by the ten powers of the gods and humans,

original: atiriva udvalyaharṣā hāhākāra udīrensuḥ //🔽āsphoṭitaprakṣveḍitakalakalasamākulā abhivartanti /
analyzed: atiḥ iva udvalya harṣāḥ hāhākāraḥ  āsphoṭita prakṣveḍita kalakala samākulāḥ abhivartanti
translated: they become extremely joyful and shout out Hā Hā!🔽They rush about in a commotion of clapping and shouting,

original: mucensu ambaragatā varacūrṇarajākula surabhi //
analyzed: mucet su
translated: and from the sky they scatter fragrant and beautiful powders and dusts.

original: ta bhagavatastādṛśa buddhavikurvita ṛddhiprātihārya dṛṣṭvā atīva devā bhagavataḥ pūjā karensuḥ māndāravehi mahāmāndāravehi karkāravehi
analyzed: bhagavataḥ tādṛśa buddha vikurvita ṛddhi prātihārya dṛṣṭvā atīva devāḥ bhagavataḥ pūjā karensuḥ māndāravehi mahāmāndāravehi karkāravehi  /
translated: Having seen such a Buddha miracle and marvel of psychic power, the gods greatly honored the Blessed One with coral tree flowers, great coral tree flowers, karkārava flowers,

original: mahākarkāravehi rocamānehi mahārocamānehi bhīṣmehi mahābhīṣmehi samantagandhehi mahāsamantagandhehi pāriyātrakapuppehi suvarṇapuṣpehi rūpyapuṣpehi
analyzed: mahākarkāravehi rocamānehi mahārocamānehi bhīṣmehi mahābhīṣmehi samantagandhehi mahāsamantagandhehi pāriyātraka puppehi suvarṇa puṣpehi rūpya puṣpehi
translated: great karkārava flowers, rocamāna flowers, great rocamāna flowers, bhīṣma flowers, great bhīṣma flowers, samanta flowers, great samanta flowers, pāriyātraka flowers, golden flowers, silver flowers,

original: rajatapuṣpehi candanacūrṇehi agarucūrṇehi keśaracūrṇehi bhagavantamokirensu abhyokirensu samantātṣaṣṭi yojanā divyehi ca gandhacūrṇehi jānumātramogho
analyzed: rajata puṣpehi candana cūrṇehi agaru cūrṇehi keśara cūrṇehi bhagavantam okiren su abhyokiren su samantāt ṣaṣṭi yojanā divyehi ca gandha cūrṇehi
translated: sandalwood powder, agaru powder, and saffron powder. They scattered and offered them to the Blessed One, covering him all around for sixty yojanas with divine fragrant powders up to his knees.

original: savṛtto //
analyzed: sa vṛttaḥ
translated: It was so.

original: bhikṣū bhagavantamāhansuḥ /
analyzed: bhikṣū bhagavantam āhansuḥ
translated: The monks said to the Blessed One:

original: kimaya bhagavandevānubhāvo nāgānubhāvo yakṣānubhāvo yena imāni dāni cchatrasahasrāṇi devehi ca nāgehi ca rājānehi ca pragṛhītāni //
analyzed: kim aya bhagavan deva anubhāvaḥ nāga anubhāvaḥ yakṣa anubhāvaḥ yena imāni dāni chatra sahasrāṇi devehi ca nāgehi ca rājānehi ca pragṛhītāni
translated: What is this, Blessed One, the power of the gods, the power of the nāgas, or the power of the yakṣas, by which these thousands of parasols are held by the gods, nāgas, and kings?

original: bhagavānāha //
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: tathāgatasyaiṣa bhikṣavaḥ paurāṇasya kuśaladharmasya anubhāvo //
analyzed: tathāgatasya eṣa bhikṣavaḥ paurāṇasya kuśala dharmasya anubhāvaḥ
translated: Monks, this is the power of the Tathāgata's ancient wholesome qualities.

original: yadi tathāgato'nuttarā samyaksabodhimabhisabuddho na bhaviṣyati sasāre sasaranto bhagavanto yattakā etāni cchatrāṇi tattakāni cakravartirājyāni
analyzed: yadi tathāgataḥ unuttarā samyaksabodhim abhisabuddhaḥ na bhaviṣyati sa sāre sa sarantaḥ bhagavantaḥ yattakā etāni chatrāṇi tattakāni cakravarti rājyāni
translated: If the Tathagata had not fully awakened to supreme perfect enlightenment, he would have turned all those parasols into universal monarchies,

original: kārayiṣyet /
analyzed: kārayiṣyet
translated: while wandering in samsara with his retinue.

original: atha ca punastathāgatasya sarvapuṇyapāpakṣayato parinirvāṇa bhaviṣyat //
analyzed: atha ca punar tathāgatasya sarva puṇya pāpa kṣayataḥ parinirvāṇa bhaviṣyat
translated: But since the Tathagata's nirvana is due to the exhaustion of all merit and demerit,

original: bhagavāndāni āyuṣmanta vāgīśamāmantresi /
analyzed: āyuṣmanta vāgīśam āmantresi
translated: the Blessed One then addressed the Venerable Vagisha:

original: pratibhātu te vāgīśa tathāgatasya pūrvayogo /
analyzed: pratibhātu te vāgīśa tathāgatasya pūrva yogaḥ
translated: May it occur to you, Vagisha, to speak of the Tathagata's former union.

original: sādhu bhagavan āyuṣmā vāgīśo bhagavataḥ pratiśrutvā tāye velāye imā gāthā babhāṣe /
analyzed: sādhu bhagavan āyuṣmā vāgīśaḥ bhagavataḥ pratiśrutvā tāye velāye imāḥ gāthāḥ babhāṣe
translated: Very well, Blessed One, the Venerable Vagisha replied to the Blessed One, and on that occasion he spoke these verses:

original: abhūcchāstā atītasmi brāhmaṇo akutobhayo /
analyzed: abhūt śāstā atītasmi brāhmaṇaḥ akutobhayaḥ
translated: There was a teacher in the past, a brahmin who was fearless,

original: prahīṇajāti brāhmaṇo brahmacaryasmi kevalī //
analyzed: prahīṇa jāti brāhmaṇaḥ brahmacarī asmi kevalī
translated: a brahmin who had abandoned birth, a solitary one in the holy life.

original: satvā duḥkhitā dṛṣṭvāna duḥkhadharmasamarpitā /🔽dharmacakra pravartesi ābhā kāsi anuttarā //
analyzed: satvāḥ duḥkhitāḥ duḥkha dharma samarpitāḥ  dharmacakra pravartesi ābhā kā asi anuttarā
translated: Having seen beings suffering, afflicted by the nature of suffering,🔽he set the wheel of Dharma in motion, causing the unsurpassed radiance.

original: dharmacakra pravartitvā ābhā kṛtvā anuttarā /
analyzed: dharmacakra pravartitvā ābhā kṛtvā anuttarā
translated: Having set the wheel of Dharma in motion, having caused the unsurpassed radiance,

original: sabuddho parinirvāyet maharṣiḥ kṣīṇapunarbhavo /
analyzed: sa buddhaḥ parinirvāyet mahā ṛṣiḥ kṣīṇa punarbhavaḥ
translated: the Fully Enlightened One, the Great Sage, whose rebirth was exhausted, would have attained nirvana.

original: tasya stūpamakarensu śrāvakā akutobhayā /
analyzed: tasya śrāvakāḥ akutobhayāḥ
translated: His disciples, fearless, erected a stupa for him.

original: śaikṣā uttamā dāntāśca akarensu kīrtihetave //
analyzed: śaikṣāḥ uttamāḥ dāntāḥ ca kīrti hetave
translated: The best of learners, the self-controlled, erected it for the sake of fame.

original: kṣatriyabrāhmaṇavaiśyā pūjā kāsi maharṣiṇo /
analyzed: kṣatriya brāhmaṇa vaiśyā pūjā kā asi mahā ṛṣiṇaḥ
translated: The Kshatriyas, Brahmins, and Vaishyas made offerings to the great sage of Kashi.

original: nṛtyavāditragītena nānāmālyasamāgatā //
analyzed: nṛtya vāditra gītena nānā mālya samāgatā
translated: They came together with various garlands, dancing, music, and singing.

original: brāhmaṇo pi vicinteti pitā buddhasya paṇḍito /
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ pi vicinteti pitā buddhasya
translated: The wise father of the Buddha, the Brahmin, thought:

original: ya nūna chatra kāreya ratnākṛta śubhapāṇḍara //
analyzed: ya nūna chatra kāreya ratna ākṛta śubha pāṇḍara
translated: Why not make an umbrella, made of precious gems, pure and white?

original: vimala chatra stūpasmi adhiropiya sacite /
analyzed: vimala chatra stūpasmi adhiropiya sacite
translated: He placed the pure umbrella on the stupa, with a concentrated mind.

original: aśrūṇī ca pravartento pitā putramapūjayi //
analyzed: aśrūṇī ca pitā putram apūjayi
translated: Shedding tears, the father worshipped his son.

original: so ta karma karitvāna kalyāṇa buddhavarṇita /
analyzed: saḥ ta karma karitvāna kalyāṇa buddha varṇita
translated: Having done that wholesome deed praised by the Buddha,

original: brāhmaṇo akari kāla jātānāmeva dharmatā //
analyzed: dharma tā
translated: the Brahmin died, as is the nature of the born.

original: savartāñca vivartāñca aśītintena karmaṇā /
analyzed: savartān ca vivartān ca aśītintena karmaṇā
translated: By that deed, he went through all the cycles of existence, eighty times.

original: durgati nopalabhate etacchatrasya tatphala //
analyzed: durgati nā upalabhate etad chatrasya
translated: He did not experience any bad destinies - this is the fruit of that umbrella.

original: manuṣyeṣu tadā rājya dharmeṇa anuśāsaya /
analyzed: manuṣyeṣu tadā rājya dharmeṇa anuśāsaya
translated: Then, among humans, he ruled the kingdom righteously.

original: pṛthivyā cakravartyāsi vijitāvī mahābalo /
analyzed: pṛthivyā cakravartyā asi vijitāvī mahā balaḥ
translated: He was a powerful universal monarch, victorious and mighty.

original: citrā janapadā āsi anuyātrāsi kṣatriye /
analyzed: citrā janapadā āsi anuyātrā asi kṣatriye
translated: His diverse lands followed the Kshatriya.

original: tameva apacāyesi śvetacchatra dadatsukha //
analyzed: tam eva apacāyesi śveta chatra dadat sukha
translated: He honored him, giving him a white umbrella and happiness.

original: tato cāpi cyavitvāna deveṣu upapadyitha /🔽marūṇā pravaro āsi devakāyāna pūjito //
analyzed: tatas ca api cyavitvāna deveṣu upapadyitha  marūṇā pravaraḥ āsi deva kāyāna pūjitaḥ
translated: And having passed away from there, you were reborn among the gods.🔽You became the foremost of the Maruts, worshipped by the assembly of gods.

original: pūjito marusaghānāmaiśvaryakambalasthito /
analyzed: pūjitaḥ maru saghānām aiśvarya kambala sthitaḥ
translated: Honoured by the assembly of Maruts, you dwelt in the splendour of sovereignty.

original: vasantacāpi vartesi śvetacchatrasya tatphala //🔽devānāmuttamo āsi manuṣyāṇā pi uttamo /
analyzed: śveta chatrasya  devānām uttamaḥ āsi manuṣyāṇām pi uttamaḥ
translated: You also lived as a white-umbrella-bearer, that is the fruit of it.🔽You were the best of the gods and the best of humans.

original: sarvatra uttamo āsi devānā manujāna ca //
analyzed: sarvatra uttamaḥ āsi devānā manujāna ca
translated: Everywhere you were the best, among the gods and among humans.

original: devānāmuttamaḥ bhūtvā manuṣyāṇā ca uttamo /
analyzed: devānām uttamaḥ bhūtvā manuṣyāṇām ca uttamaḥ
translated: Having been the best of the gods and the best of humans,

original: ta bhavañca vijahitvāna āgatvā paścima bhava /
analyzed: te bhavañca vijahitvānaḥ āgatvā paścima bhava
translated: and having abandoned that existence, you came to your last existence.

original: sabuddho pi prajāyāsi ṛṣi kṣīṇapunarbhavo //
analyzed: sa buddhaḥ pi ṛṣi kṣīṇa punarbhavaḥ
translated: You became a fully enlightened one, a sage with no more rebirths.

original: so ta mārga vābhijñāye duḥkhapraśamagāmina /
analyzed: sa u ta mārga duḥkha praśama gāmina
translated: You recognized that path which leads to the cessation of suffering,

original: yasya mārgasya pratilābhā duḥkhasyānta karīyati //
analyzed: yasya mārgasya pratilābhā duḥkhasya anta
translated: by attaining which path the end of suffering is made.

original: ta cātra atītā buddhā ta ca vīro pratāpavā /
analyzed: ta ca atra atītā buddhā ta ca vīro pratāpavā
translated: And those Buddhas who have passed away, and those heroes who have attained glory,

original: sarve samaśīlaprajñā nāsti buddhāna antara //
analyzed: sarve sama śīla prajñā na asti buddhāna antara
translated: all have the same morality and wisdom, there is no difference among the Buddhas.

original: ye ca te hi kālekāle sabuddhā nātra saśaya /
analyzed: ye ca te hi kāle kāle sabuddhāḥ na atra
translated: And those fully enlightened ones who appear from time to time, there is no doubt about that.

original: sarve te sugati yānti ātmakarmaphalopagāḥ //
analyzed: sarve te sugati yānti ātma karma phala upagāḥ
translated: All of them go to a good destination, experiencing the fruits of their own actions.

original: cakṣumā brāhmaṇo āsi antevāsiśca te aha /
analyzed: cakṣumān brāhmaṇaḥ āsi antevāsiḥ ca te aha
translated: I was a sighted brahmin, and you were my pupil.

original: tvayāha codito vīra pūrvā jātimanusmaret //
analyzed: tvayā āha coditaḥ vīra pūrvā jātim anusmaret
translated: When urged by you, the hero remembers his past birth.

original: evameva etadāsi yathā bhāṣasi vāgīśa /
analyzed: evam eva etat āsi yathā bhāṣasi vāgīśa
translated: Just so is it, as you speak, O Lord of Speech,

original: brāhmaṇo ha tadā āsi antevāsī ca me bhava //
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ ha tadā āsi antevāsī ca me bhava
translated: I was then a brahmin, and you were my student.

original: mayā tva coditaḥ santo pūrvā jātimanusmaret /🔽tasmā dhvajapatākā ca śvetacchatra ca kārayet //
analyzed: mayā coditaḥ pūrvā jātim anusmaret  tasmai dhvaja patākā ca śveta chatra ca kārayet
translated: When urged by me, he remembered his past birth.🔽Therefore, one should make banners, flags, and white parasols,

original: vedikā caiva stūpeṣu kuryātpacāgulāni ca /
analyzed: vedikā ca eva stūpeṣu kuryāt paca agulāni ca
translated: And also altars at the stūpas, and offer balls of dough.

original: sādhu puṇyavara vipula dāyakamadhivartati //
analyzed: sādhu dāyakam adhivartati
translated: Excellent, O best of the meritorious, the giver of vast merit.

original: eṣā cānyā ca yā pūjā buddhamuddiśya kriyate /
analyzed: eṣā ca anyā ca yā pūjā buddham uddiśya kriyate
translated: This and any other worship done with the Buddha in mind,

original: sarvā abandhyā saphalā bhavati amṛtopagā //
analyzed: sarvā abandhyā saphalā bhavati amṛta upagā
translated: All of it is not fruitless, it becomes fruitful, leading to immortality.

original: na hi arcanā samā loke paśyāmi viśiṣṭatarā kuto /
analyzed: na hi arcanā samā loke paśyāmi viśiṣṭatarā kuto
translated: I do not see in the world an equal worship, let alone a superior one,

original: ya ca anya pūjayanto puṇya yāsi mahattara //
analyzed: ya ca anya pūjayantaḥ puṇya yāsi mahattara
translated: And those who worship others, they attain even greater merit.

original: kace kocimasmi lokasmi sarvā pi devatā sadā /
analyzed: sarvā devatā sadā
translated: In this world, whoever, even all the gods,

original: pūjeya sarvaratanaiḥ naiva se pratikṛta siyā //
analyzed: pūjeya sarva ratanaiḥ na eva se pratikṛta siyā
translated: Would worship with all jewels, it would not be a repayment.

original: eva mahāyaśā mahākāruṇikā anukampāhitāmitā /
analyzed: eva mahā yaśāḥ mahā kāruṇikā anukampā hitā amitā
