translated: This Siha the general was at that time and on that occasion the king.

original: anyo so brāhmaṇo bhavati /
analyzed: anyaḥ saḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhavati
translated: You should not think that the Brahmin was someone else.

original: eṣo tomaro lecchaviḥ //🔽anyo so hastināgo bhavati //
analyzed: eṣaḥ tomaraḥ lecchaviḥ  anyaḥ saḥ hasti nāgaḥ bhavati
translated: This Tomara the Licchavi.

original: na khalu punareva draṣṭavya //
analyzed: na khalu punar eva draṣṭavya
translated: You should not think that the elephant was someone else.

original: aha so tena kālena tena samayena rājño hastināgo abhūṣi //
analyzed: aha saḥ tena kālena tena samayena rājñaḥ hasti nāgaḥ
translated: At that time and on that occasion I was the king's elephant.

original: tadāpi maye hastināgabhūtena mithilāyā sarve amanuṣyakḥ palānāḥ /🔽etarahi pi maye vaiśālīye sīmāmākramantenaiva sarve amanuṣyakā palānāḥ //
analyzed: tadā api hasti nāga bhūtena mithilāyā sarve  etarahi vaiśālīye sīmām ākramantena eva sarve
translated: Then too, when I was an elephant, I drove all the non-human beings out of Mithilā.🔽Now too, when I entered the boundaries of Vaiśālī, I drove out all the non-human beings.

original: api tu vāsiṣṭhāho na etarahimeva maye sīmāmākramantenaiva sarve amanuṣyakāḥ palānāḥ /
analyzed: api tu vāsiṣṭha aho sīmām ākramantena eva sarve amanuṣyakāḥ
translated: Moreover, Vāsiṣṭhas, it is not only now that I drove out all the non-human beings by merely entering the boundaries,

original: anyadāpi ṛṣabhabhūtenasīmāmākramantenaiva sarve amanuṣyakāḥ palānāḥ //
analyzed: anyadā api sarve amanuṣyakāḥ palānāḥ
translated: but also in the past, when I was a bull, I drove out all the non-human beings by merely entering the boundaries.

original: bhūtapūrva vāsiṣṭhāho atītamadhvāna rājagṛhe nagare rājā rājya kārayati kṛtapuṇyo maheśākhyo susagṛhītaparijano dānasavibhāgaśīlo mahābalo
analyzed: bhūta pūrva rājagṛhe nagare rājā rājya kārayati kṛta puṇyaḥ su sagṛhīta parijanaḥ dāna savibhāga śīlaḥ mahā balaḥ
translated: In the past, Vāsiṣṭhas, in the city of Rājagṛha, a king ruled the kingdom. He was meritorious, powerful, had a well-controlled retinue, was generous, and had the habit of sharing. He was very powerful,

original: mahākośo mahābalavāhano /
analyzed: mahā kośaḥ
translated: had a great treasury, a great army, and great means of transportation.

original: tasya ta rājya ṛddha ca sphīta cakṣema casubhikṣa ca ākīrṇamanuṣyañca bahujanamanuṣya ca sukhitajanamanuṣya ca praśāntadaṇḍaḍamara
analyzed: tasya te rājya ṛddha ca sphīta ca kṣema ca subhikṣa ca ākīrṇa manuṣya ca bahu jana manuṣya ca sukhita jana manuṣya ca praśānta daṇḍa ḍamara
translated: His kingdom was prosperous, flourishing, peaceful, abundant in food, populous with many people, happy with many people, with the rod and weapons of violence laid down,

original: sunigṛhītataskara vyavahārasampanna //
analyzed: su nigṛhīta taskara vyavahāra sampanna
translated: well-controlled thieves, and prosperous with commerce.

original: tahi amanuṣyavyādi utpanno bahūni prāṇisahasrāṇi amanuṣyavyādhinā anayavyasanamāpadyanti //
analyzed: utpannaḥ bahūni prāṇi sahasrāṇi amanuṣya vyādhinā anaya vyasanam āpadyanti
translated: There a demon had arisen, and many thousands of people were being carried off by the demon.

original: aṅgarājño ca ṛṣabho abhūṣi prāsādiko darśanīyo kṛtapuṇyo maheśākhyo //
analyzed: aṅga rājñaḥ ca ṛṣabhaḥ prāsādikaḥ darśanīyaḥ kṛta puṇyaḥ maheśākhyaḥ
translated: Now the king of Aṅga had a bull which was handsome, beautiful, virtuous, and majestic.

original: tasya tejānubhāvena sarvamaṅgaviṣaya nirītika nirupadrava //
analyzed: tasya teja anubhāvena sarva maṅga viṣaya nirītika nirupadrava
translated: By its splendour and majesty the whole kingdom of Aṅga was free from calamity and distress.

original: rājagṛhakā brāhmaṇagṛhapatikā śṛṇvanti //
analyzed: śṛṇvanti
translated: The brāhmans and householders of Rājagṛha heard

original: aṅgarājño īdṛśo ṛṣabho prāsādiko darśanīyo kṛtapuṇyo maheśākhyo /
analyzed: ṛṣabhaḥ prāsādikaḥ darśanīyaḥ kṛta puṇyaḥ maheśākhyaḥ
translated: that the king of Aṅga had such a bull which was handsome, beautiful, virtuous, and majestic.

original: tasya tejānubhāvena sarvamagaviṣaya nirītika nirupadrava bhavati //
analyzed: tasya teja anubhāvena nirītika nirupadrava bhavati
translated: By its splendour and majesty the whole kingdom of Aṅga was free from calamity and distress.

original: tehi rājño ārocita //
analyzed: tehi rājñaḥ ārocita
translated: They reported this to the king, saying,

original: mahārāja śṛṇoma agarājño edṛśo ṛṣabho prāsādiko darśanīyo kṛtapuṇyo maheśākhyo mahānubhāvo /
analyzed: mahā rāja śṛṇoma edṛśaḥ ṛṣabhaḥ prāsādikaḥ darśanīyaḥ kṛta puṇyaḥ maheśākhyaḥ mahā anubhāvaḥ
translated: “Your majesty, we hear that the king of Aṅga has such a bull which is handsome, beautiful, virtuous, and majestic, and is of great power.

original: yasya grāmasya vā nagarasya vā sīmāmākramati ta nirītika nirupadrava bhavati //
analyzed: yasya grāmasya vā nagarasya vā sīmām ākramati ta nirītika nirupadrava bhavati
translated: Wherever the boundary of the village or town which it enters is reached, there calamity and distress cease.”

original: mahārāja ṛṣabha ānaya yathā tena ānītena rājagṛhe amanuṣyavyādhi praśamiṣyati //
analyzed: mahā rāja ṛṣabha ānaya yathā tena ānītena rājagṛhe amanuṣya vyādhi praśamiṣyati
translated: “Your majesty,” said they, “fetch the bull, so that when it has been brought to Rājagṛha the demoniac plague may be allayed.”

original: rājagṛhakena rājñā agarājño brāhmaṇo preṣito //
analyzed: rājagṛhakena rājñā aga rājñaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ preṣitaḥ
translated: The king of Rājagṛha sent a brāhman to the king of Aṅga, saying,

original: gaccha agarājña ima rājagṛhe ādīnava vedayitvā ta ṛṣabha yācāhīti //
analyzed: gaccha aga rājñaḥ ima rājagṛhe ādīnava vedayitvā te ṛṣabha yācāhi iti
translated: Go to the king of Aṅga, tell him of the calamity in Rājagṛha, and ask him for a bull.

original: so dāni rājño brāhmaṇo tatheti pratiśruṇitvā rājagṛhāto anupūrveṇa aṅgarājasya nagaramanuprāotaḥ //
analyzed: saḥ dāni rājñaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ tathā iti pratiśruṇitvā rājagṛhātaḥ anupūrveṇa aṅga rājasya nagaram anuprāotaḥ
translated: The brāhman of the king of Rājagṛha, saying, So be it, went from Rājagṛha and in due course reached the city of the king of Aṅga.

original: tena aṅgarājño upasakramitvā aṅgarājāna jayena vardhāpetvā eva rājagṛhakamamanuṣyavyādhi sarva vistareṇa ārocetvā ṛṣabha yācita //
analyzed: tena aṅga rājñaḥ upasakramitvā aṅga rājāna jayena eva rājagṛhakam amanuṣya vyādhi sarva vistareṇa ārocetvā ṛṣabha yācita
translated: He approached the king of Aṅga, congratulated him on his victory, told him in detail of the calamity of the men of Rājagṛha, and asked for a bull.

original: so pi ca rājā sakṛpo ca parānugrahapravṛtto ca //
analyzed: saḥ pi ca rājā ca ca
translated: And the king was compassionate and inclined to show favour to others.

original: tena ta rājagṛhakānā mahantamādīnava śrutvā so ṛṣabho tasya brāhmaṇasya dinnaḥ //
analyzed: tena te rājagṛhakānā mahantam ādīnava śrutvā saḥ ṛṣabhaḥ tasya brāhmaṇasya dinnaḥ
translated: When he heard of the great calamity of the men of Rājagṛha, he gave the brāhman the bull.

original: gaccha brāhmaṇa sukhī bhavantu rājagṛhakā manuṣyā sarve satvāśca //
analyzed: gaccha brāhmaṇa sukhī bhavantu sarve satvāḥ ca
translated: Go, said he to the brāhman, and let the men of Rājagṛha and all creatures be happy.

original: brāhmaṇo ta ṛṣabha gṛhya agaviṣayāto magadhaviṣayamāgacchati //
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ te ṛṣabha magadha viṣayam āgacchati
translated: The brāhman took the bull and left the territory of Aṅga and came to the territory of Magadha.

original: samanantara ca vāsiṣṭhāho ṛṣabheṇa rājagṛhasya sīmā ākrāntā sarve ca te amanuṣyakā palānā nirītiko ca nirupadravo rājagṛhasya janapado savṛtto
analyzed: samanantara ca vāsiṣṭha aho ṛṣabheṇa rājagṛhasya sīmā ākrāntā sarve ca te amanuṣyakā nirītikaḥ ca nirupadravaḥ rājagṛhasya janapadaḥ sa vṛttaḥ
translated: As soon as the bull had crossed the boundary of Rājagṛha, all those non-human beings fled, and the country of Rājagṛha became free from harm and calamity, and prosperous.

original: syādvo punareva vāsiṣṭhāho evamasyāsyādanyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena aganagare agarājā abhūṣi //
analyzed: syāt vaḥ punar eva vāsiṣṭha aho evam asya asyāt anyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena aga nagare aga rājā
translated: But, sons of Vasiṣṭha, it may be that you think that at that time and at that juncture, the king of Aṅga in the city of Aṅga was someone else.

original: na khalu punareva draṣṭavya //
analyzed: na khalu punar eva draṣṭavya
translated: You should not look at it in that way.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ //
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: eṣa vāsiṣṭhāho rājā śreṇiyo bimbisāro tena kālena tena samayena aṅgarājā abhūṣi //
analyzed: eṣa vāsiṣṭhāhaḥ rājā śreṇiyaḥ bimbisāro tena kālena tena samayena aṅga rājā
translated: Sons of Vasiṣṭha, this King Śreṇiya Bimbisāra was at that time and at that juncture the king of Aṅga.

original: anyo sa tena kālena tena samayena rājagṛhe rājā abhūṣi //
analyzed: sa tena kālena tena samayena rājagṛhe rājā
translated: You may think that at that time and at that juncture, the king in Rājagṛha was someone else.

original: na etadeva draṣṭavya //
analyzed: na etat eva draṣṭavya
translated: You should not look at it in that way.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ //
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: eṣa sihasenāpatiḥ //
analyzed: eṣa siha senāpatiḥ
translated: This was the general Siṃha.

original: anyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena rājagṛhako brāhmaṇo abhūṣi yena ta ṛṣabha ānīta //
analyzed: anyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena rājagṛhakaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ yena te ṛṣabhaḥ ānīta
translated: You may think that at that time and at that juncture, the brāhmaṇa in Rājagṛha by whom the bull was brought was someone else.

original: na etadeva draṣṭavya //
analyzed: na etat eva draṣṭavya
translated: You should not look at it in that way.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ //
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: eṣa vāsiṣṭhāho tomaro lecchavistena kālena tena samayena rājagṛhe brāhmaṇī abhūṣi yena ta aṅgarājño sakāśāto ṛṣabho rājagṛhamānīto //
analyzed: eṣa vāsiṣṭha aho tomaraḥ lecchaviḥ tena kālena tena samayena rājagṛhe brāhmaṇī yena te aṅga rājñaḥ sakāśāt ṛṣabhaḥ rājagṛham ānītaḥ
translated: “Vasiṣṭhas, that Tomara of the Licchavis was that brāhman of Rājagṛha.🔽

original: syātkhalu punarvo vāsiṣṭhāho evamasyāsyā anyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena sagarājño ṛṣabho abhūsi //
analyzed: syāt khalu punarvaḥ vāsiṣṭha aho evam asya asyāḥ anyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena saga rājñaḥ ṛṣabhaḥ abhūḥ
translated: “You may think, Vāsiṣṭhas, that at that time and on that occasion the brāhman woman of Rājagṛha, who brought the bull from the king of Aṅga to Rājagṛha, was somebody else.

original: na khalvetadeva draṣṭavya //
analyzed: na khalu etat eva draṣṭavya
translated: But you must not think so.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ //
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: And why?

original: aha so vāsiṣṭhāho tena kālena tena samayena agarājño ṛṣabho abhūṣi //
analyzed: aha saḥ vāsiṣṭha aho tena kālena tena samayena ṛṣabhaḥ
translated: I, Vāsiṣṭhas, was at that time and on that occasion the bull of the king of Aṅga.

original: tadāpi maye ṛṣabhabhūtena rājagṛhasya sīmāmākramantenaiva sarve amanuṣyakā palānā etarahi pi maye paramasabodhiprāptena vaiśālīya sīmāmākramantenaiva
analyzed: tadā api maye ṛṣabha bhūtena rājagṛhasya sīmām ākramantena eva sarve maye parama sabodhi prāptena vaiśālīya sīmām ākramantena eva
translated: Then, too, when I, as a bull, entered the confines of Rājagṛha, all the non-human beings fled. And now, too, when I, having attained perfect enlightenment, entered the confines of Vaiśālī,

original: sarve amanuṣyakā palānāḥ //
analyzed: sarve amanuṣyakā palānāḥ
translated: all the non-human beings fled.”

original: iti śrīmahāvastuavadāne ṛṣabhasya jātaka samāpta //🔽atha bhagavānanupūrveṇa vaiśālīmanuprāptaḥ //
analyzed: iti śrī mahāvastu avadāne ṛṣabhasya jātaka samāpta  atha bhagavān anupūrveṇa vaiśālīm anuprāptaḥ
translated: Here ends the Jātaka of the Bull in the Mahāvastu-Avadāna.🔽Then the Exalted One in due course reached Vaiśālī.

original: bhagavā dāni vaiśālīye sābhyantarabāhirāye svastyayana karoti /
analyzed: bhagavā dāni vaiśālīye sa abhyantara bāhirāye svastyayana karoti
translated: And there the Exalted One performed a rite of protection for the benefit of Vaiśālī, both as regards the inner and the outer.

original: svastyayanagāthā bhāṣati //
analyzed: svastyayana gāthāḥ bhāṣati
translated: He speaks the verses of the Svasti-ayana.

original: namo stu buddhāya namo stu bodhaye namo vimuktaya namo vimuktaye /
analyzed: namaḥ stu buddhāya namaḥ stu bodhaye namaḥ vimuktaye namaḥ vimuktaye
translated: Homage to the Buddha, homage to enlightenment, homage to liberation, homage to the liberated.

original: namo stu jñānasya namo stu jñānino lokāgraśreṣṭhāya namo karotha //
analyzed: namaḥ stu jñānasya namaḥ stu jñāninaḥ loka agra śreṣṭhāya namaḥ karotha
translated: Homage to knowledge, homage to the knower, to the best in the world, offer homage.

original: yānīha bhūtāni samāgatāni bhūmyāni vā yāni vāntarīkṣe /
analyzed: yāni iha bhūtāni samāgatāni bhūmyāni vā yāni vā antarīkṣe
translated: Whatever beings have assembled here, on the earth or in the sky,

original: sarvāṇi vā āttamanāni bhūtvā śṛṇvantu svastyayana jinena bhāṣita //
analyzed: sarvāṇi vā ātta manāni bhūtvā śṛṇvantu svastyayana jinena bhāṣita
translated: All of them, with uplifted minds, let them listen to the Svasti-ayana spoken by the Victor.

original: imasmi vā loke parasmi vā punaḥ svargeṣu vā ya ratana praṇīta /
analyzed: imasmi vā loke parasmi vā punar svargeṣu vā ya ratana praṇīta
translated: In this world or in the next, or in the heavens, whatever is most precious,

original: na ta sama asti tathāgatena devatidevena nrottamen /
analyzed: na ta sama asti tathāgatena
translated: There is none equal to the Tathagata, the god of gods, the best of men.

original: ima pi buddhe ratana praṇīta etena satyena susvasti bhotu manuṣyat bā amanuṣyato vā //
analyzed: ima pi buddhe ratana praṇīta etena satyena susvasti bhotu manuṣyat bā amanuṣyataḥ vā
translated: This is also the most precious jewel in the Buddha. By this truth, may you be well and safe, whether from humans or non-humans.

original: ida pi dharme ratana praṇīta etena satyena susvastibhotu manuṣyato vā amanuṣyato vā /
analyzed: idam pi dharme praṇīte etena satyena su svasti bhotu manuṣyataḥ vā amanuṣyataḥ vā
translated: This is also the most precious jewel in the Dharma. By this truth, may you be well and safe, whether from humans or non-humans.

original: ya buddhaśreṣṭho parivarṇaye śuci yamāhu ānantariya samādhi samādhino tasya samo na vidyate /
analyzed: buddha śreṣṭhaḥ parivarṇaye yam āhu tasya samaḥ na vidyate
translated: The best of Buddhas praises the pure one, whom they call the infinite samadhi. There is no equal to that samadhi.

original: ida pi dharme ratana praṇīta etena satyena susvasti bhotu manuṣyato vā amanuṣyato vā //
analyzed: idam pi dharme ratana praṇīte etena satyena su svasti bhotu manuṣyataḥ vā amanuṣyataḥ vā
translated: This is also the praise of the Dharma Jewel. By this truth may there be well-being from humans and non-humans!

original: ye pudgalā āṣṭa sadā praśastā catvāri etāni yugāni bhonti /
analyzed: ye pudgalāḥ āṣṭa sadā praśastā catvāri etāni yugāni bhonti
translated: Those persons who are always praised as the eight, these are the four pairs,

original: te dakṣiṇīyā sugatena uktāḥ etāni dinnāni mahatphalāni /
analyzed: te dakṣiṇīyā sugatena uktāḥ etāni dinnāni mahatphalāni
translated: They are said to be worthy of offerings by the Well-Gone One, these when given have great fruit.

original: ida pi saghe ratana praṇīta etena satyena susvasti bhotu manuṣyato vā amanuṣyato vā //
analyzed: idam pi saghe ratana praṇītaḥ etena satyena su svasti bhotu manuṣyataḥ vā amanuṣyataḥ vā
translated: This is also the praise of the Saṅgha Jewel. By this truth may there be well-being from humans and non-humans!

original: sarvaiva yasya darśanasapadāyo trayo sya dharmā jahitā bhavanti /
analyzed: sarvā eva yasya trayaḥ sya dharmāḥ jahitāḥ bhavanti
translated: Whoever has all these four qualities, the three of them abandon his dharmas:

original: satkāyadṛṣṭīvicikitsita ca śīlavrata cāpi yadasti kicit /
analyzed: ca śīla vrata ca api yat asti kicid
translated: The view of the body, doubt, and whatever morality and ritual he has.

original: ida pi saghe ratana praṇīta etena satyena susvasti bhotu manuṣyato vā amanuṣyato vā //
analyzed: idam pi saghe ratana praṇītaḥ etena satyena su svasti bhotu manuṣyataḥ vā amanuṣyataḥ vā
translated: This is also the praise of the Saṅgha Jewel. By this truth may there be well-being from humans and non-humans!

original: kicāpi śaikṣo prakaroti pāpa kāyena vācā atha cetasāpi /
analyzed: kica api śaikṣo prakaroti pāpa kāyena vācā atha cetasā api
translated: Even if a learner commits evil with the body, speech, or mind,

original: abhavyo so tasya nigūhanāya abhavyatā dṛṣṭapatheṣu uktā /
analyzed: abhavyaḥ saḥ tasya nigūhanāya abhavya tā dṛṣṭapatheṣu uktā
translated: He is not able to conceal it, inability is said to be in the path of seeing.

original: ida pi saghe ratana praṇīta etena satyena susvasti bhotu manuṣyato vā amanuṣyato vā //
analyzed: idam pi saghe ratana praṇītaḥ etena satyena su svasti bhotu manuṣyataḥ vā amanuṣyataḥ vā
translated: This is also the praise of the Saṅgha Jewel. By this truth may there be well-being from humans and non-humans!

original: yathendrakīlo pṛthivīsanniśrito syā caturbhi vātehi asaprakampi /
analyzed: yathā indrakīlo pṛthivī sanniśritaḥ syā caturbhi vātehi a saprakampi
translated: Just as a bolt fixed in the earth cannot be shaken by the four winds,

original: tathopama satpuruṣa vademi yo āryasatyāni sudeśitāni gambhīra arthāni avetya paśyati /
analyzed: tathā upama sat puruṣa vademi yaḥ ārya satyāni su deśitāni gambhīra arthāni avetya paśyati
translated: so I say, good man, is he who, having understood and seen the noble truths well-taught, of deep meaning.

original: ida pi saghe ratana praṇīta etena satyena susvasti bhotu manuṣyato vā amanuṣyato vā //
analyzed: idam pi saghe ratana praṇītaḥ etena satyena su svasti bhotu manuṣyataḥ vā amanuṣyataḥ vā
translated: This too, O host, is a jewel, a supreme jewel. By this truth may you be safe from men and from non-men.

original: ye āryasatyāni vibhavayanti gambhīraprajñena sudeśitāni /
analyzed: ye ārya satyāni vibhavayanti gambhīra prajñena su deśitāni
translated: Those who discern the noble truths well-taught, of deep meaning,

original: kicāpi te bhonti bhṛśa pramattā na te bhavā aṣṭa upādiyanti /
analyzed: kica api te bhonti bhṛśa pramattāḥ na te bhavāḥ aṣṭa upādiyanti
translated: even if they are greatly heedless, they do not take up the eight existences.

original: ida pi saghe ratana praṇīta etena satyena susvasti bhotu manuṣyato vā amanuṣyato vā //
analyzed: idam pi saghe ratana praṇītaḥ etena satyena su svasti bhotu manuṣyataḥ vā amanuṣyataḥ vā
translated: This too, O host, is a jewel, a supreme jewel. By this truth may you be safe from men and from non-men.

original: ye yuktayogī manasā succhandasā naiṣkramyiṇo gautamaśāsanasmi /
analyzed: ye yukta yogī manasā su chandasā naiṣkramyiṇaḥ
translated: Those who are rightly concentrated, with a well-disposed mind, who have gone forth in Gautama's teaching,

original: te prāptiprāptā amṛta vigāhya vimuktacittā nirvṛti bhujamānā /
analyzed: te prāpti prāptāḥ amṛta vigāhya vimukta cittāḥ nirvṛti
translated: having attained and entered the deathless, their minds liberated, they enjoy the bliss of peace.

original: ida pi saghe ratana praṇīta etena satyena susvasti bhotu manuṣyato vā amanuṣyato vā //
analyzed: idam pi saghe ratana praṇītaḥ etena satyena su svasti bhotu manuṣyataḥ vā amanuṣyataḥ vā
translated: This too, O host, is a jewel, a supreme jewel. By this truth may you be safe from men and from non-men.

original: kṣīṇa purāṇa navo nāsti sacayo vimuktā āyatike bhavasmi /
analyzed: kṣīṇa purāṇa navaḥ na asti sacayaḥ vimuktaḥ āyatike bhavasmi
translated: The old is destroyed, the new does not arise, there is no accumulation, they are liberated from future existence.

original: te kṣīabījā avirūḍhidharmā nirvānti dhīrā yatha tailadīpā /
analyzed: te a virūḍhi dharmāḥ nirvānti dhīrāḥ
translated: The wise ones, like an oil lamp, are extinguished, with the seed of existence destroyed, they have no nature to grow again.

original: ida pi saghe ratana praṇīta etena satyena susvasti bhotu manuṣyato vā amanuṣyato vā //
analyzed: idam pi saghe ratana praṇītaḥ etena satyena su svasti bhotu manuṣyataḥ vā amanuṣyataḥ vā
translated: This is also praised as the jewel of the Saṅgha. By this truth, may you be safe from humans and non-humans!

original: agniryathā prajvalito niṣīde indhanakṣayā śāmyati vegajāto /
analyzed: agniḥ yathā prajvalitaḥ niṣīde indhana kṣayā śāmyati
translated: Just as a blazing fire goes out when the fuel is exhausted, one who is born with force is pacified.

original: evavidha dhyāyino buddhaputrāḥ prajñāya rāgānuśaya grahetvā adarśana mṛtyurājasya yānti /
analyzed: evavidha dhyāyinaḥ buddha putrāḥ adarśana mṛtyu rājasya yānti
translated: In the same way, the Buddha's sons who meditate, having taken up the latent tendency of passion with wisdom, go unseen by the king of death.

original: ida pi saghe ratana praṇīta manuṣyato vā amanuṣyato vā //
analyzed: idam pi saghe ratana praṇīta manuṣyataḥ vā amanuṣyataḥ vā
translated: This is also praised as the jewel of the Saṅgha, from humans and non-humans!

original: grīṣmāṇamāse prathame caitrasmi vane pragulmā yatha puṣpitāgrā vāteritā te surabhi pravānti /
analyzed: grīṣmāṇamāse prathame vane puṣpita agrāḥ vāta īritā te surabhi
translated: In the first month of summer, in the month of Caitra, the forest trees with their tips in full bloom, shaken by the wind, spread a sweet fragrance.

original: evavidha dhyāyino buddhaputrāḥ śīlenupetā surabhi pravānti /
analyzed: dhyāyinaḥ buddha putrāḥ surabhi pravānti
translated: In the same way, the Buddha's sons who meditate, endowed with morality, spread a sweet fragrance.

original: ida pi saghe ratana praṇīta etena satyena susvasti bhotu manuṣyato vā amanuṣyato vā //
analyzed: idam pi saghe ratana praṇītaḥ etena satyena su svasti bhotu manuṣyataḥ vā amanuṣyataḥ vā
translated: This is also praised as the jewel of the Saṅgha. By this truth, may you be safe from humans and non-humans!

original: yānīha bhūtāni samāgatāni bhūmyāni vā yāni va antarīkṣe /
analyzed: yāni iha bhūtāni samāgatāni bhūmyāni vā yāni vaḥ antarīkṣe
translated: Whatever beings have assembled here, on the earth or in the atmosphere,

original: maitrīkarontu sada manuṣyakā prajā diva ca rātri ca haranti vo bali //
analyzed: maitrīkarontu sada manuṣyakā prajāḥ ca rātri ca haranti vaḥ bali
translated: May they always be friendly towards human beings. Day and night, they carry your offerings.

original: tasmāddhi ta rakṣatha apramattā mātā va putra anukampamānā /
analyzed: tasmāt hi ta rakṣatha apramattāḥ mātā va putra anukampamānā
translated: Therefore, protect them with mindfulness, like a mother her child with compassion.

original: etena satyena susvasti bhotu manuṣyato vā amanuṣyato vā //
analyzed: etena satyena su svasti bhotu manuṣyataḥ vā amanuṣyataḥ vā
translated: By this truth, may there be well-being, from humans or non-humans.

original: vipaśyismi viśvabhuvi krakucchande bhāmakanakamunismi kāśyape mahāyaśe śākyamunismi gautame /
analyzed: vipaśyismi viśva bhuvi krakucchande bhāma kanakamunismi kāśyape mahā yaśe śākyamunismi gautame
translated: In Vipaśyin, in Viśvabhū, in Krakucchanda, in Kanakamuni, in Kāśyapa of great fame, in Śākyamuni Gautama,

original: etehi buddhehi maharddhikehi yā devatā santi abhiprasannā /
analyzed: etehi buddhehi maharddhikehi yāḥ devatā santi abhiprasannā
translated: In these Buddhas of great power, whatever deities are devoted,

original: vāḍha pi ta rakṣayantu ca karontu svastyayana mānuṣikaprajāye //
analyzed: vāḍha pi ta rakṣayantu ca karontu svastyayana mānuṣikaprajāye
translated: May they protect and carry out the welfare of the human race.

original: tasmā hi ta rakṣatha apramattā mātā va putra anukampamānā /
analyzed: tasmā hi ta rakṣatha apramattā mātā va putra anukampamānā
translated: Therefore, protect them with mindfulness, like a mother her child with compassion.

original: eta pi saghe ratana praṇita etena satyena susvasti bhotu manuṣyato vā amanuṣyato vā //
analyzed: eta pi saghe ratana praṇitaḥ etena satyena su svasti bhotu manuṣyataḥ vā amanuṣyataḥ vā
translated: By this truth, may there be well-being, from humans or non-humans.

original: yo dharmacakra abhibhūya loka pravartayati sarvabhūtanukampita /
analyzed: yaḥ dharma cakra abhibhūya loka pravartayati sarva bhū tanukampita
translated: He who, having conquered the world, sets in motion the wheel of Dharma, out of compassion for all beings,

original: etādṛśa devamanuṣyaśreṣṭha buddha namasyāmi susvasti bhotu /
analyzed: etādṛśa deva manuṣya śreṣṭha buddha namasyāmi su svasti bhotu
translated: To such a one, the best among gods and humans, I pay homage, O Buddha! May there be well-being!

original: dharma namasyāmi susvasti bhotu sagha namasyāmi susvasti bhotu manuṣyato vā amanuṣyato vā //
analyzed: dharma namasyāmi su svasti bhotu sagha namasyāmi su svasti bhotu manuṣyataḥ vā amanuṣyataḥ vā
translated: I pay homage to the Dharma, may there be well-being! I pay homage to the Saṅgha, may there be well-being, whether from humans or non-humans.

original: gośṛgīye buddhapramukhe bhikṣusaghe bhakta kṛtvā śālavana niryātita /
analyzed: gośṛgīye buddha pramukhe bhikṣu saghe bhakta kṛtvā śāla vana niryātita
translated: After the cowherd had made an offering to the Buddha and the Saṅgha of monks headed by the Buddha, he offered them the Śāla forest.

original: lecchavonāmetadabhūṣi //
analyzed: lecchavaḥ etat abhūṣi
translated: The Licchavis thought this:

original: pratibalo asmākamekako bhagavanta saśrāvakasagha yāvajjīvamupasthihita cīvarapiṇḍapātraśayanāsanaglānapratyayabhaiṣajyapariṣkārehi //
analyzed: pratibalaḥ asmākam ekakaḥ bhagavanta sa śrāvaka sagha yāvajjīvam upasthihita cīvara piṇḍa pātra śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkārehi
translated: We are able to provide for the Blessed One and his community of disciples for as long as we live with robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicines for the sick.

original: api tu tathā kriyatu yathā mahājano puṇyena sayujyeyā //
analyzed: api tu tathā kriyatu yathā mahājano puṇyena sayujyeyā
translated: But let us do it in such a way that the great multitude will be joined in merit.

original: manuṣyataṇḍulo ohārīyatu //
analyzed: manuṣya taṇḍulaḥ ohārīyatu
translated: Let human rice be brought!

original: tehi manuṣyataṇḍulo ohārito pacaviśamuttara vā taṇḍulajātā //
analyzed: manuṣya taṇḍulaḥ ohāritaḥ vā taṇḍula jātā
translated: They brought human rice, which was cooked in five hundred cauldrons and was more than enough.

original: eva tehi bhagavā saśrāvakasagho saptāhamupasthito //
analyzed: eva bhagavā sa śrāvaka saghaḥ saptāham upasthitaḥ
translated: In this way, they provided for the Blessed One and his community of disciples for seven days.

original: śirimanta maheśākhya varnavanta yaśasvina /
analyzed: śirimanta maheśākhya varnavanta yaśasvina
translated: The glorious, greatly powerful, beautiful, and famous,

original: sabudh paryupāsanti candra tārāgaṇā yathā /
analyzed: sa budh paryupāsanti candra tārā gaṇāḥ yathā
translated: the fully enlightened ones, are attended upon by the assembly of monks, just as the moon is by the multitude of stars.

original: pītālakāravasanāḥ karṇikārā va puṣpitā /
analyzed: pīta alakāra vasanāḥ puṣpitāḥ
translated: Wearing yellow ornaments and garments, like karnikara flowers in bloom,

original: sabuddha paryupāsanti ghanakeyūradhāriṇaḥ /
analyzed: sa buddha paryupāsanti ghana keyūra dhāriṇaḥ
translated: They attend upon the Buddhas, wearing solid bracelets.

original: haricandanaliptāgā kāśikottamadhāriṇaḥ / ///
translated: Anointed with yellow sandalwood paste, wearing the finest silk garments,

original: tā devasaghā pariṣā samāgaā śuci sujātā śatapuṇyalakṣaṇā /
analyzed: tā deva saghā pariṣā samāgaā śuci su jātā śata puṇya lakṣaṇā
translated: That assembly of gods has gathered, pure, well-born, with the marks of a hundred merits.

original: sarveṇa buddho abhibhoti tejasā nakṣatrarājā iva tārakāṇā //
analyzed: sarveṇa buddhaḥ abhibhoti tejasā nakṣatra rājā iva tārakāṇā
translated: The Buddha outshines them all with his splendor, like the king of stars outshines the other stars.

original: candro yathā vigatavalāhake nabhe abhirocate tāragaṇā prabhākaro /
analyzed: candraḥ yathā vigata valāhake nabhe abhirocate
translated: Just as the moon in a cloudless sky shines forth, illuminating the host of stars,

original: eva himā kṣatriyabhūmipālā sarveṇa buddho abhibhoti jejasā //
analyzed: eva himā kṣatriya bhūmi pālā sarveṇa buddhaḥ jejasā
translated: So the Buddha outshines all the Kshatriyas and lords of the earth with his splendor.

translated: “It is almost noon.

original: jānāmi tāva ki imena pravrajitena bhaikṣa labdhamiti //
analyzed: jānāmi tāva ki imena pravrajitena bhaikṣa labdham iti
translated: I know that this renunciant has obtained alms.

original: grāmikaḥ pratyakabuddhamupasakramya pṛcchati //
analyzed: grāmikaḥ pratyakabuddham upasakramya pṛcchati
translated: The village headman approached the Pratyekabuddha and asked:

original: ārya labdha bhaikṣa ti //
analyzed: ārya labdha bhaikṣa ti
translated: Noble one, have you obtained alms?

original: pratyekabuddho tūṣṇīkaśobhano tucchaka pātra grāmikasya darśayati //
analyzed: pratyekabuddhaḥ tūṣṇīka śobhanaḥ tucchaka pātra grāmikasya darśayati
translated: The Pratyekabuddha, being one who shines in silence, showed the empty bowl to the village headman.

original: grāmiko pratyekabuddhasya tucchaka pātra dṛṣṭvā namāha //
analyzed: grāmikaḥ pratyekabuddhasya tucchaka pātra dṛṣṭvā
translated: When the village headman saw the Pratyekabuddha's empty bowl, he said:

original: yāvadasavibhāgaśīlo jano yatra nāma evarūpo dakṣiṇīyo eva mahantāto grāmāto yathādhautena pātreṇa nirdhāvati ime ki uddīpaya paribhujanti
analyzed: yāvat asavibhāga śīlaḥ janaḥ yatra nāma evarūpaḥ eva mahantātaḥ grāmātaḥ yathā dhautena pātreṇa nirdhāvati ime ki uddīpaya paribhujanti
translated: As long as people are of such a divided nature, that even such a worthy recipient leaves this large village with a bowl washed clean, what will they do when they have obtained food?

original: so āha //
analyzed: sā u āha
translated: He said:

original: bhagava āgaccha aha te āhāra dāsyāmi //
analyzed: bhagava āgaccha aha te āhāra dāsyāmi
translated: Come, Blessed One, I will give you food.

original: so ta pratyekabuddha gṛhītvā ta grāma praviṣṭo //
analyzed: saḥ ta pratyekabuddha gṛhītvā ta grāma praviṣṭaḥ
translated: That Pratyekabuddha took him and entered the village.

original: so catuḥmahāpathe sthitvā avidhāvidhāti krandati //
analyzed: saḥ catur mahāpathe sthitvā avidhāvidhāti krandati
translated: He stood in the middle of the crossroads and cried out Avi! Avi!

original: avasthitagrāmikasya avidhāvidhanti śabda śrutvā sastrīmanuṣyo grāmo sannipatitaḥ //
analyzed: avasthita grāmikasya śabda śrutvā sa strī manuṣyaḥ sannipatitaḥ
translated: When the sound of Avi! Avi! was heard by the village headman who was standing there, the entire village, with its women and men, gathered.

original: grāmikasya upasakramitvā pṛcchanti //
analyzed: grāmikasya upasakramitvā pṛcchanti
translated: They approached the village headman and asked:

original: ki kṣema ki avidhāvidha ti krandasi //
analyzed: ki kṣema ki avidhāvidha ti krandasi
translated: Is everything well? Why are you crying out 'Avi! Avi!'?

original: grāmika āha //
analyzed: grāmikaḥ āha
translated: The village overseer said:

original: krandāmi yenaite na savibhāgaratā na savibhāgaśīlāḥ yatra nāma eva mahantāto grāmāto eko bhikṣu yathādhautena pātreṇa nirdhāvati //
analyzed: krandāmi yena ete na savibhāga ratāḥ na savibhāga śīlāḥ yatra nāma eva grāmātaḥ ekaḥ bhikṣu yathā dhautena pātreṇa nirdhāvati
translated: I am crying because they are not devoted to sharing, they are not in the habit of sharing, that in such a great village not a single monk goes out with a bowl washed clean.

original: te dāni grāme mahallakā tasya grāmikasya śrutvā ta pratyekabuddha satkartavya manyensu //
analyzed: te dāni grāme mahallakā tasya grāmikasya śrutvā ta pratyekabuddha satkartavya manyensu
translated: Then the elders of the village, having heard the village overseer, thought that the Pratyekabuddha should be honoured.

original: grāmikena pratyekabuddha gṛha praveśetvā āhāreṇa pratimānetvā yāvajjīvamupanimantrito //
analyzed: grāmikena pratyekabuddha gṛha praveśetvā āhāreṇa pratimānetvā yāvajjīvam upanimantritaḥ
translated: The village overseer brought the Pratyekabuddha into his house, served him with food, and invited him to stay as long as he lived.

original: ahamāryasya nimantremi yāvajjīva sarvasukhopadhānena //
analyzed: aham āryasya nimantremi yāvat jīva sarva sukha upadhānena
translated: I invite you, Noble Sir, to stay as long as you live, providing all the requisites for happiness.

original: svayadhītā saveditā //
analyzed: svaya dhītā sa veditā
translated: My own daughter, who is known to you.

original: evantuva ārya ta divasamāhāreṇa upasthihisi //
analyzed: ārya ta divasamāhāreṇa upasthihisi
translated: In this way, Noble Sir, you will be attended to with a daily meal.

original: dārikā prītā tuṣṭā savṛttā //
analyzed: dārikā prītā tuṣṭā sa vṛttā
translated: The girl was delighted, pleased, and behaved well.

original: śobhana me kalyāṇa karma sevita //
analyzed: śobhana me kalyāṇa karma sevita
translated: It is good, a wholesome deed has been done.

original: sā dāni ta pratyekabuddha divasamāhāreṇa upasthihati prāsādikābhiprasannadevamanuṣyā //
analyzed: sā dāni te pratyekabuddha divasa āhāreṇa upasthihati prāsādika abhiprasanna deva manuṣyā
translated: And she attended on the Pratyekabuddha with a daily meal, pleasing gods and humans with her beauty.

original: pratyakabuddho parijñātabhojano sarvāśuciparikṣīṇo mahābhāgo //
analyzed: pratyakabuddhaḥ parijñāta bhojanaḥ sarva aśuci parikṣīṇaḥ mahābhāgaḥ
translated: The Pratyekabuddha, having recognized the food, was completely free from impurities, and was greatly fortunate.

original: tasya dāni grāmikasya dhītuḥ tā pratyekabuddhasya īryā paśyitvā udāra pasāda jāta /
analyzed: tasya dāni grāmikasya dhītuḥ tā pratyekabuddhasya īryā paśyitvā udāra pasāda jāta
translated: The daughter of the village overseer, seeing the deportment of the Pratyekabuddha, was filled with great joy.

original: tathā anye pi janā prasanna //🔽so dāni pratyekabuddho tasya grāmikasya prasādena tatraiva grāmakṣetre anupādāya parinirvṛto //
analyzed: tathā anye pi janā prasanna  saḥ dāni pratyekabuddhaḥ tasya grāmikasya prasādena tatra eva grāma kṣetre an upādāya parinirvṛtaḥ
translated: And other people were also filled with joy.🔽And that Pratyekabuddha, through the faith of the village overseer, attained final Nirvana in that very village field without clinging to anything.

original: tato grāmikena ta pratyekabuddha dhyāyetvā stūpa kṛta na cātikhuḍḍāka na cātimahanta sudhāmṛttikālepana //
analyzed: tatas grāmikena ta pratyekabuddha dhyāyetvā stūpa kṛta na ca ati khuḍḍāka na ca ati mahanta sudhā mṛttikā lepana
translated: Then the village overseer, having cremated the Pratyekabuddha, built a stupa for him, not too small and not too large, plastered with a mixture of clay and oil-cake.

original: sā dāni grāmikasya dhītā ta stūpa daivasika kāsyapātreṇa pūjeti gandhena mālyena ca dhūpena ca //
analyzed: sā dāni grāmikasya dhītā te stūpa daivasika kāsya pātreṇa pūjā iti gandhena mālyena ca dhūpena ca
translated: And the daughter of the village overseer worshipped that stupa daily with a bowl of incense, with garlands, and with incense.

original: paścāttato stūpāto ta nānāprakāra mālya vātena apakarṣīyate //
analyzed: nānāprakāra mālya vātena
translated: Afterwards, the garlands were carried away from the stupa by the wind in various directions.

original: tāye dāni ta mālya sakaḍitvā ceṭīhi sārdha dīrghamālāguḍikā nicitopacitā nānāpuṣpāṇā //
analyzed: dāni ta mālya ceṭīhi sārdha dīrgha mālā guḍikā nicita upacitā nānā puṣpāṇā
translated: Then she, having woven those garlands together with her maids, made a long garland of various flowers.

original: tatra tāye mālāye ta pratyekabuddhasya stupa sarva pariveṭhita ///
analyzed: tatra tāye mālāye ta pratyekabuddhasya stupa sarva pariveṭhita
translated: And with that garland she completely surrounded the stupa of the Pratyekabuddha.

original: tasyā tā mālā tahi stūpe sthitā ca mālā ca sarvā rūpeṇa ca tejena ca abhibhavitvā tiṣṭhantī deveṣu divyamāyuḥpramāṇa kṣapetvā śobhantī
analyzed: tasyā tā mālā stūpe sthitā ca mālā ca sarvā rūpeṇa ca tejena ca abhibhavitvā tiṣṭhantī deveṣu śobhantī  /
translated: That garland of hers, which was on that stūpa, outshone all the other garlands in beauty and splendour. It remained there for a divine life-span, shining.

original: dṛṣṭvā atiriva cittaprasādamutpanna //
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā atiḥ iva
translated: And when she saw it, she became exceedingly serene of heart.

original: sā dāni prasannacittā praṇi dhānamutpādeti //
analyzed: sā dāni prasanna cittā praṇi dhānam utpāda iti
translated: And she made a vow, saying:

original: yādṛśeṣā mālā atra stūpe śobhati etādṛśā me mālā mūrdhni prādurbhaveyā yatrayatra upapadyeya //
analyzed: yādṛśā īṣā mālā atra stūpe śobhati etādṛśā me mālā mūrdhni prādurbhaveyāḥ yatra yatra upapadyeya
translated: “As this garland shines on this stūpa, so may a garland appear on my head wherever I am reborn.”

original: sā dāni ta kalyāṇa karma kṛtvā tatra cyavitvā deveṣūpapannā ratanamālāye ābaddhā tasyā tahi upapannāye apsarasā śatasahasra parivāresi
analyzed: sā dāni ta kalyāṇa karma kṛtvā tatra cyavitvā deveṣu upapannā ābaddhā tasyāḥ tahi upapannāye apsarasā śata sahasra
translated: And she, having done this good deed, passed away thence and was reborn among the devas, wearing a garland of jewels. She was attended by a hundred thousand celestial nymphs.

original: tato pi cyutā vārāṇasīya kṛkisya rājño agramahiṣīye kukṣismi upapannā //
analyzed: tatas pi cyutā vārāṇasīya kṛkisya rājñaḥ agramahiṣīye kukṣismi upapannā
translated: And when she passed away thence, she was conceived in the womb of the chief queen of King Kṛkī of Benares.

original: navānā vā daśānā vā māsānāmatyayena devīye dārikā prajātā prāsādikā darśanīyā ratanamālāye ābaddhā /
analyzed: navānām vā daśānām vā māsānām atyayena devīye dārikā prajātā prāsādikā darśanīyā ābaddhā
translated: And after nine or ten months the queen gave birth to a daughter who was lovely and beautiful, and who was wearing a garland of jewels.

original: tasyā mālinīti nāma kṛta //
analyzed: tasyāḥ mālinī iti nāma kṛta
translated: And she was named Mālinī.

original: rājño kṛkisya priyā manapā tathā sarvasya parijanasya sammatā sarvasyādhiṣṭhānasya yāvatkṛtapuṇyā dārikā //
analyzed: rājñaḥ kṛkisya priyā manapā tathā sarvasya parijanasya sammatā sarvasya adhiṣṭhānasya yāvat kṛta puṇyā dārikā
translated: The king Kṛkī's beloved wife, dear to the whole retinue, and dear to the whole kingdom, was a girl who had made merit.

original: pratiyekabuddho grāma puṇḍāya upasakrame /
analyzed: pratiyekabuddhaḥ grāma puṇḍāya upasakrame
translated: A Pratyekabuddha came to the village of Puṇḍra.

original: yathādhautena pātreṇa tato grāmāto niṣkramet //
analyzed: yathā dhautena pātreṇa tatas grāmātaḥ niṣkramet
translated: He went out from the village with his bowl washed,

original: tamena grāmiko dṛṭvā sabuddhamidamabravīt /
analyzed: tam enaḥ grāmikaḥ dṛṭvā sabuddham idam abravīt
translated: and the village overseer, seeing him, said this to the Pratyekabuddha:

original: kiñci arogo bhagavā labhyate piṇḍayāpana //
analyzed: arogaḥ bhagavā labhyate
translated: Are you well, Blessed One? Can you get alms?

original: tato sya bhagavanpātra grāmikasya praṇāmaye /
analyzed: tatas sya bhagavan pātra grāmikasya praṇāmaye
translated: Then the Blessed One offered his bowl to the overseer,

original: na cātra adarśī bhikṣā daurmanasya grāmikasyabhūt //
analyzed: na ca atra adarśī bhikṣā daurmanasya grāmikasya abhūt
translated: and the overseer did not see any alms there, and became displeased.

original: andhabhūto aya loko mithyādṛṣṭihato sadā /
analyzed: andha bhūtaḥ lokaḥ mithyādṛṣṭi hataḥ sadā
translated: This world is blind, always struck down by wrong views,

original: etādṛśa dakṣiṇīya na pūjenti yathāraha //
analyzed: etādṛśa dakṣiṇīya na pūjenti yathāraha
translated: and does not make offerings to such a worthy one as is fitting.

original: grāmānta upasakramya sthihitvāna catuṣpathe /
analyzed: grāma ante upasakramya catuṣpathe
translated: Having gone to the end of the village and stood at the crossroads,

original: avidhāvidha ti krandati tato sannipate janāḥ //
analyzed: avidhāvidha ti krandati janāḥ
translated: Avi! Avi! he cried out, and people gathered.

original: mahājano samāgatvā istriyo puruṣā pi ca /
analyzed: mahā janaḥ samāgatvā istriyaḥ puruṣā pi ca
translated: When the great crowd had gathered, both women and men,

original: grāmika upasakramya ki karoma avidhāvidha ti //
analyzed: grāmika upasakramya ki karoma avidhāvidha ti
translated: they approached the overseer and said, What is to be done? Avi! Avi!

original: grāmiko āha //
analyzed: grāmikaḥ āha
translated: The overseer said:

original: ya nūna koṭi yuṣmāka na savibhāgarato jano /
analyzed: ya nūna na savibhāga rataḥ
translated: But now, who among you is not devoted to the practice of non-discrimination?

original: eṣo hi etasmi grāmasmi eko bhikṣu vihanyati //
analyzed: eṣaḥ hi etasmi ekaḥ bhikṣu vihanyati
translated: For in this very village, a single monk is being harmed.

original: grāmikasya vacana śrutvā sarve grāmo saistriyo /
analyzed: grāmikasya vacana śrutvā sarve
translated: Having heard the words of the village headman, all the people of the village, both men and women,

original: sārāyaṇīya karensu sabuddhasya punaḥ punaḥ //
analyzed: sabuddhasya punar punar
translated: Repeatedly made offerings to the Fully Enlightened One.

original: tamena grāmiko vaca sabhāryāo saputrako /
analyzed: tam ena grāmikaḥ sa bhāryāḥ sa putrakaḥ
translated: The village headman, with his wife and son,

original: sarvasukhavihāreṇa nimantremi tathāgata //
analyzed: sarva sukha vihāreṇa nimantremi tathāgata
translated: Invited the Thus-Gone One to dwell in all forms of happiness.

original: grāmikasya svakā dhītā śucivastrā suvāsanā /
analyzed: grāmikasya svakā dhītā śuci vastrā su vāsanā
translated: The village headman's own daughter, wearing clean clothes and well-adorned,

original: ācāraguṇasampannā upasthīya tathāgata //
analyzed: ācāra guṇa sampannāḥ upasthīya tathāgata
translated: Attended to the Thus-Gone One with the qualities of proper conduct.

original: grāmikasya prasādena tasmi grāmasmi suvrato /
analyzed: grāmikasya prasādena
translated: Through the faith of the village headman, in that village, the one of good vows,

original: sabuddho parinirvāyi ṛṣi kṣīṇapunarbhavaḥ //
analyzed: sa buddhaḥ parinirvāyi ṛṣi kṣīṇa punarbhavaḥ
translated: The Sage, the Buddha, attained final Nirvāṇa, with no further return to existence.

original: ta nirvṛta dhyāyetvāna stūpa kāresi grāmiko /
analyzed: ta nirvṛta stūpa kāresi grāmikaḥ
translated: Having attained Nirvāṇa, the village headman erected a stūpa,

original: nṛtyavāditagītena pūjā kāresi maharṣiṇo //
analyzed: nṛtya vādita gītena pūjā kāresi mahā ṛṣiṇaḥ
translated: And made offerings to the Great Sage with dancing, music, and singing.

original: samāsādya sita puṣpa vātena apakarṣita /
analyzed: samāsādya sita puṣpa vātena apakarṣita
translated: Having collected white flowers, he fanned them with a breeze,

original: ekādhya saharitvāna dīrghamālā vagūhayet //🔽sā yādṛśī tatraiva mahya mālā citrā upaniśritā /
analyzed: dīrghamālāḥ avagūhayet  sā yādṛśī tatra eva mālā citrā upaniśritā
translated: And having made them into a single heap, he wrapped them in a long garland.🔽Just as this colorful garland is placed right here for me,

original: etādṛśī me śirasi bhotu mālā yathā aya //
analyzed: etādṛśī me śirasi bhotu mālā yathā
translated: May such a garland be on my head, just as it is.

original: yatrayatropapadyeha tatrameta samṛdhyatu //
analyzed: yatra yatra upapadya iha tatram eta samṛdhyatu
translated: Wherever I am reborn, may this be accomplished for me.

original: sā ta karma karitvāna kalyāṇa buddhavarṇita /
analyzed: sā ta karma karitvāna kalyāṇa buddha varṇita
translated: Having performed that wholesome action praised by the Buddha,

original: trāyastriśeṣu deveṣu upapadyitha apsarā //
analyzed: trāyastriśeṣu deveṣu upapadyitha apsarā
translated: She was reborn among the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three as an apsara.

original: apsarāśatasahasra ca puraskṛtvāna tā sthitā /
analyzed: ca tā sthitā
translated: She stood there, attended by hundreds of thousands of apsaras,

original: tāsā sā pravarā śreṣṭhā nārī sarvāṅgaśobhanā //
analyzed: tāsā sā pravarā śreṣṭhā nārī sarva aṅga śobhanā
translated: The most excellent and foremost among them, a woman beautiful in all limbs.

original: tato tāsā cyavitvāna devakanyā maharddhikā rājño kṛkisya bhāryāya kukṣismi upapadyitha /
analyzed: tatas tāsā cyavitvāna deva kanyāḥ maharddhikāḥ rājñaḥ kṛkisya bhāryāya kukṣismi upapadyitha
translated: Then, having passed away from there, that deva maiden of great power was conceived in the womb of King Kṛkī's wife.

original: nirgate dvādaśamāse rājabhāryā prajāyata /
analyzed: nirgate dvādaśa māse rāja bhāryā prajāyata
translated: After twelve months had passed, the queen gave birth,

original: mālinī nāma nāmena nārī sarvāṅgaśobhanā //
analyzed: mālinī nāma nāmena nārī sarva aṅga śobhanā
translated: To a girl named Mālinī, beautiful in all limbs.

original: ativarṇā atirūpavatī abhūt /
analyzed: ativarṇā atirūpavatī abhūt
translated: She was of surpassing beauty and form.

original: śreṣṭhā ca rājakanyānā dhītā sā kāśirājino //
analyzed: śreṣṭhā ca rāja kanyānā dhītā sā
translated: She was the best of the king's daughters, the daughter of the king of Kāśi.

original: ācāraguṇasampannā śucivastrā suvāsanā /🔽rājño kṛkisya antike tiṣṭhate prājalīkṛtā //
analyzed: ācāra guṇa sampannā śuci vastrā su vāsanā  rājñaḥ kṛkisya antike tiṣṭhate prājalīkṛtā
translated: Endowed with the qualities of good conduct, wearing clean clothes, well-perfumed,🔽She stood before King Kṛkī, having been presented to him.

original: tamenamavadadrājā tiṣṭhantī prājalīkṛtā /
analyzed: tam enam avadat rājā tiṣṭhantī prājalīkṛtā
translated: The king said to her, Standing here, having been presented to me,

original: brāhmaṇā me tuva bhadre bhojāpehi atandritā //
analyzed: brāhmaṇāḥ me bhadre bhoja apehi atandritā
translated: O blessed one, you must diligently feed the brahmins for me.

original: pituḥ sā vacana śrutvā brāhmaṇānāmanūnakā /
analyzed: pituḥ sā vacana śrutvā brāhmaṇānām anūnakā
translated: Having heard her father's words, she served the brahmins without fail,

original: viśatsahasrā bhojeti sarvakāmeh mālinī /🔽tamena brāhmaṇā dṛśya mālinīmapsaropamā /🔽rāgagrasitacittāśca ullapanti punarpanaḥ //🔽uddhatā unnatā dṛṣṭvā capalā prākaṭendriyā /
analyzed: viśat sahasrā bhojā iti mālinī  tam enā brāhmaṇāḥ dṛśya mālinīm apsaraḥ upamā  rāga grasita cittāḥ ca ullapanti  uddhatā unnatā dṛṣṭvā capalā prākaṭa indriyā
translated: The thousand-eyed one, the garland of all desires, enters the Bhoja.🔽Seeing that garland, resembling an apsara, the Brahmins,🔽with minds swallowed by passion, again boast.🔽Seeing the haughty, proud, fickle, and exposed senses,🔽

original: mālinī savicinteti na ime dakṣiṇārahā //🔽sā āruhitvā prāsāda samantena vilokaye /🔽adarśī bhagavato siṣya sabuddhasya śirīmato //🔽sā prāsādavaragatā kāśikavaracandanena āliptā /🔽rājño kṛkisya dhītā sarvā diśatā viloketi //🔽sā addaśāsi //🔽prāsādikenijitena praviśantā /🔽buddhasya śrāvakānbāhitapāpā antimaśarīrā //🔽sā dāsī preṣeti eteṣā ṛṣīṇā vandana bruhi /🔽vanditvā ca bhaṇāhi praviśatha bhadanta niṣīdātha //🔽sā dāsī upagamya pādā vanditvā bhāvitātmanā /🔽prāñjalikṛtā avocatpraviśatha bhadanta niṣīdātha //
analyzed: mālinī sa vicintā iti naḥ ime dakṣiṇāra hā 🔽sā āruhitvā prāsāda samantena vilokaye 🔽adarśī bhagavataḥ siṣya sabuddhasya śirīmataḥ 🔽sā prāsāda vara gatā kāśika vara candanena āliptā 🔽rājñaḥ kṛkisya dhītā sarvā diśatā vilokā iti 🔽sā addaśāsi 🔽praviśantā 🔽buddhasya śrāvakān bāhita pāpā antima śarīrā 🔽sā dāsī preṣā iti eteṣā ṛṣīṇā vandana bruhi 🔽vanditvā ca bhaṇāhi praviśatha bhadanta niṣīda atha 🔽sā dāsī upagamya pādāḥ vanditvā bhāvitātmanā 🔽prāñjali kṛtāḥ avocat praviśatha bhadanta niṣīda atha

original: rāgā upātivṛttā viśāradā agrapaṇḍitā loke /
analyzed: rāgāḥ upātivṛttāḥ viśāradāḥ agra paṇḍitāḥ loke
translated: They had overcome passion, were fearless, and the foremost wise ones in the world.

original: buddhasya śrāvakā bāhitapāpā antimaśarīrāḥ //🔽ta pāṇḍara ca sukṛta sutoraṇa khaḍga asigupta /
analyzed: buddhasya śrāvakāḥ bāhita pāpāḥ antima śarīrāḥ  ta pāṇḍara ca su kṛta su toraṇa khaḍga asi gupta
translated: They were the Buddha's disciples, who had destroyed evil, and had attained their last bodies.

original: praviśensuḥ antaḥpura rājño dhīturmanāpāye //🔽kāśikapratyāstaraṇa suvicitrakalāpaka maṇivicitra /
analyzed: praviśensuḥ antaḥpura rājñaḥ  kāśika pratyāstaraṇa su vicitra kalāpaka maṇi vicitra
translated: They entered the inner quarters, the beautiful daughter of the king, guarded by swords and shields,🔽like a white elephant, a well-built archway.🔽A seat was prepared, strewn with various flowers,

original: vicitrapuṣpāvakirṇa prajñapta āsana āsi //
analyzed: vicitra puṣpa avakirṇa prajñaptaḥ āsanaḥ āsi
translated: adorned with jewels, and covered with Kāśi cloth.

original: padmamiva śubhābhāsa jaleruha yathā jale anupalipta /
analyzed: padmam iva śubha ābhāsa jaleruha yathā jale anupalipta
translated: Like a lotus, shining beautifully, unstained by water,

original: tatha anupaliptacittā tatra niṣīde vigatamohā //
analyzed: an upalipta cittā tatra niṣīde vigata mohā
translated: so they sat there, their minds unstained, free from delusion.

original: śālīnāmodanavidhimakālakamanekavyajanamupeta /
analyzed: śālīnām odana vidhim akālakam aneka vyajanam upeta
translated: They were served rice dishes, untimely food, and various fans,

original: svahastamupanāmayate yathā bhadantāna abhiroce //
analyzed: sva hastam upanāmayate yathā bhadantāna abhiroce
translated: and offered with their own hands, as the Venerable Ones desired.

original: te bhiksū avacensuḥ śāstā mo agrapaṇḍito loke /
analyzed: te bhiksū avacensuḥ śāstā mā u agra paṇḍitaḥ loke
translated: The monks said, The Teacher is the foremost wise one in the world.

original: tasya prathama bhakta so bhujaye vamahāvīro //
analyzed: tasya prathama bhakta saḥ
translated: Let him first enjoy the food, the great hero.

original: buddho ti śruṇitvā ghoṣa loke kutūhala aśrutapūrva /
analyzed: buddhaḥ ti śruṇitvā ghoṣa loke kutūhala a śruta pūrva
translated: Hearing the word Buddha in the world, out of curiosity, never having heard it before,

original: adhikatara sā prasīde imehi kila so viśiṣṭataro //
analyzed: sā prasīde kila saḥ viśiṣṭataraḥ
translated: she became even more delighted, thinking, He is indeed superior to them.

original: sā mālinī avoca bhuñjitvā śāstuno haratha bhakta /
analyzed: sā mālinī avoca bhuñjitvā śāstunaḥ haratha bhakta
translated: Mālinī said, Having eaten, take the food to the Teacher.

original: abhivādana ca brutha mama vacanāto lokanāthasya //
analyzed: ca brutha mama vacanā atas loka nāthasya
translated: And greet him in my name, Lord of the World.

original: adhivāse bhakta bhagavā suvetanā sārdha bhikṣusaghena /
analyzed: adhivāse bhakta bhagavā suvetanā sārdha bhikṣu saghena
translated: The Blessed One has accepted the meal, together with the Saṅgha of monks,

original: antaḥ purasya madhye rājño dhīturmanāpāya //
analyzed: antar purasya madhye rājñaḥ dhītuḥ manāpāya
translated: in the middle of the king's harem, to the delight of the king's daughter.

original: te dāni bhagavato kāśyapasya agraśrāvakā tiṣyo ca bhāradvājo mālinīye bhakta paribhujitvā bhagavato kāśyapasya bhaktamādāya ṛṣivadana nirdhāvitā
analyzed: te dāni bhagavataḥ kāśyapasya agra śrāvakā tiṣyaḥ ca bhāradvājaḥ mālinīye bhakta paribhujitvā bhagavataḥ kāśyapasya bhaktam ādāya ṛṣi vadana nirdhāvitā
translated: Then the Blessed Kāśyapa's foremost disciples, Tiṣya and Bhāradvāja, having eaten Mālinī's food, took the food for the Blessed Kāśyapa and left Ṛṣivadana.

original: bhagavato kāśyapasya piṇḍapātramupanāmetvā mālinīye vacanena bhagavanta kāśyapa vandana vadensu //🔽kṛkisya bhagava kāśirājño dhītā bhagavato vandana pṛcchati saśrāvakasaghasya śuvedāni ca bhaktena nimantreti sārdha bhikṣusaghena rājño
analyzed: bhagavataḥ kāśyapasya piṇḍapātram upanāmetvā mālinīye vacanena  kṛkisya bhagavan kāśi rājñaḥ dhītā bhagavataḥ vandana pṛcchati sa śrāvaka saghasya ca bhaktena nimantreti sārdha bhikṣu saghena rājñaḥ
translated: Having presented the alms-food to the Blessed Kāśyapa, they spoke the greeting of Mālinī to the Blessed Kāśyapa:🔽The daughter of the Blessed King of Kāśi, Kṛkī, greets the Blessed One and his Saṅgha of disciples, and invites him for tomorrow's meal, together with the Saṅgha of monks,

original: kṛkisya antaḥpure tasyā bhagavā adhivāsetu anukampāmupādāya //
analyzed: kṛkisya antaḥpure tasyāḥ bhagavā adhivāsetu anukampām upādāya
translated: in the inner quarters of King Kṛkī. May the Blessed One accept out of compassion.

original: bhagavatā kāśyapena vaineyavaśena adhivāsita //
analyzed: bhagavatā kāśyapena vaineya vaśena adhivāsita
translated: The Blessed Kāśyapa accepted out of compassion for those to be trained.

original: ye tehi mahāśrāvakehi sārdha puruṣā gatā bhagavato kāśyapasya ovādamādāya tehi gatvā mālinīye nivedita //
analyzed: ye tehi mahāśrāvakehi sārdha puruṣāḥ gatāḥ bhagavataḥ kāśyapasya ovādam ādāya tehi gatvā mālinīye nivedita
translated: Those men who had gone with those great disciples, taking the instruction of the Blessed One Kāśyapa, went and informed Mālinī.

original: adhivāsita tena bhagavatā kāśyapena śuvedāni bhakta sārdha bhikṣusaghena //
analyzed: adhivāsita tena bhagavatā kāśyapena bhakta sārdha bhikṣu saghena
translated: The Blessed One Kāśyapa accepted it, saying, Tomorrow, together with the assembly of monks.

original: mālinīye teṣā puruṣāṇā śrutvā tāmeva rātri prabhūta khādanīya bhojanīya pratijāgaritvā bhagavato kāśyapasya kālamārocāpita //
analyzed: mālinīye teṣā puruṣāṇā śrutvā tām eva rātri prabhūta khādanīya bhojanīya pratijāgaritvā bhagavataḥ kāśyapasya kālam ārocāpita
translated: When Mālinī heard from those men, she prepared abundant food and drink that very night, and announced the time to the Blessed One Kāśyapa.

original: bhagavā kālajño velājño samayajño pudgalajño pudgalaparāparajño //🔽kālyameva nivāsayitvā pātracīvaramādāya yena cārikāvikālo saprāpto sāya māgadhe prātarāśe vartamāne sārdha viśatīhi bhikṣusahasrehi vārāṇasi
analyzed: bhagavā kāla jñaḥ velā jñaḥ samaya jñaḥ pudgala jñaḥ pudgala para apara jñaḥ  kālyam eva nivāsayitvā pātra cīvaram ādāya yena cārikā vikālaḥ sa prāptaḥ sāya māgadhe prātarāśe vartamāne sārdha viśatīhi bhikṣu sahasrehi vārāṇasi
translated: The Blessed One, who knows the time, knows the occasion, knows the proper time, knows the person, and knows the superiority and inferiority of people,🔽in the morning, having dressed and taken his bowl and robe, entered the city of Vārāṇasī together with twenty thousand monks,

original: nagara praviśet //
analyzed: nagara praviśet
translated: at the time when the alms round was over, in the morning meal time.

original: hasapraḍīnakamiva buddhā bhagavanto nagara praviśanti //🔽dakṣiṇapārśve tiṣyo mahāśrāvako /
analyzed: hasapraḍīnakam iva buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ nagara praviśanti  dakṣiṇa pārśve tiṣyaḥ mahāśrāvakaḥ
translated: The Blessed Buddhas enter the city as if laughing and playing.🔽On the right side was the great disciple Tiṣya,

original: vāme pārśva bhāradvājo mahāśrāvakaḥ //
analyzed: vāme pārśva bhāradvājaḥ mahāśrāvakaḥ
translated: on the left side the great disciple Bhāradvāja.

original: teṣā pṛṣṭhato catvāro mahāśrāvakā caturṇā aṣṭa aṣṭānā ṣoḍaśa ṣoḍaśānā dvātriśa dvātriśatānā catuṣaṣṭi //
analyzed: teṣām pṛṣṭhatas catvāraḥ mahāśrāvakā caturṇām aṣṭa aṣṭānām ṣoḍaśa ṣoḍaśānām dvātriśa dvātriśatānām catuṣaṣṭi
translated: Behind them were four great disciples, behind the four were eight, behind the eight were sixteen, behind the sixteen were thirty-two, behind the thirty-two were sixty-four.

original: eva bhagavā viśatihi bhikṣusahasrehi pura skṛto rājño kṛkisya antaḥpura praviśati //
analyzed: eva bhagavā viśatihi bhikṣu sahasrehi puras skṛtaḥ rājñaḥ kṛkisya antaḥpura praviśati
translated: Thus the Blessed One, surrounded by twenty thousand monks, entered the inner palace of King Kṛkī.

original: bhagavato nagara praviśantasya onatā bhūmirunnamati sama bhūmitala jāta sasthāpi /
analyzed: bhagavataḥ nagara praviśantasya onatā bhūmiḥ unnamati
translated: As the Blessed One entered the city, the low-lying areas were filled in and the high areas were raised, making the ground level.

original: aśucipāṣāṇaśarkarakaṭhallā bhūmi praviśanti muktapuṣpāvakīrṇā mahī sasthāpi /
analyzed: aśuci pāṣāṇa śarkara kaṭhallāḥ bhūmi praviśanti mukta puṣpa avakīrṇā mahī sasthāpi
translated: Impurities, stones, gravel, and pebbles disappeared, and the ground was covered with scattered flowers.

original: puṣpogā vṛkṣā puṣpanti phalopagā vṛkṣā phalanti /
analyzed: puṣpa ūgāḥ vṛkṣāḥ puṣpanti phala upagāḥ vṛkṣāḥ phalanti
translated: Flowering trees bloomed, fruit-bearing trees bore fruit.

original: ye tatra mārge vāmadakṣiṇena vāpīyo vā puṣkariṇīyo vā śītalasya vārisya bharitā bhavanti utpalapadumakumudapuṇḍarīkanalinīsaugandhikāpracchannā
analyzed: ye tatra mārge vāma dakṣiṇena vāpīyaḥ vā puṣkariṇīyaḥ vā śītalasya vārisya bharitāḥ bhavanti utpala paduma kumuda puṇḍarīka nalinī saugandhikā pracchannā
translated: On that road, to the left and right, there were pools and lotus ponds filled with cool water, covered with blue, red, and white lotuses, and fragrant with white water lilies.

original: udupānamukhā toya prasyandati /
analyzed: udu pāna mukhā prasyandati
translated: Water flowed from the mouths of the water spouts.

original: aśvā hīṣyanti ṛṣabhā nardanti hastikujarā nardana mucanti //
analyzed: aśvāḥ hi iṣyanti ṛṣabhāḥ nardanti hasti kujarāḥ nardana mucanti
translated: Horses neighed, bulls bellowed, and the female elephants trumpeted.

original: samanantara indrakīla pādena cokramati sarva ca nagara prakampati /
analyzed: samanantaraḥ indrakīla pādena ca ukramati sarva ca nagara prakampati
translated: As soon as the Blessed One placed his foot on the threshold, the entire city trembled.

original: andhā ālokenti badhirāḥ śabda śṛṇvanti unmattakāḥ smṛti pratilabhante vyādhitā vyādhito mucanti gurvuṇīyo arogāḥ prasūyanti nagnānā cailāḥ
analyzed: andhāḥ badhirāḥ śabda śṛṇvanti unmattakāḥ smṛti pratilabhante vyādhitāḥ vyādhitaḥ mucanti arogāḥ prasūyanti nagnānā cailāḥ  /
translated: The blind see, the deaf hear sounds, the insane regain their memory, the sick are cured, pregnant women give birth without pain, the naked find clothes,

original: prādurbhavanti bandhanabaddhānā bandhanāni sphuṭanti peḍākaraṇḍāvṛtāni ratanāni saghaṭṭanti bhājanāni raṇanti /
analyzed: prādurbhavanti bandhana baddhānām bandhanāni sphuṭanti peḍākaraṇḍa āvṛtāni ratanāni sa ghaṭṭanti bhājanāni raṇanti
translated: the fetters of those in bondage are loosened, chests and boxes open by themselves, jewels rattle, and vessels ring out.

original: ye bhavanti nagare parivādinīyo vallakīyo veṇuvīṇāmṛdagabherīpaṇavā asakhatānyapi aghaṭṭitāni sapravādyanti /
analyzed: ye bhavanti nagare parivādinīyaḥ vallakīyaḥ veṇu vīṇā mṛdaga bherī paṇavāḥ a sakhatāni api a ghaṭṭitāni sa pravādyanti
translated: The musical instruments in the city, such as lutes, flutes, veenas, mridangas, bheris, and panavas, sound without being played.

original: śukasārikakokilahasamayūrāḥ svakasvakāni rutāni mucanti //
analyzed: śuka sārika kokila hasa mayūrāḥ svaka svakāni rutāni mucanti
translated: Parrots, myna birds, cuckoos, swans, and peacocks sing their own songs.

original: caturaṅgulena ca bhūmi asaspṛśanto gacchati dharaṇitale ca padacakrāṇi prādurbhavanti sahasrārāṇi sanābhikāni sarvākāraparipūrṇāni antarīkṣe
analyzed: catur aṅgulena ca bhūmi gacchati dharaṇi tale ca pada cakrāṇi prādurbhavanti sahasra arāṇi sa nābhikāni sarva ākāra paripūrṇāni antarīkṣe
translated: He walks without touching the ground with the soles of his feet, and the imprints of wheels with a thousand spokes, complete with rims and hubs, appear on the ground.

original: ca devā divyāni turyasahasrāṇi pravādayanti divyāni puṣpavarṣāṇi pravarṣant //
analyzed: ca devāḥ divyāni turya sahasrāṇi pravādayanti divyāni puṣpa varṣāṇi pravarṣan
translated: In the sky, gods play thousands of divine musical instruments and rain down divine flowers.

original: bhagavā kaśyapo saśrāvakasagho edṛśāye vudhīye edṛśāye vibhūṣāye edṛśena samudayena edṛśāye ṛddhīye edṛśena vibhavena devamanuṣyehi satkriyanto
analyzed: bhagavā kaśyapaḥ sa śrāvaka saghaḥ edṛśāye vudhīye edṛśāye vibhūṣāye edṛśena samudayena edṛśāye ṛddhīye edṛśena vibhavena deva manuṣyehi satkriyantaḥ
translated: The Fortunate One Kāśyapa, together with the community of monks, with such a following, with such an array, with such an assembly, with such a miracle, with such a display, was worshipped by gods and men,

original: saśrāvakasagho rājño kṛkisya antaḥpura praviṣṭo //
analyzed: sa śrāvaka saghaḥ rājñaḥ kṛkisya antaḥpura praviṣṭaḥ
translated: together with the community of monks, entered King Kṛkī's inner palace.

original: bhagavā mālinīye saśrāvakasagho tahi abhyantarime catuḥśāle mahāsatkāreṇa pariviṣṭo prabhūtena khādanīyena bhojanīyena ṛjurasena agra 🔽rasena avigatarasena pratyagrarasena //
analyzed: bhagavān mālinīye sa śrāvaka saghaḥ abhyantarime catuḥśāle mahā satkāreṇa pariviṣṭaḥ prabhūtena khādanīyena bhojanīyena ṛju rasena  rasena avigata rasena pratyagra rasena
translated: The Fortunate One Kāśyapa, together with the community of monks, was served with excellent service in that inner palace, with abundant food and drink, with pure food, with the best food, with food that had not been prepared, with the best food.

original: bhagavā bhuktāvī saśrāvakasagho dhautahasto apanīpātro mālinī dharmayā kathayā sadarśayitvā samādāpayitvā samuttejayitvā sapraharṣayitvotthāyāsanāto
analyzed: bhagavā bhuktāvī sa śrāvaka saghaḥ dhauta hastaḥ apanī pātraḥ mālinī dharmayā kathayā sa darśayitvā samādāpayitvā samuttejayitvā sa praharṣayitvā utthāya āsanātaḥ
translated: When the Fortunate One Kāśyapa had eaten and had washed his hand and bowl, Mālinī, having been instructed, inspired, fired with enthusiasm, and delighted by the Fortunate One with a talk about the Teaching, rose from her seat,

original: prakrame //
analyzed: prakrame
translated: and departed.

original: yāni tāni kṛkisya kāśirājño viśati brāhmaṇasahasrāṇi nityabhojikā te kupitā ya mālinīye bhagavā kāśyapo saśrāvakasagho rājakule pariviṣṭo
analyzed: yāni tāni kṛkisya kāśi rājñaḥ viśati brāhmaṇa sahasrāṇi nitya bhojikā te kupitāḥ mālinīye bhagavā kāśyapaḥ sa śrāvaka saghaḥ rājakule pariviṣṭaḥ
translated: Those twenty thousand brāhmans of King Kṛkī of Kāśi who were regular recipients of gifts, being angry that Mālinī had served the Fortunate One Kāśyapa, together with the community of monks, in the royal palace,

original: mahatā satkāreṇa mahatā sanmānena //
analyzed: mahatā satkāreṇa mahatā sanmānena
translated: with great honor, with great respect.

original: tehi sarvā brāhmaṇapariṣā sannipātitā anekāni brāhmaṇasahasrāṇi //
analyzed: tehi sarvā brāhmaṇa pariṣā sannipātitā anekāni brāhmaṇa sahasrāṇi
translated: All the assembly of brahmins was gathered together, many thousands of brahmins.

original: tena kālena tena samayena brāhmaṇākrāntā pṛthivī bhavati //
analyzed: tena kālena tena samayena brāhmaṇa ākrāntā pṛthivī bhavati
translated: At that time and at that moment, the earth was filled with brahmins.

original: sanipatitā mālinī ghātetukāmā //
analyzed: sa nipatitā mālinī ghāta itu kāmā
translated: They gathered together, desiring to kill Mālinī.

original: eṣā yeva atra rājakule brāhmaṇānā kaṇṭako utpanno /
analyzed: eṣā yā iva atra rājakule brāhmaṇānā kaṇṭakaḥ utpannaḥ
translated: This very thorn has arisen in this royal family, the brahmins.

original: kṛkiśca rājā brāhmaṇeṣu abhiprasanno tasya viśa brāhmaṇasahasrā daivasika bhujanti eṣā ca pitṛṇā brāhmaṇānā niyojitā etāni brāhmaṇāni daivasika
analyzed: kṛkiḥ ca rājā brāhmaṇeṣu tasya viśaḥ brāhmaṇa sahasrāḥ daivasika bhujanti eṣā ca pitṛṇā brāhmaṇānā niyojitā etāni brāhmaṇāni daivasika
translated: And King Kṛkī was devoted to the brahmins, and his treasury was enjoyed by thousands of brahmins daily. And this Mālinī was appointed by her father to the brahmins, saying, Give these brahmins daily

original: bhojehīti /🔽etāye brāhmaṇānā avamanyitvā śramaṇā rājakule praveśitā eṣā ca edṛśo pūjāsatkāro kṛto /
analyzed: bhojehi iti  brāhmaṇānā avamanyitvā śramaṇāḥ rājakule praveśitāḥ eṣā ca edṛśaḥ pūjā satkāraḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: food.🔽She, despising the brahmins, introduced the ascetics into the royal palace, and such worship and honor was done to them.

original: sā eṣā yatta brāhmaṇānā upajīvya rājakulāto pūjāsatkārārtha śramaṇānā pariṇāmeti mānayantīti //
analyzed: sā eṣā yatta brāhmaṇānā upajīvya pūjā satkāra artha śramaṇānā mānayanti iti
translated: She, having lived off the brahmins, now turns the worship and honor from the royal palace to the ascetics, honoring them.

original: tehi brāhmaṇehi eṣo vyavasāyo kṛto mālinī māretavyā /
analyzed: tehi brāhmaṇehi eṣaḥ vyavasāyaḥ kṛtaḥ mālinī māretavyā
translated: Then this resolve was made by the brahmins: Mālinī should be killed.

original: kṛkī ca kāśirājā janapada pratyavekṣako va gato //
analyzed: kṛkī ca kāśi rājā janapada pratyavekṣakaḥ gataḥ
translated: And King Kṛkī of Kāśi went out to inspect the country.

original: tehi brāhmaṇehi kṛkisya rājño dūto preṣito //
analyzed: tehi brāhmaṇehi kṛkisya rājñaḥ dūtaḥ preṣitaḥ
translated: The brāhmans sent a messenger to King Kṛkī:

original: edṛśa mālinīye brāhmaṇānā mūle abahumānamutpanna /
analyzed: edṛśa mālinīye brāhmaṇānā mūle a bahu māna utpanna
translated: “Such disrespect has arisen in Mālinī towards the brāhmans.

original: kāśyapasya śrāvakasaghasya rājakula praveśitvā edṛśo ca pūjāsatkāro kṛto brāhmaṇānā darśana pi na deti /
analyzed: kāśyapasya śrāvaka saghasya rājakula praveśitvā edṛśaḥ ca pūjā satkāraḥ kṛtaḥ brāhmaṇānā darśana pi na deti
translated: She has brought the assembly of the brāhmans of the Śākya Kāśyapa into the royal palace and has shown them such honour and respect, but she does not give them an opportunity to see the brāhmans.

original: yathā mahārājena sadiṣṭa tathā na karoti /
analyzed: yathā mahā rājena tathā na karoti
translated: She does not do as the king commands.

original: yantu brāhmaṇānā rājakule nityaka viśatīnā brāhmaṇaśasrāṇā ta pi na vartati /
analyzed: yantu brāhmaṇānā rājakule nityaka viśatīnām brāhmaṇaśasrāṇām ta pi na vartati
translated: And the thousands of brāhmans who are always in the royal palace do not have access to her.

original: mālinī brahmaṇānā darśana pi na deti //
analyzed: mālinī darśana pi na deti
translated: Mālinī does not give the brāhmans an opportunity to see her.”

original: rājā śrutamātreṇaiva janapadāt vārāṇasimāgato paśyati anekā brāhaṇānā sahasriyo samāgatāni //
analyzed: rājā śruta mātreṇa eva janapadāt vārāṇasim āgataḥ paśyati anekā samāgatāni
translated: As soon as the king heard this, he came from the provinces to Benares and saw that many thousands of brāhmans had assembled.

original: so yena brāhmaṇāstenaiva gato //
analyzed: saḥ yena brāhmaṇāḥ tena eva gataḥ
translated: He went to the brāhmans.

original: brāhmaṇā pi rājño pratyudgatā jayena vardhāpayitvā etā prakṛti mālinīye ta sarva kṛkisya rājño nivedenti /
analyzed: brāhmaṇā pi rājñaḥ pratyudgatāḥ jayena vardhāpayitvā etā prakṛti mālinīye ta sarva kṛkisya rājñaḥ nivedenti
translated: The brāhmans went out to meet the king, and after wishing him victory and prosperity, they told King Kṛkī all about Mālinī’s nature.

original: mahārāja eṣā mālinī brāhmaṇānā kaṇṭako utpannā na śakya grāhmaṇehi rājño nityaka pratīcchitu yāvanna mālinī ghātitā /
analyzed: mahā rāja eṣā mālinī brāhmaṇānā utpannā na śakya grāhmaṇehi rājñaḥ nityaka pratīcchitu yāvat na mālinī ghātitā
translated: Your Majesty, this Mālinī is a thorn in the side of the Brahmins. She cannot be accepted by the Brahmins as the King’s constant companion until Mālinī is killed.

original: eṣa samagrāye brāhmaṇaparṣāye niścayo utpanno //
analyzed: eṣa samagrāye brāhmaṇaparṣāye niścayaḥ utpannaḥ
translated: This is the resolve of the entire assembly of Brahmins.

original: rājā pi brāhmaṇyo /
analyzed: rājā pi brāhmaṇyaḥ
translated: The King is also a Brahmin.

original: eṣā brāhmaṇapariṣāya kriyā anuparivartitavyā /🔽yadi te brāhmaṇya aparityakta mālinī parityajāhi /
analyzed: eṣā brāhmaṇa pariṣāya kriyā anuparivartitavyā  yadi te brāhmaṇya aparityakta mālinī parityajāhi
translated: This action of the assembly of Brahmins must be followed.🔽If you, O Brahmin, do not abandon Mālinī, then abandon your Brahminhood.

original: atha te mālinī aparityaktā nāsti te brāhmaṇya //
analyzed: atha te mālinī a parityaktā na asti te brāhmaṇya
translated: Otherwise, if you do not abandon Mālinī, you have no Brahminhood.

original: brāhmaṇapariṣāyā kriyāmanuprivartantasya tasya rājño etadabhūṣi /
analyzed: brāhmaṇa pariṣāyā tasya rājñaḥ
translated: When the action of the assembly of Brahmins was being followed, this occurred to the King:

original: imā brāhmaṇākrāntā pṛthivī bahubrāhmaṇyā /
analyzed: imāḥ brāhmaṇa ākrāntā pṛthivī bahu brāhmaṇyā
translated: This earth is oppressed by Brahmins, it is full of Brahmins.

original: yadi mālinī na parityajiṣyāmi ḍimba bhabiṣyati /
analyzed: yadi mālinī na parityajiṣyāmi ḍimba bhabiṣyati
translated: If I do not abandon Mālinī, there will be a disaster.

original: naiva mālinī bhaviṣyati naivamaha //🔽tyajedeka kulasyārtha grāmārtha tu kula tyajet /
analyzed: na eva mālinī bhaviṣyati na evam aha  tyajet eka kulasya artha grāma artha tu kula tyajet
translated: Neither will there be Mālinī, nor will there be me.🔽For the sake of one family, one should abandon a family. For the sake of a village, one should abandon a family.

original: grāma janapadasyārtha ātmārtha pṛthivī tyaje //
analyzed: grāma janapadasya artha ātma artha pṛthivī tyaje
translated: For the sake of a country, one should abandon a village. For the sake of oneself, one should abandon the earth.

original: tena dāni kāśirājñā mālinī parityaktā /
analyzed: tena dāni kāśi rājñā mālinī parityaktā
translated: Then the King of Kāśi abandoned Mālinī.

original: yathā brāhmaṇapariṣāye abhiprāyantatā bhavatu //
analyzed: yathā brāhmaṇa pariṣāye abhiprāyantatā bhavatu
translated: Let it be as the assembly of Brāhmans desire.

original: te dāni brāhmaṇā āhansu //
analyzed: te dāni brāhmaṇāḥ āhansu
translated: Then the Brāhmans said,

original: yadi parityaktā mālinī āṇāpiyatu rājñā //
analyzed: yadi parityaktā mālinī rājñā
translated: If Mālinī is to be abandoned, let her be given to the king.

original: tato tena bāhire nagarāto brāhmaṇānā mūle sthitakena dūto preṣito /
analyzed: tatas tena bāhire nagarātaḥ brāhmaṇānā mūle sthitakena dūtaḥ preṣitaḥ
translated: Then from outside the city, where he was standing in the presence of the Brāhmans, he sent a messenger,

original: āgacchatha mālinīmānethatti //
analyzed: āgacchatha
translated: saying, Go and fetch Mālinī.

original: rājavacanena dūto rājakulamanuprāptaḥ //
analyzed: rāja vacanena dūtaḥ rāja kulam anuprāptaḥ
translated: The messenger went to the palace and said,

original: āgaccha mālinī parityaktāsi pitari brāhmaṇānā /
analyzed: āgaccha mālinī parityaktā asi pitari
translated: Come, Mālinī, you are abandoned by your father to the Brāhmans.

original: brāhmaṇehi jīvitādvyaparopyasi /
analyzed: brāhmaṇehi jīvitāt vyaparopyasi
translated: You will be deprived of life by the Brāhmans.

original: mālinoye mātara āgatvā ārāvo mukto sarveṇa ca antaḥpureṇa /
analyzed: mātaraḥ āgatvā sarveṇa ca antaḥpureṇa
translated: Mālinī’s mother came and raised a cry, as did all the women of the court.

original: nagare sarvajano tena ārāvaśabdena utkaṇṭhito ākulībhūto /
analyzed: nagare sarva janaḥ tena ārāva śabdena utkaṇṭhitaḥ ākulībhūtaḥ
translated: The whole city was agitated and alarmed at the cry.

original: maha āsi rodana //
analyzed: mahaḥ āsi rodana
translated: There was great lamentation.

original: mālinī vārāṇasīto dūtena niṣkāsyati pituḥ sakāśa //
analyzed: mālinī vārāṇasī itas dūtena niṣkāsyati pituḥ sakāśa
translated: Mālinī was sent out of Benares by a messenger to her father.

original: sā dāni dūtehi niṣkāsitā pituh allīpitā /
analyzed: sā dāni dūtehi niṣkāsitā
translated: She was sent out by the messengers and fell at her father’s feet.

original: iya mahārāja mālinī //
analyzed: iya mahā rāja mālinī
translated: This, your majesty, is Mālinī.

original: rājñā aśrukaṇṭhena rudanmukhena mahato janakāyasya mālinī brāhmaṇānā dattā parityaktā pitare //
analyzed: rājñā aśru kaṇṭhena rudat mukhena mahataḥ jana kāyasya mālinī dattā parityaktā pitare
translated: The king, with tears in his throat and a sobbing face, gave Mālinī to the Brāhmans, abandoning her to them, in the presence of a great crowd of people.

original: sā dāni mālinī yatra kāle pitari parityaktā brāhmaṇānāmājñākṛtā //
analyzed: sā dāni mālinī yatra kāle pitari parityaktā brāhmaṇānām ājñā kṛtā
translated: When Mālinī was abandoned by her father and came under the control of the brāhmans,

original: tataḥ mālinī prājalīkṛtā brāhmaṇapariṣāye praṇipatitvā //
analyzed: tatas mālinī prājalīkṛtā brāhmaṇa pariṣāye praṇipatitvā
translated: then Mālinī was dismissed by the brāhman assembly. She fell at their feet

original: icchāmi ekā prajñapti brāhmaṇapariṣā yadi pramāṇanti //
analyzed: icchāmi ekā prajñapti brāhmaṇa pariṣā yadi
translated: and said, “I wish to make a request of the brāhman assembly, if it is in your power.”

original: te āhansu //
analyzed: te āhansu
translated: They said,

original: jalpa yā te vijñapti //
analyzed: jalpa yā te vijñapti
translated: “Speak, what is your request?”

original: āha //
analyzed: āha
translated: She said,

original: aha pitari brāhmaṇānā parityaktā yuṣmāka aha vaśagatā //
analyzed: aha pitari brāhmaṇānā parityaktā yuṣmāka aha vaśagatā
translated: “I have been abandoned by my father and have come under your control.

original: brāhmaṇapariṣāye evameva niyayo mālinī māretavyā //
analyzed: brāhmaṇa pariṣāye evam eva niyayaḥ mālinī māretavyā
translated: The brāhman assembly has decided that Mālinī should be killed.

original: tadicchāmi brāhmaṇapariṣāyameva sakāśāto saptāha jīvitu dāna dāsyāmi puṇya ca kāriṣyāmi //
analyzed: tat icchāmi brāhmaṇa pariṣāyam eva sakāśāt sapta aha jīvitu dāna dāsyāmi puṇya ca kāriṣyāmi
translated: Therefore, I wish to live for seven days in the presence of the brāhman assembly, to give gifts, to make merit,

original: aha ca brāhmaṇānā kṛtopasthānā mayāpi brāhmaṇā upasthāpitā piturvacanena //
analyzed: aha ca brāhmaṇānā kṛta upasthānā mayā api brāhmaṇā upasthāpitā pituḥ vacanena
translated: and to serve the brāhmans. I have served the brāhmans and they have been served by me at my father’s command.

original: tato me saptāhasyātyayena māretha ya /
analyzed: tatas me sapta ahasya atyayena
translated: Therefore, after seven days have passed, you may kill me.

original: vā vo kṣamati ta karotha /
analyzed: vā vaḥ kṣamati ta karotha
translated: Do whatever you wish.”

original: teṣā brāhmaṇānā mahattarakānāmutpanna //
analyzed: teṣām brāhmaṇānām mahattarakānām utpanna
translated: Then it occurred to the senior brāhmans,

original: evameta yathā mālinī jalpati cirakālametāye brāhmaṇā upasthāpitā piturvacanena bhojāpitāḥ /
analyzed: evam eta yathā mālinī jalpati cira kālam eta aye brāhmaṇāḥ upasthāpitā pituḥ vacanena
translated: “It is as Mālinī says. For a long time she has served the brāhmans and fed them at her father’s command.

original: paścā etāye pāpakacittamutpanna ya mellitvā śramaṇānāmabhiprasannā /
analyzed: pāpaka cittam utpanna mellitvā śramaṇānām abhiprasannā
translated: Later, when she had given rise to evil thoughts and turned away from the ascetics and become devoted to them,

original: tato nāviti bhūyo śramaṇānā dāna dātu utsṛṣṭā na teṣā brāhmaṇānāmeva eṣā saptarātra dāna dāsyati /
analyzed: tatas nau iti bhūyas śramaṇānā dāna dātu utsṛṣṭā na teṣām brāhmaṇānām eva eṣā saptarātra dāna dāsyati
translated: then she no longer gave gifts to the ascetics, but only to the brahmins. She said, 'For seven nights I will give gifts to them.'

original: taddīyatu etāya vijñaptiḥ mucyatu saptarātra saptāhasyātyayena haniṣyani //
analyzed: tat dīyatu etāya vijñaptiḥ mucyatu sapta rātra sapta ahasya atyayena
translated: Therefore let this message be given to her: 'Let her be released for seven nights. After the seven days have passed, I will kill her.'

original: ya kāraṇa brāhmaṇapariṣāye eṣa niścaya utpannaḥ ta mālinīye jīvamānāya kārya //
analyzed: ya kāraṇa brāhmaṇapariṣāye eṣa niścaya utpannaḥ ta mālinīye jīvamānāya kārya
translated: And the reason why this decision was made by the assembly of brahmins is that something must be done while Mālinī is still alive.

original: tasyā tehi brāhmaṇehi dattā vijñaptiḥ //
analyzed: tasyāḥ tehi brāhmaṇehi dattā vijñaptiḥ
translated: So they gave her this message:

original: saptarātramutsṛṣṭā mahato janakāyatha brāhmaṇānā sakāśāto apramādā bhaveyā saptarātra pi na vilupe tti //
analyzed: sapta rātram utsṛṣṭāḥ mahataḥ brāhmaṇānā sakāśātaḥ apramādā bhaveyā sapta rātra na
translated: 'You are released for seven nights. But let there be no negligence on your part, lest you be destroyed after seven nights, even though you are in the presence of a great multitude of brahmins.'

original: sā dāni osṛṣṭā samānāpi nūna sārdha mahatā janakāyena parivṛtā punaḥ rājakula praviṣṭā pitara vijñāpeti //
analyzed: sā dāni osṛṣṭā samānā api nūna sārdha mahatā jana kāyena parivṛtā punar rājakula praviṣṭā pitara
translated: And although she was released, she was surrounded by a great multitude and again entered the royal palace. She informed her father:

original: icchāmi imāni sapta divasāni dāna ca dātu puṇya ca kartu yatra mama abhiprāyo //
analyzed: icchāmi imāni sapta divasāni dāna ca dātu puṇya ca kartu yatra mama abhiprāyo
translated: 'I wish to give gifts and perform meritorious deeds for these seven days, as I desire.'

original: rājā āha //
analyzed: rājā āha
translated: The king said:

original: evamastu karohi putri puṇya yatra te abhiprāyo //
analyzed: evam astu karohi putri puṇya yatra te
translated: Do so, my daughter, and make merit as you wish.

original: sā āha //
analyzed: sā āha
translated: She said:

original: bhagavanta kāśyapa samyaksabuddha saśrāvakasagha saptāhamiha rājakule pariveṣeya //
analyzed: bhagavanta kāśyapa samyaksabuddha sa śrāvaka sagha sapta aham iha rājakule pariveṣeya
translated: Blessed One, may the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa, together with his disciples, be served for seven days in this royal family.

original: rājā āha //
analyzed: rājā āha
